sessions.title: 使用 NVIDIA 机器人解决方案加速端到端无序抓取的开发
sessions.topic: Content Creation / Rendering - Rendering Engines / Pipelines / Tools
sessions.speakers: Lance Li (Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Rebecca Zhang (Solution Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. 解锁基础设施 (例如：资源依赖关系图)，通过升级到 Optix 7，更好地控制低级 GPU 资源
2. 通过自动场景分区来应对 GPU 资源限制
sessions.description: 借助 NVIDIA 机器人解决方案，我们帮助人形机器人合作伙伴“银河通用”快速构建了一个端到端解决方案，用于复杂的工业随机无序抓取任务。深入了解技术流程，探索我们如何创建数字孪生并在仿真和真实环境中验证我们的软件栈，以加速工程开发。

sessions.title: AI 创业企业在中国的发展与助力
sessions.speakers: Jie Li (Founder and CEO, DataMesh) | Ming Lou (NVIDIA Inception Director of China, NVIDIA) | Jinyan Ou (Head of Communications, LimX Dynamics) | Yiqing Shen (CTO, Toursun Synbio)
sessions.description: NVIDIA 初创加速计划来到中国已 10 年之久，其伴随和经历了 AI 行业在中国的重要成长阶段。在此章节中我们将向大家介绍 NVIDIA 初创加速计划如何与生态合作伙伴共同助力中国创业企业成长。同时 3 家会员企业将分享他们如何利用创新技术推动行业变革，为社会创造更大价值。

sessions.title: NVIDIA 革新智能座舱技术发展
sessions.speakers: Charlie Chen (Sr. Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Ji Shi (Asia Pacific DevTech, NVIDIA) | Amber Liu (Sr. Software Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. The end-to-end Vision-Language-Action (VLA) model holds great potential for general-purpose robots; however, the collection of large-scale real-world training data remains a significant bottleneck
2. By leveraging NVIDIA’s suite of tools, we can generate large-scale, high-quality synthetic data, which is sufficient for VLA pretraining, enabling direct Sim2Real transfer and excellent zero-shot generalization
sessions.description: 我们将通过三部分介绍 NVIDIA 通过生成式 AI 加速智能座舱技术发展。首先将介绍生成式 AI 在智能座舱中的应用，以及 NVIDIA 生成式 AI 加速解决方案，如大模型训练并行加速和 FP8 训练优化和实践; 第二部分将介绍使用 TRT-LLM 部署和优化多模态推理；最后将介绍 Thor SoC 如何应用于大语言模型，以及 Thor 上 LLM 部署的软件解决方案和加速。

sessions.title: GPU 加速生命科学行业智能化
sessions.speakers: xiaoming zhang (Vice President, BioMap)
sessions.points:
1. 基于 Planning - Agent、Decision - Agent 和 Reflection - Agent 协同的多智能体决方案
2. 适用于汽车驾驶舱系统中多模态智能体的端云协同部署方案
sessions.description: 生命科学行业正在全面拥抱智能化，构建基础大模型是加速智能化的先进范式。我们开发了生命科学跨模态的基础大模型，覆盖 DNA，RNA，蛋白质，细胞，生物视觉，生物文本 7个模态。我们利用 GPU 加速，以 FP8 精度优化了多专家 (MOE) 大型模型的训练，并基于 Megatron 为生命科学构建了统一的多模态训练框架。此外建设生物和 AI 融合的分布式推理引擎，大大加快了该行业向智能转型的步伐。

sessions.title: The embodied end-to-end VLA model driven by synthetic big data 合成大数据驱动的具身端到端 VLA 大模型
sessions.speakers: He Wang (CTO, Galbot)
sessions.points:
1. 在 ISAAC Sim 仿真环境和真实机器人上验证端到端的无序拣选解决方案
2. 探索零样本 6D 位姿估计算法在工业领域的应用
sessions.description: The high cost and scarcity of data are significant bottlenecks for embodied intelligence. However, high-quality synthetic big data provides a cost-effective solution to enhance the generalization of embodied end-to-end models. This report...

sessions.title: Mobile-Agent: 探索基于多模态智能体的汽车座舱助手新技术
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Large Language Models (LLMs)
sessions.speakers: Ji Zhang (Sr. Staff Algorithm Engineer, Alibaba Group)
sessions.points:
1. 加速 LLM 全链路开发：Nemo Curator 加速数据处理流水线，大模型训练并行加速以及 FP8 训练优化和实践。
2. LLM 推理数据中心加速：NVIDIA LLM Inference数据中心解决方案框架，使用TRT-LLM部署和优化多模态推理。
sessions.description: 本主题将介绍通义 Mobile-Agent  技术在汽车智能驾驶舱助手场景中的实现方案和体验。该解决方案基于纯视觉理解和多模态智能体技术，提供驾驶舱屏幕感知、复杂任务规划和 UI 决策操作能力，大大扩展了驾驶舱智能助手的能力。此解决方案是由阿里云和 NVIDIA 联合开发的端云协作解决方案。

sessions.title: 使用 Optix 7 构建分布式光线烘焙系统
sessions.speakers: Zhenyuan Zhang (Sr. Development Engineer, Tencent Technology Shanghai Co., Ltd) | Chao Li (Technical Director of the Frontier Technology Center, Tencent Interactive Entertainment Group, Tencent Technology (Shenzhen) Co., Ltd)
sessions.points:
1. 了解 NVIDIA 在各行各业的加速解决方案，包括医疗健康，机器人等
2. 如何借助 NVIDIA NIMs 云端、本地数据中心和工作站快速部署标准化接口的生成式 AI 模型
sessions.description: 我们将分享构建 Dawn 2.0 的经验，Dawn 2.0 是由 Optix 7 提供支持的分布式光照烘焙系统，相较于其前代产品，可扩展为更大的开放世界场景；Hive 是可协调数百个 GPU 节点的分布式网络系统。我们来看看这些新的基础架构如何真正节省时间并提高真实游戏项目的工作效率，以及我们在此过程中所汲取的经验教训。

sessions.title: 3D 物理真实数字资产加速推动机器人开发进程
sessions.speakers: Jerry Wang (Sales & Marketing Director of SpatialVerse, Manycore Tech) | Neo Zhao (Senior Solution Specialist, Manycore Tech)
sessions.points:
1. NVIDIA 初创加速计划如何助力会员企业加速成长
2. 创业企业如何通过 NVIDIA 创业生态获得多元化的支持
sessions.description: 我们将在演讲中，介绍 3D 物理真实数字资产尤其是铰链模型资产的特点，以满足机器人开发者用户在 Isaac Sim 平台下的仿真与视觉感知等任务中，对于仿真环境的诉求。这项有意义的工作可帮助开发者降低完成 Sim2Real 任务所需的成本。

sessions.title: 构建面向微尺度建模和设计需求的大原子模型生态
sessions.speakers: Linfeng Zhang (Co-Founder and Chief Scientist, DP Technology)
sessions.points:
1. AI 已将自动售货机的成本降低 70%
2. AI 已将便利店收入提高 10%
sessions.description: 人工智能的快速发展正在推动分子建模、仿真和设计领域的重大变革。我们将探索 AI 辅助分子建模的突破和进展，重点关注从多尺度方法到大型预训练模型的转变，以及由此产生的软件、数据和模型生态系统。特别地，我们将强调 NVIDIA GPU带来的高性能计算能力的重要性，并探讨构建一个覆盖元素周期表的大原子模型 (LAM) 的可能性，并以此为基础，展望 LAM 赋能的行业未来。

sessions.title: 适用于商店和自动售货机的 AI 商业化
sessions.speakers: Yili Wu (CEO, SandStar)
sessions.description: 对于零售商和 AI 公司而言，如何在数百万家商店和自动售货机中实现 AI 商业化始终是一项挑战。在过去 8 年中，SandStar 利用 AI 在 20 多个国家和地区至少降低了 70%的自动售货机成本，并将便利店收入增加了 10% 以上。了解如何借助 NVIDIA 技术支持实现这些业务优势。

sessions.title: 创业企业在生成式 AI 及机器人方向的实践与分享
sessions.speakers: Dennis Deng (Chairman, AIdong Super AI (Beijing) Co., Ltd.) | Meiran Peng (Sr. Solutions Engineer for Developer Programs, NVIDIA) | Michael Hsu (Founder, CEO, PaXini Tech) | Qixuan Zhang (CTO, Deemos Technologies, Inc.)
sessions.points:
1. 自动化语义标签识别与赋值：通过 VLM 等技术，自动识别 3D 美术资产的语义内容，并为其添加准确的语义标签
2. 物理属性推理与生成：探讨如何基于 AI 推理出 3D 美术资产的物理属性，并实现 Gen3D 合成资产的属性自动生成与 OpenUSD 导入
sessions.description: NVIDIA技术专家将深入讲解 NVIDIA 全栈式开发平台，并分享如何利用 NVIDIA SDK 开发生成式 AI 及机器人相关模型与服务，助力创业企业打造跨行业的创新应用。同时，3 家会员企业将通过生动的案例展示如何借助这些技术突破业务瓶颈，推动行业变革与发展。

sessions.title: 应用于汽车行业聊天机器人的多模态检索增强生成方案
sessions.speakers: Alex Qiu (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Guangfu Wang (Director, Great Wall Motor)
sessions.points:
1. AI 驱动的创新：了解 AI 如何通过从传统方法转向大规模预训练模型来改变分子建模
2. 大原子模型（LAM）：探索涵盖整个周期表的 LAM 概念，在仿真和设计方面发掘新的可能性
sessions.description: 深入了解汽车行业开发检索增强生成 (RAG) 应用所面临的挑战和创新解决方案。我们提出了一种基于 LLM 的解决方案，用于处理不同的文档格式知识文档、增强多模态理解和改进语义检索，以显著提高特定领域聊天机器人和问答系统的准确性。了解我们的方法如何将 HTML 文档的问答准确率从 58%提高到 89%，并在更有挑战性的多模态 PDF 格式上实现了 91%的惊人成绩。了解如何利用这些优化方法构建针对汽车领域的更强大、更准确的 LLM 应用。

sessions.title: 加速仿真：Omniverse SimReady 3D 资产自动化构建方法研究与应用
sessions.speakers: Qi Su (Product Director, Bytedance)
sessions.points:
1. 了解如何使用 LLM 和 VLM 开发统一的文档解析器，以有效处理汽车行业中常见的各种文档格式，包括 PDF、Office 文件和图像。
2. 探索将多模态理解功能集成到 RAG 应用中，使其能够理解汽车文档中的文本和视觉元素。
sessions.description: 在本次演讲中，我们将深入探讨 SimReady 3D 资产的自动化构建方法研究与应用。SimReady 资产是 NVIDIA 率先提出的一种资产定义，具有准确的语义标签、物理属性和关节结构等真实信息，能够广泛应用于虚拟仿真、合成数据生成等生产工作流中，是数字孪生技术的核心组成部分。为实现这一目标，我们将从现有 3D 美术资产和 Gen3D 生成资产的语义标签、基于 AI 的物理属性推理以及关节结构生成三个方面展开讨论：首先，我们将使用 VLM 技术自动化识别 3D...

sessions.title: 大语言模型在智能座舱中的应用
sessions.speakers: Jie Gao (Sr. Director, Digital Cockpit Department; NIO Head of AI Development for Digital Cockpit, NIO)
sessions.points:
1. 展望 2025 年 AI 发展的趋势及市场热点
2. 投资人及 AI 创业者应该如何去抓住市场的机会
sessions.description:
大语言模型（LLM）在自然语言处理（NLP）和多模态模型领域的快速发展正在推动自然交互界面（NUI）技术的根本性变革。从环境理解、自然语言理解到对话管理，LLM 正在重塑现代 NUI 系统的几乎每个组件。所有这些变化带来对智能座舱中的创新用户体验带来了更多的期望。在本次演讲中，我将介绍蔚来作为智能电动汽车（EV）行业的领导者，如何率先使用先进的 LLM 技术，在智能座舱中打造革命性的用户体验。
我们利用所有 NVIDIA LLM 软件堆栈：
Megatron Core：我们利用 Megatron Core 提高 LLM 和 多模态大模型语言模型（M-LLM）模型的训练效率。
TensorRT-LLM：我们在设备端 NVIDIA DRIVE Orin 芯片上实施 TensorRT-LLM，从而加速 M-LLM 的部署。

sessions.title: 借助 AI 集成的 3DGS 模型扩展虚拟制作和机器人仿真
sessions.speakers: Kaiyong Zhao (Founder and CEO, XGRIDS) | Sunny Liao (Global Director of Sales, XGRIDS)
sessions.points:
1. 了解我们如何利用 GPU 强大的并行计算能力，将指标计算效率提高 10 到 100 倍
2. 借助内置的遗传算法，用户可以全面、系统化地搜索指标的特征空间，从而发现难以通过传统方法构建的隐藏指标，并将分析计算过程加速数十倍
sessions.description:
学习创建高分辨率 Gaussian Splatting 模型的基础知识，并了解如何在虚拟制作和机器人仿真中编辑和应用这些模型。本次课程将介绍 由 NVIDIA 硬件与软件支持的 AI 加速工作流程，实现实时渲染、高效数据处理和与数字孪生环境的无缝集成。
了解 NVIDIA GPU 与 AI 优化技术 如何增强 3DGS 模型的质量和性能，使其成为大规模虚拟制作和机器人训练仿真的理想选择。我们将通过实际应用案例，探讨 AI 赋能的 3DGS 技术 如何简化内容创建流程、提高仿真精度，并降低计算成本。
加入我们，一同探索 AI 集成的 3D 建模 领域的最新进展，了解 NVIDIA Omniverse、CUDA 加速和 AI 增强渲染 如何革新虚拟制作与机器人仿真。

sessions.title: Fundamentals of Deep Learning
sessions.speakers: Marcell Lipp (Senior system/software engineer for autonomous driving, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. How generative AI can be applied across various financial services sectors, including capital markets, consumer finance, and payments. This involves using AI to improve decision-making, enhance customer service, automate processes, and mitigate risks
2. Strategic guidance on deploying generative AI applications effectively within financial services
sessions.description: Explore the basics of deep learning by training and deploying neural networks and using results to improve performance and capabilities.You’ll learn how to:Implement common deep learning workflows, such as image classification and object detection.Experiment with data, training parameters, network, structure, and other strategies to increase performance and capability.Deploy your neural networks to start solving real-world problems.Prerequisite(s):An understanding of fundamental programming concepts in Python 3, such as functions, loops, dictionaries, and arrays.A familiarity of pandas data structures.An understanding of how to compute a regression line.Certificate:Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth.

sessions.title: 激发通用人工智能的创造力，引领智能汽车走向新的未来
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Computation Imaging
sessions.speakers: Xiaogang Wang (Chairman and CEO, SenseAuto)
sessions.points:
1. 物理世界探索，标配 11 路相机的 SU7 成功问世，对物理世界进行了丰富探索
2. 物理世界建模，通过 BEV、OCC、世界模型等 AI 模型，逐渐逼近理解物理世界所需的精准建模
sessions.description: 通用人工智能 (AGI) 正驱动智能汽车在能力和体验方面的巨大革新，进而推动汽车智能化研发范式的变革。此演讲将探讨大模型驱动下的舱驾融合解决方案，并分享有关如何高效发挥 NVIDIA Thor 平台的关键技术和实践。

sessions.title: Build LLM Applications With Prompt Engineering
sessions.speakers: Oleg Ovcharenko (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Real-time voice-controlled AI teammate
2. Voice recognition
sessions.description: With the incredible capabilities of large language models (LLMs), enterprises are eager to integrate them into their products and internal applications for a wide variety of use cases. These include text generation, large-scale document analysis, chatbot assistants, and more.The fastest way to begin using LLMs for diverse tasks is with modern prompt engineering techniques. These techniques are also foundational for more advanced LLM-based methods, such as retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) and parameter-efficient fine-tuning (PEFT). In this workshop, you’ll work with an NVIDIA language model NIM, powered by the open-source Llama-3.1 large language model, alongside the popular LangChain library. The workshop will provide a foundational skill set for building a range of LLM-based applications using prompt engineering.You’ll learn how to:Understand how to apply iterative prompt engineering best practices to create LLM-based applications for various language-related tasks.Be proficient in using LangChain to organize and compose LLM workflows.Write application code to use LLMs for generative tasks, document analysis, chatbot applications, and more.Prerequisite(s):Familiarity with basic programming fundamentals, such as functions and variables.Certificate:Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth.

sessions.title: 加速指标计算：CPU/GPU 异构实时计算平台
sessions.speakers: Xiaohua Zhou (CEO, DolphinDB) | Yangchun Chu (COO, DolphinDB)
sessions.points:
1. 情感化智能座舱（Emotional Smart Cockpit）：我将讨论独特的情感引擎技术（Emotional Engine）技术及其实际应用，这是蔚来上产品设计的核心指南
2. LLM 的产品-模型匹配：我将解释将 LLM 功能与智能座舱产品进行匹配的过程，并详细介绍如何利用每个 LLM 功能打造多样化的新体验
sessions.description: Shark 是 DolphinDB 推出的 CPU/GPU 异构计算平台，可为大规模指标计算和数据挖掘提供解决方案。对于复杂的指标计算，Shark 提供 GPU 加速的遗传算法，与 CPU 相比，速度提升高达 90 倍。此外，Shark 还为指标计算提供了全面的金融函数库，这些指标和表达式可以在 CPU 和 GPU 平台之间无缝切换，显著提高数据分析效率。

sessions.title: AI 如何加速赋能汽车工业设计
sessions.speakers: Yabin Liu (VP, IAT Automobile Technology Co., Ltd.)
sessions.points:
1. We'll examine how organizations can accelerate real-time business insights by capturing, embedding, and retrieving dynamic data flows, making enterprise data instantly usable for AI-driven decision-making
2. Learn to solve challenges inherent in AI retrieval processes, including complexity, scale, performance, and real-time data collection
sessions.description:
探索 AI 如何改变汽车设计流程，重点关注三个关键领域：
使用 NVIDIA Modulus 进行空气动力学预测，显著减少传统计算方法所需的时间成本，提升分析效率。
在 Omniverse 中可视化风阻预测结果，帮助决策者更直观地理解空气动力学表现，从而做出更精准的设计优化和性能改进决策。
利用 Stable Diffusion 生成汽车内饰设计样式参考，能够为造型创意设计提供多样化的灵感，快速探索不同风格和元素组合。
我们将指导您了解 AI 在汽车设计中的实际应用，并就这些先进技术如何重塑行业提供见解。

sessions.title: Get Ready for NVIDIA Certification
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Aeshah Hadges (Certification Program Manager, NVIDIA) | Gary Fluitt (Technical Certification Manager, NVIDIA) | Marco Alves (Technical Certification Lead, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. 深入了解大模型训练中的各种显存优化方法
2. 基于 vTensor 的 KV cache 管理，以简化 attention kernel 适配复杂度并提升推理性能
sessions.description: Ready to showcase your AI expertise and stand out in the crowd? Join us for an exclusive certification overview session and take the first step toward becoming NVIDIA certified.In this session, we’ll help you figure out which NVIDIA certification best fits your career goals and walk you through the preparation process. You’ll get general exam hints and tips as well as details on exam topics and weightings, recommended training, and practice questions for the following exams:NVIDIA-Certified Associate: Generative AI and LLMsNVIDIA-Certified Associate: Multimodal Generative AINVIDIA-Certified Associate: AI Infrastructure and OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI InfrastructureNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: Accelerated Data Science (Coming Soon)Once you are ready, you can take any of the certification exams at GTC during the following times:Monday, Mar 17 | 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM and 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM PDTTuesday, Mar 18 | 1:00 PM - 5:00 PM PDTWednesday, Mar 19 | 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM and 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM PDTThursday, Mar 20 | 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM and 1:00 PM - 5:00 PM PDTFriday, Mar 21 | 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM and 1:00 PM - 4:00 PM PDTDon't miss this exclusive opportunity to validate your expertise at no cost. Be among the first to earn your NVIDIA certification and stand out in the competitive fields of AI and accelerated computing.Get certified and secure your invitation to the exclusive NVIDIA Certified Reception on Thursday, March 20th, 7:30 PM – 9:30 PM.

sessions.title: Find the Bottleneck: Optimize AI Pipelines With Nsight Systems
sessions.speakers: Robert Dietrich (Sr. System Software Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Practical strategies for architecting scalable, Kubernetes-based AI cloud infrastructures
2. Insights into optimizing hardware utilization and implementing innovative cooling solutions for energy efficiency
sessions.description: Learn to use NVIDIA Nsight Systems to detect bottlenecks in AI pipelines and explore new features to optimize and scale the execution of your applications. We'll guide you through the performance analysis process of GPU-accelerated AI applications that run across multiple, possibly containerized, compute instances. In addition to profiling of CPU, GPU, network and I/O activity, we'll show how NVTX and the plugin mechanism enable the collection of custom data, which allows an even more comprehensive and tailored analysis on the target platform. You'll also learn about the recipe system that simplifies the identification of bottlenecks in applications running across multiple nodes.Prerequisite(s):Familiarity with GPUs and CUDA.

sessions.title: The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly: Cost-Efficient LLM Inference With Quantization, Pruning, and Distillation
sessions.speakers: Ziv Ilan (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Harshita Seth (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Lavinia Ghita (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the concept of sidekick facilities as cost-effective hardware representations of high-end scientific facilities, including analogous drivers and diagnostics
2. Learn how these systems facilitate the development of digital twin and closed-loop control infrastructures, components, and software
sessions.description: Dive into theoretical aspects and practical use cases for compression techniques used in creating more efficient versions of preferred models. Learn the main methods of compression — quantization, pruning, distillation — in detail, and compare trade-offs and options for jointly using multiple compression techniques. You'll become well-equipped to perform efficient inference and reduce costs when deploying LLMs. You'll understand the trade-offs in accuracy, latency, and hardware requirements for each method, and have hands-on expertise in deploying them using solutions from NVIDIA stack.Prerequisite(s):Python.Basic knowledge of LLMs.Familiarity with deep learning frameworks.

sessions.title: Developing Industrial Digital Twins Applications for Apple Vision Pro
sessions.speakers: Jen Borucki (Omniverse Spatial Workflow Developer, NVIDIA) | Max Bickley (Product Manager, Spatial Computing, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Grid Impact: Learn about the significant influence of the grid on data center sustainability, emphasizing the need for understanding and optimizing grid interactions to enhance overall environmental impact
2. Renewable Integration: Gain insights into the effective integration and procurement of renewables within AI data centers. Learn strategies for leveraging renewable energy to bolster sustainability efforts and reduce carbon footprint
sessions.description: This advanced lab guides developers through creating captivating spatial experiences for Apple Vision Pro, leveraging SwiftUI and Xcode for frontend development while utilizing NVIDIA Omniverse as a powerful backend server. You’ll explore visionOS development techniques to develop immersive user interfaces for interacting with and optimizing your industrial digital twin.By the end of this lab, you'll be able to create a fully interactive and immersive spatial experience that seamlessly blends digital content with the physical space using Apple Vision Pro technology. This lab is tailored for developers interested in spatial computing and creating next-generation applications for Apple Vision Pro.For participants who plan on testing their final application with the Apple Vision Pro, please note that glasses are not permitted to be worn with the device.Prerequisite(s):Proficiency in Swift programming language and SwiftUI framework.Experience with Xcode IDE and iOS development basics.Experience with VS Code IDE and Python development basics.Proficiency in OpenUSD, NVIDIA Omniverse and the Omniverse Kit SDK.

sessions.title: Driving Actionable Network Insights at Verizon with Real-Time SQL Retrieval and Vector Search
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Large Language Models (LLMs)
sessions.speakers: Nima Negahban (Co-Founder and CEO, Kinetica)
sessions.points:
1. Cost — Implementation of fine-tuned open-source models for LLM tools led to 70% reduction in cost.
2. Latency/Inference Time — Processing efficiency for a large batch of requests has reduced latency by 75%.
sessions.description:
At Verizon, the ability to troubleshoot customer network issues in real-time is critical for operations. Conventional tools can be slow and cumbersome leading to increased network inefficiencies. Kinetica solved Verizon’s problem with a generative AI copilot that runs in production, powered by NVIDIA cuVS.

Built on a decade of engineering atop NVIDIA hardware and software, Kinetica software enabled engineers to find root causes and reduce resolution time from hours to minutes. The Verizon copilot is built using integrated GPU-accelerated compute with CUDA for ad-hoc SQL retrieval and NVIDI cuVS for high-performance vector search, enabling actionable insights from live network data and text while accelerating diagnostics. This approach tripled the number of resolved tickets for Verizon, further enhancing productivity and customer satisfaction.

sessions.title: Get NVIDIA Certified
sessions.speakers: Aeshah Hadges (Certification Program Manager, NVIDIA) | Gary Fluitt (Technical Certification Manager, NVIDIA) | Marco Alves (Technical Certification Lead, NVIDIA)
sessions.description: For the first time ever, GTC 2025 attendees will have the exclusive opportunity to earn NVIDIA certifications at no cost. Seize this unique opportunity to validate your expertise, showcase your skills, and join the ranks of NVIDIA-certified professionals. Seats are limited and available on a first-come, first-served basis—be sure to register onsite to secure your spot!Why Certify?Validate your expertise in cutting-edge NVIDIA technologies.Boost your career prospects and earning potential.Join an elite community of NVIDIA-certified professionals.Available Certifications:NVIDIA-Certified Associate: Generative AI and LLMsNVIDIA-Certified Associate: Multimodal Generative AINVIDIA-Certified Associate: AI Infrastructure and OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI InfrastructureNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: Accelerated Data Science (Coming Soon)How to Register for an exam slot:Register for the conference.Review preparation materials thoroughly before attempting the exam.Add this session to your schedule.Sign up for an exam slot onsite.Arrive early to secure your spot – seats are limited and fill quickly.Please note the following:This promotion is available to in-person attendees only, and only available at GTC.The last exams will begin at 3:30 PM or 4:00 PM depending on the schedule.Get certified and secure your invitation to the exclusive NVIDIA Certified Reception on Thursday, March 20th, 7:30 PM – 9:30 PM.

sessions.title: The Future of Video Compression is AI-Driven
sessions.speakers: Sharon Carmel (CEO, Beamr)
sessions.points:
1. Understand available tools for model compression when smaller models are required for inference, and decide which one works best for the specifics of each use case, its requirements and constraints
2. Main components and motivations behind the major model compression techniques: quantization, pruning, and distillation
sessions.description: Learn how AI is reshaping video compression by enhancing efficiency and quality in future-ready video workflows. As AI algorithms focus on compression efforts and improve bitrate optimization, the video itself transforms into AI video.

sessions.title: Building Generative AI for a Billion Indian Voices
sessions.speakers: Pratyush Kumar (Co-Founder, Sarvam AI) | Sunil Gupta (Co-Founder, Managing Director, and Chief Executive Officer, Yotta Data Centres)
sessions.points:
1. Scalability challenges of vector search workloads in databases
2. Scalability and performance wins by using GPU acceleration
sessions.description: We'll discuss building domain-specific generative AI solutions that are voice-first and cost effective. We'll dive deep into how we build our Multilingual IndicASR, IndicLLM, and IndicTTS using NVIDIA NeMo framework. Furthermore, we'll explore new techniques to deploy these speech AI models using NVIDIA RIVA framework and TensorRT-LLM for serving the LLM models with FP8 on H100 GPU Infrastructure to achieve the lowest cost of ownership. We'll also address key research challenges in building state-of-the-art multilingual automatic speech recognition, LLM, and text-to-speech models, ensuring our voice-to-voice generative AI stack delivers real-time performance.

sessions.title: Scaling Open Source AI: From Foundation Models to Ecosystem Success
sessions.speakers: Ion Stocia (Professor, EECS Department, University of California, Berkeley) | Matt White (Executive Director, PyTorch; GM of AI, Linux Foundation) | Ankit Patel (Sr. Director, Developer Engagement, NVIDIA) | Joe Spisak (Director of Product Management, Generative AI, Meta) | Stephanie Zhan (Partner, Sequoia Capital)
sessions.points:
1. Discover different deployment options for secure AI: deploying as a confidential virtual machine (CVM) on bare metal with tamper-proof execution, or using Confidential Containers in Kubernetes
2. Explore how to build explicit trusts, securing model aggregation, and preventing model theft through CC
sessions.description: Learn how open source is transforming AI development, bringing together experts from industry, academia, and venture capital to discuss the technical and business aspects of collaborative open source AI development. Our distinguished panelists will examine how open source projects like PyTorch, vLLM, Ray, and NVIDIA's NeMo are accelerating AI innovation while creating new opportunities for businesses and researchers. They'll share real-world experiences from PyTorch's development, Berkeley's research initiatives, and successful AI startups. Take away valuable insights into the technical and business aspects of open source AI.

sessions.title: Kernel Optimization for AI and Beyond: Unlocking the Power of Nsight Compute
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Large Language Models (LLMs)
sessions.speakers: Felix Schmitt (Sr. System Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Peter Labus (Senior System Software Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Laiye AI Foundry 是一个面向企业场景应用提供了大模型定制化平台，它致力于构建一个自主可控的人工智能生态系统。通过保障企业的数据主权，驱动企业的智能化转型。
2. 利用 NVIDIA AI Enterprise (NVAIE) 组件，如 NVIDIA NeMo Framework，Laiye AI Foundry 构建了一个持续改进和优化的“数据和模型飞轮”。这一机制确保了企业大模型的性能和效果能够随着时间的推移而不断提升，通过不断的学习和适应，模型能够更好地服务于企业的具体需求。
sessions.description: Learn how to unlock the full potential of NVIDIA GPUs with the powerful profiling and analysis capabilities of Nsight Compute. AI workloads are rapidly increasing the demand for GPU computing, and ensuring that they efficiently utilize all available GPU resources is essential. Nsight Compute is the most powerful tool for understanding kernel execution behavior and performance. Learn how to configure and launch profiles customized for your needs, including advice on profiling accelerated Python applications, AI frameworks like PyTorch, and optimizing Tensor Core utilization essential to modern AI performance. Learn how to debug your kernel and use the expert system built into Nsight Compute, known as “Guided Analysis,” that automatically detects common issues and directs you to the most relevant performance data all the way down to the source code level.Prerequisite(s):Familiarity with CUDA.

sessions.title: Streamline Drug Discovery With NVIDIA BioNeMo NIMs and Blueprints
sessions.topic: Content Creation / Rendering - Ray Tracing / Path Tracing
sessions.speakers: Kristopher Kersten (Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA) | Neel Patel (WWFO - Clara Healthcare) (Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. New API to support differentiable rendering and AI training in OptiX
2. New API to enable mega-scale scene geometry in real-time scenarios
sessions.description: Drug discovery involves several stages, including target identification, hit identification, and lead optimization, each requiring the analysis of large biochemical datasets. Artificial intelligence has already shown great promise in enhancing these stages, for which NVIDIA BioNeMo provides a platform for training, fine-tuning, and deploying LLMs and generative AI tailored for drug discovery. With BioNeMo NIMs, researchers can streamline AI workflows using cloud-native, modular components that improve the scalability and deployment of complex models. We'll highlight how BioNeMo NIMs and Blueprints can accelerate drug development, improve prediction accuracy, and enable more efficient analysis of biochemical data, showcasing real-world examples of their transformative potential in drug discovery.Prerequisite(s):Basic python understanding.Basic ML understanding.Basic understanding of dockers.

sessions.title: Blackwell Numerics for AI
sessions.speakers: Paulius Micikevicius (NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Leverage robot learning technologies to enhance your robotics projects
2. Build robot policies using to sim-to-real approach
sessions.description: We'll describe the number formats supported by Blackwell GPU architecture and their best uses for AI. We'll also explain the recipes for using these formats for both training and inference, providing accuracy and speed results. Software and tool support will also be discussed.

sessions.title: Interpret Health Data With AI to Change the Future of Medicine
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Training AI Models
sessions.speakers: Jurgi Camblong (CEO and Co-Founder, SOPHiA GENETICS)
sessions.points:
1. Why autonomous vehicles are critical for the future of transportation
2. How generative AI is driving a new end-to-end architecture to power autonomous vehicles
sessions.description: Today, medicine stands on the cusp of revolution due to the availability of more health data than ever before. We’ll dive into how AI is used to cut through data complexity and enable faster innovation, while providing an opportunity to make medical advancements and advance health equity for all.

sessions.title: The Speed of Thought: Navigate LLM Inference Autoscaling for a Gen AI Application Toward Production
sessions.speakers: Dmitry Mironov (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Sergio Perez (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Mohak Chadha (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Enhanced Concurrency: Moving tasks like toxic language detection and toxic voice detection to the GPU allows for better concurrency, enabling faster, near-real-time processing of player chats
2. Faster Time-to-Action: Leveraging GPUs helps reduce the time needed to detect and respond to player behavior or game events, leading to more immediate outcomes and enhanced player experience
sessions.description: Learn how to choose the autoscaling hyperparameters for your LLM applications by understanding the key metrics during inference. Gain essential tools to optimize latency and throughput by running and dissecting LLM inference benchmarks. See how NVIDIA's benchmarking software can be leveraged to make an informed decision about the Kubernetes deployment of your Gen AI application. You'll acquire best practices and tips to allow you to bring low latency at unmatched cost-effectiveness to your NIM applications for production.Prerequisite(s):Comfortable reading code in Python and Pandas.Basic understanding of Kubernetes.Basic understanding of LLMs.

sessions.title: Developing an OpenUSD Configurator Experience for Apple Vision Pro
sessions.topic: AR / VR - AR / VR Development Tools
sessions.speakers: Jen Borucki (Omniverse Spatial Workflow Developer, NVIDIA) | Max Bickley (Product Manager, Spatial Computing, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn the fundamentals of visionOS development using SwiftUI and Xcode
2. Gain hands-on experience integrating NVIDIA Omniverse as a backend for high-fidelity 3D content and real-time rendering
sessions.description: Explore the future of retail with spatial computing. In this hands-on lab, we'll have the opportunity to create an application for the Apple Vision Pro (AVP) that allows users to configure a photoreal, 3D asset. This includes how to develop an application and set it up to communicate with a product configurator built with the Omniverse Kit SDK and OpenUSD. We'll also learn how to implement custom Swift UI to interact with the virtual product in real time. You'll learn to leverage advanced technologies to create immersive, interactive retail experiences.For participants who plan on testing their final application with the Apple Vision Pro, please note that glasses are not permitted to be worn with the device.Prerequisite(s):Basic knowledge of Swift programming language and SwiftUI framework.Familiarity with Xcode IDE and iOS development basics.Familiarity with VS Code IDE and Python development basics.Basic knowledge of OpenUSD, NVIDIA Omniverse and the Omniverse Kit SDK.

sessions.title: Enable Intelligent Storage to Process Data for AI Applications
sessions.speakers: Vincent Hsu (VP, IBM Fellow, CTO for IBM Storage, IBM) | Rob Davis (VP Storage Technology, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Uncover the growing challenges of high-throughput next-generation sequencing (NGS) and current barriers to data analysis
2. Learn how the most advanced GPUs and AI are constantly evolving to handle never-before-seen data generation rates
sessions.description: The common implementation of AI pipelines today is to bring data to AI. This works well when your dataset is relatively small and co-located. When we look at the next step of AI journey, we know one thing for sure: there will be a lot more data in a lot more locations. The effective way to address this challenge is to push AI processing closer to where the data is. This concept is “AI Content-Aware Storage (AI CAST).” The vision of content-aware storage is to enable intelligent storage to process data for AI applications. We'll demonstrate the architecture of AI CAST by leveraging  NVIDIA Blueprints and NIMs to accelerate the retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipeline by incorporating storage and storage metadata in the Continuous Data Ingest and vector DB management.

sessions.title: CUDA Techniques to Maximize Memory Bandwidth and Hide Latency
sessions.speakers: Athena Elafrou (Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Allard Hendriksen (Sr. Developer Technology, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Data curation
2. Data quality assurance
sessions.description: Do you want to write speed-of-light CUDA kernels? When a hand-written kernel is the right approach for the job, you want to use the best possible practices to maximize performance on the GPU. In this tutorial, we will showcase techniques to maximize memory bandwidth and hide memory latencies in our CUDA kernels, including how to efficiently use shared memory, distributed shared memory and asynchronous data copies.

sessions.title: Harnessing AI for Advanced Flood Risk Modelling and Mitigation Strategies
sessions.speakers: David Wood (Director, JBA Risk Management) | Marius Koch (Solution Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Increasing HBM bandwidth and capacity will address growing data and performance demands in AI and HPC
2. Reducing power per bit of data transferred is essential for applications aiming to improve energy efficiency
sessions.description: Understanding flood risk beyond historical precedent is essential for catastrophe modelling. We leverage Nvidia's Earth2 platform to evaluate the Huge Ensemble (HENS) method developed by researchers at Berkeley. The approach combines Spherical Fourier Neural Operators (SFNO) with bred vectors and multiple checkpoints to generate large ensembles of synthetic weather scenarios. By integrating this AI-driven approach into JBA’s flood modelling workflow, we simulated 1,008 realizations of the 2023-2024 winter season for the Elbe River basin, capturing a range of plausible meteorological conditions and their potential flood impacts. This work demonstrates the potential for AI weather models to enhance catastrophe modelling, enabling more comprehensive risk assessment and resilience planning for the insurance industry.

sessions.title: GPU DiskANN and Beyond: Accelerating Microsoft Vector Search with NVIDIA cuVS
sessions.speakers: Benjamin Karsin (AI Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Renan Santana (Software Engineer, Microsoft) | Xinlin Li (Senior Software Engineer, Microsoft)
sessions.points:
1. Understand and implement RAG for contextual AI interactions
2. Integrate multi-modal AI models to enhance digital human capabilities
sessions.description: From web search to ads recommendation to RAG, vector search has become an essential operation for vast range of large-scale applications. However, these applications may have widely varying requirements. As such, no single design or algorithm fits all use cases. Nevertheless, GPUs can accelerate many scenarios, potentially giving orders of magnitude improvements in index construction time or search throughput, compared with CPU-based solutions. In this talk joint talk with Microsoft and NVIDIA, we will present a range of Microsoft use cases that require high performance vector search. We will then discuss the unique challenges of these scenarios and how we leverage NVIDIA GPUs and the cuVS library to accelerate these workloads. From fast DiskANN index construction to high-throghput filtered search, a range of algorithms, features, and optimizations are used to leverage GPUs and provide performance and cost benefits over current CPU-based solutions.

sessions.title: Create your own End-to-End Data Flywheel on NVIDIA DGX Cloud
sessions.speakers: Zoey Zhang (Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA) | Robert Clark (Sr. Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Dive into core GPU programming concepts, such as SIMT programming, warp scheduling, and Little’s law. See how to apply them when optimizing your CUDA kernels.
2. Understand how both occupancy and instruction level parallelism can be used to hide latencies, increase instructions in flight, and keep your CUDA cores busy.
sessions.description: In this session, learn how to build an end-to-end generative AI pipeline with NVIDIA AI technologies on DGX Cloud. We'll begin with an overview of a DGX Cloud cluster and how to deploy NeMo Microservices. Next, using the microservices, we'll demonstrate how to leverage synthetic data generation and retrieval-augmented generation to create a novel dataset. Lastly, together we'll fine-tune a community LLM with the custom dataset, and deploy the final model as a NIM on DGX Cloud for inference. Come learn how DGX Cloud enables the end-to-end LLM development pipeline and serves your AI development needs!

sessions.title: Introduction to Robot Simulation: Learn How to Develop, Simulate, and Deploy Scalable Robot Intelligence
sessions.speakers: Ashish Kapoor (CEO, Scaled Foundations) | Sai Vemprala (Co-Founder and CTO, Scaled Foundations)
sessions.points:
1. Novel approach to automating the entire LLM life cycle using CI/CD pipelines on Kubernetes in a cloud-agnostic approach
2. Discover how NVIDIA NIMs and Nemo Microservices can be leveraged to create scalable and flexible CI/CD pipelines for LLMs
sessions.description: Robots hold massive potential to automate and scale difficult and repetitive tasks across industries and in our lives. Programming robots to conduct these tasks safely has historically been challenging, costly, and specialized. Robotics simulation enables developers to virtually train, test, and validate robots in physics-based digital representations of the real world.In this lab, we’ll take you through the end-to-end robotics development process using Scaled Foundations’ GRID platform powered by NVIDIA Isaac Sim. Starting with a fully functional robot simulation instance with a robot, sensor, AI model, and environment, you’ll create an end-to-end, functional robot solution to perform a task and combine your robot solution with several of the latest robot AI models. Finally, you’ll see how you can take your solution from GRID and deploy on a real robot.Prerequisite(s):Experience with Python.Basic knowledge of robotic architectures.

sessions.title: “I See Dead Pipelines...Without CI/CD:" The Gen AI Easy Button for Fine-Tuning, Evaluation, and Inference With NVIDIA NIMs and NeMo Microservices
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Profilers / Debuggers / Code Analysis
sessions.speakers: Dmitry Mironov (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Anshul Jindal (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Martin Piercy (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how to profile and optimize AI kernels with Nsight Compute to get the most out of your GPU's performance
2. Learn how to identify common performance bottlenecks and how to resolve them
sessions.description: "Dead pipelines" — abandoned scripts that once ran parts of a workflow — plague LLM development, causing errors, delays, and wasted resources. Learn how to automate the entire LLM life cycle using CI/CD pipelines, Kubernetes, NVIDIA NIMs, and NeMo Microservices in a cloud-agnostic approach. Discover how to streamline development, fine-tuning, evaluation, and deployment of LLMs, ensuring seamless integration, validation, and deployment of updates.In this hands-on course, you'll:Design and build a cloud-agnostic LLMOps CI/CD pipeline on Kubernetes for scalable and flexible Gen AI app deployment.Utilize Argo CD for declarative continuous delivery and Argo Workflows for managing complex LLM workflows.Leverage NVIDIA NIMs and NeMo Microservices in the end-to-end LLMOps pipeline.Learn how to improve development cycles, accuracy, and reliability with automated fine-tuning and continuous evaluation.Prerequisite(s):Kubernetes basic knowledge.DevOps tools basic knowledge like ArgoCD.

sessions.title: Optimizing Multi-Language Scientific Simulations: A Grace Superchip Case Study
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Industrial Digitalization / Digital Twin
sessions.speakers: Holly Wilper (Manager, System Software Tools, NVIDIA) | Michael Wall (Senior Scientist, Los Alamos National Lab)
sessions.points:
1. See how Teamcenter enables photorealistic visualization of your digital twins using multi-CAD data, managed in Teamcenter
2. Discover the benefits of incorporating photorealism in the product design
sessions.description: The LANL Scalable Ecosystem for Complex Chemistry Simulations (SEDACS) team recently ported their computational chemistry framework and associated libraries from a pure CPU workload for the x86-64 instruction set to the LANL Venado supercomputer based on nodes built from NVIDIA Grace Hopper Superchips. The SEDACS and NVIDIA Nsight Systems teams will tell this porting story, how the workload was balanced to take advantage of the compute resources, and explain the gains in performance and efficiency achieved. We’ll demonstrate how Nsight Systems features for Grace Hopper platforms are used in practice, with a large multi-language scientific software project.

sessions.title: Pioneering AI in Higher Education: Accessible Learning and Future-Proofing Universities
sessions.topic: Content Creation / Rendering - Rendering Engines / Pipelines / Tools
sessions.speakers: Katherine Yelick (Vice Chancellor for Research, University of California, Berkeley) | Jack Wells (Director of Higher Education and Research Computing, NVIDIA) | Arijit Raychowdhury (Steve W. Chaddick School Chair, Georgia Tech School of Electrical and Computer Engineering) | David Keyes (Founding Dean and Founding Director of the Extreme Computing Research Center, KAUST) | Satoshi Matsuoka (Director, RIKEN Center for Computational Science)
sessions.points:
1. ways: Learn to profile and optimize performance for CUDA, ray tracing, and AI-enhanced graphics applications using NVIDIA Nsight Graphics.
2. Understand the connection between high-level programming constructs (CUDA C, HLSL, GLSL) and GPU hardware performance.
sessions.description: Join us for a dynamic panel discussion with esteemed executives from top universities. We'll explore the transformative power of AI in higher education. Discover how these leading institutions are harnessing AI to enhance accessibility, innovate teaching methods, and future-proof their curricula. Dive into real-world case studies, emerging trends, and best practices for integrating AI into academia. This session is a must-attend for educators, administrators, and tech enthusiasts eager to shape the future of learning.

sessions.title: Profiling Hybrid CUDA/Graphics Applications using Nsight Graphics
sessions.speakers: Aurelio Reis (Director, Graphics Developer Tools, NVIDIA) | Axel Mamode (Graphics Performance Tools Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the security risks associated with autonomous AI systems
2. Be prepared for the new threats of multimodal LLMs
sessions.description: In this session, you'll learn how to use NVIDIA Nsight Graphics to profile applications that combine the use of CUDA and graphics APIs , including ray tracing and AI-enhanced workloads, focusing on optimizing performance across compute and graphics tasks. We’ll explore the connection between high-level CUDA C, shader code (HLSL, GLSL), and GPU hardware concepts, while inspecting performance traces of CUDA, DirectX, Vulkan, and NVIDIA SDK calls. By the end of the session, you’ll be better equipped to identify and resolve performance bottlenecks at both the source code and GPU assembly (SASS) levels, ensuring your applications run with maximum efficiency.

sessions.title: Edge Computing 101: Introduction to Smart Edge and Autonomous Robots
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Industrial Digitalization / Digital Twin
sessions.speakers: Chen Su (Sr. Technical Product Marketing Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how to create digital twins of stores, combined with planograms to optimize merchandising
2. Find out how store associates deliver the best in-store customer shopping experience using GenAI
sessions.description: Discover the potential of NVIDIA's edge AI platform in transforming the future of smart edge and autonomous robotics. This session will provide an overview of the platform's capabilities across embedded edge, industrial edge, and enterprise edge environments. Learn about the best practices and software framework that enable AI-powered robots and intelligent vision systems from advanced sensor processing to real-time decision-making. Explore how these innovative technologies are creating generative physical AI systems and shaping industries across healthcare, retails, robotics, transportation, manufacturing and more.

sessions.title: Create, Cure, Care: Reimagining Healthcare — Driving Innovation From Ideation with AI
sessions.topic: Data Center / Cloud - Software-Defined Data Center
sessions.speakers: Chelsea Sumner (Healthcare Startups Lead, Americas, NVIDIA) | CONY D'CRUZ (CEO and Founder, Superluminal Medicines, Inc.) | Alessandro De Sario (CEO and Co-Founder, Therapyside) | Davide Tricarico (CTO, AITEM solutions srl) | Shai Shen-Orr (Chief Scientist and Co-Founder, CytoReason)
sessions.points:
1. AI Foundry on DGX Cloud to build your own flywheel
2. End-to-end model creation workflow including synthetic data generation and retrieval-augmented generation
sessions.description:
Generative AI and foundational models are transforming healthcare and life sciences by enhancing efficiency, driving breakthroughs, and enabling tailored approaches to care. These technologies are creating a future where innovation changes how care is given, making patient outcomes and experiences much better. They're doing this by accelerating drug discovery, improving clinical workflows, and improving patient care.

This panel brings together leaders from CytoReason, AITEM, Therapyside, and Superluminal Medicines, showcasing how NVIDIA inference microservices (NIMs), AI blueprints, and BioNeMo are driving advances in diagnostics, therapy workflows, and drug development. Through a technical and forward-looking discussion, we’ll explore how these innovators are integrating AI into their systems, overcoming challenges, and shaping a future where technology fundamentally transforms patient care and advances the potential for better health for all.

sessions.title: How Lowe’s Leverages AI to Become an Agile Digital Retailer
sessions.speakers: Azita Martin (VP and GM, AI for Retail and CPG, NVIDIA) | Chandhu Nair (SVP Technology - Data, Artificial Intelligence & Innovation, Lowe's)
sessions.points:
1. AI-powered NPCs can join group voice chats
2. Combination of extended reality and AI technology
sessions.description: Lowe’s has been at the forefront of leveraging AI in every aspect of their business. From generative AI (GenAI) to digital twins to computer vision, Lowe’s is using AI across their entire value chain to become a more agile digital retailer, optimize merchandising, reduce shrink, and deliver the best customer shopping experience. We'll highlight how Lowe’s has created digital twins of their stores, combined with planograms to optimize merchandising. It created an associate sales advisor using GenAI to ensure store associates deliver the best in-store customer shopping experience. And finally, using computer vision, Lowe’s is preventing shrink and speeding up the customer checkout experience.

sessions.title: Advancing Sovereign AI in Korea: Data-Efficient Multilingual Pre-Training by Trillion Labs
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Computational Chemistry / Materials Science
sessions.speakers: Jay Shin (CEO, Trillion Labs)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how AI enabled by the power of GPUs allows us to map and calculate the entire universe of “small” organic molecules of 10^11 that was previously never possible
2. Learn how generative models, such as reinforcement learning agents and large language models (LLMs), significantly accelerate the discovery and design of novel electrolyte molecules for lithium metal batteries
sessions.description: We'll share how we've built a next-generation multilingual large language model that achieves world-class performance on Korean language tasks while preserving the flexibility to excel across other languages. Leveraging data-efficient scaling laws and tailored data mixtures, we'll show how to optimize pre-training efficiency without compromising model quality. We'll also discuss our specialized tokenizers designed for multilingual data, along with a unique “knowledge bridging” technique that transfers insights from high-resource languages during pre-training to strengthen Korean capabilities. Finally, we'll introduce mixture-of-experts (MoE) layers for multilingual pre-training that enables more efficient scaling and adaptation across diverse language pairs. Gain insight into the core recipes and best practices for building sovereign multilingual LLMs, with a focus on elevating Korean AI technology to global leadership.

sessions.title: Apply Multi-Node Multi-GPU Computing to HPO and Inference
sessions.speakers: Roman Yokunda Enzmann (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Nick Venanzi (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Miguel Martinez (Sr. Deep Learning Data Scientist, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how to develop AI agents that automate 5G network configurations using LangGraph and NVIDIA NIM
2. Discover how LLM agents monitor network QoS and automatically create new slices when congestion occurs
sessions.description: With ever-increasing amounts of data and limited compute resources, training competitive ML models end-to-end can take hours, days, or even weeks. Parallel computing offers a solution. Join us to learn how to reduce your end-to-end ML pipeline and increase model accuracy by parallelizing and distributing model training, hyperparameter optimization, and inference across GPUs.Prerequisite(s):Foundational understanding of a data science workflow on tabular data.Experience with programming in Python.Experience with the Pandas and scikit-learn API.

sessions.title: Train Video Foundation Models at Scale
sessions.speakers: Ersin Yumer (Sr. Director of AI/ML Platform and Data, Adobe)
sessions.points:
1. Achieve Photoreal Quality: Learn how ray tracing delivers superior image quality beyond traditional game engine pipelines
2. Streamline Asset Pipeline: Discover how to go directly from DCC applications to LED walls while maintaining full production assets
sessions.description: Join us for a deep dive into how generative AI is being used to train foundation models at scale.

sessions.title: Immersive BMW Factory Tour powered by AI
sessions.speakers: Xaver Freiherr Loeffelholz von Colberg (Product Owner 3D AppStore, BMW Group)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how to make your video models faster to render, working closely with NVIDIA
2. Taming thousands of GPUs for training and inference for large video models
sessions.description: Building on our 3D AppStore, the cloud streaming solution for high-end visualization presented at last year's GTC, we're now enabling a new use case to support BMW's implementation of a new battery assembly process across multiple factories worldwide. We'll demonstrate how we integrate AI NPCs (non-playable characters) into any application on our 3D AppStore, focusing on the Gen 6 Battery Assembly use case. Using AWS Bedrock, we created a knowledge base (retrieval augmented generation, or RAG) from a Confluence project that details each station in the battery assembly process. Multiple users can interact with the AI freely via a group voice chat. Given the global requirement, we support multiple languages, including English, German, Spanish, and Chinese. The NPC is integrated into a detailed 3D visualization of the factory, which can be experienced in virtual and augmented reality, thanks to NVIDIA's Cloud XR. Additionally, we are evaluating different NVIDIA inference microservices, like Audio2Face, to better integrate the NPCs into the virtual world.

sessions.title: An Introduction to OpenUSD
sessions.speakers: Aaron Luk (Director of Product Management, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how we can use the accelerated libraries NVIDIA RAPIDS and NVIDIA Triton to create a multi-node multi-GPU end-to-end accelerated ML pipeline
2. Get insights into each step of the modeling process, all packaged into a reproducible environment
sessions.description: Universal Scene Description is much more than just a file format. This open, powerful, easily extensible world composition framework has APIs for creating, editing, querying, rendering, simulating, and collaboration within highly complex 3D scenes. NVIDIA continues to invest in helping evolve USD for workflows beyond media & entertainment to enable industrial digitalization workflows and the next wave of computer vision and generative AIs. Join this session to learn about the latest developments from NVIDIA and our next major milestones.

sessions.title: Building a 3D Image-Based Search System for Medical Images: How Can Foundational Models Help?
sessions.topic: Conversational AI - Audio / Speech Foundation Models
sessions.speakers: Ivan Tarapov (Group Manager, Healthcare AI, Microsoft) | Alberto Santamaria-Pang (Principal Applied Data Scientist, Microsoft)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how to develop cost-effective, domain-specific generative AI solutions that prioritize voice-first applications, including Multilingual IndicASR, IndicLLM, and IndicTTS using the NVIDIA NeMo framework
2. Explore innovative deployment techniques for speech AI and LLM models using the NVIDIA RIVA framework and TensorRT-LLM, leveraging FP8 on H100 GPU infrastructure to minimize the cost of ownership
sessions.description: Dive deep into the transformative potential of foundational multimodal models in the realm of medical imaging. We'll explore how advanced models can be harnessed to build sophisticated 3D medical image search systems that meet the exacting standards of clinical relevance. We'll walk you through the latest tools and technologies available, shedding light on how to effectively implement them in your projects. Learn about the critical search criteria — such as accuracy, speed, and specificity — that are essential for clinical applications, and discover how to configure your system to prioritize these factors. We'll also discuss strategies for managing the costs associated with building and operating these systems, ensuring you can achieve high performance without exceeding your budget. You'll see some hands-on examples and gain actionable insights and practical knowledge that will help you develop cutting-edge 3D image search solutions in the medical field.

sessions.title: Address Complex/Logical Tasks With Conversational AI: Multi-Agent, Multi-Turn Framework From Scratch
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Medical Imaging
sessions.speakers: Sagar Desai (Sr. Solution Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Explore how MONAI accelerates the development of AI models for medical imaging applications
2. Learn about leveraging generative AI foundational models to create synthetic medical imaging data
sessions.description: Learn to build an agent framework to tackle the multi-turn complex task, how to add tools, and multi-turn agents behavior. Learn how to build conversational AI agents that can tackle complex tasks with ease, and explore new techniques for multi-turn conversations and persona-based interactions.Prerequisite(s):Python, GenAI.

sessions.title: AI’s Enterprise Breakthrough: Delivering Real-Time Intelligence at Scale (Presented by VAST Data, Inc.)
sessions.speakers: Jeff Denworth (Co-Founder, VAST Data)
sessions.points:
1. 借助 Modulus 进行空气动力学预测：了解如何使用 NVIDIA Modulus 预测风阻、优化车辆设计以快速提高性能。
2. Omniverse：了解如何在 Omniverse 中可视化预测的空气动力学结果，使设计师能够根据准确的模拟做出明智的决策。
sessions.description: Learn how enterprises can overcome the constraints of retrieval-augmented generation pipelines to enable secure, real-time, AI-powered decision-making. We'll showcase a universal view into all of an enterprise’s structured and unstructured data to achieve advanced AI-enabled decision-making.

sessions.title: AI-Powered Art: The Influence of Robots on Creative Expression
sessions.speakers: Alexander Reben (Artist) | Heather Schoell (NVIDIA) | Andrew Zolty (Artist known as BREAKFAST) | Catie Cuan (Entrepreneur, Engineer, and Artist, Zenie, Stanford, Exploratorium) | Emanuel Gollob (Artist and Researcher, Creative Robotics, University of Arts Linz)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the value and importance of edge computing
2. Learn the tools and framework necessary to build edge AI and robotics systems
sessions.description: While artists can work with AI as a tool, a collaborator, or a muse, when a robot is added to the mix, artists are defining what role the robot will play in their creative practice. For some, like Emanuel Gollob, his robot synchronizes with the observer’s brainwaves and helps them “do nothing” and daydream. Artist Alex Reben uses robots and AI as executors of his conceptual works, a means to an end that couldn't have been achieved without the use of this technology. Catie Cuan develops interactions with robots, by first designing the robot to move and feel in a way that complements her vision, and then the way she and the audience experience that interaction builds further on her creative voice. And BREAKFAST transforms real-time data from the natural world to tell stories through his kinetic artworks. By understanding how artists use robots, we can learn more about the cultural impact of using robots for certain experiences. We can also teach the public about robotics and AI, and we can inspire innovative applications in other fields.

sessions.title: AI Promise to Profits: Maximize Business ROI with Accelerated Computing  (Presented by IBM)
sessions.speakers: Hillery Hunter (CTO of IBM Infrastructure, IBM) | Briana Frank (VP, IBM Cloud PaaS and Platform Product Management and Design, IBM Cloud) | Chandra Ravi (Senior Director, Distributed Systems Engineering, Visa)
sessions.points:
1. Explore a new era of AI-powered insights through the processing and retrieval of vast amounts of structured, semi-structured, and unstructured enterprise data in real time
2. Learn how enterprises can embrace “atomic security” to ensure strict, real-time data governance and access control, allowing organizations to enforce enterprise-wide policies from a single pane of glass
sessions.description: AI looks like a goldmine waiting to be tapped, but many organizations are discovering that success hinges on their ability to wrangle their data. Unlock, accelerate, and protect your data with the NVIDIA accelerated computing platform to minimize costs, address ethical dilemmas, and overcome technical hurdles that make sustainable monetization of AI tricky. We'll discuss how to solve for common AI delivery model challenges and accelerate time-to-value with customer-facing AI workloads that leverage NVIDIA technologies.

sessions.title: Optimizing HPC and AI for Energy and Performance
sessions.speakers: Patrick Atkinson (Senior Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Alan Gray (Principal Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. How profiling can help you move a large scientific code, formerly all CPU-based, to efficiently work on modern Grace Hopper systems
2. Understand and recognize some common bottlenecks in large codes during conversion, even in established projects, to modern chip architecture
sessions.description: It's becoming increasingly vital to optimize for energy and power, in addition to raw performance, for environmental, financial, and logistical reasons. We'll showcase recent work to tune a range of representative HPC and AI benchmarks and applications for energy and power, where the findings and techniques are transferable to other applications. We'll show how careful tuning of the industry-standard High Performance Linpack (HPL) benchmark within the performance and energy landscape on Grace Hopper has enabled the NVIDIA-powered supercomputers to sweep the Green500 world rankings. We'll show the effectiveness of tuning processor clock frequencies for energy minimization across a range of applications, and how application-level optimizations can go even further. We'll discuss this work within the context of the latest NVIDIA technology.

sessions.title: OpenUSD Best Practices for Developing with NVIDIA Omniverse
sessions.speakers: Aaron Luk (Director of Product Management, NVIDIA) | Rama Darbha (Director, Solutions Architecture, NVIDIA) | Matt Kuruc (Senior Manager, Engineering, NVIDIA) | Steven Feng (Robotics Engineer, NVIDIA) | Renato Gasoto (Robotics and AI Engineer, NVIDIA) | Ayush Ghosh (Robotics Systems Engineer, NVIDIA) | Asawaree Bhide (Robotics Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA) | Alex Qi (Sr. Product Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the importance of energy optimization for applications
2. Discover the effect that a variety of optimizations can have in minimizing energy usage
sessions.description: Join NVIDIA's product leaders and workflow specialists for an interactive discussion on how to get started building with OpenUSD and NVIDIA Omniverse. In either a group or 1:1 setting, discuss your use cases and challenges, get your questions answered, and learn how you can build USD-native applications.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Accelerating Quantum Computing
sessions.speakers: Alex McCaskey (Manager, Quantum Computing Architecture, NVIDIA) | Dmitry Lyakh (Senior Math Libaries Engineer, NVIDIA) | Bettina Heim (System Software Engineering Manager, NVIDIA) | Tom Lubowe (Product Manager, cuQuantum, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Design and implement multi-agent conversational workflows to tackle complex tasks and improve overall efficiency
2. Master multi-turn conversations and persona-based interactions to create more realistic and engaging user experiences
sessions.description: Join us and learn about quantum computing at NVIDIA! We'll show you how to use CUDA-Q and cuQuantum to accelerate your quantum computing research, from simulating algorithms and processors to running hybrid quantum-classical workloads. In this interactive session, we'll discuss how to take full advantage of NVIDIA’s most powerful GPUs to explore the benefits of quantum computing. Join NVIDIA quantum software experts to learn more about the CUDA-Q open-source platform for programming quantum processing units (QPUs), GPUs, and CPUs seamlessly, and how it integrates with cuQuantum to accelerate applications simulation. Discuss your ideas with the team and give us feedback on your experience using NVIDIA’s quantum computing software.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Put AI Agents to Work for People (Presented by ServiceNow)
sessions.speakers: Nicolas Chapados (Vice President, Research, ServiceNow, Inc.) | Dorit Levy-Zilbershot (Group Vice President of AI Experiences & Innovation, ServiceNow) | Gregory George (Sr. Director PM, Platform and AI Incubation, ServiceNow)
sessions.points:
1. Why staying ahead of AI infrastructure challenges will allow you to lead the next wave of innovation - designing for the future the only way to build AI-ready data centers.
2. What you should demand from data centers to maximize the return on your AI investment.
sessions.description: As the convergence of generative AI and accelerated computing takes center stage, ServiceNow and NVIDIA stand at the forefront of this revolution. By taking an innovative approach to AI agents using advanced reasoning grounded in cross‑enterprise data through the Now Platform, ServiceNow can advance the industry beyond prompting, to agents that can comprehend and interpret context, break down complex outcomes into smaller tasks, prioritize them, plan actions, and execute strategies to achieve desired results with built-in guardrails. From reshaping enterprise operations to enhancing productivity and streamlining workflows across industries, the potential is huge! Join us to discover the transformative potential of Agentic AI for your business.

sessions.title: AI, Energy, and Climate: Driving Sustainability and Energy Security
sessions.speakers: Josh Parker (Sr. Director of Corporate Sustainability, NVIDIA) | Lauren Risi (Program Director, Environmental Change and Security Program, Wilson Center) | David Sandalow (Inaugural Fellow, CGEP; Co-Director, Energy and Environment Concentration, School of International and Public Affairs, Columbia University) | Bernhard Lorentz (Managing Partner and Global Consulting Sustainability and Climate Strategy Leader, Deloitte)
sessions.points:
1. We'll share multiple examples of artworks created in collaboration between artists and robotics.
2. We'll cover a growing trend in robotics and AI, where these technologies are used for creative expression.
sessions.description: At a time when energy systems are under pressure and managing energy consumption is central to climate targets, the rise of generative AI has sparked concern about how much electricity AI systems use. We'll consider the data behind these concerns, and ask whether advances in the efficiency of AI technology can deliver sustainable innovation. We'll also consider the role of regulators in ensuring that the implementation of AI is aligned with climate and energy policy.

sessions.title: New Frontiers in Brain Research: Real-Time Imaging, BCIs, and AI-Driven Neuroscience Exploration
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Computation Imaging
sessions.speakers: Yosuke Sato (Director, Professor, Brain Function Analysis & Digital Medicine Research Institute, Showa University) | Katie Link (Healthcare Solutions Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Mohanasankar Sivaprakasam (Professor, Head of Brain Research Center, Indian Institute of Technology Madras (IITM)) | Peter Yoo (Senior Director of R&D, Neuroscience & Algorithms, Synchron)
sessions.points:
1. 世界模型的起源、自动驾驶中世界模型的应用场景以及 NVIDIA Cosmos 前沿世界模型
2. 神经重建引擎：完善可用的传感器建模、为相机和 LiDAR 渲染新视角传感器帧以及重建与生成的结合
sessions.description:
The brain remains one of the most complex studies in human biology, and advances in technology are opening new possibilities in neuroscience. This session brings together three initiatives shaping the future of brain research, namely: 

•	Exploration of real-time stereoscopic imaging in neurosurgical microsurgery using NVIDIA Clara’s edge AI platform, Holoscan, to enhance depth perception and precision. 
•	Discovery of brain-computer interfaces (BCIs) that are currently on the verge of creating a digital twin of the brain, unlocking key capabilities for individuals with neurological conditions. 
•	Multi-modal large language models (MLLMs) and NVIDIA’s AI tools, such as NeMo and NIM microservices. 

Learn how these tools are evolving neuroscience knowledge exploration. Together, these innovations are driving progress in brain science, education, and digital health.

sessions.title: Scaling AI Systems for Human Creativity: Lessons From Building Canva’s AI-First Design Platform
sessions.topic: Content Creation / Rendering - Rendering Engines / Pipelines / Tools
sessions.speakers: Danny Wu (Head of AI Products, Canva)
sessions.points:
1. How digital twins, traditional content creation, and AI come together
2. Leveraging OpenUSD to support different use cases and digital content creations
sessions.description: This deep dive explores the architecture and strategic challenges behind building accessible AI tools that power millions of creative use cases. Cameron Adams, co-founder and chief product officer of Canva, will share how the company scaled its infrastructure to unite more than 100 AI and ML models, and discuss the decisions and trade-offs that go into maintaining a reliable, seamless product experience for millions of users. We'll cover practical approaches to integrating multiple AI technologies into a cohesive platform that serves diverse user needs. Learn about the challenges of rapid AI deployment, upgrading as new capabilities become available, and how Canva approaches building AI workflows rather than siloed solutions.

sessions.title: Introduction to Autonomous Vehicles
sessions.speakers: Katie Washabaugh (Product Marketing Manager, NVIDIA) | Aaraadhya Narra (Senior Product Manager, Autonomous Vehicles, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Initiate a fully functional robot simulation instance with robot, sensor, AI model, and environment
2. Create an end-to-end, functional robot solution to perform a task
sessions.description: Autonomous vehicles are revolutionizing the way we think about transportation. This session provides an entry point into this transformative technology and its effect on the future of mobility. You'll hear a comprehensive overview of fundamental concepts, including AI model development and validation, software-defined compute, and intelligent cockpits, as well as how recent technological breakthroughs such as generative AI are shaping the industry. Whether you're new to autonomous vehicles or seeking to deepen your knowledge, this session offers a foundation for engaging with the new era of mobility.

sessions.title: Secure Critical Infrastructure With AI-Powered Cyber Defense
sessions.speakers: Arik Roztal (Sr. Director of Business Development for Cybersecurity, NVIDIA) | Ofir Arkin (Sr. Distinguished Engineer, NVIDIA) | Nadir Izrael (CTO and Co-Founder, Armis) | Dmitry Dudorov (AI Security Centre Lead, Deloitte) | Anirudha Dambal (VP/GM of the Process Lifecycle Services Segment, Siemens AG)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the storage requirements for AI applications
2. Understand the innovations here now, and coming soon, to address these requirements
sessions.description: As threats to critical infrastructure grow — from sophisticated malware to nation-state attacks — the need for robust security in operational technology (OT) environments is more urgent than ever. Many of these systems, some built decades ago, were never designed with modern security in mind. The convergence of IT and OT networks, often accelerated by remote access requirements, has introduced new attack vectors. We'll demonstrate how the NVIDIA Cybersecurity AI platform, combined with a strong partner ecosystem, can secure critical infrastructure seamlessly — without the need to change existing networking infrastructure or how it operates. Learn strategies for achieving real-time visibility at the host, network, and application levels, enforcing command-level authorization, implementing zero-trust access control, and blocking cyberattacks in real time. Discover how these collaborative innovations enable organizations to safeguard OT infrastructure across the energy, utilities, and manufacturing sectors from evolving cyberthreats.

sessions.title: Compression and Decompression on GPUs: nvCOMP and the Blackwell Decompress Engine
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Computation Imaging
sessions.speakers: Naveen Himthani (Senior Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Eric Schmidt (Senior Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Samuel Irving (Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Akshay Subramaniam (Sr. AI Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Makan Taghavi (Senior Product Manager for Image Processing and Data Compression, NVIDIA) | Balazs Nagy (Senior CUDA Math Libraries Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.description: We'll connect with you to discuss compression use cases in data analytics, genomics, deep learning (DL), and more.  We'll answer your questions about how to achieve best performance with the Blackwell Decompress Engine, and we'll discuss nvCOMP's new APIs, including Python APIs, along with other new features in the library.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Accelerating Advanced Materials Discovery With Generative AI: Tutorial and Case Studies
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Image / Video Detection & Recognition
sessions.speakers: Jonathan Godwin (Chief Executive Officer, Orbital Materials)
sessions.points:
1. Understand how NVIDIA’s TensorRT and CV-CUDA libraries can significantly accelerate AI inference in visual search
2. Learn optimization techniques for large-scale image processing, including GPU-accelerated decoding and preprocessing
sessions.description: We'll dive into the transformative impact generative AI is having on the discovery of new advanced materials — things like batteries, semiconductors, and climate technologies. Learn about the latest generative AI models for advanced materials discovery, how we trained them, and how to apply them, as we walk through a real-life case study in the world of carbon removal materials.

sessions.title: Mistral AI: Placing Frontier AI in Your Hands
sessions.speakers: Arthur Mensch (CEO, Mistral AI)
sessions.points:
1. Real-Time Insights: How IoT-powered digital twins provide a full plant overview, leading to proactive decision-making. Powered by Omniverse headless connector
2. Root Cause Analysis: The ability to replay events and pinpoint quality issues, improving operational efficiency, showcasing the power of USD as a single source of data truth
sessions.description: Arthur Mensch, co-founder and CEO of Mistral AI, will explain why now is the time to take your AI future into your own hands. Discover what it takes to build enterprise-grade frontier AI solutions with a combination of custom models, configurable platforms, and delightful interfaces, while retaining complete ownership of your data, maintaining your competitive advantage, and up-leveling your entire organization.

sessions.title: Building World Models in the Era of Generative AI
sessions.speakers: Ed Balduf (Cloud Integration Architect - DGX Cloud, NVIDIA) | Ming-Yu Liu (VP Generative AI Research, NVIDIA)
sessions.description: Today’s developers are struggling to get accelerated infrastructure optimized for the demands of modern LLM customization. As model sizes increase, so will the demand for high-performance compute, therefore developers must use resources more efficiently. In addition, there’s an overwhelming array of tools, services, open-source models, and platforms to customize generative AI, but many developers don’t know where to begin. Before productive training begins, many offerings require developers to validate and test environments before fine-tuning occurs, amounting to loss of resources and slower time-to-train. Learn how to build a world-class model using NVIDIA DGX Cloud, with all the tools and capabilities you need, starting from data curation through model training to fine-tuning and inferencing. See how NVIDIA DGX Cloud, a fully-managed platform with high performance compute clusters, optimized at every layer, provides Day One productivity, allowing you to focus on delivering AI-driven outcomes.

sessions.title: Building SCaNN and HNSW Indexes in the Cloud with Serverless GPUs
sessions.speakers: Alan Li (AlloyDB Semantic Search Uber Tech Lead, Google Cloud Databases) | Corey Nolet (Principal Engineer, ML, Data Mining, and Vector Search, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Day-One Productivity: Use a fully managed service to maximize GPU utilization and increase return on investment. Learn how DGX Cloud can provide resource quotas and efficient GPU allocation across multiple teams
2. Achieve a multi-cloud strategy through an open, flexible platform that provides portability and allows us to port your AI and machine learning (AI/ML) pipelines anywhere
sessions.description:
Accelerated vector search is crucial for semantic search use cases, with embeddings from unstructured data powering next-gen AI. As enterprise data scales to petabytes, zetabytes, and beyond, the demand for cost-effective, high-performance vector search solutions intensifies. Google Cloud Platform (GCP) recently announced that its serverless infrastructure known as CloudRun is now capable of running workloads on the GPU and now Google is using it to address the aforementioned challenges in AlloyDB with NVIDIA cuVS.

In this session, discover how cuVS is enhancing indexing efficiency and lowering operational costs by offloading index building for Google’s own SCaNN algorithm on the GPU. You will also learn how AlloyDB is utilizing the GPU to improve build times of the popular HNSW index within pgvector.

sessions.title: Voice-to-Voice LLM for End-to-End Voice Generation
sessions.speakers: Bharath Shankar (VP-Engineering, Gnani.ai) | Ananth Nagaraj (Co-Founder and CTO, Gnani.ai)
sessions.points:
1. Optimizing for Simplicity: Learn how to create small, efficient language models tailored to specific tasks like NPC dialogue, without the need for heavy computational resources
2. Dataset Curation: Understand the process of generating, curating, and distilling datasets that are focused and effective for training smaller models
sessions.description: We'll share our journey, best practices, insights, and lessons learned from training an enterprise-grade cross-lingual SpeechLLM leveraging NVIDIA Nemo platform. Voice-to-voice LLM  (a.k.a SpeechLLM) integrates speech and text processing, allowing real-time voice output generation without relying on traditional speech-to-text and text-to-speech steps. This technology can potentially impact billions of people by eliminating language barriers in human-to-human and human-machine interactions. We'll also look at an example use case on how SpeechLLMs can enable voice bots to respond more accurately and empathetically where speed, clarity, and contextual relevance are crucial. Additionally, we'll explore how SpeechLLM can enhance voice bots through retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) for delivering precise responses.

sessions.title: Data Center Vision 2030: How Data Center Infrastructure Will Evolve to Support AI and Accelerated Compute. (Presented by Vertiv)
sessions.topic: AR / VR - AR / VR Development Tools
sessions.speakers: Martin Olsen (VP, Global Product Strategy, Vertiv) | Sean Graham (Research Director, Cloud to Edge Datacenter, IDC)
sessions.points:
1. Develop an application for Apple Vision Pro to interact with photorealistic assets in real time
