2. Gain hands-on experience in integrating Omniverse Kit SDK and OpenUSD with visionOS to create immersive spatial computing experiences
sessions.description: The adoption of AI and accelerated compute is guiding the future of data center technology development, including the key power, cooling, and service elements to support AI initiatives. CIOs must play a strategic and future-thinking role to create a comprehensive strategic roadmap, governance structure, and AI economic models that align IT investments with business goals to drive sustainable growth.

sessions.title: Enterprise Gen AI's Next Wave: Unlock Efficiency and Effectiveness in Business specific functions with Agentic AI (Presented by Deloitte)
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Medical Imaging
sessions.speakers: Ashok Divakaran (Principal and Zora AI CPO, Deloitte)
sessions.points:
1. Privacy-Preserving AI Development: Understand how federated learning enables collaborative AI model training in medical imaging while ensuring patient data remains decentralized and secure
2. Overcoming Traditional Barriers: Learn how FL addresses challenges in healthcare AI, including data scarcity for rare diseases, contracting challenges, and the lack of centralized computing resources
sessions.description: Companies today are only scratching the surface of how foundation models can be used to transform business operations. The traditional setup of closed-source business model plus RAG can serve a few basic archetypes (e.g., "chat with your data", customer service chatbots) - but a fundamentally different approach is needed to deploy foundation models and unlock value in core business operations. What's needed is a new kind of application - one that begins with open-source models, deeply fine-tunes them with domain-specific data, and surrounds them with agents to allow them to problem-solve in specific functions and domain areas. In this session, you'll learn about how Deloitte and NVIDIA are partnering to create these domain-specific, agentic AI solutions, and the types of business problems they can uniquely solve.

sessions.title: Using immersive design collaboration to improve efficiency in AECO
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Tracking / Video Analytics
sessions.speakers: Krasi Nikolov (CEO and Co-Founder, QuarkXR) | Dan Stine (Director of Design Technology, Lake|Flato Architects) | Hadi Nsouli (Sr Business Development Manager, T-Mobile Wholesale, T-Mobile)
sessions.points:
1. New features and quality and performance enhancements in NVIDIA video hardware and software
2. Video codec cloud APIs and microservices being introduced in Q1 2025
sessions.description: Together with T-Mobile and Lake/Flato, a leading architecture firm, we leveraged the T-Mobile 5G network, NVIDIA CloudXR, and the QuarkXR platform to deliver remote customer presentations in virtual reality. Customers of Lake/Flato experienced immersive Enscape renders from the comfort of their office, thus enabling a quicker and more impactful design collaboration. By having a robust solution that works anywhere, Lake/Flato could reliably deliver an engaging customer presentation to geographically distributed stakeholders, and speed up the project approval process. Learn how NVIDIA CloudXR and 5G technology can reduce friction in the architecture and construction process and speed up the architecture, engineering, & construction (AEC) workflow.

sessions.title: Think Fast! Accelerate Your Game Services
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Climate / Weather / Ocean Modeling
sessions.speakers: Israel Knight (Tech Lead - Principal Machine Learning Engineer, Riot Games) | Liu Liu (Staff Data Scientist, Riot Games) | James Maki (Sr. Deep Learning Data Scientist, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand how AI weather models are set to help understand and anticipate the risks of natural catastrophes
2. Learn how AXA simulates huge ensembles with NVIDIA Earth-2 and GPUs to model the frequency and severity of extreme weather eventsarth-2 tools, and GPUs to simulate huge ensembles for extreme weather events in order to model their frequency and severity
sessions.description: Unlock the full potential of your game services and elevate performance by leveraging GPU acceleration. In this session, we'll show you how to supercharge critical services— toxic name detection, prosocial chat detection, and toxic voice detection—by transitioning from CPU to GPU compute. By harnessing the power of GPUs, you'll gain faster, more efficient data processing, and increased concurrency—all while delivering real-time responses that enhance player experience and trust.

sessions.title: Using Video Codecs in Blackwell for Transcoding and Other Video Processing Applications
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Computation Imaging
sessions.speakers: Abhijit Patait (Sr. Director, Multimedia Software, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. VLA 是空间智能、语言智能和 action policy 的统一，将快、慢思考结合为一个模型
2. VLA 是自动驾驶 Physical AI 的核心技术
sessions.description:
Get an overview of the latest enhancements, features, and APIs (native and cloud) being introduced in Video Codec SDK 13.0, releasing in Q1 2025. Specifically, we'll will cover:

•	Video encode and decode quality and performance enhancements and new features
•	Cloud APIs that we’ll be introducing for video encoding/decoding 
•	Microservices (NIMs) for video encoding and decoding

Video codec technologies on NVIDIA GPUs are extremely important for designing any use cases that involve video processing on GPUs. Gain insights into the latest features and enhancements in NVIDIA video technologies that help cutting-edge applications such as video transcode, intelligent video analytics, video data curation, efficient cloud-based video processing services, etc.

sessions.title: Transform Natural Catastrophe Risk Simulations With Advanced Computational Tools
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Image / Video Detection & Recognition
sessions.speakers: Xavier Renard (Research Scientist Lead, AXA) | Satheesh Maheswaran (Sr. Solutions Architect, Amazon Web Services) | Stefan Weissenberger (Solution Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. 一站式多模态基础模型
2. 多模态基础模型加速
sessions.description: Artificial Intelligence is transforming the way we model and predict natural catastrophe risks by creating more comprehensive and accurate datasets than ever before. AXA leverages the NVIDIA Earth-2 platform on AWS to simulate large sets of hypothetical weather events. Utilizing the Huge Ensembles (HENS) method, developed by researchers at LBNL, AXA can more precisely estimate natural hazard risks, enhancing global risk management and resilience planning for extreme weather. AWS offers robust solutions for the compute, storage, and networking demands of these AI-driven weather simulations.

sessions.title: Low-Latency Numerical Computing With MatX
sessions.speakers: Cliff Burdick (Principal Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Dylan Eustice (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Tyler Allen (Sr. Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Explore workload optimization leveraging NVAIE and AWS
2. This session is ideal to help technical leaders make informed decisions about the best technologies for AI projects
sessions.description: This lab will introduce MatX and demonstrate how to accelerate latency-sensitive workflows with its easy-to-use C++ template library for numerical computing. MatX's powerful Tensor language enables rapid prototyping and a seamless transition to production. Using this library, we'll demonstrate a powerful set of well optimized transforms and operations and walk users through optimizing their pipelines to speed of light performance. We'll then use our environment's profiling tools to measure and ensure compliance with critical performance budgets. From this solid foundation, we'll build a real-world workflow, showing how MatX's simple syntax can still provide outstanding acceleration. Finally, we'll use MatX's extensible operators to develop our own custom operator, seamlessly extending MatX for our own unique function.Prerequisite(s):Basic understanding of C++ and the ability to work with the command line.

sessions.title: Watch Your Language: Create Small Language Models That Run On-Device
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Computation Imaging
sessions.speakers: Oluwatobi Olabiyi (Sr. Engineering Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. VLA 模型详解
2. NVIDIA DRIVE Thor 赋能 VLA 模型
sessions.description: Large language models are great for complex tasks like writing code or translating Japanese into Greek, but they're overkill if you just need a nonplayer character dialog generator in a single language. We'll present tools and techniques you can use today to generate, curate, and distill a dataset, then train a small language model (SLM) that can perform the tasks you designed it for.

sessions.title: The Real Last Mile: De-Risking Generative AI in Production
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Bethann Noble (Product Marketing Manager, NVIDIA AI Enterprise, NVIDIA) | Yash Sheth (Co-Founder and COO, Galileo) | Ahmed Khan (Principal Architect, dkube.io) | Iftach Orr (CTO and Co-Founder, ActiveFence) | David Campbell (AI Security Risk Lead, Scale AI)
sessions.points:
1. Choose autoscaling hyperparameters informed by the latency and throughput-optimal configurations analyzed during benchmarking
2. Predict the resulting speeds, benchmark your deployed NIM application, and validate your assumptions
sessions.description: While moving generative AI proofs of concept to production is often considered a key final phase in the journey to achieving results, efficiently assessing and mitigating ongoing security, safety, and performance issues present additional hills to climb. In this round of lightning talks, hear from three innovative companies tackling real-time gen AI risk assessment and mitigation. Through demos and real-world examples, you’ll understand tools and best practices for programmatically addressing LLM application vulnerabilities across the development life cycle.

sessions.title: Multimodal-to-Omniverse: An End-to-End Pipeline for 3D Model Generation from Voice or Text, Ninja Edition
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Accelerated Computing Libraries
sessions.speakers: Stefanie Grois (Sr. Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Mireille Fares (Senior AI Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Benedikt Keyzers (Senior Solution Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. How NCCL has evolved to power the next scale of AI training, up to hundreds of thousands of GPUs
2. What performance to expect on each generation of NVIDIA GPUs and platforms, including Blackwell
sessions.description: Learn how to run an multi-modal end-to-end pipeline generating 3D assets using your own voice. We'll use state-of-the-art NIM Agent LLMs with Langchain, Langgraph, and Langserve to create an agentic pipeline transforming from text to 2D to 3D, generating 3D assets to be imported via CAD Converter, and see it come to life using Omniverse KIT SDK. In the end, you'll be able to create a 360-degree beauty shot video as trophy that you can share on social media.Prerequisite(s):Basic understanding of Python.An understanding of Langchain and Omniverse is a plus but not mandatory.

sessions.title: MOFA: GPU-Accelerated Generative AI for High-Throughput Metal-Organic Framework Discovery on HPC Systems
sessions.speakers: Eliu Huerta (Lead for Translational AI, Argonne National Laboratory)
sessions.points:
1. Use NIM Agent LLMs as the main language model
2. Combine multiple models into an agentic pipeline
sessions.description: Explore how MOFA, a GPU-accelerated generative AI framework, enables the high-throughput discovery of novel metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) using large-scale HPC systems. Learn how this cutting-edge approach combines AI with advanced simulations to tackle key challenges in materials science, delivering faster, more efficient solutions for carbon dioxide capture and other critical applications.

sessions.title: Maximizing Embedding and Retrieval Efficiency on Nasdaq’s Generative AI Platform with NVIDIA AI
sessions.speakers: Eric Reiser (Senior Director, Nasdaq)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how MOFA uses NVIDIA GPUs to accelerate the generation of novel metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) through AI-driven workflows
2. Discover how MOFA integrates AI with molecular dynamics, density functional theory, and Monte Carlo simulations for high-throughput materials discovery
sessions.description: From Hackathon to Production: Discover how Nasdaq's Gen AI platform, an enterprise-grade solution that enables organizations to build and deploy AI applications through customizable skill, agentic flows and model access, leverages NVIDIA AI Enterprise to maximize the efficiency of embeddings and vector stores. This session will highlight the integration of cutting-edge tools like NVIDIA NeMo Retriever and NIM microservices deployed to Kubernetes with NVIDIA’s GPU Operator across L40s cloud infrastructure. Learn how these advancements deliver a significant increase in retrieval and embedding accuracy, improve performance, and reduce costs compared to alternatives. Gain insights into the benefits of flexible, up-to-date models and the partnership driving innovation in AI workflows.

sessions.title: Revolutionize Virtual Production With AI-Powered Ray Tracing
sessions.speakers: Vladimir Koylazov (Head of Innovation, Chaos) | Phillip Miller (VP Product Management, Chaos)
sessions.points:
1. Get an introduction to the ways AI is transforming advanced materials
2. Learn how to train the fastest and most accurate AI models for advanced materials
sessions.description: Join Academy Award and Emmy-winning software developer Chaos for a deep dive into Project Arena's architecture for delivering ray-traced content to LED walls in real time. Discover how this groundbreaking system achieves frame-synchronized distributed rendering across multiple GPUs while maintaining production-quality image fidelity. We'll demonstrate the benefits of direct digital content creation (DCC) application integration, handling scenes with trillions of polygons at interactive frame rates, and how AI-powered denoising with NVIDIA DLSS Ray Reconstruction is a game-changer. Using practical examples from the short film "Ray Tracing for the Win," see how Project Arena overcomes traditional virtual production bottlenecks to enable better creative iteration on set and enhance the filmmaking experience.

sessions.title: Photorealistic Digital Twin at Scale in Product Design
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Large Language Models (LLMs)
sessions.speakers: Enzo Krka (Product Manager, Industrial Metaverse and XR Visualization, Siemens) | Ian Fisher (Product Management - Visualization, Siemens)
sessions.points:
1. AI accessibility in education
2. Emerging AI trends for students, professors, and researchers
sessions.description: Teamcenter photorealistic visualization, powered by NVIDIA Omniverse, is now generally available, enabling companies to create photorealistic, physics-based digital twins of their products while eliminating workflow waste and errors. This breakthrough solution bridges the gap to AI-enabled digital twins, empowering companies to accelerate product development, enhance data-driven decision-making, and seamlessly integrate real-world and digital processes. With standards-based interoperability and robust data exchange, Teamcenter X enables engineering teams and developers to collaborate at scale, driving innovation in industrial applications. Join us to see how this cutting-edge platform is transforming the future of industrial digitalization.

sessions.title: Agentic AI at the Edge: Real-Time Sentiment Analysis for Engaging Customer Interaction
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Training AI Models
sessions.speakers: Niels Kasch (Chief Data Scientist, Eviden) | Jacque Istok (CEO, Enfuse) | Cahlen Humphreys (Chief AI Architect, Enfuse)
sessions.description: Discover an AI agent that reimagines customer interactions, turning physical spaces into engaging and personalized experiences. Using on-device Vision Transformers (ViTs) on NVIDIA Jetson, this solution performs real-time sentiment analysis to gauge audience reactions while providing relevant product contents and ensuring rapid responsiveness. It processes sensitive data locally, sending only anonymized metadata to the cloud via Kafka streams, and employs hybrid cloud reinforcement learning and generative AI to tailor advertisement content dynamically. Leveraging NVIDIA DeepStream for real-time video analytics and a closed-loop feedback mechanism, the system continuously improves interactions with customers to maximize their experiences and improve business ROI.

sessions.title: Federated Learning in Medical Imaging: Enhancing Data Privacy and Advancing Healthcare
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Profilers / Debuggers / Code Analysis
sessions.speakers: John Garrett (Assistant Professor and Director of Imaging Informatics, University of Wisconsin-Madison)
sessions.points:
1. Learn about how to detect bottlenecks in AI applications
2. Explore new features of Nsight Systems, such as plugins
sessions.description: Federated learning is revolutionizing medical imaging by enabling collaborative AI development while preserving data privacy. In this session, attendees will gain insights into how federated learning advances healthcare by protecting patient data, simplifying collaboration, and accelerating the development of AI solutions for medical imaging. In healthcare, sharing sensitive patient data across institutions is challenging due to privacy regulations and contracting issues. Federated Learning addresses these concerns by allowing institutions to train AI models on decentralized data without transferring raw patient information. This session will explore how federated learning overcomes traditional barriers to innovation, with a focus on practical applications that enable healthcare organizations to harness distributed computing power. We will highlight key use cases, such as handling rare diseases with limited data availability across institutions and overcoming the lack of centralized compute resources often needed for training complex AI models. We will also examine the impact of federated learning on real-world case studies that not only tackle data privacy concerns, but also support researching rare disease and triaging patients.

sessions.title: Discover the Sustainability Promise of AI Data Centers
sessions.speakers: Pankaj Sharma (EVP Secure Power & Data Center Business, Schneider Electric) | Jim Simonelli (CTO, Data Center Business, Schneider Electric)
sessions.points:
1. Discover how Autodesk XLB and NEON leverage GH200 and NVIDIA Warp to scale multi-resolution LBM simulations up to 100 billion cells
2. Learn key implementation strategies to combine NVIDIA Warp and JAX to achieve optimized throughput in distributed, multi-GPU setups
sessions.description: AI equals more data centers, and more data centers equals more energy. Curbing carbon emissions is a growing concern for data center operators. Discover how AI data centers of the future will be the most sustainable data centers, and the criticality of power and cooling infrastructure in this equation.

sessions.title: Automate 5G Network Configurations With NVIDIA AI LLM Agents and Kinetica Accelerated Database
sessions.speakers: Swastika Dutta (Solutions Architect Generative AI, NVIDIA) | Maria Amparo Canaveras Galdon (Senior Solutions Architect Generative AI, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Blackwell GPU architecture introduced block-formats for AI, with 8-, 6-, and 4-bit element datatypes
2. NVFP4 is the format for maximum inference efficiency (lowest memory footprint and highest math throughput)
sessions.description: Learn how to create AI agents using LangGraph and NVIDIA NIM to automate 5G network configurations. You'll deploy LLM agents to monitor real-time network quality of service (QoS) and dynamically respond to congestion by creating new network slices. LLM agents will process logs to detect when QoS falls below a threshold, then automatically trigger a new slice for the affected user equipment. Using graph-based models, the agents understand the network configuration, identifying impacted elements. This ensures efficient, AI-driven adjustments that consider the overall network architecture.We'll use the Open Air Interface 5G lab to simulate the 5G network, demonstrating how AI can be integrated into real-world telecom environments. You'll also gain practical knowledge on using Python with LangGraph and NVIDIA AI endpoints to develop and deploy LLM agents that automate complex network tasks.Prerequisite(s):Python programming.

sessions.title: Enable Blackwell Inference With TensorRT Model Optimizer
sessions.speakers: Huizi Mao (Engineering lead of TensorRT Model Optimizer, NVIDIA) | Ye Yu (Sr. Deep Learning Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Jingyu Xin (Deep Learning Algorithms Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn the architecture to improve RAG performance and efficiency by pushing down RAG data processing to storage
2. Learn the APIs needed to access data artefacts from content-aware storage
sessions.description: Learn about TensorRT Model Optimizer's quantization and speculative decoding techniques for NVIDIA GPU platforms, with a focus on Blackwell. We will introduce the FP4 and other quantization formats on Blackwell, go through quantization recipes including post-training quantization (PTQ) and quantization-aware training (QAT), and demonstrate the latest results for large language models (LLM) and diffusion models. We’ll also cover new features like speculative decoding, which further boosts the inference speed on latest GPU architectures.

sessions.title: Advancing GPU as a Service: Build a New Serverless Platform for AI-Native Cloud Applications (Presented by Vultr)
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Large Language Models (LLMs)
sessions.speakers: Kevin Cochrane (Chief Marketing Officer, Vultr)
sessions.points:
1. Data-Efficient Pre-Training: Discover how carefully curated data mixtures and optimized tokenizers reduce training costs and time
2. Knowledge Bridging: Learn how insights from high-resource languages can significantly boost Korean language performance
sessions.description: In the traditional world of cloud compute, multi-cloud architectures depend on leveraging Kubernetes as an abstraction layer for running containers across cloud compute providers. What happens, however, in the world of AI-native applications? Just as in cloud compute, we need Kubernetes as an abstraction layer to run containerized AI models across GPU providers in conjunction with running containerized application logic across CPU providers. A new serverless, GPU-based cloud compute platform is needed for building and running AI native applications on Kubernetes leveraging NVIDIA AI Enterprise and NVIDIA-powered AI model orchestration leveraging Run:AI.

sessions.title: Curate High-Quality Multimodal Datasets for Generative AI Training with NeMo Curator
sessions.speakers: Ryan Wolf (Deep Learning Algorithm Engineer, NVIDIA) | Arham Mehta (Product Manager, Deep Learning Software, NVIDIA) | Mehran Maghoumi (Sr. Deep Learning Developer Advocate, NVIDIA) | Ayush Dattagupta (Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Vibhu Jawa (Senior Data Scientist, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. The findings from Vertiv, IDC and NVIDIA research on the evolution of the data center over the next five years
2. Forecasted growth of energy and power demand from increased rack density and the grid-to-chip implications
sessions.description: Connect with NVIDIA experts to answer your AI data processing questions. Whether you're just beginning your journey into AI or you're a seasoned professional, our specialists are here to guide you through every step of building generative AI models. We can discuss a wide range of topics, such as multimodal dataset acquisition, cleaning, filtering, deduplication, and building flexible data curation pipelines that can easily scale across many compute nodes.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: From Zero to Scale: How to Build an Efficient AI Cloud Platform From Scratch (Presented by Nebius)
sessions.speakers: Gleb Kholodov (Head of Foundational Services, Nebius AI) | Oleg Fedorov (Head of Hardware R&D, Nebius)
sessions.description:
Nebius built an AI cloud platform from the ground up in just one year, transforming a bold concept into a fully operational system running tens of thousands of NVIDIA GPUs connected via 400 Gbps InfiniBand network. We architected multiple Kubernetes clusters as the platform’s scalable backbone, enabling elastic growth, rapid provisioning, and seamless upgrades. We made several strategic decisions to leverage our own data centers, refine hardware configurations, and implement advanced cooling techniques to achieve sustainable energy efficiency.

We'll share the approach and experience of our foundational services and hardware teams. Learn how our LLM team and early multimodal customers provided critical feedback, guiding iterative improvements that honed our infrastructure’s capabilities. By the end, you’ll understand the strategic insights, technical optimizations, and customer-driven methodologies that enabled Nebius to build a cutting-edge AI cloud platform from scratch.

sessions.title: An Enterprise-Ready AI Platform: Unlocking Real-Time Insights at Scale
sessions.speakers: Prasad Venkatachar (AI Solutions Engineering Director, Vast Data) | Sagi Grimberg (Systems Architect, VAST Data) | Nave Algarici (Generative AI Product Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Gain fundamental knowledge of OpenUSD universal data interchange
2. Understand the latest developments and advancements in OpenUSD
sessions.description:
Enterprises are increasingly adopting Gen-AI to transform operations and deliver actionable insights, but existing solutions often fall short of meeting the demands for scalability, security, and real-time performance required by the enterprise. In this session, we introduce the VAST InsightEngine with NVIDIA, a comprehensive, purpose-built Gen-AI platform that integrates NVIDIA inference microservices (NIMs) with the VAST Data Platform to address these challenges.

Designed to support both structured and unstructured data at a massive scale, the VAST Insight Engine delivers real-time pipeline orchestration and AI inference as a service, creating a one-stop solution for enterprise AI. It enables enterprises to build custom pipelines suited to their needs and also leverage pre-built AI pipelines.  Additionally, we will give an overview of several industry use cases from multi-modal RAG through vision language models. Finally, we describe a robust multimodal RAG pipeline powered by the VAST InsightEngine.

sessions.title: Accelerating Insights and Efficiencies in Automotive Manufacturing using Immersive Digital Twins
sessions.speakers: Paulina Chmielarz (Industrial Operations Digital and Innovation Director, JLR (Jaguar Land Rover))
sessions.points:
1. AI is a potent weapon in the fight against climate change because it can accelerate climate science and support climate change mitigation efforts
2. Accelerated computing is the most energy-efficient path to sustainable AI
sessions.description:
Learn about Omniverse, AI, and the evolving role of digital twins in revolutionizing the automotive industry, with particular focus on the integration of internet-of-things (IoT) data. We'll discuss how micro twins (a scaled-down version of a digital twin) enable real-time visualization of an entire plant, providing critical insights that drive smarter, data-informed decision-making. Leveraging IoT connectivity allows digital replicas to unlock new ways of monitoring plant operations, identify root causes of quality issues, and optimize our performance through data replay. We're pushing the boundaries of this technology, and believe the future lies in AI-assisted intelligence, where our digital twins evolve into a powerful tools capable of offering actionable process-related insights through simple queries. Our work with NVIDIA promises to unlock a new era of operational efficiency, predictive maintenance, and intelligent automation.  

Our team is helping develop a miniature-scale digital twin, called the "micro twin," to provide visibility across our entire plant. Utilizing the Apple Vision Pro, this visualization enables users to view the whole plant in a single, immersive experience, making complex processes easy to monitor at a glance. Additionally, with the integration of NVIDIA's NIMs with large language models, users will be able to communicate with the digital twin directly. These combined technologies are setting the foundation for a dynamic, interactive digital twin experience that aligns with our commitment to innovation in plant management.

sessions.title: Hands-on with Next Generation Digital Human Blueprint
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Climate / Weather / Ocean Modeling
sessions.speakers: Rohit Vaswani (Engineering Leader, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Explore how AI-driven weather models can simulate ensembles of a recent European season with justifiable properties
2. Discover how AI models capture the complex, nonlinear interactions in weather data, leading to more diverse and realistic simulations of flood events
sessions.description: This hands-on lab explores the creation of interactive avatar applications using the NVIDIA Tokkio pipeline, building on the next generation digital human blueprint. Participants will learn to customize the reference workflow to integrate Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), providing knowledge and context to their digital avatars. The lab covers customization of the Tokkio pipeline with ACE microservices for updating the avatar character and the end-to-end web experience. We'll dive into the developer experience of creating sophisticated and interactive digital human experiences. By the end of this session, participants will be able to imbue their digital avatars with advanced AI capabilities, enabling more natural and informed interactions for a wide array of use cases.Prerequisite(s):Basic understanding of AI and machine learning concepts.Having an avatar to work with and make intelligent.Familiarity with Python programming.

sessions.title: CUDA Techniques to Maximize Compute and Instruction Throughput
sessions.speakers: Ben Pinzone (Compute Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | David Clark (Compute Performance Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Gain a clear understanding of the GPU memory model.
2. Learn how to use advanced CUDA features to optimize data movement within the GPU through step-by-step examples
sessions.description:
Come reload your hat with tricks and tips to optimize compute and latency bound kernels.
This session will explain core concepts, briefly illustrate where these concepts are seen in our profiling tools, and outline general optimization strategies using specific examples.

sessions.title: High-Bandwidth Memory: Backbone of High Performance Computing and AI (Presented by SK hynix)
sessions.speakers: Jungsoo Park (HBM Product Planning, SK hynix)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how NVIDIA helps the academic research community adopt NVIDIA software technologies
2. Learn about how different teams at NVIDIA can assist in accelerating your scientific discoveries on multiple levels
sessions.description: High-bandwidth memory (HBM) plays a key role in enabling high performance computing and generative AI, and is expected to see significant advancements in the coming years. We'll share HBM’s technical attributes, applications, and future implications so you can better understand the value of HBM, and how SK hynix leads the world in HBM technology and market.

sessions.title: How NVIDIA can Help You, as a Researcher, Accelerate Scientific Discovery
sessions.speakers: Tomasz Bednarz (Director of Strategic Researcher Engagement, NVIDIA) | Zahra Ronaghi (Sr. Manager, HER and Gen AI Solutions, NVIDIA) | Jack Wells (Director of Higher Education and Research Computing, NVIDIA) | Michael Isadore (Sr Director, AI State Strategic Initiatives , NVIDIA) | Will Ramey (Senior Director, NVIDIA) | Breanne Ertmer (Senior Program Manager, NVIDIA) | Johan Barthelemy (Strategic Researcher Engagement, NVIDIA) | Andy Grant (EMEA Director – Supercomputing and AI, Higher Education and Research, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Explore computation of expected speed-of-light performance of an algorithm on a particular GPU
2. Optimization strategies for matrix multiplication
sessions.description: Join this engaging session led by NVIDIA experts who collaborate closely with the global academic research community, supporting leading researchers in leveraging NVIDIA software technologies to drive scientific advancements across diverse fields. We'll provide insights into how various NVIDIA teams, representing different functional areas, can assist in accelerating your scientific discoveries at multiple levels. The team will outline their approach to working with individual researchers and groups, share success stories, and introduce a range of developer support programs, including but not limited to the Academic Grant Program, Deep Learning Institute courses and Teaching Kits, Researcher Advisory Councils, etc. We'll also focus on aligning discussions with specific research domains such as robotics, biology, gen AI, data processing, and climate science — while showcasing tools and resources available to help researchers enhance research outcomes.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: AI-Accelerated Materials Discovery for Next-Generation Lithium Metal Batteries
sessions.topic: Cybersecurity - Accelerated Computing / AI for Security
sessions.speakers: Qichao Hu (Chief Executive Officer, SES AI)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how Generative AI is transforming Cybersecurity by enabling intelligent agents across the enterprise.
2. Learn about opportunities to significantly improve the efficiency and effectiveness of security measures.
sessions.description: AI is revolutionizing the search and design of new molecules that will enable the next-generation lithium metal batteries (LMBs) to drive our energy future. We'll dive into SES's efforts and achievements in leveraging cutting-edge AI-techniques to rapidly explore molecular universe at magnitudes (10^11) beyond any scale ever attempted. Some of these molecules generated by AI techniques are already successfully synthesized and under test in electrochemical devices, demonstrating superior performances and revealing an encouraging future of AI-assisted materials design. This AI-driven materials discovery based on comprehensive mapping of molecular universe represents a breakthrough not only for energy storage technology, but in a broader sense for any industry sectors relying on organic materials, such as drug discovery, biomedicine, catalysts, or photo-/electro-chemicals.

sessions.title: How to ace a finance developer interview: A Deep Dive into GPU Matrix Optimization
sessions.speakers: Joe Stam (Head of Research Technology, Jump Trading)
sessions.points:
1. How to optimize the factory layout using digital twins
2. Immersive VR environments enhance global collaboration, allowing remote teams to virtually monitor, analyze, and interact with crops, promoting shared insights and data-driven decisions
sessions.description:
Matrix multiplication is inarguably the most ubiquitous operation performed on GPUs. Yet it's one of the hardest of all algorithms to implement, and guidance for optimization is surprisingly scarce. The vast majority of users are well-served by cuBLAS and other NVIDIA tools, but there are cases where a developer's needs are so unique they must start from scratch. More importantly, the techniques used are extremely instructive for many other CUDA tasks. This talk is aimed at developers with such requirements. But even more importantly, the concepts taught here will be applicable to those seeking to improve their GPU performance programming skills overall.

We explore a dense MatMul Float 32 FMA kernel, using standard CUDA C++. We begin by analyzing speed-of-light expectations and performance bottlenecks. Then we’ll proceed from a naïve example to a highly performant version, properly illustrating use of the GPU memory hierarchy, and conclude with an Nsight Compute analysis.

sessions.title: Advance Research and Clinical Workflows With an AI Factory for Medical Imaging

sessions.title: Build Real-Time, Voice-Controlled AI Teammates In Games

sessions.points:

Through noise recognition advancements, natural language understanding, and low-latency engineering, the game has garnered widespread player appreciation and shown a 4% increase in retention among participants.

sessions.title: Distributed and Differentiable Fluid Dynamics with Accelerated Python
sessions.speakers: Lukasz Wawrzyniak (Principal Research Scientist, NVIDIA) | Massimiliano Meneghin (Sr. Principal Research Scientist, Autodesk)
sessions.points:
1. Discover the challenges of integrating real-time data into sophisticated Gen AI applications in large enterprises
2. Explore essential features like data catalogs, query federation, and language-to-SQL capabilities that simplify building advanced Gen AI applications for enterprise needs
sessions.description: Explore the development of modular, scalable, and differentiable computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations using accelerated Python. In this joint talk from Autodesk and NVIDIA, we'll discuss techniques for scaling multi-resolution Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) simulations up to 100 billion cells on distributed multi-GPU systems powered by NVIDIA's GH200 hardware. Gain insights into the challenges and advancements involved in enabling large-scale simulations for industrial design and physics-based machine learning, with a focus on usability.

sessions.title: Driving Telco Innovation: Distilling Large Models Into Economical Small Language Models for Agentic Workflow Automation
sessions.speakers: Ryan Chesler (Kaggle Grandmaster and Principal Data Scientist, H2O.ai) | Hien Lam (Sr. Data Scientist, AT&T)
sessions.points:
1. MTEF Benchmarks for retrievals have been maxed out, limiting the effectiveness of embeddings
2. We invented mQuery*, a method of parallelization combined with NVIDIA's GPUs
sessions.description: Discover how the largest telecom company in the United States fine-tuned open-source models to create 81 LLM-driven customer-agent interaction categories, dramatically enhancing customer service and reducing costs. We’ll explore how our approach achieved an 85% cost reduction, while seamlessly transitioning from OpenAI with no compromise in performance or quality. By distilling large language models into efficient small models, we optimized telecom AI without sacrificing effectiveness. These interaction categories now play a critical role in customer churn models, identifying service gaps, enabling proactive outreach, and reinforcing the company's commitment to a customer-first strategy.

sessions.title: Embeddings are Limiting AI Agents: How Codeium used NVIDIA GPUs at Scale During Inference to Improve Retrieva lCurrent
sessions.speakers: Anshul Ramachandran (Head of Enterprise and Partnerships, Codeium)
sessions.points:
1. Learn concepts and usage of FP4 quantization in TensorRT Model Optimizer.
2. Learn the workflow of speculative decoding in TensorRT Model Optimizer.
sessions.description: Many retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)-based solutions use embeddings to add context to prompts for LLMs. However, embeddings have significant limitations, especially when using large data sources, and this becomes particularly problematic for agentic systems that are expected to reason and edit across more code simultaneously. Learn how Codeium turned this into an inference-time compute problem powered by NVIDIA GPUs at scale to increase retrieval accuracy by 4x over state-of-the-art embedding models, enabling the first generally accessible agentic tool for software development, the Windsurf Editor.

sessions.title: The Next Frontier in AI: Multi-Agent Systems (Presented by Cognizant)

sessions.points:
1. Explore the latest gen AI safety and security risks highlighted through real-world examples and lessons learned in the trenches
2. Understand tools and techniques for implementing rails and other policy-based controls for data protection, access control, and content safety
sessions.description:
Learn how enterprises can quickly discover, prototype, and deploy AI-driven solutions using the Cognizant Neuro AI Decisioning Platform. We'll request a company name from the audience and build a use case in under 15 minutes. 

Enhanced with multi-agent orchestration, this platform helps identify opportunities, create prototypes, and build AI decision-making use cases across siloed operations. Leveraging specialized AI agents and powered by NVIDIA NIMS/NeMo, it improves performance and generates new revenue streams. 
Additionally, the Neuro AI Multi-agent Accelerator is a no-code/low-code framework with pre-built agent networks for rapid creation, customization, and scaling of multi-agent systems. It supports various enterprise and industry functions and allows natural language descriptions to create additional agent networks suited to specific use cases. Built on NVIDIA NIM models and endpoints, it incorporates langchain-based substitutes and NVIDIA blueprints.

sessions.title: The Instrumental Edge: Enabling Real-Time AI Scientific Discovery
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Adam Thompson (Principal Technical Product Manager - Sensor Processing, NVIDIA) | Abhik Sarkar (Staff Computer Scientist, Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory) | Luigi Cruz (Staff Engineer, SETI Institute)
sessions.points:
1. Hands-On Demo of Augmented Decision-making with Neuro AI Decisioning platform to quickly prototype and create decision-making use cases using a multi-agent system and Gen AI, running on NIM endpoint
2. Hands-On Demo of Neuro AI Multi-agent Accelerator Platform powered by NVIDIA NIMS/NEMO across different enterprise functions, focusing on producing multiple agents quickly and making them interoperable
sessions.description:
From radio telescopes to high-speed laser accelerators, scientific instruments produce tremendous amounts of data at equally high rates; previous architectures that relied on offline storage and large data transfers can't keep up. The future of scientific discovery is interactive, streaming, and AI-driven, placing the autonomous and intelligent instrument at the center of a given science workflow. By making our instruments smarter, scientists can run higher-impact experiments and yield higher-fidelity data, wherein noise is largely discarded from the signal.  
  
In this talk, collaborators from Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL) and the SETI Institute will brief their work advancing edge HPC workflows. LLNL will highlight their efforts toward building and using small-scale surrogate facilities of large-scale instruments for rapid prototyping, and the SETI Institute will highlight their work in building the world’s first real-time AI pipeline on raw sensor data to look for fast radio bursts and extraterrestrial intelligence. Altogether, this talk highlights the power of building community across domains and advancing the state of the art of physical experimentation.

sessions.points:

We'll take a deep dive on how CV-CUDA, nvImageCodec, TensorRT, and ONNXRuntime worked together to achieve this optimization, discussing topics including batched image decoding and pre-processing, efficient I/O bindings, and streamlined inference processing.

sessions.title: UFO-Lite: 基于自推测解码的低延迟多模态大模型
sessions.speakers: Teng Xi (Staff Engineer, Baidu)
sessions.points:
1. How NVIDIA CloudXR and 5G are used to deliver impactful architectural presentations to a widely distributed customer base
2. The potential of extended reality (XR) to transform the design collaboration process and make it more efficient
sessions.description: 近年来，多模态大语言模型（MLLMs）展示了卓越的能力和强大的泛化能力。然而，目前的 MLLMs 往往难以满足快速响应的需求，推理延迟成为其在现实应用中的一个重要的挑战。本讲座将介绍 UFO-Lite，这是 VIMER-UFO MLLMs 系列的最新快速版本，其针对现实场景中的高效化部署进行了优化。具体而言，UFO-Lite 引入了自推测解码机制，显著的减少了端到端的延迟，且准确性几乎没有损失。它采用了新颖的双 LLM 结构，将自回归生成任务中序列化的多次前向推理卸载到了快速分支（即草稿模型），并通过原始模型对草稿序列进行并行的验证，以保持精度。为了实现自推测解码，UFO-Lite 基于量化感知的知识蒸馏，有效地开发了双 LLM 的快速分支，确保其分布与原始模型相似且具备较高的推理速度。此外，UFO-Lite 还提出了基于置信度的自适应切换，利用动态验证窗口大小，而不是固定大小，并兼容短序列生成。UFO-Lite 在 AI2D 和 MathVista 数据集上展示了与 Qwen2-VL-7B 和 InternVL2-8B 相当的性能。在 MMMU 上，它实现了与 InterVL2-8B、MiniPCPMV2-2_6 和 GLM-4V-9B 相当的结果。与上述模型相比，UFO-lite 可以加速 2 倍以上。此演讲可以为进一步发展高效且有效的多模态大语言模型提供有价值的见解。

sessions.title: NVIDIA 全面赋能端到端自动驾驶
sessions.speakers: John Shao (Sr. Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Tyler Zhu (Sr. System Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Wenjing Zhu (DevTech Manager, NVIDIA) | Tony Yin (Machine Learning Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Get help with specific OpenUSD workflow or data fundamentals questions
2. Understand the latest developments and advancements in OpenUSD
sessions.description: 我们将从以下四个部分介绍 NVIDIA 如何赋能端到端自动驾驶：世界模型、神经重建引擎（NRE）、模型的训练加速和自动驾驶端侧优化部署。世界模型部分将介绍其起源，自动驾驶中世界模型的应用场景以及 NVIDIA Cosmos 这一前沿的世界模型；第二，我们将介绍为什么需要NRE，并从完善可用的传感器建模、为相机和 LiDAR 渲染新视角传感器帧等方面介绍神经重建引擎；第三，我们将从视频、图像训练 Pipeline、Core Lib 和损失计算加速介绍模型在数据中心的训练加速；最后针对自动驾驶的端侧优化，我们将探讨针对 Thor 的模型优化，以及模型部署的优化内容。

sessions.title: 构建以 Megatron-Core 为核心的大语言模型训练加速生态
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Computation Imaging
sessions.speakers: Jun Huang (Senior Staff Engineer, Alibaba Cloud)
sessions.points:
1. 深入探讨大模型给智能驾驶、座舱交互、智能体领域带来的创新变革，引领未来出行新范式
2. 探索大模型驱动下开创性的舱驾融合 AI 域的构建，涵盖 NVIDIA 超大算力计算平台（Thor）、端云一体协同的部署框架、原生流式多模态模型等关键因素
sessions.description: Megatron-Core 是 NVIDIA 开发的用于训练超大规模 Transformer 模型的分布式框架，具有出色的分布式性能，是训练具有数千亿或更多参数的大语言模型的必备工具。Pai-Megatron-patch 是阿里云旗下 PAI 平台开发的大语言模型训练工具包，包含基于 Megatron-Core构建高效 LLM 训练系统的关键组件，如 mcore 和 Huggingface 之间的双向 ckpt 转换，弥合 mcore 和 Huggingface 生态系统之间的差距；实现了 Distributed Optimizer CPU 卸载技术，进一步降低了大模型训练的成本；还开发了给定硬件资源条件下的自动超参数优化工具，提高了框架的可用性等功能。在此基础上，它提供了训练各种开源大语言模型的最佳实践。

sessions.title: 探索 2025 年中国 AI 市场与创业的热点及机遇
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Deep Learning Frameworks
sessions.speakers: Jaden Xie (Co-Founder, PixVerse.AI) | Jack Pei (Inception Program Partner Manager, NVIDIA) | Cynthia Zhang (Founder, FutureX Capital) | YingJie Zhang (Managing Director, Fortune Venture Capital) | Qiajin Shen (CEO, Ideaflow, Ltd.)
sessions.points:
1. 填补了 Megatron 优化器在 GPU 资源有限时无法卸载的空白。 我们实现了具有高效 CPU 卸载的分布式优化器，这是一种用于训练的 GPU 显存优化技术，可在 GPU 资源有限的情况下训练长序列
2. 支持 HuggingFace 和 MCore 模型之间的高精度双向 ckpt 转换。 更具体地说，我们可以对复杂的稠密 MoE 模型 (例如 Llama 3、DeepSeek-V2-MoE 或 Qwen-MoE 等) 进行 3D (张量并行/流水线并行/专家并行) 转换
sessions.description: NVIDIA 将与创投联盟中的优秀投资人代表及典型被投企业代表共同探讨 2025 年中国 AI 市场的前景，分析市场的潜在爆发点、新兴创业企业以及新机遇。此外，他们还将就大模型、生成式 AI、具身智能、AI 智能体等热门行业的投资趋势，以及投资人和投资机构如何选择被投企业等话题进行深入探讨。

sessions.title: 使用投机采样和计算通信 Overlap 提升 LLM 推理效率
sessions.speakers: Lei Su (Team Lead, Baichuan, Inc.) | Bin Xiao (Sr. Software Engineer, Baichuan, Inc.)
sessions.points:
1. AI 驱动的 Gaussian Splatting（3DGS）技术支持高精度环境的实时渲染，大幅缩短制作周期并降低计算成本
2. 基于 3DGS 的 LCC 模型，机器人训练和仿真能够实现高度逼真的空间映射与物理交互，从而提升决策精度
sessions.description:
介绍百川智能自研投机采样（Clover 系列模型）与计算通信 overlap 在大模型推理优化上的设计到落地流程。
1. 使用投机采样优化 decode 阶段效率问题，通过设计高命中率低成本的模型结构及动态的候选 token tree 结构，提升投机采样有效性；
2. 采用计算通信 overlap 优化通信占比大场景下 prefill 效率问题，通过创新的序列内 overlap 提升计算利用率，从而降低 prefill 阶段耗时。

sessions.title: VLA：迈向自动驾驶物理智能体的关键一步
sessions.speakers: Peng Jia (VP of Autonomous Driving Algorithms, Li Auto)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how SpeechLLM improves real-time multitasking in voice bots
2. Learn about broader applications of speech LLMs
sessions.description: 在 GTC2024 大会上，我们介绍了 DriveVLM-Dual，一种快-慢思考混合的自动驾驶系统，可协同发挥端到端 (传感器数据输入、轨迹输出) 模型和视觉语言模型 (VLM) 的优势。两个模型均基于大量人类驾驶数据进行训练，并展现出符合数据量扩展定律（data scaling law）的特性，系统在真实驾驶环境中的表现随训练数据量的增加而提升。双系统被部署在双 Drive Orin 车载平台上，并已经大规模交付给终端客户，覆盖超过 40 万辆汽车。今天，我们将介绍理想 VLA（视觉-语言-行动）模型。理想 VLA 模型将快慢系统结合为一个单一大模型并赋予该模型自主决定何时采用慢思维的能力。它实现了空间感知与理解、开放世界知识、语言推理和行动策略的统一并进行联合训练和优化。此模型已经部署在单 Drive Thor的车载平台上，展现出了诸多令人兴奋的特性和能力。这套系统可以被视为一个物理世界智能体的雏形，通过语言自然地与用户互动，执行复杂、开放世界的驾驶任务。这一进步不仅标志着技术上的飞跃，也预示着一种全新、前所未有的自动驾驶产品形态的出现。

sessions.title: GLake：大模型训练和推理的显存优化探索
sessions.speakers: Junping Zhao (Software Director, Ant Group) | Rui Zhang (Software Engineer, Ant Group)
sessions.points:
1. We'll discuss how the cuVS library can be used to perform fast highly accurate vector search for a range of use cases.
2. We'll present technical details and performance results of the latest GPU-accelerated algorithms in cuVS, including DiskANN, and compare it with CPU-based approaches.
sessions.description:
大模型需要巨大的 GPU 显存。为缓解显存不足 OOM 问题并实现高性能和易用性，我们将介绍一系列基于 CUDA 虚拟内存管理（VMM）的显存优化方案，包括训练和推理。

1. 对于训练，我们分享 GMLake（ASPLOS2024）来减少显存碎片。它动态地将非连续物理显存融合成连续的虚拟地址且对模型透明，在八个模型上的评测表明，GMLake 可每卡节省显存 9.2GB~25GB。
2. 对于推理，我们介绍 vTensor 和 LayerKV。前者是基于 VMM API 而新派生的 PyTorch tensor 数据结构，它可替代 vLLM PagedAttention，使得集成或定制新的 attention kernel 变得非常简单，例如只需修改 3 行代码可在 vLLM 中支持新的稀疏或量化 kernel。后者重点优化了显存不足导致的排队和首字延迟激增问题，在高负载下可将首字优化3X~69X 包括 TP 并行和 PD 分离。

sessions.title: 从智能驾驶到 AGI：下一代自动驾驶技术的演进
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Maxwell Zhou (CEO, DeepRoute.ai)
sessions.points:
1. 介绍 Clover 系列投机采样 draft 模型的设计路线，如何实现低计算成本高精度。
2. 了解投机采样的原理，介绍投机采样工程落地难点，及大 batch下如何利用动态 token tree 提升高命中率等。
sessions.description: 传统自动驾驶系统对复杂环境的理解和决策能力有限，元戎启行研发的 VLA 模型（Vision-Language-Action）通过融合视觉、语言理解与行动，并借助 Chain of Thought 思维链更显性地逐步解释其逻辑推理过程，显著提升了对长时序场景的精准理解和判断能力，从而让自动驾驶系统在复杂且动态变化的道路环境中，做出更加透明、更具可解释性且值得被消费者信赖的决策。展望未来，VLA 模型不仅将在智能驾驶领域持续创新，还将扩展到更广泛的物理 AI 应用，推动行业迈向更自主、智能的 AGI 时代。

sessions.title: 重塑短视频视觉体验，基于 TensorRT-LLM 加速的智能视频质量评价与处理大模型
sessions.speakers: Kun Yuan (Algorithm Expert, Kuaishou Technology)
sessions.description: 快手视频内容丰富多样，记录并分享了每一种生活。相较于由专业机构生产的视频，快手包含了更多样的用户创作内容。但这些视频由于多种因素存在画质差异，为了提升用户消费体验，快手音视频部门致力于通过 AI 算法和大数据进行视频的内容理解、质量评价和增强修复处理。本次分享会介绍快手音视频结合大模型技术进行的业务实践：（1）KVQ：白盒化的视频质量评价算法，针对复杂的视频内容和低质成因提供一致性的客观质量打分和归因分析；（2）LPM：兼具真实性与保真度的处理大模型，基于海量数据和 DiT 大模型重塑视觉体验；（3）高效部署：通过引入 TensorRT 和 TensorRT-LLM，推理效率相较于原生 PyTorch 加速 5 倍以上。

sessions.title: Laiye AI Foundry - NVIDIA AI Enterprise 在中国的最佳实践
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Zilo Zhao (CTO, laiye.ai)
sessions.points:
1. 了解 2-bit 量化算法的详细信息
2. 详细了解 NVIDIA GPU 上 2-bit 的高性能优化
sessions.description:
在生成式人工智能时代，企业正迎来前所未有的机遇与挑战。为了助力企业实现智能化转型，Laiye AI Foundry 应运而生。它是一个专为企业场景应用打造的大模型定制化平台，致力于构建一个自主可控的人工智能生态系统。通过保障企业的数据主权，Laiye AI Foundry 为企业提供了坚实的数据基础，驱动企业迈向智能化的未来。
利用 NVIDIA AI Enterprise 组件，如 NVIDIA NeMo Framework，Laiye AI Foundry 构建了一个持续改进和优化的“数据和模型飞轮”。这一机制确保了企业大模型的性能和效果能够随着时间的推移而不断提升，通过不断的学习和适应，模型能够更好地服务于企业的具体需求。基于 NVAIE BCME 的集群管理系统，提供私有化集群部署服务保障了 GPU 集群稳定高效和稳定的运行。
此外 Laiye AI Foundry 基于 NVIDIA AI Blueprints，融合了 NVAIE 组件中的 NVIDIA NIM、NeMo-Microservices 等微服务，打造了全面的大模型企业服务， 提供了强大的模型构建和部署能力，确保了服务的灵活性和可扩展性，以满足不同企业在智能化转型过程中的多样化需求。

sessions.title: 端到端全场景智能驾驶
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Kuiyuan Yang (Expert Engineer, Xiaomi)
sessions.points:
1. 深入了解嵌入如何在推荐推理中发挥重要作用及其在 CPU 架构中的局限性
2. 了解如何设计 GPU 缓存来解决这一挑战、其架构和实现
sessions.description: 汽车是具身智能的首个大规模载体，在载人帮助用户出行同时，也载着AI规模化进行着物理世界探索并数字化。小米智驾借助SU7在物理世界的探索，使用AI持续提升对物理世界建模的完整性和精准度。同时，基于 NVIDIA Triton 重构云端推理服务 pipeline，GPU 吞吐提升提升一倍以上，基于 NVIDIA DALI、CV-CUDA 等技术进行模型训练加速，小米持续迭代拓展智驾能力。自 SU7 量产交付后9个月内，完成了有图、无图、端到端三代技术升级。

sessions.title: LLM 2-bit 后量化的加速与部署实践
sessions.speakers: Wei Chen (High Performance Computing Engineer, Bytedance) | Yi Guo (High Performance Computing Engineer, Bytedance)
sessions.points:
1. Establish a reliable low-latency framework with Holoscan SDK
2. Demonstrate extensibility of the Holoscan SDK using HoloHub to leverage industry-leading components
sessions.description: 我们深入研究了用于 LLM 的高精度 2-bit 权重压缩。将模型参数解耦为整数和浮点部分，并通过对权重和 scale/zp 的交替迭代进行优化，求解局部极小值，最终在 Llama-1/2 7B~70B 的 2-bit 后量化上实现了 sota 精度。此外，我们还探索利用 2-bit 内存访问优势的新技术，并基于 TensorRT-LLM 中的 w4a16 Gemm 运算符开发 Gemm CUDA 内核，该内核可以高效加速 w2a16 模型的推理，并在 NVIDIA GPU 上实现 1.4 倍至 1.7 倍的加速。

sessions.title: 释放 GPU 缓存的强大威能：闪电加速短视频推荐系统！
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Image Processing & Enhancement
sessions.speakers: Xinhua Li (Developer of Recommendation Infrastructure, Beijing Kuaishou Cooperation) | Eric Chen (Solution Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. 快手音视频采用多模态大模型进行视频质量评价，能够有效分析视频画质并归因
2. 快手音视频采用生成式的扩散模型进行视频处理，增强和修复受损的视频画质，提升用户的消费体验
sessions.description: 根据对推荐业务的深入分析，我们发现推理过程受到 CPU 资源的限制。推荐推理的关键瓶颈在于嵌入查找带来的大规模随机内存访问。GPU 缓存有望在 HBM 中吸收热嵌入的访问。我们将分享利用 GPU 缓存 (源自 NVIDIA HugeCTR) 在 CPU 资源有限的情况下实现 1.6 倍加速的实践经验，例如直播和短视频业务中的内容和广告推荐。

sessions.title: 使用 NVIDIA 技术为你的母語构建 LLM
sessions.speakers: Thomas Chong (AI Research Engineer, Votee, Ltd.) | Jacky Chan (CTO, Votee, Ltd.)
sessions.points:
1. 高效的集合操作可以让许多信息检索和大数据应用受益
2. 基于位图的 GPU 集合操作仍需进一步优化
sessions.description: 我们将提供详细的路线图，以便使用 NVIDIA 强大的 GPU 架构和软件工具训练专为资源稀缺语言 (例如广东话/粤语) 训练的大语言模型。了解如何使用 NeMo Curator 预处理数据集，以高效处理语言细微差别，并利用 NeMo Framework 优化模型训练和超参数调优。我们将探索专为资源稀缺语言设计的架构调整，演示模型性能的量化，并分享重点介绍实际应用的案例研究。最后，您将拥有切实可行的实施和部署 LLM 的策略，以满足服务水平低下的语言社区的独特需求。

sessions.title: 有效利用 NVAIE 构建利用边缘到云的端到端自动驾驶数据闭环
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Shawn Li (CTO, Shanghai Yoocar Network Technology Co., Ltd)
sessions.points:
1. 在 NVIDIA Nsight Systems 工具包的指导下，深入研究文本转图像工作负载的计算和内存访问模式
2. 深入了解我们的免引擎构建技术，该技术能够在线加速新微调的模型，而不会产生任何编译优化开销
sessions.description: 在从规则驱动模型向数据驱动模型转变的趋势下，汽车公司在构建自动驾驶数据闭环方面面临着诸多挑战。我们将分享对基于边缘到云技术构建数据闭环功能的见解。除了双 5G 连接、数据合规性之外，该解决方案还包括由 NVIDIA 技术 (尤其是 NVAIE ) 提供支持的自动数据处理、自动标注、模型训练工作流、场景构建和挖掘以及仿真。通过将大数据和大模型与开发流程相结合，我们的目标是加速汽车公司的高水平自动驾驶研发。

sessions.title: 面向海量模型业务场景的文生图高效推理加速解决方案
sessions.speakers: Carson Lee (AI Infrastructure Technical Expert, Alibaba Cloud) | Alex Ng (AI Infrastructure Technical Expert, Alibaba Cloud)
sessions.description:
文生图掀起了一股 AI 创作浪潮，是当下 AIGC 赛道最受关注的应用方向之一。然而，这些服务的推理部署上线面临着诸多挑战，例如面向消费者 (ToC) 场景下，处理大量用户自定义模型时所带来的高昂编译优化成本；较长的图片生成时间导致的用户体验下降；频繁加载/切换不同模型导致的 GPU 资源利用效率低下等问题。

为了应对这些挑战，我们推出了一套基于 TensorRT 的文生图推理加速解决方案。利用 cuBLAS、cuDNN、cuTLASS 和 CUDA 算子融合技术，在各类算子中都实现了极致的性能。我们还设计了高效的权重重排、权重更新和线上模型免编译等技术，实现推理服务期间快速的模型优化与切换。总体而言，相较于未定制优化的社区 PyTorch 版本，我们在各种 NVIDIA GPU 上实现了最高 1.8 倍的加速比，业务成本降低多达 40%，同时显著改善了 AIGC 用户的体验。

sessions.title: 使用 GPU 加速图像视频处理方法的演进
sessions.speakers: Yifan Zhu (GPU Sr. Engineer, Volcano Engine Video Cloud)
sessions.points:
1. 了解在为资源稀缺语言训练 LLM 时面临的主要挑战，以及如何使用先进的 NVIDIA 技术克服这些挑战
2. 学习使用 NeMo Curator 进行高效数据处理和 NeMo Framework 模型训练的技术，从而加快迭代速度并提升性能
sessions.description: 在实际应用过程中，基于卷积神经网络的 AI 算法，由于优越的性能表现，逐步取代了传统算法。但是随着生活水平的提高，人们对于视频质量的要求也越来越高，各种算法对于算力的要求也越来越高，CPU 已经不能满足最新算法的算力要求，因此 GPU 加速方法得到了广泛的应用。 随着 AI 技术的发展，增强技术从单一模型逐渐发展到多模型叠加，取得了更好的增强效果。最新试验表明，基于画质信息结构化的动态自适应模型叠加方法成为了主流。AI 算法处理高分辨率的视频图像对显存的巨量开销，和有限的 GPU 显存形成了天然矛盾。我们会描述如何在一张 GPU 上运行几十种图像增强模型的调度方法，以及最新的 VLM 调度优化的内容。经过异步执行器调度优化，填补了 LLAVA 算法中的 GPU 空隙，通过nsys 分析得到的结果，整体速度相比 SGLang 提升了20%。

sessions.title: 基于端到端世界模型的生成式智驾体验
sessions.speakers: 晓智 陈 (AI CTO, Zhuoyu Technology)
sessions.points:
1. 自动驾驶技术从规则驱动模型向数据驱动模型转变的行业趋势
2. 汽车公司在构建自动驾驶数据闭环过程中面临的一系列挑战
sessions.description: 卓驭作为国际一流的智能驾驶供应商及服务商，以“为所有人，提供安全、轻松的出行体验”为使命，提供行业领先的智能驾驶系统及自研核心零部件，为多种价位、多种动力类型的乘用车提供灵活多样的高阶智能驾驶解决方案，推动高阶智能驾驶功能全面普及，提升消费者的智能驾驶体验。演讲内容将为听众介绍卓驭端到端世界模型的最新技术进展、相关量产成果以及未来规划。

sessions.title: 在 GPU 上加速基于位图的集合操作
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Large Language Models (LLMs)
sessions.speakers: Peter Huang (Engrg-Hardware 1) (DevTech Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. 广​告领域生​成式​召回​方案探索
2. TensorRT-LLM 最​佳​实践​
sessions.description:
从信息检索到各种大数据工作负载 (包括混合检索和留存分析)，高效的集合操作可使许多应用受益。
Bitmap 是构建高性能集合操作工具包的基本数据结构，我们看到其中一些工具包在行业中取得了巨大成功。与此同时，GPU 上基于位图的集合操作工具包仍需进一步优化。
在本次演讲中，我们将分享基于位图的集合操作优化实践，详细阐述高效集合并集、交集、差集和其他操作的设计和实现要点，并展示如何与现有的基于排序数组的 GPU 集合操作工具包 (如 Thrust) 合作。
通过充分利用 GPU 设备显存带宽和高效的线程调度机制，并通过位图减少显存占用，我们可以在密集集合的运算上提供比现有工具包更高的吞吐量。

sessions.title: Rapid Application Development Using Large Language Models (LLMs)
sessions.speakers: Anna Louise Ollerenshaw (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how algorithms based out of large matrix multiplication techniques replaced traditional methods for better mule detection using improved network analysis
2. Understand the strategy behind implementing GPU technology to overcome previous bottlenecks in scaling mule detection for billions of transactions
sessions.description: Most enterprises need to perform multiple language-related tasks every day. This includes organizing documents based on common themes (text classification), writing emails (content generation), removing harmful posts from their online communities (toxicity classification), and much more. Applications powered by LLMs can help enterprises automate these and many other tasks, letting them streamline their operations, decrease expenses, and increase productivity. Alternatively, enterprises can use large language model-powered apps to provide innovative and improved services to clients or strengthen customer relationships. For example, providing customer support with AI companions or using sentiment analysis apps to extract valuable customer insights.You’ll learn about:The intuitions and best practices underlying LLM architectures and systems, including transformers and context insertion.Techniques to apply state-of-the-art language models to problems spanning vanilla classification, novel content generation, and image/audio reasoning.Engineering and abstraction practices to work with and keep up with the evolving LLM ecosystem, including HuggingFace and LangChain offerings.You’ll also have a deep understanding of the modern LLM ecosystem, the architectures and design choices that power the models, and the techniques necessary to build your own LLM-powered applications with a well-informed and responsible strategy.Prerequisite(s):Professional experience with the Python programming language.Familiarity with fundamental deep learning topics like model architecture, training, and inference.Familiarity with a modern Python-based deep learning framework, preferably PyTorch.Certificate:Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth

sessions.title: Fundamentals of Accelerated Data Science
sessions.speakers: Juan Jose Durillo Barrionuevo (DLI Principal Instructor, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. From Reactive to Anticipatory: See how AI-first factories predict failures, adapt in real time, and optimize operations — preventing inefficiencies before they occur
2. AI & Simulation Transform Manufacturing: Discover how Omniverse, Metropolis, TAO Toolkit, NIM, Cosmos, and GR00T are redefining supply chains, quality control, and automation at scale
sessions.description: Data science is about using scientific methods, processes, algorithms, and systems to analyze and extract insights from data. It lets organizations turn data into a valuable resource, leading to smarter decision-making, improved operations, and enhanced customer experiences. In this workshop, you'll explore how to use GPU-accelerated tools to conduct data science faster, leading to more scalable, reliable, and cost-effective results.You’ll learn how to:Use cuDF to accelerate pandas, Polars, and Dask for analyzing datasets of all sizes efficiently.Use a wide variety of machine learning algorithms, including XGBoost, for different data science problems.Deploy machine learning models on an NVIDIA Triton™ Inference Server to deliver optimal performance.Learn and apply powerful graph algorithms to analyze complex networks with NetworkX and cuGraph.Perform multiple analysis tasks on massive datasets to stave off a simulated epidemic outbreak affecting the U.K.You’ll also be able to perform and accelerate the end-to-end data science workflow. The speedup will translate into more iteration cycles, better performance, and improved productivity.Prerequisite(s):Experience with Python, ideally including pandas and NumPy.Certificate:Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth.

sessions.title: Build AI Agents With Multi-Modal Models
sessions.speakers: Nourchene Benslimane (Deep Learning Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. How to build and deploy high-quality AI agent systems
2. How to evaluate the quality of your AI agent systems, and how to continuously improve quality
sessions.description: Just as humans have multiple senses to perceive the world around them, more and more computer sensors are being developed to capture a wide variety of data. In the health industry, computed tomography (CT) scans provide a 3D representation to detect potentially dangerous abnormalities. In the robotics industry, lidars help robots see depth and navigate their complex environments. In this course, you'll develop neural network agents that can reason using many different data types by exploring multiple fusion techniques.You’ll learn about:Different data types and how to make them ready for neural networks.Model fusion, and the differences between early, late, and intermediate fusion.PDF extraction using OCR.The difference between modality and agent orchestration.Customization of NVIDIA AI Blueprints for for video search and summarization.Upon completion, you'll be able to orchestrate several multimodal agents into an application.Prerequisite(s):Basic understanding of Python, including classes, objects, and decorators.Basic understanding of neural networks, such as image convolution and sequential models.Certificate:Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth.

sessions.title: 基于 TensorRT-LLM 的广告场景生成式推理加速方案
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Image / Video Detection & Recognition
sessions.speakers: Jian Li (Algorithm Engineer, JD.com) | Zehua Zhang (Algorithm Scientist, JD.com)
sessions.points:
1. 卓驭生成式智驾体验介绍
2. 卓驭端到端世界模型架构
sessions.description: 电​商​平台​具有极​其复杂的用​户决策和行为​逻辑​，传统的​推​荐​算法存​在明显的​容​量​瓶颈​。而大语言模型​在复​杂模式​识​别、语义理​解和泛化​性上​具有​显著优势，配​合​ DPO 等偏​好对齐​算法在具体​的召回优化任​务上​体现出​极​强​的适应​性和灵活​性​。LLM 及​相关​技术将推动搜​索、广​告和推​荐​领域的技​术创新和​效率​突破​。京东广告基​于​这一​技术洞​察，探索了一​套可实现的生​成式​召回服​务​解​决方案​，并且基于​ TensorRT-LLM 解​决​生成​式大型模型的​端到​端推理​性​能问题。

sessions.title: 下一代生成式推荐模型训推引擎的建设和落地实践
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Image Processing & Enhancement
sessions.speakers: Lei Yu (Principal Software Engineer, Meituan) | Chi Ma (Sr. Software Engineer, Meituan)
sessions.points:
1. 使用 CUDA 重写传统算法
2. 使用子图融合的方法加速 GPU 计算过程
sessions.description: 大模型技术在搜索、推荐和广告领域的应用如火如荼，尤其是以生成式推荐为代表的研究被视为下一代搜推广稀疏大模型的全新技术路线，成为各大公司争相探索和落地的方向。本次分享主要介绍我们基于 Torch 搭建的一套易于使用的高性能分布式训推框架，低成本支持类似 GPT-3 计算规模甚至更大 FLOPS 的稀疏大模型的训练、推理、部署和线上实验。引入生成式推荐技术后，多个业务场景下都观察到了scaling law，线上AB实验也取得了一定的效果收益。

sessions.title: Get NVIDIA Certified
sessions.speakers: Aeshah Hadges (Certification Program Manager, NVIDIA) | Gary Fluitt (Technical Certification Manager, NVIDIA) | Marco Alves (Technical Certification Lead, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. GIGAPOD, a turnkey AI data center solution with scalable infrastructure and full software stack, lowers the barrier to AI adoption
2. GIGAPOD Manager software platform simplifies the data center infrastructure management to IT admins and orchestrates computing resources for AI, HPC, and hybrid applications workloads
sessions.description: For the first time ever, GTC 2025 attendees will have the exclusive opportunity to earn NVIDIA certifications at no cost. Seize this unique opportunity to validate your expertise, showcase your skills, and join the ranks of NVIDIA-certified professionals. Seats are limited and available on a first-come, first-served basis—be sure to register onsite to secure your spot!Why Certify?Validate your expertise in cutting-edge NVIDIA technologies.Boost your career prospects and earning potential.Join an elite community of NVIDIA-certified professionals.Available Certifications:NVIDIA-Certified Associate: Generative AI and LLMsNVIDIA-Certified Associate: Multimodal Generative AINVIDIA-Certified Associate: AI Infrastructure and OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI InfrastructureNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: Accelerated Data Science (Coming Soon)How to Register for an exam slot:Register for the conference.Review preparation materials thoroughly before attempting the exam.Add this session to your schedule.Sign up for an exam slot onsite.Arrive early to secure your spot – seats are limited and fill quickly.Please note the following:This promotion is available to in-person attendees only, and only available at GTC.The last exams will begin at 3:30 PM or 4:00 PM depending on the schedule.Get certified and secure your invitation to the exclusive NVIDIA Certified Reception on Thursday, March 20th, 7:30 PM – 9:30 PM.

sessions.title: GTC 2025 Keynote
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Deep Learning Frameworks
sessions.speakers: Jensen Huang (Founder and CEO, NVIDIA)
sessions.description: Don't miss this keynote from NVIDIA founder and CEO Jensen Huang. He'll share how NVIDIA's accelerated computing platform is driving the next wave in AI, digital twins, cloud technologies, and sustainable computing.

sessions.title: GIGAPOD: Redefining the Future Data Center by Scaling Beyond Servers and Software Stack (Presented by Giga Computing)
sessions.speakers: Eric Ming Chiang Chen (CEO, MyelinTek, Inc.)
sessions.points:
1. Learn about deployment-time guardrails, with a focus on runtime monitoring of end-to-end AI stacks
2. Learn about validation-time guardrails, with a focus on data generation, simulation, and evaluators
sessions.description: GIGAPOD redefines the future data centers by providing scalable solutions of computing resources, tailored performance of cluster, ease of deployment, verified optimal performance, data storage platforms, networking solutions, and POD Manager software platform to manage infrastructure at scale and AI workload for development and applications.

sessions.title: How Yum! Brands Serves Up Digital Innovation
sessions.speakers: Joe Park (Chief Digital & Technology Officer, Yum! Brands, Inc. and President, Byte by Yum!) | Andrew Sun (Director, Business Development - Retail/CPG/QSR, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Real robots need real data. Today, there is a 100,000x “data gap” between general vision-language models and generalist robotics.
2. To close this gap, one option is to collect systematic data from industrial robots working in real applications.
sessions.description: Join us as Joe Park, chief digital and technology officer at Yum! Brands, highlights the company’s transformative use of AI in its digital evolution. Since 2019, digital sales have soared from 19% to over 50%, driven by AI-powered innovations that enhance both customer experiences and operational efficiency. Yum! leverages AI to optimize order customization, streamline kitchen management, and enhance ecommerce platforms. Joe will discuss AI’s pivotal role in creating a smarter, more responsive quick-service restaurant ecosystem tailored to evolving consumer needs.

sessions.title: Application Optimization for NVIDIA Grace CPU
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Climate / Weather / Ocean Modeling
sessions.speakers: Lukas Krenz (Sr. Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Mathias Wagner (Sr. Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how AI revolutionizes weather forecasting through next-level speed, efficiency, and accessibility
2. Leverage Earth2Studio to create global deterministic and probabilistic AI weather forecasts with only a few lines of Python code
sessions.description:
The NVIDIA Grace CPU, NVIDIA’s inaugural CPU for the data center, delivers exceptional performance whether paired with NVIDIA’s best-in-class data center GPU or combined with a second Grace CPU in the Grace Superchip. While offering impressive out-of-the-box performance and power efficiency, understanding and optimizing applications is essential to fully harness the capabilities of the Grace CPU.
We'll show how to optimize existing applications — ranging from HPC to data center workloads — to maximize their performance on Grace. We'll cover best practices, including recommendations on compiler options, performance libraries, and coding considerations for targeting the NVIDIA Grace CPU. Discover how to leverage developer tools to detect and bring to life optimization possibilities using a data-driven approach for real-world applications.

sessions.title: Real-Time Mule Account Detection at India Scale
sessions.speakers: Vishal Kanvaty (CTO, National Payments Corporation of India) | Tittu Varghese (Solution Architect, National Payments of Corporation of India)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how a unified platform can simplify getting an AI app to production 60% faster while controlling costs and enhancing customer experience
2. Explore how to enable iteration and experimentation with retrieval-augmented generation using NeMo Retriever and Langflow, supporting a self-managed enterprise environment on an open stack
sessions.description: Explore how National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), in partnership with NVIDIA, revolutionized the detection of mule accounts across India's extensive payments network. We'll cover the strategic shift from traditional fraud detection methods to a custom-developed algorithm that uses large matrix multiplication spread across multiple NVIDIA DGX H100s. With billions of transactions flowing through UPI, IMPS, and RuPay, real-time fraud detection was previously tackled using time- and resource-intensive CPU and RAM solutions. Learn how NVIDIA's CuNumeric and Legate-Sparse libraries enabled NPCI to overcome these limitations, providing a high-performance, scalable, and efficient solution at the scale required for India's financial ecosystem.

sessions.title: Beyond Prediction: The Future of Inference in AI, Science, and Society
sessions.speakers: Vartika Singh (Strategic AI Lead, NVIDIA) | Eric Steinberger (Co-founder & CEO, Magic.dev) | Beidi Chen (Assistant Professor, Carnegie Mellon University) | Lianmin Zheng (Member of Technical Staff, xAI) | Bita Darvish Rouhani (Distinguished Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. The Cloud Model No Longer Fits AI at Scale: Traditional cloud computing models, where compute is done where data resides, create bottlenecks that hinder AI scalability and efficiency
2. Siloed Compute is a Bottleneck for AI Workloads: Deploying isolated compute resources for model training limits performance, delays innovation, and cannot meet the growing demands of AI-driven enterprises, neoclouds, and model builders
sessions.description: Explore how inference, a fundamental concept in reasoning and decision-making, is evolving across disciplines, shaping everything from AI systems to scientific discovery and societal impact. We'll bring together diverse perspectives and spark discussion on cutting-edge advancements, ethical considerations, and future trends.

sessions.title: Founder Frameworks: Seven Lessons Learned
sessions.speakers: Caryn Marooney (General Partner, Coatue)
sessions.points:
1. Role of NVIDIA AI and robotics technology in helping startups evolve rapidly and innovate at scale
2. Utility and impact of AI-powered robotics solutions in various industries
sessions.description:
Join Caryn Marooney, general partner at Coatue, for a primer on how entrepreneurs can start to turn a vision into a scalable company. Caryn has had a front-row seat working with some of the best tech founders in the world, including her investments in Notion, Supabase, RunwayML, ClickHouse, DeepJudge, and Lightning AI. As the co-founder of OutCast, she spent 13 years working with Marc Benioff from the earliest days of Salesforce.com through IPO and beyond. She then went on to lead communications at Facebook/Meta, including its early days through IPO, as well as Instagram, WhatsApp, Oculus, and Congressional testimony.

Caryn will share the S.W.I.M. Framework, a guide to big moments in businesses. It helps answer the questions: How do you know when it’s time to launch? How to get internal alignment? How do you win in a crowded market? How do you get momentum? How do you keep momentum?

sessions.title: Blueprints for Success: Navigating NIM Agent Workflows for Real-World Multimodal Retrieval
sessions.speakers: Ziv Ilan (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Natalia Segal (Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Rita Fernandes Neves (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. We built a high-performant multi-modal scientific workflow using the Megatron framework with a focus on protein design applications
2. The framework is generalizable to other scientific domains with the crucial capability to incorporate experimental feedback
sessions.description: In this comprehensive course, you'll delve into the real-world applications of multimodal retrieval-augmented generation (RAG). Through a series of hands-on modules, learn how to leverage NIM agent blueprints as a one-stop solution for your AI projects. Much of the course is a deep dive into a real-life multimodal RAG application at scale, utilizing NVIDIA NIMs. You'll gain the knowledge and skills needed to implement and optimize multimodal data ingestion, embedding, and retrieval. You'll also learn how NVIDIA Blueprints can guide your AI solution from proof of concept (POC) to production using self-hosted microservices. This holistic approach ensures that you are equipped to handle every stage of the AI development lifecycle. In the end, you'll have a solid understanding of NIM agent workflows and be able to apply them effectively in real-world scenarios, taking your AI projects to the next level.Prerequisite(s):Basic knowledge of Python.Basic knowledge of LLMs.Familiarity with basic RAG concepts.

sessions.title: Future-Ready Factories: The AI-First Revolution in Manufacturing (Presented by TCS)
sessions.speakers: Laksh Parthasarathy (Global Head, Smart Mobility Group, Tata Consultancy Services) | Naresh Mehta (Global Chief Technology and Innovation Officer, Tata Consultancy Services)
sessions.points:
1. Understanding AI Inference: Deep dive into the prefill and decode phases of LLM inference and their impact on GPU utilization and performance
2. Advanced Model Serving Strategies: Discover methods such as in-flight batching and speculative inference to boost GPU utilization and minimize latency during deployment
sessions.description: A machine halts. A defect spreads. A supply chain stalls. Traditional factories react — fixing issues after they occur. But what if your factory already knew? What if it predicted failures before they happened? If AI-driven vision caught defects early? If supply chains adapted in real time? This is not the future — it's happening now. TCS’s Design for Intelligence, powered by NVIDIA platforms — Omniverse for digital twins, Metropolis for vision AI, TAO Toolkit and NIM for scalable AI, Cosmos for generative simulations, and GR00T for AI-driven robotics in manufacturing — is enabling AI-first factories that predict, adapt, and optimize in real time. The result? Resilient supply chains, zero-defect quality, and intelligent automation at scale. See how future-ready factories are shifting from reactive to truly intelligent — because in manufacturing’s next era, you lead or fall behind.

sessions.title: Making Physical AI a Reality Through Real-Time Edge Computing
sessions.speakers: Mostafa Toloui (Holoscan Product Management Lead, NVIDIA) | Mischa Dohler (VP Emerging Technologies, Ericsson, Inc.) | Hajime Akutsu (Product Manager, Sony Semiconductor Solutions) | Jay Carlson (Staff Engineer, Virtual Incision) | Derek Mariscal (Experimental Physicist, Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory)
sessions.points:
1. Learn about current hard drive recording technologies and how they enable mass capacity storage
2. Discover other enabling technologies and their impact on existing usage models
sessions.description:
The world's largest industries are poised to embrace physical AI. The challenge comes with necessity to understand multimodally in real time. The entire sensor AI processing needs to be accelerated. Developers now can tackle edge AI challenges by seamlessly integrating sensor data, accelerated computing, real-time visualization/actuation, and AI inferencing — all while it abstracts away complexities for developers and reduces time-to-market. 
 
We'll feature cross-industry use cases including medical surgical robotics, brain-computer interface, semiconductor defect detection, and high-bandwidth sensor processing at scientific computing to demonstrate real-world physical AI applications. Cross-industry use cases will demonstrate real-world physical AI applications and sensor processing problems from model training and simulation to edge computing.

sessions.title: How AI is Fueling Innovation in Automotive Software and Manufacturing
sessions.speakers: Norm Marks (Worldwide Field Ops) (VP, Automotive Enterprise, NVIDIA) | David Richardson (SVP, Software and Services Engineering, General Motors)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the evolution of the marketing industry and how AI is changing the space
2. Discover the potential of predictive intelligence in optimizing marketing strategies and increasing revenue
sessions.description: Join David Richardson, SVP of Software Engineering at General Motors, in a fireside chat with Norm Marks, VP of Automotive Enterprise at NVIDIA, as they discuss how AI is driving transformation across automotive manufacturing and vehicle software development. With the broadest EV portfolio in the U.S. and strong ICE vehicle sales, GM is pioneering innovative AI applications across its global ecosystem. In this conversation, Richardson will share how GM is leveraging AI to create a competitive advantage-- through better, safer, and more efficient processes. From digital twins that simulate production lines pre-construction, to precision quality testing systems for battery packs and vehicle assembly, to advancements in autonomous driving technology. Discover how industrial AI is not only reshaping traditional manufacturing but fundamentally changing what vehicles can do and how they're built, while empowering GM's workforce to focus on craftsmanship and delivering exceptional customer experiences in today's competitive landscape.

sessions.title: Introduction to NVIDIA’s Strategy for AV Safety
sessions.speakers: Marco Pavone (Director, Autonomous Vehicle Research, NVIDIA) | Jonas Nilsson (Director of Safety Engineering, Head of AV Safety, NVIDIA) | Karl Greb (Sr. Director Safety Engineering, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
