1. Build a foundational understanding of agentic design patterns for data-centered tasks with evaluations and observability to build apps that can be trusted
2. Examine key agentic design patterns to build trustworthy data agents, including reflection and refinement loops, tool use, and multi-agent systems
sessions.description: We'll introduce NVIDIA’s framework for autonomous vehicle (AV) safety, comprising state-of-the-art hardware and software components, tools, and models, as well as the design principles for combining them to safeguard end-to-end AV stacks, and physical AI systems more broadly. After the introduction, we'll dive deep into design-time safety guardrails, from platform to algorithmic safety.

sessions.title: Building Future-Ready AI With Agents and Data Flywheels: Insights From NVIDIA’s Enterprise Deployments
sessions.speakers: Rama Akkiraju (VP, AI/ML for IT, NVIDIA) | Santiago Pombo (Generative AI Product Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. How key industries are adopting accelerated data science today
2. Data scientists can accelerate applications built with pandas, Polars, Scikit-learn, NetworkX, and Apache Spark with minimal-to-no code change
sessions.description: We’ll share insights, best practices, and lessons learned from building scalable, enterprise-ready AI solutions using AI agents and data flywheels. Drawing from our enterprise generative AI deployments, including chatbots, copilots, and ‘talk-to-your-data’ solutions, we’ll show how we implemented AI agents to orchestrate LLMs, APIs, and workflows for automating multi-step tasks, and data flywheels to drive continuous improvement of LLMs through user feedback. These architectural patterns are key to keeping enterprise AI solutions accurate, scalable, adaptable, and relevant in fast-paced business environments.

sessions.title: Inside NVIDIA's Growing AI Portfolio
sessions.speakers: Vishal Bhagwati (Head of Corporate Development, NVIDIA) | Chase Lochmiller (Co-founder & CEO, Crusoe) | Cack Wilhelm (General Partner, IVP) | George Mathew (Managing Director, Insight Partners) | Umesh Sachdev (Co-founder & CEO, Uniphore) | John Watson (Managing Director, Blackstone)
sessions.points:
1. High-level understanding of NVIDIA’s framework for AV safety
2. Deep dive into design-time safety guardrails, from platform to algorithmic safety
sessions.description: Join Vishal Bhagwati, Head of Corporate Development at NVIDIA, for an insightful panel featuring VCs and thought leaders in AI and standout members of the Corporate Development portfolio. The panelists will discuss trends within the Generative AI, LLMs and DC/GPU Cloud ecosystems from the perspective of NVIDIA as well as the VC and startup panelists.

sessions.title: Imitation Learning Techniques Using NVIDIA Isaac Lab and Apple Vision Pro
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Oyindamola Omotuyi (Technical Marketing Engineer - Isaac, NVIDIA) | Edith Llontop (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Showcase Corp Dev Portfolio companies
2. Thought leadership from NVIDIA on top investment trends
sessions.description: This immersive lab introduces participants to the cutting-edge field of imitation learning for robotics. Using NVIDIA's GR00T and Isaac Lab frameworks, attendees will experience the full pipeline of imitation learning, from data collection via teleoperation to training and deploying an autonomous robot policy. The lab combines theoretical concepts with practical, hands-on exercises, allowing participants to gather data using Apple Vision Pro, synthesize additional training examples, and train a robot using Robomimic within the Isaac Lab environment. By the end of the session, attendees will have created and tested their own imitation learning model, gaining valuable insights into this powerful approach for robot skill acquisition.For participants who plan on leveraging the Apple Vision Pro for data capture, please note that glasses are not permitted to be worn with the device.Prerequisite(s):Basic understanding of robotics concepts and principles, including teleoperation.Experience with programming, particularly in Python.Understanding of computer vision concepts and 3D simulation environments.Familiarity with NVIDIA's robotics development platforms like Isaac Sim.Familiarity with spatial computing concepts and Apple's development ecosystem.

sessions.title: Build the Future of AI Infrastructure: From Silicon to Secure Systems at Scale (Presented by Cisco)
sessions.speakers: Will Eatherton (SVP, Networking Engineering, Cisco) | Jake Katz (VP, Product Management, Cisco)
sessions.points:
1. The presentation will discuss the requirements for delivering scalable AI solutions
2. Special focus on highlighting the complexities of custom design, global deployment infrastructure, and understanding testing frameworks
sessions.description:
In an era where AI workloads push boundaries of traditional infrastructure, organizations face a critical inflection point. This session highlights how the Cisco-NVIDIA collaboration is reshaping enterprise AI system deployment and scaling. We'll examine real-world performance data demonstrating how the convergence of networking, compute, and security creates a foundation for next-generation AI applications, including:
•	Infrastructure implications and fabric for AI workloads, including performance analysis and innovations that improve efficiency and reduce completion times.
•	Cisco-NVIDIA technology integration to enhance performance and visibility.
•	Benefits of simplified cluster and fabric management for operators and users.
•	Approaches to securing AI systems, workloads, and applications.

Expect live performance data, architectural insights, and demonstrations to bridge theory and implementation to address key challenges in infrastructure integration, performance optimization, and security.

sessions.title: Learn to Build Agentic AI Workflows for Enterprise Applications
sessions.speakers: Dhruv Nandakumar (Cybersecurity AI Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Matt Penn (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Brian McBrayer (Segment Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how BioNeMo Framework enables the development and training of large-scale AI models for drug discovery
2. Learn how to accelerate your drug discovery process through BioNeMo NIMs and NIM Agent Blueprints
sessions.description: Using NVIDIA technologies, you will build configurable tools and workflows for agentic AI. Learn to deploy an agentic AI workflow, create tools for an AI agent, and quickly augment existing workflows with new tools. With these workflows and tools, you'll increase productivity when dealing with multiple enterprise data sources.Prerequisite(s):Python programming, RAG, agentic frameworks (LangChain, LlamaIndex, etc.).

sessions.title: Accelerate R&D in Quantum Computing
sessions.speakers: Eric Kessler (Sr. Manager Applied Science, Amazon Braket, AWS)
sessions.points:
1. Together Compute Clusters provide a proven and robust platform for AI workloads
2. Automation unlocks scale
sessions.description: Quantum computers are one day expected to solve problems out of reach of even the most powerful classical processors. But these computers won't operate in isolation. Instead, quantum computers will form an integral part of high  performance computing architectures that transform some of today’s most challenging workflows, such as drug discovery, portfolio optimization, and many others. Learn how AWS and NVIDIA are collaborating to bring this shared vision to life through AWS’ quantum service, Amazon Braket, and NVIDIA’s CUDA-Q platform. By providing the tools needed by customers, wherever they are in their quantum journey, they can learn and innovate with easy access to a diverse range of quantum computing hardware on Braket. We'll describe recent progress to improve the runtime performance on quantum processors by over 10-fold, enabling researchers to maximize efficiency when running their algorithms. Finally, as a first step toward understanding the longer-term classical compute resource requirements up and down the quantum stack to deliver a production-grade, hybrid quantum infrastructure for customers, we’ll describe our recent work to enable NVIDIA's CUDA-Q framework for all quantum devices on Braket.

sessions.title: How to Onboard Your Team of AI Agents and Transform Your Enterprise
sessions.speakers: Adel El Hallak (Senior Director of Product Management, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Switching to Arm and adopting Grace is not difficult
2. Many of the CPU techniques used for profiling and performance tuning are directly applicable to Grace
sessions.description: Agentic AI is inspiring a paradigm shift from software-as-a-service to service-as-software. Agents combine reasoning, dynamic data retrieval and can access tools to drive outcomes. Teams of AI agents can work together, achieving results that are often far better than those of a single AI agent. With NVIDIA AI Blueprints, building blocks for agentic AI, we will show how enterprises can easily compose teams of agents, and securely deploy them with confidence.

sessions.title: Empowering Breakthroughs: Leveraging AI Across Pharma From Discovery to Trials With Innovators
sessions.speakers: Renee Yao (Ecosystem Business Development, HCLS (Startups and Consulting Partners), NVIDIA) | Shaan Gandhi (Vice President and Head of Strategic Partnerships, Pfizer Ignite)
sessions.points:
1. Several methods for emulating FP64 and FP32 tensor- and matrix-based operations are known, tested, well-understood, and time- and power-efficient on modern NVIDIA GPUs
2. Low(er)-precision arithmetic units are vastly more power-efficient than are their high(er)-precision counterparts
sessions.description:
AI is transforming the biopharmaceutical landscape, enabling breakthroughs in drug discovery, development, and clinical trials. NVIDIA and Pfizer will share key insights into how innovation is shaping the future of biopharma. We'll spotlight cutting-edge startups pushing the boundaries of AI in biopharma and discuss how these innovations are being applied to solve some of the industry's biggest challenges.

Explore how AI-powered tools, platforms, and collaborations are accelerating R&D and bringing transformative therapies to market. We'll also provide an inside look at how NVIDIA and Pfizer partner and engage with startups in this rapidly evolving space, highlighting collaborative models and success stories that are driving progress from lab to clinic.

sessions.title: Use GPUs to Accelerate Vector Databases
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Programming Languages / Compilers
sessions.speakers: Julio Perez (Senior software engineer, NVIDIA) | Nathan Stephens (Product Manager, Vector Search, NVIDIA) | Corey Nolet (Principal Engineer, ML, Data Mining, and Vector Search, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Gain an updated, comprehensive understanding of the CUDA ecosystem and the tools available for GPU-accelerated computing beyond just kernel programming
2. Develop a mental model for finding and choosing the right tools based on the needs of your project, whether in AI, HPC, data science, or general-purpose GPU computing
sessions.description: Vector databases are a hot topic today for semantic search, and they're powering everything from generative AI workloads to recommender systems. This lab will provide hands-on instruction for optimizing vector database workloads on the GPU, including (1) optimizing ingest and index creation at scale, (2) choosing the best indexes for your data, and (3) tuning the indexes to trade off search speed and quality.Prerequisite(s):This lab assumes basic Python skills and only a high-level familiarity with databases. No familiarity with vector search or vector databases is assumed.

sessions.title: CUDA: New Features and Beyond
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - AI Policy / Trustworthy AI
sessions.speakers: Stephen Jones (SW) (CUDA Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. AI, and particularly generative AI, holds huge potential for overcoming some of the most complex and important challenges in healthcare and life sciences
2. It's critical that AI applications in life sciences meet or exceed rigorous safety and ethical standards to ensure their outputs are trustworthy
sessions.description: The CUDA platform is the foundation of the GPU computing ecosystem. Every application and framework that uses the GPU does so through CUDA's libraries, compilers, runtimes and language — which means CUDA is growing as fast as its ecosystem is evolving. At this engineering-focused talk by one of the architects of CUDA, you'll learn what's new and what's coming next for both CUDA and GPU computing as a whole.

sessions.title: An Introduction to NVIDIA Cosmos World Foundation Models
sessions.speakers: Ming-Yu Liu (VP Generative AI Research, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the latest AI infrastructure trends and how they can be leveraged to maintain a competitive edge
2. Learn how you can stand up a next-gen data center with workload-aware orchestration, end-to-end observability, and unmatched uptime
sessions.description: NVIDIA Cosmos is transforming how robots and autonomous vehicles learn, accelerating physics-aware synthetic video generation with world foundation models. Join Ming-Yu, NVIDIA’s VP of Generative AI Research, to see how Cosmos is democratizing physical AI development—giving developers open models and tools to build custom world models faster than ever.

sessions.title: The Future of Marketing: Unilever’s Innovative Approach with Digital Twins
sessions.speakers: Adam Cleaver (Founder and ECD, Collective) | Esi Eggleston Bracey (Chief Growth and Marketing Officer, Unilever) | Stéphane Bourez (Head of Creative Technology, Collective)
sessions.points:
1. Examples from blockbuster movies and record-breaking music videos, demonstrating AI's impact beyond VFX
2. Unprecedented real-time control over character expressions and movements on set
sessions.description: Join Unilever’s Chief Growth and Marketing Officer Esi Eggleston Bracey and creative-tech innovators Collective World to discover how Unilever is pioneering consistent, creative, and ultra-high-quality product images at scale with NVIDIA Omniverse–powered digital twins.

sessions.title: Insights and Lessons Learned From Building LLM-Powered Applications
sessions.speakers: Tanay Varshney (Developer Advocate Engineer for Deep Learning SW, NVIDIA) | Chip Huyen (Independent Researcher) | Eugene Yan (Sr. Applied Scientist, Amazon)
sessions.points:
1. Overview of the accelerated data processing ecosystem and capabilities
2. Key announcements and updates
sessions.description: Join industry visionaries Eugene Yan and Chip Huyen for a panel discussion uncovering lessons learned from their work helping companies deploy machine learning into production that can serve customers at scale.

sessions.title: Igniting the Real Robot Revolution Requires Closing the “Data Gap”
sessions.speakers: Ken Goldberg (Co-Founder and Chief Scientist, Ambi Robotics, William S. Floyd Distinguished Chair, College of Engineering, UC Berkeley)
sessions.description: Imagine a future where robots handle billions of items with AI to support an aging population that doesn’t have enough human workers. Computation is increasing rapidly but much more data is needed to ignite this robotics revolution.  Several unicorn startups emerged in the past year to generate humanoid robot data but I’ll show that there is still a 100,000x “data gap” between large vision-language models and current robot models. Goldberg will present the state-of-the-art in robotics and review the options for generating robot data, including the case study of Ambi Robotics, which has collected 200,000 hours of real robot data from their award-winning robot systems that have sorted 100 million real consumer packages.  This is allowing Ambi Robotics to close the data gap for a practical subclass of robot skills to enable a new generation of real industrial robots.

sessions.title: RAPIDS in 2025: Accelerated Data Science Everywhere
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - 3D Animation and Modeling
sessions.speakers: Nick Becker (Sr. Technical Product Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how Unilever tackled growing demands for content while improving quality, creativity and consistency
2. Discover how a single, interoperable ‘digital truth’ in Omniverse drives creativity, speed and efficiency across agencies and partners
sessions.description: RAPIDS open source library suite is the foundation for accelerated AI and data science workloads. It supports dataframes, machine learning, graph analytics, vector databases, and LLM-based workflows. In this session, NVIDIA technical leaders will walk data scientists and engineers through new features, zero code change interfaces, powerful optimizations and give a peek at what’s around the corner.

sessions.title: Effective Fundraising Techniques
sessions.speakers: Lu Zhang (Founder and Managing Partner, Fusion Fund)
sessions.points:
1. NVIDIA is accelerating Gen AI with biopharma tools like BioNeMo — discover how NVIDIA’s groundbreaking AI tools, including BioNeMo, are transforming drug discovery and enabling faster, more accurate molecule design, leading to accelerated breakthroughs in biopharma
2. NVIDIA Inception program and pharma corporate ventures foster innovation — learn how NVIDIA's Inception program, in collaboration with pharma corporate ventures, plays a crucial role in matchmaking, supporting, and nurturing a vibrant community of startups building AI tools to drive cutting-edge innovation across the healthcare and life sciences sectors
sessions.description: Join Lu Zhang, founder and managing partner of Fusion Fund, as she shares proven strategies for fundraising. This session will cover techniques for attracting investors, crafting compelling pitches, and building the right relationships for your startup.

sessions.title: Mass Personalization at Scale: Activating the Snickers Brand World Through Gen AI
sessions.speakers: Gülen Bengi (Lead CMO and Global Chief Growth Officer, Mars) | Oliver Feldwick (Chief Innovation Officer, T&Pm, part of WPP)
sessions.points:
1. A use case of DGX Superpod
2. Reference architecture for next-gen AI systems
sessions.description:
Mars is innovating how it builds iconic brand worlds and experiences that engage, inspire and convert consumers, through data driven relationships with no dead ends, which enable personalization at scale and co-creation with fans.  

In the summer of 2024, Mars' Snickers brand partnered with the legendary soccer coach Jose Mourinho, with the aim of delivering a personalized Snickers experience to every soccer fan during Euro 2024.  The response to the brief to their partners at T&Pm took a team of combined talents and disciplines, to design a compelling consumer proposition, backed by an innovative technical solution, and robust safety layers.  

We will share some of the key organizational lessons learned as they worked to deliver such an ambitious campaign. Responsibility was paramount, and we'll share how we did a mass participative activation with zero harmful interactions.  See how we created a generative AI engine for Mars, Inc. that redefines personalized storytelling and brand building. Using custom language models, we crafted on-brand, funny scripts, then paired them with voice and video tech to generate unique content for each consumer. Finally, we'll discuss how this approach will shape consumer packaged goods marketing in the future, as we apply personalized storytelling to new markets and brands — demonstrating the power of innovation through generative AI.

sessions.title: Build and Manage Customizable LLM Pipelines Using NIM Operator
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Programming Languages / Compilers
sessions.speakers: Vishesh Ajay Tanksale (Sr. Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Mahesh Yeole (Engineering Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn about new and existing NVCC flags that improve compiler performance, runtime performance, or reduce binary size
2. Gain a clear understanding of how CMake provides a robust and convenient way to manage building CUDA C++ software
sessions.description: This session explores the intricacies of managing LLM inference pipelines on Kubernetes. We’ll examine how the NIM Operator streamlines the deployment and orchestration of inference pipelines using NIMs. Additionally, we’ll showcase how NeMo services can be used to customized inference workflows and enable data flywheels. Finally, we’ll provide a deep dive into deploying NeMo services with the NIM Operator on a Kubernetes cluster to build and manage data flywheels with ease.

sessions.title: High Scalability, Low Costs, and No Rate Limits: Peek Inside the Serverless Inference API Breaking the Mold (Presented by Lambda)
sessions.speakers: Maxx Garrison (Director of Product, Lambda)
sessions.description: Learn how Lambda serves inference at scale and at the best costs in the market. We'll review inference engine architectures, NVIDIA GPU options, model optimization, and inference delivery methods such as NVIDIA NIM microservices.

sessions.title: A Distributed Inference Serving Framework for Reasoning LLM models
sessions.speakers: Tanmay Verma (Senior System Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Neelay Shah (Principal Software Architect, NVIDIA) | Harry Kim (Principal Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Ryan Olson (NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Denmark has made a huge investment in AI and partnered with NVIDIA to bring a supercomputer to Denmark
2. The new AI supercomputer powered by NVIDIA is a critical tool that is accelerating research in Denmark, including in healthcare, life sciences, energy, and quantum computing
sessions.description: This session will introduce an innovative NVIDIA AI inference serving framework designed to deploy reasoning large language models (LLMs) in multi-node environments. We’ll explore the key components and architecture of the server, highlighting how they enable seamless scaling within data centers and drive advanced inference optimization. Additionally, we’ll cover cutting-edge inference serving techniques, including disaggregated serving, which optimizes request handling by separating prefill and decode, increasing the number of inference requests served. Attendees will also learn how they will be able to quickly deploy this innovative serving framework using NVIDIA NIM.

sessions.title: AI for Safe and Efficient Trading in Electronic Markets
sessions.speakers: Iain Dunning (Head of AI Lab, Hudson River Trading)
sessions.points:
1. Building digital health agents deployable anywhere, for almost anything
2. Setting up drug discovery AI factories and the latest in biomolecular foundation models
sessions.description: The problem of designing a trading strategy has traditionally been deconstructed into first making predictions ("alpha"), and then desperately deciding on trading actions with those predictions as input. As we approach a decade from the release of AlphaGo, and with the surge of interest in planning and reasoning in the context of large language models, we describe some the problems and opportunities in creating a true end-to-end trading strategy using AI.

sessions.title: Advancing AI to Build the Most-Trusted Driver
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Drago Anguelov (VP, Head of Research, Waymo)
sessions.points:
1. Learn about the challenges and opportunities in creating a true end-to-end trading strategy using AI
2. Discover innovations in building end to end trading strategies from prediction to execution
sessions.description: We'll present some of Waymo's latest AI research, with a focus on expanding the capabilities of Waymo's autonomous vehicle stack, and those of the simulator that helps Waymo evaluate their performance and safety.

sessions.title: Physical AI for the Next Frontier of Industrial Digitalization
sessions.speakers: Deirdre Bosa (“TechCheck” Anchor, CNBC) | Christoph Berlin (VP, Engineering, Microsoft) | Jean-Claude Ercolanelli (Sr. Vice President, Simulation and Test Solutions, Siemens) | Wendy Tan White (CEO, Intrinsic) | Pras Velagapudi (CTO, Agility Robotics) | Rev Lebaredian (VP of Omniverse and Simulation Technology, NVIDIA) | Brand Cheng (Chairman and CEO, Fii (Foxconn Industrial Internet))
sessions.description: The world’s largest industries are racing to become software-defined, using the latest advancements in AI and simulation technologies to transform their enterprises. Hear from this panel of distinguished luminaries about their journeys to industrial digitalization. Learn how they're leveraging generative AI, open data frameworks, and advanced digital twins to unlock new possibilities across their organizations, from accelerated planning to a new era of agentic-AI powered autonomous operations.

sessions.title: Frontiers of AI and Computing: A Conversation With Yann LeCun and Bill Dally
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Industrial Digitalization / Digital Twin
sessions.speakers: Bill Dally (Chief Scientist and SVP of Research, NVIDIA) | Yann LeCun (Chief AI Scientist at Meta, Professor at New York University)
sessions.points:
1. How leaders across industries are leveraging AI and simulation to transform their operations
2. The role of open standards and data interoperability across the ecosystem
sessions.description:
As artificial intelligence continues to reshape the world, the intersection of deep learning and high performance computing becomes increasingly crucial. This talk brings together Yann LeCun, a pioneer in deep learning and the chief AI scientist at Meta, and Bill Dally, a leading computer architect and chief scientist at NVIDIA, to explore the future of AI models, hardware accelerators, and the evolving computational landscape.
The discussion will cover:
•	The next breakthroughs in deep learning and AI architectures
•	How hardware innovation drives AI efficiency and scalability
•	Challenges in training large-scale models and real-time AI inference

sessions.title: The Next Frontier of AI Supercomputing: Efficiency With Unprecedented Capability
sessions.speakers: Ian Buck (VP Hyperscale and HPC Computing, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Practical applications of AI agents, including capabilities such as routing and function calling — going beyond retrieval augmented generation
2. Strategies for ensuring AI reliability and trustworthiness
sessions.description: Groundbreaking hardware technologies and AI are unlocking unprecedented computational power. NVIDIA’s Ian Buck will highlight cutting-edge innovations that are revolutionizing high-performance computing while prioritizing energy conservation. Discover how these technologies are enabling industries and nations to achieve new insights. Join us to explore how supercomputing is not only advancing capabilities, but also paving the way for a greener, more efficient future in tech.

sessions.title: Digital and Physical AI Helps Write a New Chapter in Medicine
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Industrial Digitalization / Digital Twin
sessions.speakers: Kimberly Powell (VP, Healthcare and Life Sciences, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn invaluable insights into how digital twins and AI can deliver measurable results
2. How digital twins are shaping PepsiCo’s path toward sustainability and operational excellence
sessions.description: AI is revolutionizing healthcare by seamlessly integrating digital and physical technologies to address critical industry challenges. Digital AI agents now provide round-the-clock, individualized healthcare services, significantly reducing the administrative burden on medical teams. Concurrently, the convergence of AI and biology offers unprecedented insights into biological processes, enabling the exploration of vast therapeutic possibilities. In the physical realm, AI-powered medical devices and robotics enhance precision in diagnostics and treatments while optimizing operational efficiency. Domain-specific computing platforms are fostering a more responsive and patient-centric healthcare ecosystem. These advancements collectively promise to improve health outcomes on a global scale, marking a transformative chapter in medical history. Join Kimberly Powell, NVIDIA’s vice president of healthcare and life sciences, to explore how these advancements are reshaping the future of the industry.

sessions.title: Meta's Llama Ecosystem: Unlocking New Possibilities (Presented by Meta)
sessions.speakers: Chaya Nayak (Director of Product Management, Meta)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the principles of modular design and its role in creating flexible, scalable AI systems
2. Learn how advancements in AI algorithms dynamically influence hardware configurations to optimize performance for specific use cases
sessions.description: Join us as we dive into the world of Llama models, exploring their capabilities, developer tools, and exciting use cases. Discover how these innovative models are transforming industries and improving performance in real-world applications.

sessions.title: NVIDIA Nventure Showcase: AI Agents in Physical and Virtual Worlds
sessions.speakers: Justin Johnson (Co-founder, World Labs) | Jim Fan (Research Scientist, NVIDIA) | Eric Jang (VP of AI, 1x Technologies) | Misha Laskin (Co-founder & CEO, Reflection AI) | Saad Godil (Co-founder & Chief Technology Officer, Hippocratic) | Pete Florence (Co-founder & CEO, Generalist AI)
sessions.points:
1. NVIDIA 创新推出了 AI 网络 ，铺就 AI 计算网架构
2. AGI 时代下采用 AI 网络构建 AI 工厂和 AI 云的思考、见解和趋势
sessions.description: Join Jim Fan, Senior Research Manager & Lead of Generalist Embodied Agent Research at NVIDIA, as he presents a curated lineup of NVentures portfolio companies. Hear from each of the founders about how they're disrupting their respective industries and what's next for each in the era of AI Agents.

sessions.title: Accelerated Tabular Processing with Polars & RAPIDS
sessions.speakers: Matt Harrison (Python and Data Science Expert, Author, and Educator, MetaSnake) | William Hill (Developer Advocate, Data Science, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Write a simple Python client to Sensor RTX
2. Configure cameras and non-visual sensors, set simulation state, and request renders and receive and interpret the generated data
sessions.description:
As data workloads grow in scale and complexity, achieving optimal performance is critical for data engineers and scientists. Polars, a high-performance DataFrame library written in Rust, is already known for its speed and efficiency. This talk explores how to take Polars a step further by integrating NVIDIA RAPIDS for GPU-accelerated data processing — using your preexisting code. 

Learn practical strategies for seamlessly incorporating NVIDIA RAPIDS into existing Polars workflows. We'll cover leveraging GPU-enabled backends, optimizing data transfer between CPU and GPU, and accelerating key operations such as filtering, aggregations, and joins. By harnessing CUDA, you'll unlock significant performance improvements with minimal code changes. Gain actionable insights to enhance Polars workflows with GPU acceleration, as well as the tools and knowledge to supercharge your pipelines while preserving your existing codebase.

sessions.title: How to Build an Agentic AI System Using the Best Tools and Frameworks
sessions.speakers: Kris Murphy (Technical Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Bartley Richardson (Director of Engineering, NVIDIA)
sessions.description: AI agents are the new digital workforce, working for and with us. They can reason about a mission, create a plan, and retrieve data or use tools to generate a quality response. Data is the fuel for AI agents, but the magnitude and scale of enterprise data often make it too expensive and time-consuming to leverage effectively. For enterprises to thrive in the AI era, they must find a way to make use of all of their data. Join this session to learn about tools and frameworks to more easily build agentic AI systems that connectAI agents to a library of reusable tools that unlock your data, and drive efficiency gains across the organization.

sessions.title: What's CUDA All About Anyway?
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Training AI Models
sessions.speakers: Rob Armstrong (CUDA Technical PM Lead, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. 基于 torch，支持千亿参数、100 GFLOP/example甚至更大计算量的稀疏大模型的多机多卡分布式训练。在保持 torch 易用性的同时，又能达到和 tensorflow 同样的高性能
2. 开发了一个基于 TensorRT 的高性能推理引擎，结合量化、算子融合等技术，支持稀疏大模型低延迟、高吞吐的在线 serving
sessions.description: Discover the full power of CUDA beyond just writing kernels! We'll unlock the entire ecosystem of tools, libraries, and SDKs that make GPU-accelerated computing faster, easier, and more powerful than ever. This is a comprehensive tour of the CUDA landscape, showing how all the pieces fit together to solve real-world challenges. Whether you're just getting started or have been using CUDA for years, you’ll gain a fresh, up-to-date understanding of the latest tools and best practices to keep you at the cutting edge of CUDA development.

sessions.title: Direct Liquid Cooling for AI Systems: Design Requirements from the Processor to the Data Center (Presented by CoolIT Systems)
sessions.speakers: Neil Mulji (VP of Product, CoolIT Systems)
sessions.points:
1. Future architectures for edge AI LLM inference will be distributed and multi-modal
2. These architectures will centralize core FM/LLM functions, with some functions distributed at the edge
sessions.description: We'll explore the performance requirements and key features of liquid-cooled products and infrastructure (coldplates, manifolds, piping networks, and coolant distribution units) needed to support current and next-generation NVIDIA AI processors and MGX NVL platforms. We'll discuss how data center operators can future-proof their facility infrastructure to accommodate NVIDIA’s expanding liquid-cooled portfolio and avoid obsolescence.

sessions.title: AI-Powered Robotics: Forging the Future of Intelligent Automation
sessions.speakers: Madison Huang (Director of Product and Technical Marketing, Physical AI Platforms, NVIDIA) | Johnny Chen (Executive Chairman and President, Solomon) | Etienne Lacroix (Founder and CEO, Vention) | Amir Bousani (Co-Founder and CEO, RGo Robotics) | James Davidson (Chief AI Officer, Teradyne) | Dr. Eugen Solowjow (Head of Research Group - Robotics AI, Siemens)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how to compile your application optimally for the NVIDIA Grace CPU
2. Discover which performance libraries can help to improve your application performance on NVIDIA Grace CPUs
sessions.description:
Attend this lightning talk session to gain a comprehensive understanding of the current state of AI-enabled robotics and automation, as well as a glimpse into the future of smart manufacturing.

As we enter a new era of industrial automation, the integration of artificial intelligence, advanced robotics, and smart manufacturing technologies is revolutionizing the production landscape. This session brings together industry leaders to explore the cutting-edge developments at the intersection of AI, robotics, and industrial automation. 

Experts will discuss the integration of AI into autonomous mobile robots (AMRs) and industrial robot arms, and the development of more intuitive robotic systems. They will share how their companies are leveraging AI technologies to enhance robotic capabilities, improve autonomous systems, and optimize manufacturing processes.

sessions.title: Revolutionizing Mobility through Edge AI: Train as a Robot
sessions.speakers: Nadia Mazzino (Senior Director, Control Center Integration & Advanced Services, Hitachi Rail) | Stefanie Grois (Sr. Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Roslyn Stuart (Vice President, Synergy Creation, Green Energy & Mobility, Hitachi Digital)
sessions.points:
1. The challenges in complying with the evolving regulation and standardization environment, and NVIDIA’s solutions
2. The impact of AI in regulation and standardization
sessions.description:
AI at the edge is reshaping human interaction with the physical world. With real-time data processing using advanced AI algorithms, edge AI is driving smarter decision-making, reducing operational costs, and improving experiences across various industrial sectors. This session does a deep dive on how the convergence of AI and edge computing is unlocking new possibilities in the railway industry.

The session details a groundbreaking use case in the rail industry: Hitachi Rail’s HMAX (Hyper Mobility Asset eXpert), accelerated by NVIDIA’s enterprise-grade IGX platform. HMAX technology improves maintenance and energy efficiency by optimizing trains, signaling, and infrastructure, promising to turn traditional rail systems into intelligent ecosystems. 

NVIDIA IGX platform's advanced sensor processing is fully integrated into existing railway systems, empowering transport operators with real-time actionable insights, replacing the delays of legacy data systems. By enabling predictive maintenance, improving operational efficiency, and supporting smarter decision-making, these technologies streamline railway performance while enhancing reliability.

Join us to discover how AI-powered edge solutions are driving a paradigm shift in transportation and learn how Hitachi is collaborating with NVIDIA:

sessions.title: CUDA Techniques to Maximize Concurrency and System Utilization
sessions.speakers: Myrto Papadopoulou (Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Igor Terentyev (Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Reduce operating and financial risk in your data center by lowering your loss footprint
2. Build ultra-high-density data centers
sessions.description:
Do you want to increase the concurrency of GPU work in your application? In this tutorial, we will primarily focus beyond individual kernels to show you how to improve concurrency and system utilization for your CUDA applications.
You will learn how to hide launch latencies, improve load balancing, handle concurrency and synchronization, and optimize resource management and data movement.

sessions.title: Short-range, Deep-learning-based Probabilistic Forecasts of Heavy Precipitation: A Collaboration Between The Weather Company and NVIDIA
sessions.speakers: Thomas Hamill (Head of Innovation Science, The Weather Company)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how RAG + LAB-tuned small language models can outperform the incumbent technique while achieving significant cost reduction
2. Explore how fine-tuned smaller language models with customer-specific datasets, combined with a leaner RAG, deliver more accurate results at lower cost than applying RAG on a large language model
sessions.description:
Despite many decades of staff and supercomputer time devoted to developing conventional numerical weather prediction (NWP) systems, accurately predicting surface precipitation amounts remains one of the most challenging problems in weather prediction. In part, this is because of the substantial bias of precipitation forecasts in conventional models, and also because precipitation exhibits variability on scales of a kilometer, with the precipitation often produced by local events such as thunderstorms
whose positions cannot be specified with precision. Potentially, with a large ensemble, one could better understand and quantify the likelihood of heavy precipitation, which has some modulation from large-scale weather patterns. Unfortunately, given the computational expense of conventional high-resolution NWP systems, a large ensemble of forecasts from these systems is intractable.

sessions.title: Accelerating Physics Using Quantum Computing and Synergies With Machine Learning (Presented by Ansys)
sessions.speakers: Jay Pathak (Sr. Director, Research & Development, Ansys, Inc.) | Prith Banerjee (Chief Technology Officer, Ansys)
sessions.points:
1. A better understanding of AI agents — what's available now, and what innovations are coming in the near future
2. The skills and information you need to begin your AI agent journey in a cloud environment
sessions.description: As the frontiers of computational physics evolve, the convergence of quantum computing and machine learning offers unparalleled opportunities to tackle long-standing challenges in simulation and optimization. We'll present Ansys' work using CUDA-Q to integrate these cutting-edge technologies to accelerate physics-based computations and enhance the efficiency of complex engineering tasks. By leveraging quantum algorithms applied to large matrix operations, we are researching how to accelerate linear and nonlinear partial differential equations.

sessions.title: Accelerating End-to-End CAE Workflows: Cloud-Native and On-Premises
sessions.speakers: John Linford (Principal Technical Product Manager, Datacenter CPU Software, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Quantum computing is the next technological disruption after AI/ML
2. The future is in combining quantum and artificial intelligence
sessions.description:
Computer-aided engineering(CAE) is used to study behavior of mechanical systems, electrical systems, fluid dynamics, thermodynamics, and more. CAE is used by a variety of industries such as aerospace, automotive, electrical engineering, and architecture to model, simulate, and optimize the performance of technologies ranging from data centers to aircraft to handheld electronics before they are physically built.  

Explore NVIDIA’s new platform that accelerates the entire CAE workflow and facilitates the creation of cloud-native CAE solutions. We'll highlight the ecosystem partners we're working with for accelerating the CAE workflow. We'll introduce NVIDIA’s portfolio of technologies for CAE workflow acceleration — CUDA-X, Omniverse, Modulus, Warp, etc.

sessions.title: The Future of Training in the Era of Agentic, Physical, and Sustainable AI (Presented by HPE)
sessions.speakers: Trish Damkroger (SVP and GM, HPC & AI Infrastructure Solutions, Hewlett Packard Enterprise)
sessions.points:
1. Learn why AI is becoming a key player in corporate decision-making
2. Understand why better decisions aren’t enough – organizations need better choices
sessions.description: The world’s largest companies and research centers are evolving to agentic and physical AI to advance their innovations and make breakthroughs. The growth of training sizes requires specialized solutions to efficiently support strong scaling and compute-intensive workloads. Learn how you can outpace the competition with AI-capable HPC solutions to drive discovery and streamline resources to make decisions faster — from accelerating time-to-market for new drugs and vehicles to advancing renewable energy initiatives.

sessions.title: Guardrails for AV Safety Across the Product Life Cycle
sessions.speakers: Wei Luo (VP of Automotive, NVIDIA) | Ed Schmerling (Sr. Research Scientist, NVIDIA) | Apoorva Sharma (Research Scientist, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Gen AI-led service transformation across software development life cycle
2. Enhancing efficiency across IT and business operations with Gen AI
sessions.description: This session will continue the presentation of NVIDIA’s framework for autonomous vehicle (AV) safety, with a focus on deployment-time and validation-time safety guardrails. From runtime monitoring to scenario generation for stress testing, we'll cover the many elements needed to assure safety of AI-based, end-to-end AV stacks.

sessions.title: Optimize the Future of Ads with MoE Models
sessions.speakers: Tris Warkentin (Sr. Director of Research and Product for Gemma, Google Deepmind)
sessions.points:
1. Discover strategies to reduce capital expenditure by leveraging GPU cloud infrastructure instead of costly physical hardware investments
2. Understand how dynamic scaling ensures cost-efficiency and optimal performance for AI workloads of all sizes
sessions.description: Learn how cutting-edge mixture-of-experts (MoE) models from Google Deepmind are applied to solve problems in search and advertising use cases. We'll walk through how these models are developed and optimized for best performance on NVIDIA GPUs, using the NeMo Framework and TRT LLM. Learn how you can download these OSS Gemma models and apply them to similar problems in your business.

sessions.title: Developing Solutions for and With BlueField-3: A Network Telemetry for AI Clusters Case Study (Presented by Arista)
sessions.speakers: Simon Capper (Software Engineer, Arista Networks)
sessions.description: Learn about the ability to build integrated solutions that leverage telemetry from the BlueField-3 SuperNIC and correlate it with other datasets. As an example, we'll showcase an agent that unifies configuration and correlates real-time telemetry from various network elements, such as switches in AI clusters. This extensibility can enable rapid identification and notification of hardware and software failures across the entire cluster.

sessions.title: Earn your RAG-ing rights: Learn how to Power Smarter AI with Object Store and NVIDIA NIMs (Presented by MiniIO)
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Climate / Weather / Ocean Modeling
sessions.speakers: Dileeshvar Radhakrishnan (Engineer, MinIO)
sessions.points:
1. Insights into leveraging AI and climate science to align business goals with sustainability initiatives
2. Emerging funding models and investment strategies for scaling climate innovation
sessions.description: Vector databases are essential for retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) applications. Learn how to architect vector database infrastructure to improve throughput and scalability using NVIDIA GPUs and object storage.

sessions.title: Leading the Future: Governors on AI Partnerships and Workforce Transformation
sessions.speakers: Gretchen Whitmer (Governor, Michigan) | Tate Reeves (Governor, Mississippi)
sessions.points:
1. Build and expose custom tools for an AI agent to utilize
2. Configure agentic workflows to utilize multiple tools
sessions.description: Artificial intelligence is revolutionizing how we work, learn, and grow, providing unprecedented opportunities to transform communities and economies globally. This panel convenes governors from forward-thinking states and nations collaborating with NVIDIA to harness AI's potential for economic development, workforce enablement, and societal impact. Discover how these partnerships are integrating AI into education, establishing innovation hubs, and constructing inclusive, future-ready ecosystems.

sessions.title: No Memory Left Behind: How CXL Unlocks the Full Potential of AI (Presented by Astera Labs)
sessions.speakers: Ahmed Medhioub (Sr. Product Manager, Astera Labs)
sessions.points:
1. Showcase NVenture Portfolio companies
2. Thought leadership from NVIDIA on top investment themes
sessions.description: Explore how CXL technology overcomes memory bottlenecks in AI infrastructure. As AI models grow larger and more complex, the demand for scalable memory capacity has outpaced traditional solutions. Learn how CXL can boost performance for AI inferencing with dynamic resource sharing and efficient scaling.

sessions.title: From NIM to Blackwell: Effectively Drive all of Your Data to all of Your AI Projects (Presented by NetApp)
sessions.speakers: Ingo Fuchs (Sr. Director, Solutions Marketing, NetApp)
sessions.description: From department-specific inferencing for Gen AI tools to machine learning projects in the cloud and all the way to powerful AI factories, a hybrid data management strategy feeds AI infrastructure with data, no matter where it lives. Discover how the combination of intelligent data services, an AI data engine, and infrastructure designed for AI first, can deliver an end-to-end data foundation for AI today — and tomorrow.

sessions.title: How to Use NVIDIA Omniverse™ on Smart Factory Design: The Fii Omniverse Digital Twin Project on NVIDIA GB200 Grace™ Blackwell Superchip Production Line (Presented by Foxconn)
sessions.speakers: Leo Guo (GM, Fii (Foxconn Industrial Internet))
sessions.points:
1. Understand how to integrate NVIDIA Isaac Lab, Apple Vision Pro, and MimicGen NIM microservice to enhance robot learning through advanced simulation and synthetic data generation
2. Learn to capture teleoperated demonstrations using Apple Vision Pro and simulate these recordings in NVIDIA Isaac Sim to create synthetic datasets for accelerated robot training
sessions.description:
Digital twin evolution represents the progressive development and implementation of digital twins, beginning from simple geometric representations to comprehensive enterprise-wide systems. This evolution reflects the increasing complexity and integration of technologies such as the industrial internet of things, AI, and enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems to enhance operational efficiency, streamline production, and improve decision-making.

Key Benefits:
•	Enhanced Collaboration: Real-time updates and collaborative capabilities via platforms like Omniverse empower teams globally.
•	Improved Operational Efficiency: From visualizing machine layouts to conducting full factory simulations, these phases optimize workflows and reduce downtime.
•	Scalability: A modular and centralized approach ensures that the system can grow and adapt to new challenges and requirements.
•	Informed Decision-Making: By integrating real-time data and ERP systems, the enterprise twin enables data-driven decisions that enhance productivity and profitability.

sessions.title: LLM Pruning and Distillation in Practice: The Minitron Approach
sessions.speakers: Saurav Muralidharan (Sr. Research Scientist, NVIDIA) | Sharath Turuvekere Sreenivas (Sr. Deep Learning Algorithms Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how NVIDIA AI Enterprise with NIM integrates with Nutanix Enterprise AI using a simple point-and-click interface
2. Discover the elegant control of role-based access controls for AI models (LLMs) deployed with NVIDIA NIM
sessions.description: We'll ive deep into the Minitron approach for producing compact language models via structured pruning and knowledge distillation. We'll describe how we apply this approach to compress LLMs in the Nemotron-4, Llama 3.1, and Mistral-NeMo families by 2-4X, achieving state-of-the-art accuracy while using orders of magnitude fewer training tokens compared to training from scratch.

sessions.title: Maximize GPU Utilization With Dynamic GPU Allocation (Presented by Ori Industries)
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Large Language Models (LLMs)
sessions.speakers: Scott Collins (Field CTO, Ori)
sessions.points:
1. Learn about the latest advancements in Llama models, including new features, capabilities, and use cases.
2. Explore the growing Llama ecosystem, including developer tools, libraries, and frameworks that make it easy to integrate Llama into your projects.
sessions.description: Discover how dynamic GPU allocation drives efficient infrastructure utilization, optimizing use of resources from training to inference. Learn some practical strategies to maximize GPU utilization, enabling faster innovation and smarter infrastructure management.

sessions.title: Revolutionize Automotive Marketing with Generative AI and Apple Vision Pro
sessions.speakers: Mario Viviani (Manager of Developer Relations, Omniverse, NVIDIA) | Damian Fulmer (Director of Workflow and Technology, Katana)
sessions.points:
1. Ushering in an era of “trains as a robot”. This particular in-train solution has reduced Hitachi Rail’s fault-detection time from 10 days to 10 milliseconds, giving them enormous operational agility and efficiency.
2. How we developed a neural architecture search to develop AI that can detect rare and developed a digital twin in omniverse to detect critical events, such as overhead defects, that are typically underrepresented even in petabytes of video data gathered over time.
sessions.description: Join Damian Fulmer, Director of Workflow and Technology at Katana, and Mario Viviani, Senior Developer Relations Manager at NVIDIA, for an in-depth presentation on how Katana is transforming marketing asset creation with NVIDIA Omniverse. This session will showcase Katana’s innovative COATcreate tool, powered by Omniverse, and its role in streamlining content creation for industry leaders like Nissan. Discover why Nissan embraced this technology by migrating to OpenUSD and how it has redefined their digital workflows. The presentation will also explore Katana’s integration of Extended Reality (XR) with Apple Vision Pro and the transformative impact of Generative AI on the future of automotive marketing and design.

sessions.title: Safety Regulation and Standardization in the Era of AI-Based AVs
sessions.speakers: Riccardo Mariani (VP Safety, NVIDIA) | Tina Kirschner (Manager Regulatory Affairs, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. How to use vision language models to improve retail catalog management and search
2. How to deploy vision language models at scale
sessions.description: This session will elaborate NVIDIA’s strategy for compliance with safety regulations and international standards, including the implications related to the use of AI-based, end-to-end autonomous vehicle (AV) stacks. Learn how ecosystem partners can benefit from this strategy.

sessions.title: The Anti-Portfolio: VCs Share the Startups that Got Away
sessions.speakers: Bryan Hale (Investor, Anthos Capital) | Eleanor Haglund (Manager, VC Alliance, NVIDIA) | Lauren Reeder (Partner, Sequoia Capital) | Navin Chaddha (Managing Partner, Mayfield) | Collin Wallace (General Partner, Lobby Capital)
sessions.points:
1. Advanced AI training requirements and how to manage them
2. Faster results require faster, more optimized computing
sessions.description: Join Eleanor Haglund, Manager of the VC Alliance at NVIDIA, along with a panel of leading VCs, as they explore the challenges even the most seasoned investors face. Hear firsthand from investors about the key insights and valuable lessons they've gained from deals they passed on, how those experiences have shaped their strategies moving forward, and what startups can do differently to get the coveted term sheet from the investor of their dreams.

sessions.title: Transform Data Center Architecture With Micron’s AI Memory and Storage Portfolio (Presented by Micron Technology)
sessions.speakers: Praveen Vaidyanathan (VP and General Manager, Compute Products Group, Micron Technology)
sessions.points:
1. Understand what multimodal generative AI is
2. Know how content generation with diffusion works
sessions.description: For AI to deliver insights, decisions, and innovations, it needs a vast amount of data. Data are fueling the AI revolution. And all of these data must be stored, analyzed, and processed across diverse infrastructures, from edge to cloud. We'll highlight the progress Micron has enabled by collaborating with NVIDIA to address the pivotal role that memory and storage play in transforming the data center architecture. From HBM3E to GDS, advanced memory and storage technologies enable faster and more power-efficient ingestion, processing, and analysis of vast data volumes. We'll delve into how advancements in technologies such as HBM3E, high-capacity DDR5 DIMMs, and PCIe Gen5 SSDs are not only enhancing AI's capabilities, but also paving the way for more sustainable, energy-efficient data centers. Join us as we explore the interconnected realms of data, storage, memory, computing, and AI algorithms, and how they seamlessly integrate into our lives to enrich our future.

sessions.title: Turn Text into Video: Explore Animated Content Creation with Multimodal Gen AI and NVIDIA NeMo Framework
sessions.speakers: Ekaterina Sirazitdinova (Senior Data Scientist, NVIDIA) | Oleg Sudakov (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand how NVIDIA-Certified Systems are meticulously configured according to design best practices, ensuring optimal performance and scalability. With over 400 systems certified in collaboration with 30 different partners, NVIDIA ensures top-tier performance on real-world applications
2. Discover how NVIDIA-Certified Systems undergo a comprehensive suite of functional, security, and performance tests, including single-GPU, multi-GPU, and multi-node evaluations. These systems support leading IT management frameworks, empowering enterprises to confidently deploy accelerated platforms to power their modern applications
sessions.description: This training explores the principles behind multimodal generative AI, focusing on text-to-video diffusion models and their practical applications. We will begin by defining multimodal generative AI and examining the core mechanisms of text-to-video synthesis. Participants will learn how input descriptions influence video quality and how guardrails—both pre-generation (Pre-Guard) and post-generation (Post-Guard)—help ensure safe and responsible content creation.We will break down the process of converting text into numerical representations for diffusion models, encoding video into a latent space for efficient processing, and decoding it back into high-quality outputs. Additionally, we will explore methods to extend generated videos using video-to-video models.Attendees will gain insights into building an interactive text-to-video generation pipeline using Gradio, leveraging multi-GPU processing, and optimizing performance with NVIDIA NeMo Framework for faster video generation. While live model training won’t be conducted due to resource constraints, participants will leave with a strong foundational understanding and practical tools to experiment with text-to-video AI models.Prerequisite(s):Programming skills, Python, and knowledge of AI fundamentals.

sessions.title: Unlock the Power of NVIDIA Certified Systems: Live Q&A With Experts
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Image / Video Detection & Recognition
sessions.speakers: Tiffany Xie (Product Manager - NVIDIA-Certified Systems, NVIDIA) | Annie Chen (Product Manager - NVIDIA Certified Systems, NVIDIA) | Steve Stein (Sr. Product Marketing Manager, Data Center Platforms, NVIDIA) | Greg Crider (Director, NVIDIA-Certified Systems, NVIDIA) | Satheesh Iyer (Product Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.description: Engage directly with NVIDIA specialists in an informal "Connect With Experts" session to learn about the NVIDIA-Certified Systems program. This unique opportunity allows you to ask questions, get insights, and gain a deeper understanding of how NVIDIA-Certified Systems validate optimal performance for a wide range of real-world applications. Ideal for IT professionals, AI system architects, and anyone interested in leveraging NVIDIA's cutting-edge technologies to deploy AI in the enterprise, this session offers invaluable insights and expert advice. Don’t miss this chance to connect with experts and enhance your knowledge of NVIDIA-Certified Systems!!

sessions.title: How PepsiCo is Revolutionizing Manufacturing and Supply Chain with Digital Twins
sessions.speakers: Azita Martin (VP and GM, AI for Retail and CPG, NVIDIA) | Athina Kanioura (EVP, Chief Strategy and Transformation Officer, PepsiCo)
sessions.points:
1. There are several challenges with developing agentic AI systems: Connecting the many AI agent frameworks and orchestration tools that currently exist, Evaluation and benchmarking of agentic AI systems,  Telemetry and logging are important for complex agentic AI workflows or production environments Achieving the best performance requires system-level accelerations which can be implemented only with knowledge of the entire system
2. Learn about technologies that will help with building full-stack accelerated agentic AI systems that accelerate developer velocity and provide built-in interoperability to choose from the best available frameworks for your task.
sessions.description:
In today’s fast-paced consumer packaged goods (CPG) industry, PepsiCo is leading the way in digital transformation by harnessing the power of AI and digital twins. Join this fireside chat featuring PepsiCo’s executive vice president and chief strategy and transformation officer, and NVIDIA’s general manager of AI for retail and CPG, as we explore how AI-driven solutions are improving efficiency, productivity, and resiliency across manufacturing and supply chain operations.

Learn how PepsiCo leverages NVIDIA's cutting-edge platforms, including Omniverse and AI technologies, to simulate, optimize, and automate workflows — transforming operations from planning to production. Discover the strategic vision behind the PepsiCo-NVIDIA partnership and how it holds the potential to revolutionize the CPG industry.

sessions.title: How to Run and Optimize Your Workloads on the NVIDIA Grace CPU
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Industrial Digitalization / Digital Twin
sessions.speakers: Lukas Krenz (Sr. Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Mathias Wagner (Sr. Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Andrea Miele (Senior CPU Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Holly Wilper (Manager, System Software Tools, NVIDIA) | Anastasia Stulova (HPC Compiler Programming Models Architect, NVIDIA) | Hans Mortensen (Grace Product Specialist – NVIDIA Solutions Architecture, NVIDIA) | Jason Tichy (Grace Product Specialist – NVIDIA Solution Architecture, NVIDIA) | Diana Aung (Senior Software Product Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Phase 1: Geometric Twin. Digital representation with 3D blocks for machine layout
2. Phase 2: Active Asset Twin. Continuous data streaming pipeline to Omniverse
sessions.description: Grace, NVIDIA’s first CPU for the data center, packs 72 high-performance Armv9 cores on a single die and integrates LPDDR5 memory for up to 500GB/s of memory bandwidth. Whether paired with NVIDIA’s best-in-class data center GPUs or combined with a second Grace CPU in the Grace Superchip, it delivers exceptional performance. It's designed for HPC and hyperscale data center deployments where absolute performance, energy efficiency, and density matter. In this interactive session, our experts will answer any questions you may have about fully unlocking the potential of the Grace CPU. We welcome anyone interested in evaluating and deploying NVIDIA Grace-based solutions in their data center. You should understand the basics of CPU programming and are encouraged to bring application-specific questions and general questions about the Arm software ecosystem.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Field Notes on Scaling Real-Time AI-Native Applications in Production (Presented by Baseten)
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Philip Kiely (Head of Developer Relations, Baseten Labs, Inc.)
sessions.points:
1. Thought leadership from a VCA member on going to market with startups
2. Promote venture capital to startup connections
sessions.description: Today’s AI models power a new class of real-time generative applications, but these near-magical user experiences can stumble when faced with the market’s overwhelming demand for these tools. Drawing from years of experience in scaling mission-critical production workloads for AI-native startups and enterprises, we'll outline the most important — and often overlooked — considerations for building robust AI model-serving infrastructure.

sessions.title: The New Role of AI in Electric Vehicles
sessions.speakers: RJ Scaringe (Founder and CEO, Rivian) | Rishi Dhall (VP, Automotive Business, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Adoption and performance of the accelerated platform by commercial independent software vendors
2. Insights into how accelerated computing drives energy efficiency into data centers
sessions.description:
Join RJ Scaringe, CEO of Rivian, for a fireside chat with Rishi Dhall, VP of automotive business at NVIDIA, where he'll discuss the groundbreaking innovations shaping the future of electric vehicles (EVs) and the role of cutting-edge technologies in Rivian's vision. RJ will share insights into how Rivian is leveraging artificial intelligence, autonomous driving, and advanced computing to create sustainable transportation solutions that push the boundaries of performance, safety, and environmental impact. This conversation will explore the intersection of EV development with the latest advancements in AI and GPU-powered technology, underscoring how these tools are revolutionizing the automotive industry.

This is a must-attend session for anyone interested in the future of mobility and the technologies driving its transformation.

sessions.title: Accelerate Data Analytics on GPUs With the RAPIDS Accelerator for Apache Spark
sessions.speakers: Ahmed Hussein (Sr. System Engineer, Apache Spark, NVIDIA) | Lee Yang (Sr. Principal Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Matt Ahrens (Director of Engineering, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Introduction to GPU-Accelerated Polars: Learn how NVIDIA RAPIDS can be integrated into Polars to significantly boost performance for large-scale data processing tasks
2. Minimal Code Changes: Discover strategies to enhance Polars workflows with GPU acceleration while keeping existing codebases intact
sessions.description: The RAPIDS Accelerator for Apache Spark leverages the distributed big data processing framework of Spark along with the power of GPUs to greatly speed up ETL and analytics workloads while reducing cost. In this training lab, we'll walk through the RAPIDS Accelerator for Apache Spark, including running SQL queries on CPU and GPU in Spark and also diving into the toolset that helps enable success with the RAPIDS Accelerator for Apache Spark.Prerequisite(s):An understanding of large-scale analytics and Apache Spark is not required, but would be helpful.

sessions.title: Building Custom Reasoning Models to Achieve Advanced Agentic AI Autonomy
sessions.speakers: Wenwen Gao (Lead Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Shyamala Prayaga (NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Discover our reference architectures for AI agents and data flywheels
2. Learn when and how to integrate agents into enterprise AI workflows
sessions.description:
Empowering AI agents with advanced reasoning capabilities is essential for developing truly intelligent autonomous systems. By systematically deconstructing complex problems into logical reasoning pathways, AI agents can perform complex tasks and enhance decision-making to emulate human-like reasoning. Whether you're developing solutions in healthcare, finance, customer support, or supply chain, this session will demonstrate how to leverage the NVIDIA NeMo framework to develop models for AI agents with enterprise-grade reasoning capabilities.

In this talk we will cover how you can build or customize your reasoning models using various techniques including distillation and reinforcement learning from open-source models like DeepSeek-R1, Llama, and Nemotron using NVIDIA NeMo and OpenRLHF, elevating your AI agents to think and act autonomously with enhanced reasoning.

In this talk we will cover how you can build or customize your reasoning models using various techniques including distillation and reinforcement learning from open-source models like DeepSeek-R1, Llama, and Nemotron using NVIDIA NeMo and OpenRLHF, elevating your AI agents to think and act autonomously with enhanced reasoning.

sessions.title: Build Lightning-Fast Data Science Pipelines in Industry With Accelerated Computing
sessions.speakers: Nick Becker (Sr. Technical Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Qichao Hu (Chief Executive Officer, SES AI) | Dhivyaa Thayalan (AI Products and Partnerships Lead, Commonwealth Bank of Australia (CBA))
sessions.points:
1. Easy-to-Use, Scalable, and Modular Solutions: Discover how NVIDIA NeMo microservices provide a scalable, efficient, and modular framework for enterprises to build data flywheels, enabling rapid adaptation to new data and evolving business needs
2. Customization and Continuous Improvement: Understand how these microservices facilitate the customization of generative AI models and support ongoing performance evaluation, ensuring that models remain relevant and effective over time
sessions.description: In this set of lightning talks, leading data science practitioners across industries will share their journey with practical tips for adopting accelerated computing. Learn how data scientists are using new zero-code change interfaces for accelerated libraries within AI and ML pipelines to improve productivity and cut costs.

sessions.title: Build Generative AI With NVIDIA NeMo
sessions.speakers: Chris Alexiuk (Deep Learning Developer Advocate, NVIDIA) | Shashank Verma (Sr. Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA) | Aditi Bodhankar (Developer Advocate Engineer, NVIDIA) | Nirmal Kumar Juluru (Product Marketing Manager, NVIDIA) | Vinh Nguyen (Data Scientist, DL Engineer, NVIDIA) | Sergio Perez (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Meriem Bendris (Sr. Deep Learning Data Scientist, NVIDIA) | Miguel Martinez (Sr. Deep Learning Data Scientist, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Generative AI offers enhanced scenario generation by learning and sampling data distributions for realistic market modeling
2. Integrating LLMs creates a natural language interface, making data exploration more intuitive and less tedious
sessions.description:
Connect with NVIDIA experts to answer your generative AI model development and deployment questions. Whether you're just beginning your journey into generative AI or you're a seasoned professional, our specialists are here to guide you through every step of building generative AI models.

We can discuss a wide range of topics, such as model architectures, dataset requirements, parallelism techniques, optimizations, advanced customization and evaluation methods. Additionally, learn how to add guardrails to orchestrate dialog management, ensuring accuracy, appropriateness, and security in your applications.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: CUDA on Microsoft Windows and WSL
sessions.speakers: Raphael Boissel (Principal Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Mike Delorme (Sr. Manager, CUDA Software Engineering, NVIDIA) | Vishnuswaroop Ramesh (Senior System Software Engineer, CUDA Driver, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how to better leverage CUDA features, such as streams and graphs, to increase concurrency and improve performance.
2. Discover the new Cluster Launch Control feature to reduce compute overhead and improve load balancing.
sessions.description: Join this session to discuss any topic related to CUDA support for MS Windows and WSL (Windows Subsystem for Linux). We can answer questions about everything from Windows integration and configuration best practices to developer-focused CUDA APIs to help you get the best performance on Windows and from next-gen Grace Hopper and Grace Blackwell systems.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: The Impact of AI on Filmmaking: Real-World Transformation
sessions.speakers: Ed Ulbrich (Chief Content Officer and President of Production, Metaphysic)
sessions.points:
1. Understand what Apache Spark is and how it is used
2. Understand how the RAPIDS Accelerator for Apache Spark integrates with Spark and leverages GPUs
sessions.description: Dive into the transformative power of AI across the entire filmmaking spectrum. We'll showcase groundbreaking examples from blockbuster movies and record-breaking music videos, demonstrating AI's impact beyond visual effects. Discover how AI technology empowers directors with unprecedented real-time control over character expressions and movements on set. Explore a future where AI amplifies human artistry, democratizes high-end production techniques, and redefines the boundaries of cinematic storytelling.

sessions.title: AI Meets Healthcare and Life Sciences: A VC Perspective on Innovation and Challenges
sessions.speakers: Renee Yao (Ecosystem Business Development, HCLS (Startups and Consulting Partners), NVIDIA) | Vijay Pande (General Partner, Andreesen Horowitz) | Lu Zhang (Founder and Managing Partner, Fusion Fund) | Scott Barclay (Managing Director, Insight Partners) | Tess Van Stekelenburg (Science Partner, Lux Capital)
sessions.points:
1. The integration of advanced AI, including technologies like NVIDIA's Isaac platform, is enabling unprecedented levels of autonomy in robotics. This is leading to more intelligent, versatile, and efficient robotic systems across various industries, from manufacturing to healthcare
2. There's a growing trend toward making advanced robotics more accessible to businesses of all sizes. Companies are developing user-friendly platforms and AI-powered solutions that simplify programming and deployment, potentially opening up new markets for robotics technology, particularly among small and medium-sized enterprises
sessions.description: Join leading healthcare and life science venture capitalists (VCs) as they explore the transformative role of AI in life sciences and healthcare innovation. This high-level discussion will delve into emerging trends, cutting-edge technologies, and the complexities of scaling groundbreaking ideas. An invaluable session for entrepreneurs, investors, and industry leaders, it offers forward-looking insights on creating impactful, science-driven ventures.

sessions.title: Defining the Accelerated Quantum Supercomputer
sessions.speakers: Sam Stanwyck (Group Product Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. How to extend and integrate with the BlueField3/ConnectX NICs
2. How to achieve a single pane of glass across AI network telemetry and configuration
sessions.description: Quantum computing has the potential to offer giant leaps in computational capabilities, impacting a huge range of industries, from drug discovery to portfolio optimization. Realizing these benefits requires pushing the boundaries of quantum information science in developing algorithms, researching more-capable quantum processors, and creating tightly integrated quantum-classical systems and tools. We'll review these challenges, offer insight into how AI supercomputing will enable quantum advantage, and discuss the latest developments in software and systems for tightly integrated quantum-classical computing.

sessions.title: Accelerate Physical AI Development Workflows with Omniverse Cloud Sensor RTX
sessions.speakers: Justine Lin (Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA) | Daniel Lindsey (NVIDIA Omniverse Product Manager for Sensor RTX, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Quantum computing is hybrid
2. Customer needs are evolving quickly
sessions.description: This hands-on lab introduces developers to NVIDIA Omniverse Cloud Sensor RTX, a set of APIs and microservices for physically accurate sensor simulation. Ideal for robotics engineers, autonomous vehicle developers, and AI specialists, this lab offers practical experience in leveraging the Sensor RTX APIs to accelerate the creation and testing of autonomous systems.Prerequisite(s):Experience with 3D software, Python and APIs.

sessions.title: Build a Strategic Foundation for Enterprise Gen AI
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Programming Languages / Compilers
sessions.speakers: Charlie Boyle (VP, DGX Systems, NVIDIA) | Panagiotis Korfiatis (Ph.D., AI Scientist, Mayo Clinic) | Marie J. Kostecki (Senior Service Owner for Data/HPC, Mayo Clinic)
sessions.points:
1. Learn about a host of new features we're adding to the CUDA Platform this year
2. Learn about the future direction of CUDA and GPU computing
sessions.description: Generative AI is now central to global business strategies, with a recent survey showing that nine in 10 companies are already deploying or piloting the technology. However, with this integration comes the challenge of scaling AI development and deployment across the enterprise. We’ll delve into the critical elements required to operationalize Gen AI at scale — including proven infrastructure with a comprehensive software stack that enables high reliability and uptime, high visibility into cluster and job status, and simplified workload management to maximize developer productivity.

sessions.title: Accelerate Inference on NVIDIA GPUs
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Ce Zhang (CTO, Together AI)
sessions.points:
1. Explore the modular architecture of the server and its ability to scale seamlessly at the data center level.
2. Delve into the server’s powerful features, including its customizable API server, low-latency KV cache transfer, and robust messaging planes for efficient worker communication.
sessions.description: Deploying large language models for inference at scale is inherently complex, often requiring intricate optimizations across compute-bound and memory-bound regimes. We examine automatic vertical fusion, epilogue optimization, and adaptive kernel generation across batch sizes for GEMV and GEMM workloads, addressing key efficiency concerns, from NVIDIA CUDA® graph captures and optimized all-reduce strategies to custom kernel registrations. We'll highlight Together AI's journey in optimizing inference performance across the stack.

sessions.title: Distributed Agentic Multi-Modal LLM Deployments
sessions.speakers: Jeff White (Product CTO, Dell Technologies) | Irfan Ali (NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Improve the scalability of vector databases with object storage
2. Increase the performance of vector databases using NVIDIA GPUs (Presented by MinIO)
sessions.description: Future enterprise architectures for edge AI inference will be multi-modal. With core foundation model (FM)/LLM functions centralized (attention, MLP-FFNN, layer normalization, residual connection) and some functions distributed to edge (retrieval-augmented generation, input processing-tokenization/vector embedding/position encoding [maybe], guardrails, caching, inference optimization-sampling/beam search). In addition, in multi-modal architectures, convolutional neural networks (CNNs) will be integrated with the FM/LLM.

sessions.title: Accelerated Python: The Community and Ecosystem
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Andy Terrel (CUDA Python Product Lead, NVIDIA) | Jeremy Tanner (Open Source Programs, NVIDIA) | Anshuman Bhat (CUDA Product Management, NVIDIA)
sessions.description: Python is everywhere. Simulation, data science, and Gen AI all depend on it. Unfortunately, the dizzying array of tools leaves a newcomer baffled at where to start. We'll take you on a guided tour of the vibrant community and ecosystem surrounding accelerated Python programming. Explore a variety of tools, libraries, and frameworks that enable efficient computation and performance optimization in Python, including CUDA Python, RAPIDS, Warp, and Legate.
