We'll also discuss integration points with PyData, PyTorch, and JAX communities. Learn about collaborative efforts within the community, including open source projects and contributions that drive innovation in accelerated computing. We'll discuss best practices for leveraging these frameworks to enhance productivity in developing AI-driven applications and conducting large-scale data analyses.

sessions.title: Fault-Tolerant Managed Training: Crusoe Cloud’s Blueprint for AI Reliability (Presented by Crusoe.ai)
sessions.speakers: Aditya Shanker (Sr. Product Manager, Crusoe)
sessions.points:
1. How to apply performance research in robust, production-ready model deployments
2. How to orchestrate multiple models for compound AI tasks like AI phone calling
sessions.description: Crusoe Cloud is revolutionizing AI with unmatched reliability and simplicity. With a seven-fold growth in customers since the last GTC, we’re rapidly becoming the go-to cloud for AI innovation. Discover how our managed training service eliminates complexity, allowing you to focus on building groundbreaking products using NVIDIA accelerated computing infrastructure. See it in action: automatic node-swapping, advanced monitoring, and actionable performance insights — all setting the “gold standard” for enterprise AI workloads. Join us to explore why top innovators trust Crusoe Cloud for their mission-critical AI training.

sessions.title: Earth to AI: Engineering a Sustainable Future
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Tenika Versey Walker (Global Head of Inception Sustainable Futures, NVIDIA) | Karthik Kashinath (Principal Engineer and Scientist, AI-HPC, NVIDIA) | Colin le Duc (Founding Partner, Generation Investment Management) | Suzanne DiBianca (EVP and Chief Impact Officer, Salesforce) | Shimon Elkabetz (Chief Executive Officer and Co-Founder, Tomorrow.io)
sessions.points:
1. Thought leadership from VCA member on fundraising with startups
2. Promote VC connections in healthcare and the life sciences
sessions.description: "Earth to AI" brings together industry leaders to explore how AI and climate science are transforming business strategies for a sustainable future. From cutting-edge technologies to innovative funding models, this panel highlights actionable ways to drive climate resilience and economic growth.

sessions.title: Energy-Efficient Supercomputing Through Tensor Core-Accelerated Mixed-Precision Computing and Floating-Point Emulation
sessions.speakers: Samuel Rodriguez Bernabeu (Senior Software Engineer CUDA Math Libraries, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. How DGX SuperPOD with DGX GB200 differs from B200 for management and job scheduling
2. How to deal with DGX SuperPOD or DGX BasePOD maintenance and upkeep
sessions.description: The trends in computer architecture, primarily driven by AI-based applications (most recently, large language models), has led to a rapid increase in the reduced- and mixed-precision computing capabilities of GPUs. These processors demonstrate an outsized power-efficiency (FLOPS/watt) advantage over systems almost exclusively focused upon native single- and double-precision arithmetic. Thus, there is a great deal of motivation to leverage these capabilities, through the use of various mixed-precision algorithms and emulation techniques, to facilitate greater scientific computing throughput without sacrificing accuracy. We'll touch upon a number of these approaches and present real-world case studies that provide compelling evidence in support of this path to increasing the science per watt of supercomputers.

sessions.title: Everything DGX!
sessions.speakers: Jacques Bessoudo (Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Paul Bryan (DGX Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Jeff Weiss (Sr. Director, NVIDIA) | Jia Dai (Senior MLOps Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Yang Yang (Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | David Dean (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Scott Ellis (Manager - Solutions Architecture and Engineering, NVIDIA) | Martin Piercy (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Liquid cooling systems are essential for managing the heat generated by AI servers equipped with high thermal design power components, like GPUs used in training large language models
2. Efficient liquid cooling can significantly enhance server reliability and performance while reducing energy consumption
sessions.description: Wondering how to incorporate new technology into your current DGX SuperPOD? Trying to understand exactly how usage and management of a B200 DGX SuperPOD compares to one with DGX GB200? Trying to understand something that seems simple, but somehow isn't, on an NVIDIA DGX? This is the session for you! Connect with solution architects, product managers, and other experts in an open discussion to help get your questions answered by the people who know.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Applying AI Weather Models With NVIDIA Earth-2
sessions.speakers: Georg Ertl (Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Jussi Leinonen (Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Stefan Weissenberger (Solution Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Engage with technical product managers, engineers, and solutions architects to learn best practices for connecting generative AI resources to your enterprise knowledge base
2. Discover best practices for architecting retrieval pipelines and agentic workflows that deliver the best accuracy and throughput
sessions.description: Explore how NVIDIA Earth-2 facilitates efficient weather and climate modeling. Learn how to run a large and growing stack of global AI weather forecasting models and how downscaling models generate super-resolution outputs. Discover use cases and applications benefiting the most from this emerging technology.Prerequisite(s):Basic familiarity with Python.

sessions.title: Building a Scalable Enterprise Multi-Agent Platform for Financial Services
sessions.speakers: Pedro Vicente (Principal AI Engineer, Aladdin, BlackRock) | Shawn Simpson (Senior Data Science Team Director, AI Labs, BlackRock)
sessions.description: BlackRock's Aladdin® Copilot is an innovative generative AI tool that helps institutional investors instantly harness the power of BlackRock’s Aladdin investment management platform to make more-informed business decisions faster. As Aladdin Copilot's capabilities continue to expand, the Aladdin AI Engineering team has developed an enterprise, multi-agent platform that enables federated application development in a controlled and explainable environment that can scale with the needs of the organization. During this presentation, BlackRock will dive into the technical architecture of this multi-agent orchestration platform, including key design decisions made to reduce platform latency and support developer productivity. They will also discuss how they used NVIDIA NIM to optimize platform performance and future plans for agentic evaluation.

sessions.title: Build the Next-Generation AI Data Center: From Design to Deployment at Scale (Presented by Hyve Solutions)
sessions.speakers: Conor Malone (VP, Engineering, Hyve Solutions)
sessions.points:
1. Demystify between IGX and Jetson
2. Key customer applications for IGX and Jetson
sessions.description: The rapid evolution of AI workloads demands a fundamental rethinking of data center architecture. We'll explore NVIDIA's groundbreaking AI Factory platforms and Hyve Solutions' comprehensive approach to building and scaling AI infrastructure. We'll dive deep into the convergence of accelerated computing, networking, and cooling technologies that enable modern AI factories.

sessions.title: Pegatron’s Innovative High-Density GPU Rack Solution With NVIDIA Platform (Presented by Pegatron)
sessions.speakers: Kenneth Patchett (VP Data Center Infrastructure, Lambda) | Christopher Liang (Sr. VP of Product Department, Pegatron Corp)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how an AI gateway can save you AI inference costs through rate-limiting and caching
2. Prevent prompt injections and unauthorized data exposure through your AI application
sessions.description: Discover Pegatron's groundbreaking high-density GPU rack solution, leveraging the NVIDIA platform to revolutionize AI infrastructure. We'll explore the innovative design and performance enhancements that drive efficiency and scalability in AI applications, addressing the data center's demand for higher-density AI computing power, key factors in high-density design, and the importance of liquid cooling.

sessions.title: Protect and Control Your AI Applications (Presented by Cloudflare)
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Large Language Models (LLMs)
sessions.speakers: David Liu (Sr. Product Marketer, AI, Cloudflare)
sessions.description: Traditional security tools weren't built for the AI age. Step into the future of AI security as we unveil Cloudflare's integrated approach to AI protection. Learn how leading enterprises are combining AI gateway controls for cost management, firewall rules for prompt injections, and AI scraper bot protection from scraping and training on your data.

sessions.title: Evolving Cooling Needs for High-Density Data Centers (Presented by Schneider Electric)
sessions.speakers: Andrew Bradner (SVP Cooling Business, Schneider Electric)
sessions.description: Join our engaging fireside chat where industry leaders discuss the transformative potential of liquid cooling solutions in modern data centers. As AI workloads continue to evolve, so does the need for innovative cooling strategies that ensure efficiency and reliability. Discover the benefits these systems offer, from improved performance to enhanced energy efficiency, and learn how to navigate the selection of heat rejection methods and coolant distribution unit types. Our experts will discuss the latest advancements and provide insights into optimizing your data center operations.

sessions.title: The Great Power Shift: How AI is Changing Decision Rights (Presented by TCS)
sessions.speakers: Sivaraman Gopalasamudram Ganesan (Head of AI.Cloud Business Unit, Tata Consultancy Services)
sessions.points:
1. AI training: HBM3E, high-capacity DIMMs, high performance storage
2. AI inference: DDR5 high cap DIMMs, LPDDR, MRDIMM, memory expansion modules based on Compute Express Link, and storage
sessions.description: MIT Sloan Management Review, working with TCS, offers compelling evidence that intelligence choice architectures (ICAs) can transform decision-making. AI’s role is evolving from task automation to reshaping how decisions are made. ICAs use the power of AI to redefine decision-making; they're grounded in the principles of choice architecture from behavioral economics. As AI agents, ICAs can articulate and explain trade-offs, surface hidden options, highlight overlooked interdependencies, and suggest new pathways to success. What truly sets AI-driven choice architectures apart are their abilities to innovatively engage with human decision-makers and learn to make better recommendations and choices through feedback loops. TCS will examine the changing power dynamics of decision-making, decision rights considerations, and custom choices for a custom AI journey. We’ll explore how by leveraging NVIDIA’s innovative AI platform, AI is becoming a key player in corporate decision-making.

sessions.title: Accelerating Data Analytics Workflows on GPU Systems
sessions.speakers: Greg Kimball (Software Engineering Manager, NVIDIA) | Miloni Dipak Atal (Developer Technology Engineer, Data Analytics, NVIDIA) | Tanmay Gujar (Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Thomas Graves (Principal System Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Nuttiiya Seekhao (Developer Technology Manager, Data Analytics, NVIDIA) | Nikolay Sakharnykh (Senior AI Developer Technology Manager, NVIDIA) | Bobby Evans (Distinguished Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Rui Lan (Senior Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Tim Kaldewey (Director AI Developer Technology North America, NVIDIA) | Clemens Lutz (Senior Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Accelerate CAE workflows
2. How to get access to APIs
sessions.description: Are you looking to accelerate your data analytics workflow on GPUs? Is your workflow bottlenecked by complex and slow-running SQL queries or dataframe operations? Join our session on data analytics workloads on GPUs, where you'll discover how to accelerate your data processing with cutting-edge NVIDIA hardware and software solutions. Learn about libraries like RAPIDS and Spark, powerful tools that leverage GPUs for fast data processing, and explore NVIDIA's Grace Hopper and Grace Blackwell architectures designed to accelerate your data workloads like never before.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: AI Agents in Production: Insights and Future Directions
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Harrison Chase (Co-Founder and CEO, LangChain)
sessions.description: As a leading developer platform for generative AI orchestration, LangChain has been at the forefront of the journey of AI agents from experimental concepts to essential components in production systems. We'll cover key lessons learned from LangChain’s experience enabling customers to develop, deploy, and manage enterprise AI agents in production at scale, and will explore emerging technologies that will shape the future.

sessions.title: Scaling Vision LLMs to extract and deploy targeted metadata for Catalog Management
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Climate / Weather / Ocean Modeling
sessions.speakers: Kshetrajna Raghavan (Senior Staff Machine Learning Engineer, Shopify) | Diego Castañeda (Senior ML Engineer, Shopify)
sessions.points:
1. The Weather Company and NVIDIA are collaborating to develop products for probabilistic weather predictions at the scale of thunderstorms
2. Before the advent of deep learning numerical weather prediction, this was computationally intractable
sessions.description: In the dynamic world of ecommerce, the challenge of managing unstructured product data is significant. Shopify leverages multimodal vision LLMs (large language models) for enhanced product metadata extraction. We discuss the complexities of categorizing products accurately and enabling precise search and filtering within a vast and diverse product catalog. Our two-step approach with vision LLMs involves category prediction followed by attribute prediction, utilizing cutting-edge techniques to achieve remarkable accuracy. We also detail the creation of a "Golden Dataset" to fine-tune these models effectively. This talk further explores the deployment of these models in production, highlighting the performance improvements achieved and the impact on Shopify's ecosystem. Addressing the challenges of unstructured product data enables Shopify to empower merchants and enhances the overall shopping experience for millions of users.

sessions.title: AI Day Startup and VC Networking Hour
sessions.speakers: Renee Yao (Ecosystem Business Development, HCLS (Startups and Consulting Partners), NVIDIA) | Vijay Pande (General Partner, Andreesen Horowitz) | Lu Zhang (Founder and Managing Partner, Fusion Fund) | Scott Barclay (Managing Director, Insight Partners) | Tess Van Stekelenburg (Science Partner, Lux Capital)
sessions.points:
1. Emerging Trends in HCLS Startups: Insights from leading VCs on the latest innovations, market opportunities, and key challenges shaping healthcare and life sciences startups
2. VC and NVIDIA Collaboration: How NVIDIA partners with top venture capital firms to accelerate AI deployment and development across their portfolio companies, driving transformative innovation
sessions.description: Join us for a networking hour to connect with founders, developers, and venture capitalists (VCs) after the conclusion of the AI Day sessions. This is your chance to exchange ideas, form valuable connections, and dive deeper into the world of AI with some of the brightest minds in the industry.

sessions.title: Designing the Future: Protein Engineering, AI, and Responsible Innovation
sessions.speakers: Angela Aristidou (Professor, University College London; Fellow, Human-Centered AI Institute (Digital Economy Lab), Stanford University) | Abe Stern (Clara Discovery Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Frances Arnold (Nobel Laureate in Chemistry (2018); Linus Pauling Professor of Chemical Engineering, Bioengineering and Biochemistry, California Institute of Technology) | Gevorg Grigoryan (Co-Founder and Chief Technology Officer, Generate:Biomedicines)
sessions.points:
1. Hear best practices and insights for writing AI applications using the latest tools and techniques
2. Explore new ideas in machine learning, recommender systems, and large language models
sessions.description: Join us as we explore the cutting-edge advancements in protein engineering and molecular design, focusing on how artificial intelligence is revolutionizing the field. We will discuss the latest breakthroughs in protein science, including AI-driven structure prediction and de novo protein design. The session will also address the critical aspects of AI safety in this domain, examining potential risks and ethical considerations as we push the boundaries of what's possible in molecular engineering.

sessions.title: AI Accelerating a Country: Advances from Gefion, an AI Supercomputer in Denmark
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Pre-Trained / Foundation Models
sessions.speakers: Nadia Carlsten (CEO, Danish Centre for AI Innovation)
sessions.points:
1. State-of-the-art generative AI from NVIDIA research
2. How visual generative AI is advancing multiple industries like media & entertainment, retail, robotics, and automotive
sessions.description:
Learn about an exciting strategic collaboration that is bringing large-scale AI computing power to Denmark, and how the new AI supercomputer is accelerating the work of many innovators. The goal of the Danish Centre for AI Innovation (DCAI) is to accelerate research and innovation in fields from healthcare and life sciences to the green transition, supporting the development of innovative solutions to the world’s biggest problems. 

Hear from DCAI’s CEO Nadia Carlsten about what it takes to stand up one of world’s largest supercomputers, and how customers from academia, startups, and large companies are using this new facility to make headway in healthcare, life sciences, and quantum computing.

sessions.title: Rethinking E-Commerce: Build a Multi-Agent Shopping Assistant on Langflow  (Presented by DataStax)
sessions.speakers: Kiyu Gabriel (GM, Search and AI, DataStax)
sessions.points:
1. How OpenUSD is changing the game for digital marketing
2. How NVIDIA Omniverse can enable seamless content creation when powering independent software vendor tools
sessions.description: Agents are key to bringing your AI platform to life—but how do you get started? Join Kiyu Gabriel, GM, Search & AI at DataStax, to learn how to customize and deploy an agentic shopping assistant using Langflow’s intuitive drag-and-drop interface and the NVIDIA NeMo platform. Discover how Langflow and NVIDIA NeMo streamline the creation of robust, multi-agent solutions, empowering you to build intelligent, scalable systems with ease for e-commerce and beyond. This session is also a preview of the hands-on workshop, Getting Started with Langflow: Build a Multi-Agent Shopping Assistant, where you’ll get hands on and create the same flow demonstrated in this session.

sessions.title: Best Practices and Techniques for Building Agentic and Retrieval Pipelines
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Even Oldridge (Director, Generative AI Engineering, NVIDIA) | Santiago Pombo (Generative AI Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Tanay Varshney (Developer Advocate Engineer for Deep Learning SW, NVIDIA) | Nick Reamaroon (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Matt Penn (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Ryan Kraus (Senior Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA) | Bartley Richardson (Director of Engineering, NVIDIA) | Vinay Bagade (Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA) | Nave Algarici (Generative AI Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Annie Surla (Developer Advocate Engineer, NVIDIA) | Sean Sodha (Sr. Software Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Devin Robison (Data Scientist, NVIDIA) | Rohan Rao (Sr. Solutions Architect, Enterprise Generative AI, NVIDIA) | Fei Yu (Machine Learning Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. How are modern AI systems redefining inference, particularly in various reasoning tasks?
2. Emerging technologies like quantum computing and their potential to transform inference processes
sessions.description: Explore the latest techniques for building retrieval pipelines and agentic workflows that can uncover fast, accurate insights within your data. Bring your hardest data processing and retrieval challenges and work one-on-one with NVIDIA experts to learn about the latest techniques, technologies, and tools to unblock your projects.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Wired for AI: Lessons from Networking 100K+ GPU AI Data Centers and Clouds
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Programming Languages / Compilers
sessions.speakers: Gilad Shainer (Senior Vice President Networking, NVIDIA) | Peter Salanki (CTO, CoreWeave) | Jeff Drehobl (Senior Staff Network Development Engineer, X) | Nidhi Chappell (VP Azure AI Infrastructure, Microsoft) | Pradeep Vincent (SVP, Chief Technical Architect, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, Oracle Corporation) | Omar Baldonado (Director of DC Networking, Meta)
sessions.points:
1. Tour of key Python segments: simulation, data science, and generative AI
2. Overview of key accelerated Python frameworks
sessions.description:
As AI continues to evolve, the need for massive computational power has led to developing some of the world's largest GPU-based data centers. These centers are at the forefront of training large language models (LLMs) with trillions of parameters, pushing the boundaries of what AI can achieve.

In this session, leading AI cloud data centers will come together to share our experiences and insights from building and deploying these colossal systems. We'll delve into the unique challenges of networking at such a massive scale, and how we overcame them.

Attendees will gain a deep understanding of the lessons learned in scaling infrastructure to support the next generation of AI, from the complexities of connecting thousands of GPUs to the innovations required to maintain performance and reliability at such an unprecedented scale.

sessions.title: Unlock the Power of AI Agents in Automotive
sessions.speakers: Bryan Goodman (Executive Director, Artificial Intelligence, Ford Motor Co.)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the critical networking architectures and strategies used to support the massive data flow in 100,000+ GPU-based AI data centers, ensuring efficient and reliable training of trillion-parameter LLMs
2. Learn the best practices for minimizing latency and maximizing throughput in large-scale AI deployments, essential for maintaining performance during extensive model training processes
sessions.description: Discover how Ford Motor Co. is leveraging AI agents to revolutionize customer experience, operational efficiency, and innovation. Explore real-world applications, including customer-facing agents, service technician assistants, and employee productivity agents. Learn about the benefits, challenges, and practical solutions for deploying AI agents in the automotive industry, including from ensuring reliability to implementing effective feedback loops. See examples of AI agents in production use for manufacturing, engineering, and marketing.

sessions.title: Upskill Manufacturing Workforces with AI Agents
sessions.speakers: Sam Zheng (Chief AI Officer and Chairman, DeepHow)
sessions.points:
1. Learn the differences between vector databases and traditional databases such as relational and nosql
2. Become familiar with the benefits and drawbacks to the different types of vector database offerings available and how to best utilize them for their semantic search workloads
sessions.description:
Rapid advancements in Industry 4.0, robotics, and automation require companies to reskill and upskill their workforce. To reduce this skill gap and transfer knowledge effectively, DeepHow was founded to capture expert knowledge and deliver it in ways that empower frontline workers. 

In this session, we’ll showcase how DeepHow leverages NVIDIA AI Blueprint for video search and summarization to transform expert video demonstrations into rich, multimodal Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). These SOPs include interactive videos, step-by-step textual instructions, summaries, and assessments, all seamlessly managed and shared through our Maven platform. We’ll also highlight how DeepHow integrates AI-generated SOPs with critical industrial systems like Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES), Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), and Learning Management Systems (LMS) to provide high-quality, consistent training at scale—significantly reducing operational errors and training costs.

Join us to discover how AI-driven knowledge transfer empowers workers, boosts efficiency, and fosters human-AI collaboration in manufacturing. We’ll share use cases from a few industry-leading customers including AB InBev, Stanley Black & Decker, Owens Corning, and USG to showcase the impact of leveraging AI Agents to close the skills gap in industrial environments.

sessions.title: Own your AI: Building an open-source AI strategy
sessions.speakers: Sid Rabindran (Head of Partnership, Fireworks AI) | Lin Qiao (CEO and Co-Founder, Fireworks AI)
sessions.points:
1. Pegatron’s high-density GPU rack solution, powered by the NVIDIA platform, addresses the increasing demand for scalable and efficient AI infrastructure in data centers
2. Focus on the importance of liquid cooling and high-density design features, which enhance performance while optimizing space and energy use
sessions.description: The release of DeepSeek R1 was a breakthrough moment for AI, showing that open-source models can match—and even surpass—proprietary models like OpenAI and Anthropic on key benchmarks like logical reasoning and code generation. This was a watershed moment that shook the entire AI industry because it proved that open models could now be a viable alternative against proprietary models. Every company now needs to ask itself: What is my open-source AI strategy?

sessions.title: Next-generation at Scale Compute in the Data Center
sessions.speakers: Mike Houston (VP and Chief Architect of AI Systems, NVIDIA) | Julie Bernauer (Senior Director, Applied Systems Engineering, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. The pivotal role of AI and machine learning in developing autonomous driving systems
2. How Rivian uses advanced computing to optimize vehicle performance, safety, and user experience
sessions.description: As emerging technologies continue to advance computing, comprehensive builds of very large-scale systems are becoming increasingly integrated to address the rapidly evolving demands of next-gen workloads. We'll highlight our latest designs for DGX clusters, including both compute and data center configurations showcasing an example with DGX Superpod. We'll discuss the architectural and design principles underlying next-gen air- and liquid-cooled deployments. We'll also examine the network fabric, interconnect solutions, and storage options that enable maximum performance, and how these components integrate with the software stack for generative AI applications.

sessions.title: Beyond the Camera: Revolutionize Content Creation With Advanced Lip-Sync AI
sessions.speakers: Anshul Khandelwal (Co-Founder, CTO, and SVP Product, Invideo, Inc.)
sessions.description:
Dive into the world of next-generation content creation as we unveil an innovative lip-sync model designed to break down barriers for millions of creators. We'll take you on a journey through the development of a cutting-edge AI system that's set to transform video production. We'll explore the challenges of processing vast amounts of diverse audio-visual data, the intricacies of our generative adversarial network (GAN)-based architecture with StyleGAN innovations, and the optimization techniques that make this technology scalable for millions of users.

Learn how we tackled common issues in lip-sync technology, from audio-visual misalignment to identity preservation, and discover the potential applications of this model in conjunction with existing B-roll and AI director capabilities. Whether you're an ML engineer, AI researcher, or developer working on large-scale video processing systems, you'll gain valuable insights into the future of AI-assisted content creation.

sessions.title: From Concept to Reality: Startups Driving AI-Powered Industry Automation
sessions.speakers: Kalyan Vadrevu (Product Marketing Manager, Robotics, NVIDIA) | Heidi Schubert (Director of Software and Autonomy, Cobot) | Zhaopeng Chen (Founder, CEO, and Executive Director, Agile Robots) | Dr. Ali Agha (Founder and Chief Executive Officer, Field AI) | Bachir Kharraja (Chief Technology Officer, Miso Robotics)
sessions.points:
1. NetApp provides a comprehensive data management solution that spans the entire AI life cycle, from data ingestion and preparation to model training and inference
2. Learn how NetApp ONTAP integrated with NVIDIA’s AI infrastructure to provide a unified infrastructure for managing AI data across on-premises and cloud environment
sessions.description: Join us for an insightful lightning talk featuring founders and technologists from leading robotics startups in the NVIDIA Inception program. These innovators will share how they are addressing industry challenges using NVIDIA acceleration libraries, AI models, and the Omniverse platform. Gain insights into the unique challenges faced by these entrepreneurs and discover how they are using advanced AI to serve customers across industries such as manufacturing, healthcare, retail, and food service.

sessions.title: Generative AI Inference At Scale
sessions.speakers: Neal Vaidya (Developer Advocate Engineer for Deep Learning SW, NVIDIA) | Davide Onofrio (Director, Deep Learning, NVIDIA) | Hongkuan Zhou (Deep learning algorithm engineer, NVIDIA) | Rudy Pei (Senior Deep Learning Algorithm Engineer, NVIDIA) | Alec Flowers (NVIDIA) | Sean Choi (NVIDIA) | Ishan Dhanani (NVIDIA) | Kyle Kranen (NVIDIA) | Ryan McCormick (Senior Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Neelay Shah (Principal Software Architect, NVIDIA) | Guan Luo (NVIDIA) | Tanmay Verma (Senior System Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | David Zier (NVIDIA) | Ryan Olson (NVIDIA)
sessions.description: Deploying AI models for real-world applications demands efficient inference strategies to handle their intense memory and compute requirements. Learn the key phases of LLM inference and provide practical techniques for developers and data scientists to optimize model performance, reduce costs, and achieve scalable deployment. We'll also cover state-of-the-art attention mechanism improvements, such as multi-query and flash attention, to optimize memory use during inference. Additionally, we'll explore model serving strategies like in-flight batching and speculative inference, which can significantly enhance GPU utilization while minimizing latency in production environments.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Insights From NVIDIA Research
sessions.speakers: Bill Dally (Chief Scientist and SVP of Research, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Creative application of generative AI needs to start with a compelling brand idea to be meaningful
2. We need to shift focus from using AI as a new tool to do old approaches, to something that can reinvent our approach
sessions.description: The talk will give some highlights from NVIDIA Research for the past year. Detailed topics will be disclosed closer to the event.

sessions.title: Develop the Future of Photoreal Spatial Computing With Apple Vision Pro and Omniverse
sessions.speakers: Brad Peebler (Director, Apple) | Max Bickley (Product Manager, Spatial Computing, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Higher secondary flow rate capability and pressure head are critical to supporting next-generation liquid-cooled products (exceeding 1.2 LPM/kW)
2. 25-micron technical water filtration requirements will continue to be a standard for the majority of AI liquid-cooled platforms
sessions.description:
Join Apple and NVIDIA for a technical deep dive about spatial computing. This session will give an overview of how advancements in high-fidelity immersive interaction within spatial environments are made possible with Apple and NVIDIA Omniverse. Now developers can create and experience OpenUSD-based digital twins specific for their enterprise workflow. Learn how hybrid computing enables traditional computing methods to be combined with cloud computing to stream datasets directly to the Apple Vision Pro.
Attendees will gain valuable technical insights in spatial computing development that will enhance collaboration, drive industry innovation, and create unparalleled user experiences. Discover the transformative capabilities of the combination of the Apple Vision Pro and NVIDIA Omniverse that redefines the art of possibility across several industries.
Don't miss out on this chance to understand the evolving landscape of immersive technologies.

sessions.title: Healthcare Reimagined: Coding the Future of Medicine Through Digital Acceleration
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Munjal Shah (Co-Founder and CEO, Hippocratic AI) | Brad Genereaux (Global Lead, Healthcare Alliances, NVIDIA) | Andrew Gostine (CEO, Artisight) | Zachary Lipton (CTO and Chief Science Officer, Abridge) | Thomas Schoedl (Sub-Chapter Lead Information Extraction, Roche Diagnostics) | Drew McCombs (VP Cloud and Analytics, Epic)
sessions.points:
1. A review of a scalable, resilient, and secure inference engine architecture for serving billions of tokens per day
2. How to leverage various NVIDIA platforms like H100 and GH200 to serve inference, along with preliminary results on Blackwell
sessions.description: Every week, new breakthroughs in accelerated computing are made, with enabling SDKs and APIs to bring it to every industry on the planet. How can the industry leverage these to solve healthcare's biggest problems? An aging patient population, more complex and interwoven chronic health problems, ever-rising costs, staff burnout, service satisfaction, reimbursements — accelerated computing is making a real difference in all of these areas. In this talk, luminaries from all around the digital health landscape will share their insights into what's here, and what's next.

sessions.title: How Predictive Intelligence is Driving the Future of Marketing
sessions.topic: Data Center / Cloud - Software-Defined Data Center
sessions.speakers: LaSandra Brill (VP, Global Digital Marketing, NVIDIA) | Alicia Tillman (CMO, Delta Air Lines) | Jeffrey Katzenberg (Founding Partner, WndrCo) | Tomás Puig (CEO and Founder, Alembic Technologies) | Jeremiah Owyang (General Partner, Blitzscaling Ventures)
sessions.points:
1. How to utilize NVIDIA AI Enterprise to build and deploy production-grade AI agents
2. Impact of orchestrating multiple teams of agents across your organization
sessions.description: For over a century-and-a-half, businesses have grappled with optimizing marketing efficiency. While digital marketing has enhanced accountability, it still struggles to accurately measure offline channels, which make up nearly 40% of global advertising expenditure. Join us as we delve into the future of marketing analytics and discover how predictive intelligence is transforming enterprise marketing strategies. We’ll explore how predictive marketing analytics is becoming an essential tool for CMOs, empowering them to shape future outcomes with unparalleled precision and drive revenue growth.

sessions.title: Connect With IGX and Jetson Hardware Experts on IPC and Embedded Applications
sessions.speakers: Leela Karumbunathan (Sr. Hardware Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Suhas Hariharapura Sheshadri (Sr. Software Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Chen Su (Sr. Technical Product Marketing Manager, NVIDIA) | Thejas Shivashankar (Partner Ecosystem Manager, NVIDIA) | Winnie Hsu (Director, Embedded Platform Software, NVIDIA) | Brad Griffis (NVIDIA) | Yogesh Kini (NVIDIA) | Eric Work (NVIDIA) | Bhanu Pisupati (NVIDIA) | Hemal Shah (NVIDIA) | Anubhav Rai (NVIDIA) | Bridget Bissell (NVIDIA) | Dustin Franklin (Principal Engineer and Developer Evangelist, NVIDIA) | Martin Doe (NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. CUDA Integration with MS Windows and WSL
2. Understanding CUDA Toolkit APIs for Windows application developers
sessions.description: NVIDIA IGX and Jetson are the world's leading computing platform for AI at the edge. It offers high-performance compute and advanced NVIDIA AI software stack as well as an extensive ecosystem to help you create and take products to market. Join with NVIDIA engineers and experts to ask your questions and join discussion on topics ranging from hardware design, platform software, sensors and connectivity. For questions about AI models, software SDKs and application frameworks, please join CWE 73457.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Build Scalable Data Flywheels for Continuously Improving Generative AI Applications
sessions.speakers: Vivienne Zhang (Product Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Further understanding of how the convergence of networking, compute, and security creates a foundation for next-generation AI applications
2. The implications of infrastructure and fabric to AI workloads, performance analysis, and the innovations that can improve the performance and efficiency of job completion and reduce time
sessions.description: Enterprises need a scalable, efficient, and modular solution for building data flywheels to capture the latest data and train and continuously improve the models that power generative AI applications. NVIDIA NeMo offer a complete solution for building these flywheels. NeMo enable enterprises to quickly and easily collect and process data, customize the generative AI models, evaluate the model's performance, and implement guardrails to ensure responsible and ethical use of the model. Learn about the ease of use, flexibility, and advanced techniques that will help you build your solutions faster.

sessions.title: Key Design Patterns to Build Trustworthy Data Agents (Presented by Snowflake, Inc.)
sessions.speakers: Anupam Datta (Prinicipal Research Scientist, Snowflake) | Rajhans Samdani (Principal AI Architect, Snowflake)
sessions.points:
1. Harnessing AI for Workforce Development: Learn how state partnerships with NVIDIA are driving workforce transformation by integrating AI into education systems and creating career pathways aligned with the demands of the future economy
2. Fostering Innovation Hubs for Economic Growth: Discover how governors are leveraging AI to establish innovation hubs that attract investment, support startups, and fuel regional economic development
sessions.description: Trustworthy data agents couple agentic design patterns for data-centered tasks with evaluations and observability to build apps that can be trusted. Using text-to-SQL and retrieval-augmented generation as concrete examples, we'll examine key agentic design patterns to build trustworthy data agents, including reflection and refinement loops, tool use, and multi-agent systems. Building on TruLens, our open-source project, we'll also present a methodology for evaluating, experiment tracking, and monitoring agentic apps that enables developers to measure app quality, identify and debug failure modes, and build the trust that’s needed to move apps into production and keep them there. Specifically, we'll share our recent research on agentic text-to-SQL that placed No. 1 on the Spider 2.0-Snow leaderboard (in January 2025) and optimizing LLM judges that yields up to 15% improvement in their precision — i.e., true positive agreement with human evaluators.

sessions.title: Build CUDA Software at the Speed of Light
sessions.speakers: Robert Maynard (Principal Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn a quick path to build generative AI apps leveraging easily deployable microservices, including an introduction to key steps in the developer workflow
2. For advanced developers, we can provide guidance on curating data, scaling training, and customization with NeMo Framework, including parallelisms and various optimization techniques
sessions.description: CUDA is well known for performance, but do you know how to compile CUDA software with the same speed and efficiency? Join one of NVIDIA’s build engineers (and original author of CUDA support in CMake) to learn how to design your build infrastructure to have super-fast builds, quick CI turnaround, and small binaries. If you are a developer, build, release or DevOps engineer, or just interested in best practices for building CUDA applications, this session is for you!

sessions.title: Leveraging AI for Digital Biology: BioNeMo, Parabricks, and NVIDIA NIMs and Agent Blueprints
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Large Language Models (LLMs)
sessions.speakers: Neha Tadimeti (Product Manager, NVIDIA) | T.J. Chen (Product Lead, Genomics, NVIDIA) | Xin Yu (Senior Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Christian Dallago (Senior Solution Architect - Healthcare and Life Sciences, EMEA, NVIDIA) | Eric Dawson (NVIDIA) | Pankaj Vats (Senior Bioinformatics/Genomics Scientist, NVIDIA) | Daniel Puleri (NVIDIA) | Severin Dicks (NVIDIA) | Gary Burnett (Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA) | Neel Patel (WWFO - Clara Healthcare) (Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA) | Kristopher Kersten (Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how we applied the Minitron compression strategy to three distinct LLM families (Nemotron-4, Llama 3.1, and Mistral-NeMo), obtaining compressed models with state-of-the-art accuracy
2. Practical and effective structured compression best practices for LLMs, grounded in extensive empirical evidence
sessions.description: Join NVIDIA experts to explore the field of digital biology. Discuss the latest advancements in accelerated computing and foundation models for drug discovery and genomics — from bioinformatics tooling to protein structure prediction, molecular dynamics to molecular generation, and much more. Learn how NVIDIA BioNeMo and Parabricks, together with NVIDIA NIM and Blueprints, empower developers, researchers, and enterprises to quickly create generative AI solutions across chemistry, biology, and genomics. Engage directly with our product managers, developer relations, and solution architects in discussions that address your challenges and seek answers to your questions.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Break the ExaFLOPS Barrier With Scientific Workflows Using the Megatron Training Framework
sessions.speakers: Gautham Dharuman (Senior ML Scientist, Lila Sciences)
sessions.points:
1. NVIDIA cuVS achieves state-of-the-art vector search performance at scale by GPU-accelerating popular libraries and vector databases.
2. Apache Lucene has long been the 800-pound gorilla for various types of search, used by many popular databases.
sessions.description: We built a generalizable multi-modal scientific workflow using the Megatron framework with a focus on protein design applications. We trained generative models preferentially aligned with experimental feedback and achieved more than 1ExaFLOPS sustained performance in mixed precision on five diverse supercomputing systems, including systems in the top 10 list of most powerful supercomputers, such as Aurora, Frontier, Alps, and Leonardo. Our implementation sets high benchmarks for multi-modal protein design workflows.

sessions.title: Blackwell Programming for the Masses With OpenAI Triton
sessions.speakers: dePaul Miller (Deep Learning Library Software Performance Engineer, NVIDIA) | Phil Tillet (Member of Technical Staff, OpenAI)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the challenges and motivation behind multimodal data ingestion, embedding, and retrieval
2. Learn how to use NIM Agent Blueprints as a one-stop solution for your RAG application
sessions.description: Get an overview of how the Triton programming language supports NVIDIA’s new Blackwell GPU architecture. We'll examine the design and implementation details of this new backend, showing how it leverages Blackwell's new hardware features without breaking backward compatibility with previous architectures. Learn about the compilation pipeline and key optimizations, and see benchmark results that demonstrate real-world performance gains. This talk is ideal for developers interested in leveraging Triton for high-performance computing on Blackwell GPUs.

sessions.title: Navigating the High-Stakes Safety Challenges of Autonomous Driving
sessions.speakers: Riccardo Mariani (VP Safety, NVIDIA) | Warren Merkel (Vice President, Policy, ANSI National Accreditation Board) | Melissa Wade (Sr. Director of Government Affairs, Aurora) | Sreeja Roy-Singh (Head of Systems Engineering, Nuro)
sessions.points:
1. Learn about real-world applications of CXL to boost AI inferencing performance by 73%, with 40% faster time to insights and 2X more instances
2. Discover how CXL can complement high-bandwidth memory with additional memory capacity
sessions.description: Building an autonomous vehicle to navigate safely in the complex physical world is challenging. The system needs to perceive and understand its surroundings holistically, and then make correct, safe decisions in a fraction of a second. This requires human-like situational awareness to handle potentially dangerous or rare scenarios. We'll dive into the challenges of delivering safety processes and architectures, including standardization and regulatory oversight, to ensure autonomous vehicle safety.

sessions.title: Build and Deploy High-Quality Generative AI Agent Systems (Presented by Databricks)
sessions.speakers: Craig Wiley (Sr. Director of Product for AI, Databricks) | John Carnahan (SVP of Engineering and Architecture, Experian) | Nicolas Pelaez (Technical Marketing Engineer, Databricks)
sessions.points:
1. Learn about the lesson we learned when deploying AI inference pipeline on kubernetes cluster
2. High level understanding of components of NVIDIA’s open source tool NIM Operator for managing AI inference services on kubernetes cluster
sessions.description: Generative AI has the potential to disrupt every industry. However, building a high-quality generative AI agent system where the outputs are accurate, safe, and governed is difficult to do. Learn how you can build, deploy, evaluate, and govern AI agent systems on a single unified solution. Mosaic AI by Databricks is designed to streamline the entire Gen AI life cycle. You can securely use your enterprise data to augment, fine-tune, or build your own custom LLM, powering these models with a semantic understanding of your business.  Also, hear from Experian on how they built out an end-to-end AI solution to help fight identity theft.

sessions.title: Modular Design to Accelerate AI Technologies (Presented by MSI)
sessions.speakers: Philip Maher (Director of Marketing, MSI Enterprise Platform Solutions, Micro-Star International)
sessions.points:
1. Autonomous vehicles (AVs) have the potential to significantly reduce human error. AVs can reduce crashes, injuries, and fatalities
2. Safe AVs require safety processes and architectures, including redundancy, diversity, and continuous monitoring, as well as standardization and regulatory oversight to ensure system safety
sessions.description: Discover how modular design transforms AI hardware development, enabling dynamic system architectures to meet the demands of evolving algorithms and diverse operating environments. We'll showcase real-world applications, such as how modularized server designs enhance performance for AI model training, edge computing, and data-intensive workloads. We'll delve into how modularization optimizes hardware utilization, accelerates development cycles, and ensures adaptability to rapid technological advancements.

sessions.title: Build a Customizable HPC Platform With Enhanced GPU Fault Tolerance
sessions.speakers: ChandraShekhar Mudarapu (Director, AI/ML Platforms, CapitalOne) | Ali Rodell (Senior Director, AI/ML Platforms, Capital One) | Herik Webb (Director, AI/ML Platforms, Capital One)
sessions.description: Learn more about how to strategize around, design, build, and configure a high performance computing (HPC) cluster with advanced GPU fault tolerances with Kubernetes on AWS. When running a HPC cluster, it's important to have robust recovery mechanisms to ensure minimal downtime and high availability. Take this to the next level by developing robust components from the ground up that integrate with Kubernetes to provide recovery from GPU XID errors in a seamless manner. We’ll also cover best practices of building a scalable HPC cluster in a multi-tenant environment bundled with enhanced GPU observability.

sessions.title: Bring Massive-Scale Vector Search to the GPU with Apache Lucene
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Training AI Models
sessions.speakers: Vivek Narang (Sr. Software Engineer, SearchScale) | Corey Nolet (Principal Engineer, ML, Data Mining, and Vector Search, NVIDIA) | Chris Hegarty (Senior Principal Software Engineer, Elastic)
sessions.points:
1. Gain a clear understanding of foundation blocks needed to build a HPC stack on AWS using kubernetes
2. Hear our experiences around the journey of building these systems from inception to implementation
sessions.description:
Lucene has long been the dominant player in search, in part because of its foundational role in so many software tools. As unstructured data continues to grow and as LLMs and generative AI continue to advance, it is increasingly critical to support massive-scale vector embeddings in modern search systems. The recently released lucene-cuvs library addresses this critical need by supercharging vector search algorithms in Lucene.

Join this session to learn how the NVIDIA cuVS library accelerates Apache Lucene’s vector search capabilities on GPUs, enabling faster queries and scalable indexing for massive workloads without compromising quality. We’ll dive into the advanced algorithms for approximate nearest neighbors and clustering provided by cuVS, share key benchmarks, and discuss the transformative performance impact across Lucene’s broader ecosystem of databases.

sessions.title: Beyond Silos: Unlock AI’s Full Potential With Petabit-Scale Data Mobility (Presented by Stelia)
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Training AI Models
sessions.speakers: David Hughes (VP Engineering, Stelia)
sessions.points:
1. Gain insights into managing and preprocessing 10,000 hours of diverse audio-visual data, including solutions for audio diarization, vocal separation, and audio-visual synchronization
2. Explore the architecture of our GAN-based model, featuring a modified StyleGAN encoder with self-attention mechanisms and audio-driven style learning
sessions.description:
Traditional cloud computing, where compute is anchored to data location, is no longer viable for modern AI workloads. This session explores the fundamental shift toward data mobility and interconnection, enabling AI infrastructure to scale beyond the limitations of siloed resources. We'll dissect the challenges of existing models, examine the barriers to AI scalability, and introduce petabit-scale data mobility as the solution for AI training and deployment at hyperscale. 

Discover how interconnected compute resources redefine performance, flexibility, and efficiency — ushering in a new era where AI operates without boundaries across compute, network, and storage environments.

sessions.title: Data Center Operators Must Lower Risk As GPU Costs Rise: Future-Proof Your Data Center (Presented by DDC Solutions)
sessions.speakers: Chris Orlando (Co-Founder, DDC Solutions)
sessions.points:
1. The future of useful quantum computing is accelerated quantum supercomputing — a quantum computer tightly integrated with an AI supercomputer
2. AI supercomputing is essential to help us get to future useful quantum computing
sessions.description: S&P Global reported in a Business Impact Report that the demand for AI accelerators is growing and the cost to deploy GPUs, power, cooling, and data center construction can be 5-10 times more costly. Equipment exposure to water hazards from sprinklers and overhead chilled water cooling is not an “if,” but when. A single outage can rapidly expand across the facility, affecting hundreds of pieces of expensive equipment. Learn how DDC mitigates risk by lowering the loss footprint from an entire data center to a single cabinet, all while delivering ultra-high-density cooling with up to 100KW air and 400KW liquid-to-chip ready per cabinet.

sessions.title: Accelerating AI with Purpose-Built Cloud Infrastructure (Presented by Together AI)
sessions.speakers: Charles Srisuwananukorn (Founding VP of Engineering, Together AI)
sessions.points:
1. GPUs’ compute power can accelerate complex database queries. Up to 16X speedup for TPC-H queries over CPU
2. Grace Hopper and Grace Blackwell systems can alleviate the data transfer bottleneck. GH200 achieves up to 4X speedup over x86+H100 when executing CPU-GPU interconnect bound queries
sessions.description: The next generation of AI demands an entirely new kind of cloud — one designed from the ground up to meet the unique challenges of generative AI, advanced reasoning, and the road to superintelligence. This session by Together AI will delve into the three critical pillars of an AI-optimized cloud: state-of-the-art hardware purpose-built for AI workloads, cutting-edge software that maximizes performance, and integrated services that simplify model development and deployment. Together, these elements form the foundation of AI-first clouds that accelerate innovation, turbocharge performance, and empower researchers and businesses to achieve transformative outcomes.

sessions.title: Agentic Cloud: Using Agents to Build Tomorrow’s Cloud (Presented by DigitalOcean)
sessions.speakers: Bratin Saha (Chief Product and Technology Officer, DigitalOcean)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the unique requirements and challenges for AI agents in production
2. Explore popular design patterns, tools, and techniques for production AI agents
sessions.description: DigitalOcean is a cloud provider with more than 600,000 customers, including many growing tech companies. Learn how DO is using agents — a bleeding-edge innovation that will drive how we use generative AI — to improve the experience for cloud developers. We’ll also show why the use of agents allows DO to customize the cloud for its customers and, in turn, make AI simple enough for anyone to use. We'll talk about the key considerations in deploying agents within a cloud infrastructure, lessons learned from deploying it at massive scale, and how the company is operationalizing NVIDIA H100 and H200 GPUs for model training, inference, agents, and natural language interfaces.

sessions.title: Overcome Bottlenecks in AI Development With Flexible GPU Cloud Solutions (Presented by IREN)
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Daniel Roberts (Co-CEO, IREN)
sessions.points:
1. Understand Compound AI Systems: Learn what compound AI systems are, and how they differ from single-model approaches
2. Enterprise Examples of Compound AI Systems: See examples of enterprises building and deploying production-scale compound AI systems. Learn top use cases in production, realized business impact building on top of a compound AI system, across ecommerce/marketplace, healthcare, insurance, transportation, productivity tools, IT departments, etc.
sessions.description: AI developers often face issues such as high costs, hardware shortages, and inefficient scaling. Flexible GPU cloud solutions can address these problems by offering on-demand access to high-performance GPUs, reducing capital expenditure, and allowing dynamic scaling based on workload.

sessions.title: Make it Easy with Nutanix GenAI Inference (Presented by Nutanix)
sessions.speakers: Mikey Barmonde (Sr. Product Marketing Manager, AI, Nutanix)
sessions.points:
1. Understand Holoscan as a horizontal platform to solve real-time sensor processing challenges
2. Learn how to use relevant tools to address vertical challenges
sessions.description: As your business attempts to pivot and adopt generative AI (Gen AI), ask yourself: are you ready? Explore the integration of NVIDIA AI Enterprise with NIM inside Nutanix Enterprise AI (NAI) as a microservice platform powerhouse to easily deploy, monitor, and adapt Gen AI anywhere under your control, on-premises to the public cloud. Allow traditional IT personnel to become AI resources quickly, making it simple to manage, easy to secure, and predictable to budget without per-API or per-token costs.

sessions.title: HCLTech’s GenAI platform – AI Force accelerates software engineering and IT operations life cycle with NVIDIA AI Enterprise (Presented by HCLTech)
sessions.speakers: Gopal Ratnam (VP, Product Management, Generative AI Products and Platforms, HCLTech)
sessions.points:
1. Healthcare is ready and eager for the next wave of digital transformation, and needs technology leaders to drive it
2. Large language models are easy to leverage and have healthcare-appropriate guardrails for safety, bias, confidentiality, and security
sessions.description: Software engineering and operations management across industries face several challenges, including poor code quality, long testing times, delayed deployments and extended resolution times. HCLTech’s flagship GenAI platform – AI Force has been instrumental in driving service transformation for customers across industries. Now, with the integration of NVIDIA AI Enterprise (NVAIE), AI Force is accelerating cloud native applications development, modernization and migration of legacy applications, software testing, applications support, infrastructure and business process operations. The platform is enabling enterprises with enhanced productivity, improved quality and faster time-to-market.

sessions.title: Smarter, Not Bigger: How Small Language Models With RAG and Fine-Tuning can Deliver Better Results at Lower Cost with Red Hat AI (Presented by Red Hat)
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Tushar Katarki (Sr. Director of Product Management, Red Hat)
sessions.points:
1. Thought leadership from VCA members on fundraising strategies
2. Promote VC to startup connections
sessions.description:
Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) helps align Gen AI apps to customer use cases, but large models can be expensive, and RAG has limitations. We’ll explore how Red Hat AI can provide a better approach with RHEL AI and OpenShift AI:

•	Fine-tune smaller language models with customer datasets for better accuracy and lower costs 
•	Introduce LAB: Large-Scale Alignment for ChatBots, a novel approach for instruction alignment and fine-tuning 
•	Achieve significant cost reduction with RAG + LAB-tuned small language models

We'll demo LAB and discuss real customers who've benefited from this approach with Red Hat AI and OpenShift AI.

sessions.title: Mass Capacity Storage: Storing Infinite Potential in the AI Era (Presented by Seagate Technology)
sessions.speakers: Praveen Viraraghavan (Technologist, Products and Markets Organization, Seagate Technology)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how dynamic GPU allocation enables matching demand with capacity
2. Hear from our experience utilizing this to maximize utilization of GPUs in our public cloud
sessions.description:
With the exponential growth of computing power, more resources have become available for applications requiring complex calculations. Developers have better access to the same robust computing ability thanks to the cloud, while open-source platforms and technologies greatly accelerate application development. This potentially life-changing level of innovation and revolutionary technology will lead to more and better AI models and, in turn, more reliable applications. These pivotal innovations will exist on a foundation of data storage.  

After all, data centers uphold data. Data upholds Al. Al upholds our next era. As always, Seagate remains focused on storage innovation. We empower operators with new technological capabilities, applications, and industry categories through products that maximize scale and optimize total cost of ownership. At this inflection point, partnering with customers and the Al ecosystem is crucial, and we’re poised to capture exciting opportunities.

sessions.title: NVIDIA 开创 AI 计算网
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Large Language Models (LLMs)
sessions.speakers: Libo Ma (Head of China Networking Marketing, NVIDIA) | Qingchun Song (Sr. Director of NVIDIA Networking APAC, NVIDIA) | Gaofeng Feng (Sr. Technical Marketing Director of NVIDIA Networking, NVIDIA) | Dennis Cai (VP of Engineering, Head of Network Infrastructure, Alibaba Cloud) | Shan Ding (Head of Networking, Bytedance) | Ran Zheng (Distinguished Architect, Baidu) | Yu Kong (Infrastructure Development Engineer, Kuaishou) | Peiwei Li (Project leader, Samsung R&D Institute China Xian)
sessions.points:
1. How the ads and search industries are evolving; how new models like Gemma (MoE) are helping connect consumers and businesses
2. How MoE models are created, maintained, and optimized by the Gemma teams and their open-source ecosystem, and how to apply these models to search applications
sessions.description: 随着生成式 AI 的兴起，AI 模型的参数规模和数据集快速扩张，对于AI 算力的需求达到了前所未有的程度。NVIDIA 率先针对 AI 工作负载推出了突破性的 AI 网络 - 计算网（Compute Fabric），创新地实现了计算和通信的融合，助力 AI 数据中心走向高性能和无限可扩展，达到了算力和能源的优化平衡，并在十万卡以上 GPU 规模的 AI 集群中得到了验证。在本活动中，我们将深入探讨如何采用 NVIDIA 的 AI 计算网提升超大规模 AI 数据中心的整体性能、大幅降低数据中心的构建时间，助力于全球各大 AI 工厂和 AI 云。

sessions.title: Intelligent Industrial Robotics: From Simulation to Robot Low-Code Deployment
sessions.speakers: Benjamin Blumhofer (Head of Demonstrator Development, German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence) | Martina Hutter-Mironovova (Platform Architect, Yaskawa Europe GmbH)
sessions.points:
1. The technological development of large models has transitioned from the pre-training scaling law to the fine-tuning and inference scaling laws
2. New computing models have led to new computing characteristics in fine-tuning and inference, imposing new requirements on the AI computing power infrastructure
sessions.description: Discover how collaborative robotics transforms industrial environments through NVIDIA Isaac Sim-based vision AI training and Yaskawa robots with integrated NVIDIA Jetson. See how encapsulated "skills," deployed as containers, enable low-code creation of complex robot programs, paving the way for new business models like skill providers and software as a service. Learn how these specialized skills can be combined by AI into intelligent robot solutions based on behavior trees.

sessions.title: Pioneering Construction Innovation with Omniverse
sessions.speakers: Jérôme Loywick (R&D-Innovation Project Manager, Bouygues Construction)
sessions.points:
1. The Future of AI Development: Scale toward larger GPU clusters and higher in-rack density to enhance massive AI computing power and meet the growing needs for training and inference
2. QCT’s Comprehensive AI Solutions: From large-scale training to efficient inference, QCT offers comprehensive solutions. Explore new NVIDIA technologies, which are based on NVIDIA MGX and HGX designs to deliver superior GPU performance and optimized designs for scaling demands
sessions.description: Discover how you can leverage NVIDIA Omniverse to revolutionize building and infrastructure projects, tackling important industry challenges. Building information modeling (BIM) enhanced project efficiency by standardizing use cases such as multi-discipline coordination, visualization, work phasing, and quantity extraction. Now, NVIDIA Omniverse is pushing the boundaries of BIM, enhancing design workflows, fostering collaboration, and improving safety by creating a unified platform connecting BIM, internet of things, site data, computer vision, geographic information system, and other emerging technologies. Learn how this unified platform is already transforming the construction industry:  leveraging OpenUSD and synthetic data generation, we can create realistic assets and hazardous situations to train vision models used to monitor construction sites to check safety rules and improve safety for the workers.

sessions.title: AI Meets Robotics: European Startup Showcase
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Training AI Models
sessions.speakers: Naomi Betz (Sr. Account Manager for Manufacturing and Industry, NVIDIA) | Wolfgang Pointner (Team Lead Future Technologies, Agilox) | David Niedermaier (AGILOX) | Stephan Hotz (Chief Product Officer, Wandelbots) | Lars Beier (Staff Software Engineer, Wandelbots) | Lorenz Wellhausen (Software CTO, RIVR) | Abhilash Nand Kumar (Team Lead, Perception and SLAM, NODE Robotics GmbH) | David Reger (Founder and CEO, Neura Robotics)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the real-world impact of AI research
2. Learn from the journeys of leading AI researchers
sessions.description: Learn how five innovative European startups are developing robotics and automation systems accelerated by NVIDIA platforms to deliver world-class solutions. Learn how their real-world applications are using next-generation technologies at the intersection of robots, sensors, and artificial intelligence. Discover how these innovations are transforming industries by simplifying the development and utilization of autonomous systems across manufacturing, healthcare, and beyond.

sessions.title: Highly Optimized Edge-Compatible Gen AI-Enabled Avatars and NPCs for Education and Entertainment
sessions.topic: Content Creation / Rendering - Media Streaming / Data Streaming
sessions.speakers: Sam Frish (R&D Lead, SoftServe, Inc.) | Ihor Romanovych (R&D Engineer, SoftServe, Inc.)
sessions.points:
1. We'll highlight recent advances in technology and software products embracing this new world
2. AI offers new creative possibilities while also raising important ethical considerations around authenticity and content manipulation
sessions.description: We've experimented with different digital humans and avatars for many years. We've created several unique projects and are willing to share the pros and cons. We'll share the case for kids' education, which brings many challenges, specifics, and possibilities: trunks, ears, cartoonish view and sound, children's voices, and childish tricky questions, with many more tricky topics are on the list. Apps for children face the same business and technical challenges, but the solutions are different. Chatbot-enabled avatars are good for education, but they seem a bit old-fashioned nowadays. We’ll share our experiments and thoughts about what’s beyond avatars and nonplayer characters (NPCs) in EdTech and entertainment. Finally, we’ll share our steps on the road to avatars and NPCs that can be generated with AI, based on photos, images, and text descriptions of kids' favorite physical toys.  Education for children should be bright, fun, and up-to-date, since they are much closer to the future.

sessions.title: The Hidden Driver of Autonomy: Why Remote Driving is Indispensable
sessions.speakers: Esther Daweke (Head of Business Development, Vay)
sessions.points:
1. Importance of Human Data in Fine-Tuning AI: Learn how using high-quality human data after training makes AI models more accurate, safer, and less biased
2. Strategies for Sourcing Diverse Human Data: Discover ways to source and include diverse human inputs, including advice from experts, to make AI better
sessions.description: Discover how integrating teledriving with autonomous driving systems is revolutionizing autonomy. You’ll hear about “assisted autonomy," an innovative solution that addresses complex edge cases through human oversight, bridging the gap toward full autonomy. See assisted autonomy in action, and understand why this approach is a game-changer for autonomous fleets. Gain insights into how addressing edge cases in autonomy through teledriving significantly reduces costs and development challenges. Dive into demonstrations of seamless transitions between AI-driven autonomy and human teledriving, and see how these enable end-to-end driverless operations.

sessions.title: Build Agentic AI Applications With Large Language Models
sessions.speakers: Juan Jose Durillo Barrionuevo (DLI Principal Instructor, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Partnership with NVIDIA: Microsoft Azure collaborates closely with NVIDIA to integrate the latest GPU and networking technologies into Azure's cloud AI infrastructure
2. Optimization and Performance: Azure's end-to-end systems approach ensures optimization and industry-proven performance for AI models
sessions.description: The bar for what AI-powered agents can do has been steadily rising over the past few years. New breakthroughs allow them to not only engage in conversations, but also use tools, conduct research, and execute on complex objectives at scale. This course helps you develop sophisticated agent systems that can execute on deep thought, research, software calling, and distributed operation.You'll gain hands-on experience in designing agents that efficiently retrieve and refine information, intelligently route queries, and execute tasks concurrently using orchestration tools like LangGraph and deployment abstractions like NVIDIA NIM microservices. By the end of the course, you'll be proficient in creating scalable, high-performance agent architectures capable of thriving in dynamic, real-world applications.You’ll learn:Fundamentals of agent systems, including tool-calling, state management, and content pipelines.How to develop concurrent, multi-threaded agents using LangChain and LangGraph.How expert systems can be adapted for real-time data retrieval, processing, and adaptive feedback.How to use NVIDIA NIM and other scalable frameworks for robust, real-world agentic use cases.Prerequisite(s):Familiarity working with LLM-based applications.Familiarity with LLM orchestration frameworks like LangChain.Intermediate Python experience.Certificate:Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth.

sessions.title: Fundamentals of Accelerated Computing With Modern CUDA C++
sessions.speakers: Paul Graham (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Explore the evolving data center landscape in the era of gen AI enterprise development
2. Share insights into data center design, infrastructure considerations and operations/management essential to supporting these mission critical workloads
sessions.description: This workshop provides a comprehensive introduction to general-purpose GPU programming with NVIDIA CUDA®. You'll learn how to write, compile, and run GPU-accelerated code, use CUDA core libraries to tap into the power of massive parallelism provided by modern GPU accelerators, optimize memory migration between CPU and GPU, and implement your own algorithms.At the conclusion of the workshop, you'll have an understanding of the fundamental concepts and techniques for accelerating C++ code with CUDA and be able to:Write and compile code that runs on the GPU.Optimize memory migration between CPU and GPU.Use powerful parallel algorithms that simplify adding GPU acceleration to your code.Implement your own parallel algorithms by directly programming GPUs with CUDA kernels.Use concurrent CUDA streams to overlap memory traffic with compute.Know where, when, and how to best add CUDA acceleration to existing CPU-only applications.Prerequisite(s):Basic C++ competency, including familiarity with lambda expressions, loops, conditional statements, functions, standard algorithms, and containers.No previous knowledge of CUDA programming is assumed.Certificate:Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth.

sessions.title: Efficient Large Language Model Customization
sessions.speakers: Carlos Morais (EMEA Developer Relations Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Discover real-world examples of how AI is being used to solve pressing scientific challenges
2. Understand the practical applications of NVIDIA platforms like BioNeMo and Earth-2
sessions.description: Enterprises need to execute language-related tasks daily, such as text classification, content generation, sentiment analysis, and customer chat support. And they need to do so in the most cost-effective way. Large language models can automate these tasks, and efficient LLM customization techniques can increase a model’s capabilities and reduce the size of models required for use in enterprise applications.In this course, you'll go beyond prompt-engineering LLMs and learn techniques to efficiently customize pretrained LLMs for your specific use cases. We’ll cover how to do this without engaging in the computationally intensive and expensive process of pre-training your own model or fine-tuning a model's internal weights. Using NVIDIA NIM microservices, NeMo Curator, and NeMo Framework, you’ll learn various parameter-efficient fine-tuning methods to customize LLM behavior for your organization.Prerequisite(s):Professional experience with the Python programming language.Familiarity with fundamental deep learning topics like model architecture, training, and inference.Certificate:Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth.

sessions.title: Enhancing Genomic Variant Detection
sessions.speakers: Gaurav Tripathi (Co-Founder and Group CTO, Innoplexus AG)
sessions.points:
1. Get an introduction on the significance of power forecasting for new energy utilization, power grid stability, and the electricity market
2. By leveraging AI-driven methods, Earth-2 delivers high-quality weather forecasting data for photovoltaic power generation prediction around 1,000X faster at a 100X lower cost than traditional numerical weather prediction methods
sessions.description:
The genomics field is rapidly expanding. Efficient, accurate data analysis is critical for applications like drug discovery and precision medicine. Next-generation sequencing (NGS) generates massive datasets that require advanced bioinformatics tools for efficient processing and analysis.

We'll delve into how we leveraged the enhancements that were made possible by NVIDIA Clara Parabricks, a GPU-accelerated secondary analysis software. We'll share a study on 500 WES samples showing how Parabricks achieved 25X faster processing times and identified 9,000 more mutation sites in patients than traditional CPU-based pipelines. We'll demonstrate how to implement this technology, enabling you to benefit from greater precision and effectiveness when analyzing vast datasets.

sessions.title: AI Research Careers: From Research to Reality
sessions.speakers: Tomasz Bednarz (Director of Strategic Researcher Engagement, NVIDIA) | Oya Celiktutan (Reader in AI and Robotics, King's College London) | Steven Travis Waller (Professor, TU Dresden) | Yannis IOANNIDIS (University of Athens) | Peter Coveney (University College London)
sessions.points:
1. Deploying AI safety for high scale user-facing retail applications
2. Benchmarking against standard open datasets and metrics
sessions.description: Hear a panel of pioneering AI researchers share their personal journeys and the transformative impact of their work. Get insights into how their research has revolutionized real-world applications of AI, from generative AI and robotics to digital twins to urban planning, and more. Discover the challenges and triumphs of AI research. Discover the pathways to success in AI research, garnering motivation and actionable advice from those who've shaped the field, ensuring that you'll leave inspired and equipped to embark on your own AI research journey.

sessions.title: Optimize Automotive Site Operations With Automated Vehicle Marshalling
sessions.speakers: Oliver Korfmacher (CSO, Kopernikus Automotive) | Stefan Jenzowsky (Co-Founder & CEO, Kopernikus)
sessions.points:
1. Application Deployment: Learn how to seamlessly integrate LLMs into your infrastructure using NIMs and discover strategies for scaling your applications to handle high-concurrency demands
2. Performance Optimization: Explore low-level model optimizations using state-of-the-art advanced techniques with TRT-LLM
sessions.description: Discover how AI and machine learning are revolutionizing vehicle marshalling in automotive plants and logistics compounds. Learn about the latest advancements in automated maneuvering. We’ll explore how to optimize the use of infrastructure-based sensors and vehicle-to-infrastructure communication. You’ll also see new use-cases in action, such as robotic charging and trained-self-parking. We’ll also explain the challenges of implementation and how automated marshaling compares with a human counterpart. We’ll discuss how this technology is improving safety and efficiency in automotive plants and logistics compounds, and its ongoing potential.

sessions.title: Generative AI for Core Banking
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
