sessions.speakers: Guilherme Cristovao Pombo (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Mantas Armonas (Head of Engineering AI, Temenos)
sessions.points:
1. Learn about the latest release of NVIDIA Triton and how it simplifies scale-out deployment of Gen AI models
2. Explore the different backends that NVIDIA Triton supports, including TensorRT-LLM and vLLM
sessions.description:
Learn about the development and implementation of the first generative AI solution for core banking operations. We'll explore how this technology was created to enhance workflows, user journeys, and query handling, providing a deep dive into the technical and practical aspects of its integration. Discover the innovative semantic layer that converts complex banking data into a format compatible with generative AI, addressing key challenges such as integration with existing infrastructure and maintaining data security. We'll also discuss the collaboration with NVIDIA, which enabled the deployment of this solution on-premises, ensuring robust and efficient performance.

Through this real-world use case, you'll gain valuable insights into the first generative AI application for core banking. Learn from NVIDIA how to optimize model inferencing using tools like NIMs, and understand the steps taken to meet high user-experience standards. We'll show how to leverage generative AI for operational improvements in the banking sector.

sessions.title: Unlocking the Potential of Multilingual Language Models
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Image / Video Detection & Recognition
sessions.speakers: Aitor Aguirre (Head of Language Modeling, Barcelona Supercomputing Center)
sessions.points:
1. Revolutionizing Data Interaction: Understand how NVIDIA's transformer models are changing the landscape of data interaction, allowing organizations to move beyond text and leverage the rich context of unstructured data
2. Scalable Automation: Learn about the scalable and automated processes that transform unstructured datasets into discoverable insights, enhancing the user experience and streamlining workflows across various industries
sessions.description: Hear about the latest advancements in multilingual language modeling, exploring a new family of large language models trained on a massive, diverse dataset encompassing 35 European languages and programming languages. We'll examine the challenges and opportunities in multilingual natural language processing, discussing how these models can break down language barriers and foster cross-cultural communication. We'll dive into the architecture and training of large-scale language models, providing insights into the underlying technology driving this revolution. We'll also show the application of these models in various domains, including translation, cross-lingual information retrieval, and code generation, highlighting their potential to transform how we interact with information and each other.

sessions.title: Enhancing Surgical Efficiency With Concurrent On-Edge AI Algorithms
sessions.speakers: Pieter De Backer (Surgical Artificial Intelligence Lead, Orsi Academy)
sessions.points:
1. Learn about the strategic importance and unique challenges of integrating advanced RAG and search solutions in enterprise
2. Get practical tools and techniques for evaluating enterprise RAG and sematic search systems using advanced techniques such as LLM-as-a-Judge
sessions.description: Join us to explore how four AI algorithms running concurrently on NVIDIA IGX Orin optimize robot-assisted partial nephrectomy. Learn how phase recognition, organ segmentation, anonymization, and augmented reality provide real-time solutions for surgical precision, efficiency, and patient safety.

sessions.title: Preserving a Medieval Tower in Italy Using a Digital Twin Built With NVIDIA Omniverse
sessions.speakers: Chiara Dellacasa (Project Manager, CINECA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how Barclays uses the NeMo Retriever framework to interpret vast, unstructured financial data
2. These models can retrieve specific, real-time market data from large repositories, allowing analysts to generate risk scenarios grounded in up-to-date quantitative data
sessions.description: The Garisenda Tower, located in Bologna, Italy, is one of most famous medieval towers. Similarly to the Tower of Pisa, the Garisenda Tower leans at about a 4-degree angle, requiring constant monitoring. In 2023, unusual movements were detected, leading to the tower being classified as "high risk" for collapse. To improve monitoring in this complex scenario, a digital 3D twin of the monument was developed using NVIDIA Omniverse, in collaboration with the Municipality of Bologna, the University of Bologna, and CINECA. This virtual 3D replica enables a comprehensive understanding of the tower's condition and helps anticipate critical scenarios, allowing for the planning of appropriate countermeasures. Real-time data streams generated by numerous sensors are integrated in the centralized platform for data visualization, and predictive modeling, to develop targeted, efficient strategies to ensure the tower's long-term stability and safety.

sessions.title: Empowering Innovation: Startups Enabling Scientific Breakthroughs
sessions.speakers: Pierre-Antoine Beaudoin (Inception Community Manager, NVIDIA) | Pierre Salvy (CTO, Cambrium) | Yann Lechelle (Probabl) | Hannah Bull (Amphitrite)
sessions.points:
1. Building the Foundation for AI: A comprehensive guide to data center infrastructure with ASUS solutions
2. Gain a Competitive Edge with ASUS: Streamline operations from deployment to production with our solutions designed to maximize efficiency and productivity
sessions.description: Explore how NVIDIA technologies are accelerating scientific breakthroughs in oceanography, drug discovery, and more. Join our panel of leaders from startups across domains as they show how platforms like BioNeMo and Earth-2 are empowering researchers to address critical challenges in climate science, marine conservation, and pharmaceutical innovation. The speakers will dive deep into the technology driving these innovations, including the ways in which computer vision is enabling the characterization of the physical and dynamic properties of the ocean in real time, and how it's equipping open-source communities with the information they need to address society's greatest challenges. Learn how our speakers have used cutting-edge technologies to drive revolutionary change.

sessions.title: Advance Surgical Imaging: Explore Software-Defined Video Pipelines for Enhanced Flexibility and AI Integration
sessions.speakers: Bernhard Fuerst (Principal, Enterprise Ecosystem Architecture, KARL STORZ)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how Holoscan Sensor Bridge reduces input latency and IGX enhances AI computing to accelerate real-time medical AI applications
2. Discover how these technologies are advancing AI-driven surgical guidance, improving real-time decision-making for clinicians
sessions.description: Traditional image processing in surgical systems often relies on specialized hardware, such as field-programmable gate arrays, to handle tasks from sensor data acquisition to image formation. While effective, this hardware-centric approach limits flexibility, scalability, and integration with AI. We'll explore how transitioning to software-defined imaging pipelines addresses these challenges, offering greater adaptability across diverse camera and sensor types while enabling advanced AI-driven capabilities. We'll also discuss the trade-offs between hardware and software implementations, and the transformative potential of NVIDIA’s ecosystem in accelerating this shift.

sessions.title: Navigating the Future: The Impact of Accelerated Computing and AI on Data Center Electricity Demand
sessions.speakers: Laura Cozzi (Director, Sustainability, Technology and Outlooks, International Energy Agency) | Josh Parker (Sr. Director of Corporate Sustainability, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Market Entry and Adaptation
2. Partnerships and Networking
sessions.description: In this fireside chat, Laura Cozzi, Director of Sustainability, Technology and Outlooks at the IEA, will discuss with Josh Parker, Head of Sustainability at NVIDIA, the future evolution of energy consumption in data centres which is being driven by the exponential demand for computing power necessary for the development and deployment of AI. During the discussion, they will also explore the impact of AI in the energy sector as a whole and the benefits and the challenges that AI can bring. Attendees will gain a deeper understanding of the projected pathways for data centre electricity demand and how accelerated computing can ensure the energy efficiency of data centres. The conversation will also cover the implications of the adoption of AI and energy-efficient technologies across the whole energy sector.

sessions.title: Productionize LLMs for Quantitative Analysis of Market Risk
sessions.speakers: Dimitris Emmanoulopoulos (Head of Machine Learning Technologies, Barclays)
sessions.points:
1. NERSC is the mission HPC facility for the U.S. Department of Energy Office of Science and has a large and diverse production science workload with 10,000 users across 1,000 projects from a wide range of scientific disciplines
2. NERSC supports AI workloads through the deployment of systems like Perlmutter, which features over 7,000 NVIDIA A100 GPUs, along with the software and infrastructure to enable efficient model training and inference at scale
sessions.description:
Learn how Barclays uses the NeMo Retriever framework to interpret vast, unstructured financial data — such as earnings reports and regulatory filings — and identify signals relevant to market risk. These models can retrieve specific, real-time market data from large repositories, allowing analysts to generate risk scenarios grounded in up-to-date quantitative data. We also use the NeMo framework to fine-tune general-purpose LLMs, such as Llama 3.1 8B, to our set of hand-curated question-answer pairs to improve accuracy in information extraction pertaining to the modeling of market risk.
 
We run both NeMo and NeMo Retriever on our on-premises GPUs, since the critical nature of the data means our retrieval-augmented generation framework can't be hosted on any cloud services. We'll highlight the latency, throughput, and accuracy improvements obtained by using NVIDIA’s software, as well as the time saved to our market risk analysts.

sessions.title: Venture Capital Reverse Pitches
sessions.speakers: Troy Estes (Developer Relations, NVIDIA) | Cali Chill (Chief Investment Officer, OurCrowd) | Victoria Lietha (Investment Director, Swisscom Ventures) | Javier Nunez-Vicandi (Principal - Digital Medicine Fund, Sofinnova Partners)
sessions.points:
1. Horizon will be the largest academic supercomputer in the United States, and is part of the U.S. National Science Foundation Leadership-Class Computing Facility (NSF LCCF). When it comes online in 2026, the supercomputer will be 10 times as powerful as the current leading academic supercomputer in the U.S.
2. To prepare for Horizon, we deployed Vista, which will serve as a bridge between Frontera, the current NSF leadership-class computing system, and help the community prepare for the new workload that will combine simulation with AI
sessions.description:
Finding the right investor for your startup can be tricky. Venture capital (VC) firms offer more than just funding. They provide mentorship, technical guidance, access to valuable partners and customers, and a range of other benefits. Making the right connections can help your business reach its potential.
Join us to hear four visionary VCs pitch their firms and present their thesis. This event is for founders and business leaders looking to connect with some of the most impactful VCs in the technology industry. You'll also get a chance to request to connect with a VC of your choice for a deeper individual discussion.

sessions.title: A Journey to Improved LLM Serving Performance
sessions.speakers: Vikash Sharma (Product Owner, SAP AI Core, SAP)
sessions.points:
1. NVIDIA GPUs and RAPIDS enable accelerated analytics for network graphs
2. The Anonymized Network Sensing Graph Challenge enables high-performance privacy-preserving network sensing for AI-enabled network protection
sessions.description: Achieve exceptional performance by deploying and serving large language models for your business applications. We’ll demonstrate how we leverage advanced inference techniques and production-ready runtime engines to achieve efficient LLM serving within Generative AI Hub. You’ll learn best practices for optimizing LLM inference performance, as well as how we reduce latency and increase throughput for a superior user experience. Discover how we simplify LLM deployment process and rapidly integrate new LLMs into Generative AI Hub to fuel business applications. Let’s explore how to unlock the full potential of LLMs and deliver outstanding AI experiences for your enterprise.

sessions.title: Accelerate High-Performance Signal Processing Using GPU/CUDA
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Anders Ahlander (Sr. Systems Designer, Saab) | Jacob Lundberg (Systems Engineer, Saab)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how we accelerate the pre-filling phase of long-context LLM inference using an accuracy-friendly fine-grained sparsity attention algorithm and a high-performance token-sparsity attention kernel
2. Learn how we accelerate the decoding phase of long-context LLM inference through block-level sparsity attention combined with KV cache clustering.
sessions.description:
There's a huge potential for transformation of sensor signal processing architectures. We'll demonstrate this by showing a radar signal processing use case. Learn about significant performance gains that can be achieved in a short time when switching from CPU- to GPU-based systems.

Radar systems with phased-array antennas can have impressive detection performance. However, this performance comes with high signal processing demands due to the amount of data produced. The processing is typically embedded, which stresses the requirements for processing efficiency.

We will:
•	Dive into the experience of developing GPU-based systems, highlighting the technical challenges and how they were overcome.

•	Explain the benefits of leveraging the latest NVIDIA libraries such as cuSolver and cuBlas for signal processing filters.

•	Tell you about the over 500% processing gains achieved with GPUs. and how these advances can be applied to all kinds of sensor processing.

Additionally, we will discuss how adopting NVIDIA Holoscan can make it easier to create and manage complex sensor applications, thereby significantly improving engineering efficiency.

sessions.title: Toward a Comprehensive Framework for Evaluating LLMs in Clinical Applications
sessions.speakers: Praveenkumar Kanithi (M42)
sessions.points:
1. Inspirational AI use cases for architecture, engineering, and construction
2. Technical information on the tools and processes used to deliver AI solutions
sessions.description:
Healthcare AI is evolving fast, but how do we know if it's truly ready for real-world use? Benchmarks like MedQA, USMLE, and MMLU don't tell the whole story. And while real-world trials are crucial, they take time — often so long that the AI has already moved on by the time results are in. With proliferating model choices both open (Med42-v2, Meditron-3, OpenBioLLM) and closed (GPT-4, Claude 3.5, Gemini, etc.), we need a structured way to evaluate LLMs quickly and thoroughly, helping us select the right one for specific medical tasks.

That's why we developed MEDIC, a new framework to assess LLMs more comprehensively. It looks at key areas like medical reasoning, ethics, and safety, giving us a clearer picture of how these models might perform in actual clinical settings. We also introduce a novel cross-examination framework that helps detect hallucination, assess coverage, and other metrics for applications such as clinical note generation, among others.

sessions.title: Get Ready for NVIDIA Certification
sessions.speakers: Juan Jose Durillo Barrionuevo (DLI Principal Instructor, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand memory placement and how it affects performance
2. How to extract the most bandwidth from Grace Hopper
sessions.description: Ready to showcase your AI expertise and stand out in the crowd? Join us for an exclusive certification overview session and take the first step toward becoming NVIDIA certified.In this session, we’ll help you figure out which NVIDIA certification best fits your career goals and walk you through the preparation process. You’ll get general exam hints and tips as well as details on exam topics and weightings, recommended training, and practice questions for the following exams:NVIDIA-Certified Associate: Generative AI and LLMsNVIDIA-Certified Associate: Multimodal Generative AINVIDIA-Certified Associate: AI Infrastructure and OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI InfrastructureNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: Accelerated Data Science (Coming Soon)

sessions.title: Scalable Robot Autonomy Everywhere, All the Time, with Vision and AI 3D Perception
sessions.speakers: Amir Bousani (Co-Founder and CEO, RGo Robotics)
sessions.points:
1. Batch ETL workloads can be accelerated with GPUs for cost savings, performance and data center footprint power reduction
2. Explore how to configure the RAPIDS Accelerator for Apache Spark for best performance
sessions.description: Get an in-depth look at how a 3D perception solution based on vision, sensor fusion, and AI is revolutionizing autonomous mobile robots (AMRs) in real-world applications. We'll dive into how these technologies are solving critical challenges in autonomous robot navigation and site commissioning, and how they enable quick integration of advanced AI capabilities. We'll share best practices, insights, and lessons learned to help you quickly bring to market an autonomous robot based on vision and AI perception software, to streamline commissioning of new site with 3D global map. You'll also learn to leverage existing and developing AI capabilities like object recognition, natural language interaction, and large foundation models to accelerate development, enhance performance, and give your robotic solution a competitive advantage.

sessions.title: AI-Driven Code Evolution: Unlocking Next-Level Performance
sessions.speakers: Michail Basios (CTO, TurinTech AI)
sessions.points:
1. Explore new vision-based AI applications for safety, designed to protect humans in industrial settings by offering proactive solutions to prevent serious accidents
2. Understand the development stacks required to enable AI safety systems to run effectively on NVIDIA IGX edge devices or similar, allowing for immediate and localized decision-making
sessions.description: As AI-generated code becomes more prevalent, developers face the challenge of optimizing that code for specific hardware environments, particularly NVIDIA GPUs. Learn how context-aware AI code optimization is crucial for improving runtime performance, energy efficiency, and scalability in GPU-accelerated systems. We'll delve into techniques for adapting code to leverage NVIDIA’s unique parallel processing capabilities, enhancing performance across AI workloads while minimizing bottlenecks.

sessions.title: From Lab to Market: How Poland’s Research-Startup Ecosystem Drives AI Innovation
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - 3D Animation and Modeling
sessions.speakers: Troy Estes (Developer Relations, NVIDIA) | Marek Cygan (Chief AI Officer and Co-Founder, Nomagic) | Aleksandra Przegalinska (Associate Professor and VP, Kozminski University)
sessions.points:
1. Streamlined 3D Workflows: OpenUSD on Omniverse resolves inconsistent 3D file formats and enables seamless data exchange, activating enterprise data assets and expanding global reach.
2. Enhanced Collaboration: OpenUSD supports version control and collaborative workflows for large-scale 3D design projects across global teams.
sessions.description: A unique aspect of Poland’s vibrant technology ecosystem is the relationship between research institutions and startups. The innovative and important technology developed in research institutions is quickly spun up into successful startups — often by the researchers themselves. We'll explore this effective model through real-world examples and discuss how it has not only built momentum for Poland to be the world’s next major technology hub, but also how other markets can replicate this process for their own success. Aimed at startup founders, university leaders, investors, and policymakers, this discussion will uncover how Poland’s approach can serve as a blueprint for fostering innovation ecosystems worldwide.

sessions.title: Leverage Computer Vision for High-Fidelity Scene Detection and Actionable Insights
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Vision Language Models (VLMs)
sessions.speakers: Jay Prasad (CEO, Relo Metrics) | Matthew Goodman (Founder & Principal, GoodGame Advisory)
sessions.points:
1. Key technologies for embodied intelligence: multimodal information fusion, intention alignment under uncertainty, reflexive evolution of embodied agents, safety and trustworthiness in embodied intelligence applications
2. How does embodied intelligence empower branch service robots in the financial industry and enhance service quality?
sessions.description: In this session, Relo Metrics will share how their computer-vision models leverage NVIDIA NV-CLIP NIMS (a multi-modal embeddings model for image and text). These models are used to run placement analysis across various rights holders and sports. But Relo Metrics takes it a step further and runs logo detection for brand measurement and impact — key return-on-investment measures important to brands, agencies, and rights holders. Relo Metrics will also demo the next evolution of agentic AI use cases for the company, exploring video summarization, AI agents, and machine learning intelligence.

sessions.title: Leveraging Large Model-Based Embodied Intelligence to Enhance Financial Service Robots
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: JIANZONG WANG (Deputy Chief Engineer, Ping An Technology)
sessions.points:
1. Overview of GB200 NVL72 and its programming model, including multi-node NVLink
2. Low-latency inference for large models exploiting features of GB200
sessions.description: Multimodal large models-based embodied intelligence, which integrates cognitive and reasoning abilities with interaction in the physical world, allows agents to perceive, plan, and act in real world. In the financial services industry, where human interaction and data management are critical, embodied intelligence offers new opportunities and challenges. We have exploited multimodal model-based embodied intelligence to enhance branch service robots in the financial industry and optimize the assessment of insurance claims. These implementations were powered by training multimodal models on NVIDIA data center GPUs. With the NeMo, we achieved an acceleration of 20-25% in model training. ISAAC and Omniverse tools enabled us to perform virtual environment simulations and modeling, while TensorRT provided inference acceleration for deployment on Jetson platforms. Our practices have been employed in the financial industry, improving customer Net Promoter Scores and reducing operational costs by approximately 10%.

sessions.title: How Walmart Uses RAPIDS to improve efficiency, and What We've Learned Along the Way
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Large Language Models (LLMs)
sessions.speakers: Richard Ulrich (Associate Fellow II, Walmart)
sessions.points:
1. How and why OpenAPI specifications (OAS, formerly known as Swagger) became the standard interface between AI and software systems
2. Why OAS in their current form are insufficient for integrating AI applications to software systems
sessions.description: Walmart has been involved with RAPIDS for almost a decade, guiding and helping to evolve the open-source accelerated data processing community. We'll describe the journey taken with RAPIDS data processing, including how RAPIDS helped us reduce our operating costs, enabled faster time-to-decision-making, and improved our ability to scale our data compute. We'll discuss how we leverage the range of RAPIDS libraries, from the core libraries to higher-level libraries like Dask RAPIDS and RAPIDS for Apache Spark. This talk will describe our learnings on when to apply the right RAPIDS library for different problem spaces.

sessions.title: Low-Precision Inference in vLLM
sessions.speakers: Lucas Wilkinson (Principal HPC Engineer, Neural Magic) | Tyler Michael Smith (Technical Director, Neural Magic)
sessions.points:
1. Generate a domain-specific synthetic dataset using a synthetic data generation (SDG) tool
2. Process the generated synthetic dataset to mine hard negative samples to fine-tune the embedding model
sessions.description:
vLLM, now the de facto standard for open-source LLM serving, plays a pivotal role in driving the widespread adoption of open-weight LLMs. As enterprises and the broader community seek to reduce deployment costs and maximize inference performance, optimizing model execution time becomes essential. We'll explore how vLLM achieves significant performance gains, focusing on the quantized linear layers that deliver dramatically faster inference.

We'll deep dive into the implementation and performance of vLLM's quantized linear layers, explaining how they enable both compute speedup and memory compression. We'll examine the computational regimes where different quantization strategies excel and relate that to different real-world LLM inference server workloads. Finally, we'll look at some of the advanced optimizations in vLLM’s mixed-input Machete kernels, implemented via NVIDIA CUTLASS, and discuss how these innovations pave the way for high-performance LLM serving.

sessions.title: Maximize Contact Center Efficiency With NVIDIA AI: Boost First-Call Resolution and Cut Handle Time
sessions.speakers: Nilesh Kumar (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Swapnil Belhe (Chief AI Architect, Wipro Ltd.)
sessions.points:
1. Learn about the range of capabilities of NVIDIA's platforms for developing and deploying a diversity of accelerated, edge-AI medical applications
2. Understand the architecture of Holoscan hardware to enable low-latency, edge AI workflows for multi-sensor applications
sessions.description: Explore how Wipro Healthcare Process Solutions (WHPS) is leveraging NVIDIA’s AI technology to transform its contact center operations. We'll show how implementing AI-driven solutions increased first-call resolution from 84% to 92% and reduced average handle time by 20%. By using NVIDIA NeMo and Riva, WHPS has deployed an AI agent-assist system that supports human agents, achieving an initial 10% reduction in live agents, and is now transitioning to a fully AI-powered virtual assistant. Gain insights into the deployment process and the strategic benefits of using NVIDIA technology in customer service operations.

sessions.title: Advancing the Frontier of Medical Devices with Physical AI
sessions.speakers: Prerna Dogra (Senior Manager for Healthcare AI Products, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Best practices in refining workflow with data ingestion, processing, and transformation with NVIDIA RAPIDS
2. Creating and capturing data elements for feature engineering, model training, and model inference
sessions.description: The healthcare sector is evolving rapidly, with medical devices, treatment facilities, and operating rooms transitioning toward fully robotic systems. We'll address the vital role of physical AI — models designed to understand, interact, and navigate within this new paradigm. Delve into the comprehensive workflows across training, simulation, and runtime that underpin these technological advances. We'll explore how platforms like MONAI, Omniverse, Isaac Lab, and Holoscan are critical in developing next-generation medical devices. These tools create a robust ecosystem for innovation, empowering you to lead in the transformation of healthcare. Join us to enhance your skills and contribute to the future of medical technology, where intelligent robotic systems are the norm.

sessions.title: Harness AI Agents to Strengthen and Scale Security Operations
sessions.speakers: Patrick Crennen (Sr. Director of Cybersecurity Product Development, Visa, Inc.)
sessions.points:
1. Uncover the critical role of simulated scenario models in empowering organizations to strategically and efficiently scale into new markets, enhancing their competitive edge before making a physical presence
2. Gain insight into the transformative power of generative AI in training autonomy systems to proactively identify and mitigate potential hazards, ensuring safety and reliability before issues arise
sessions.description: AI agents are transforming cybersecurity operations across security operations center (SOC) and application security teams by enhancing efficiency, accuracy, and responsiveness. Learn how Visa is integrating autonomous AI agents into cybersecurity operations and SOC workflows to streamline threat detection, automate event triage, and empower analysts to focus on high-priority incidents. Gain insights into the practical challenges and solutions involved in deploying these agents inside your operations, including strategies for balancing performance, scalability, and cost-efficiency

sessions.title: Advancing Driving and Vehicle Safety by Harnessing AI, Data, and Software
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Large Language Models (LLMs)
sessions.speakers: Erik Coelingh (VP of Product, Zenseact) | Alwin Bakkenes (VP and Head of Software Engineering, Volvo Cars)
sessions.points:
1. Discover how connecting and refining healthcare data is crucial for driving the next wave of technological advancements in drug development and care delivery
2. Learn how biopharma and MedTech companies leverage real-world data and AI solutions to spearhead the next breakthroughs in healthcare
sessions.description: Join Volvo Cars and Zenseact for a technical deep dive into their journey toward a software-defined technology stack. Learn how they tackled architectural challenges, leveraged deep learning to enhance driver assistance systems, and optimized iterative development cycles to deliver scalable, safety-critical solutions. Gain practical insights into deploying advanced technologies that drive innovation in vehicle safety.

sessions.title: Get Ready for NVIDIA Certification
sessions.speakers: Aeshah Hadges (Certification Program Manager, NVIDIA) | Gary Fluitt (Technical Certification Manager, NVIDIA) | Marco Alves (Technical Certification Lead, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn about different NVIDIA certifications
2. Find out which NVIDIA certification best fits your career goals
sessions.description: Ready to showcase your AI expertise and stand out in the crowd? Join us for an exclusive certification overview session and take the first step toward becoming NVIDIA certified.In this session, we’ll help you figure out which NVIDIA certification best fits your career goals and walk you through the preparation process. You’ll get general exam hints and tips as well as details on exam topics and weightings, recommended training, and practice questions for the following exams:NVIDIA-Certified Associate: Generative AI and LLMsNVIDIA-Certified Associate: Multimodal Generative AINVIDIA-Certified Associate: AI Infrastructure and OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI InfrastructureNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: Accelerated Data Science (Coming Soon)Once you are ready, you can take any of the certification exams at GTC during the following times:Monday, Mar 17 | 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM and 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM PDTTuesday, Mar 18 | 1:00 PM - 5:00 PM PDTWednesday, Mar 19 | 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM and 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM PDTThursday, Mar 20 | 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM and 1:00 PM - 5:00 PM PDTFriday, Mar 21 | 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM and 1:00 PM - 4:00 PM PDTDon't miss this exclusive opportunity to validate your expertise at no cost. Be among the first to earn your NVIDIA certification and stand out in the competitive fields of AI and accelerated computing.Get certified and secure your invitation to the exclusive NVIDIA Certified Reception on Thursday, March 20th, 7:30 PM – 9:30 PM.

sessions.title: It’s Easier than You Think – Debugging and Optimizing CUDA with Intelligent Developer Tools
sessions.speakers: Mahender Hari (DevTools Product Managment, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Harnessing Cutting-Edge GPUs for Financial Innovation: Learn how CoreWeave’s infrastructure delivers Jane Street reliable access to the latest NVIDIA GPUs, enabling rapid training and fine-tuning of AI models to drive innovation in financial markets
2. Scaling Infrastructure for Demanding AI Workloads: See how CoreWeave proactively builds out GPU capacity and optimizes data center designs, including liquid cooling and RDMA networking, to meet the unique challenges of large-scale workloads
sessions.description: CUDA applications running on NVIDIA GPUs, such as Gen AI, are some of the top-performing workloads running today. Unlocking this performance doesn't require expert knowledge of the hardware as long as you have the right tools for the job. We'll start with a brief overview of the tools available for free, and then dive deep on the latest features that provide even more insights into application behavior and performance. These include new optimization recipes for cluster-scale GPU workloads, a timeline for key kernel performance metrics, and source comparison features to show exactly how and why source modifications impact performance. Additionally, debugging tools have added several improvements to make bug detection and correction easier. Learn how to unlock the performance potential of CUDA applications.

sessions.title: Future Proofing AI Factories with Sustainable Computing and Private AI
sessions.speakers: Justin Dustzadeh (Chief Technology Officer, Equinix)
sessions.points:
1. An understanding of the urgency and challenges arising from the rapid adoption of AI technologies
2. Key insights into why private AI is essential for organizations looking to leverage AI's power while maintaining control over sensitive data
sessions.description:
With the growing adoption of AI, organizations are navigating a complex AI landscape shaped by unique business needs, data residency, privacy, and regulatory requirements. To address these challenges, many enterprises are shifting towards a distributed infrastructure for AI, with data and compute spanning private infrastructure and public clouds. In such a distributed environment, many enterprises require a private AI deployment that can deliver the highest level of data privacy and control over their AI operations, while also focusing on sustainability.

We will explore how organizations are navigating the complex AI landscape, maintaining the highest level of data privacy and control over their AI operations, while still prioritizing sustainability.

sessions.title: Domain-Adaptive Pre-Training: Tailoring LLMs for Specialized Applications
sessions.speakers: Aastha Jhunjhunwala (Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Sugandha Sharma (Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Janaki Vamaraju (Deep Learning Architect and Scientist, NVIDIA)
sessions.description: In this hands-on lab, explore an end-to-end approach for building domain-specific large language models. Learn how to curate domain-specific datasets, design and train custom tokenizers, and execute the pre-training process to tailor LLMs for specialized applications. You'll gain practical skills and knowledge necessary to adapt LLMs to your unique domain requirements and to real-world use cases.Prerequisite(s):Some familiarity with basic deep learning fundamentals.

sessions.title: Level Up Retail Store Security and Customer Insights with Video Analytics AI Agents
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Tracking / Video Analytics
sessions.speakers: Gaurav Saxena (Principal Consultant, Infosys) | Vijay Mehta (Industry Principal, Infosys)
sessions.points:
1. Computer vision, specifically NVIDIA’s NIM NV-CLIP, for multi-modal embeddings model for frame detection, logos, and more
2. Using data science and analytics to calculate real-world ROI
sessions.description:
Learn how AI Agents are deployed using Infosys Video Analytics platform, transforming retail security and deeply understanding customer behaviour to improve loyalty retention, satisfaction, and safety. Using store security feeds, the joint solution can continuously analyse both customer and staff behaviour, detecting anomalous actions, potential vandalism, and potential security concerns in real time. 

We’ll show how our solution, which uses NVIDIA AI Blueprint for video search and summarization, creates in-depth insights into customer traffic patterns, interactions with product displays, and drill times in key store areas. With a query-based interface, staff can retrieve detailed reports on past incidents and track shopping trends over time, all while maintaining privacy compliance. 
This comprehensive application of AI Agents will drive a safer, smarter shopping environment, prevents losses from thefts, and enables retailers to optimize store layout and marketing strategies based on actionable insights.

sessions.title: Bending Scaling Laws with Brighter Algorithms
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Large Language Models (LLMs)
sessions.speakers: Yejin Choi (Senior Research Director, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Democratizing Digital Access: Enhancing engagement in native languages for all citizens
2. Efficient Training Processes via NVAIE: NVIDIA’s frameworks boost training efficiency for high-quality AI solutions
sessions.description: Scaling laws tell us "more is more" — that brute-force scaling of data and compute smoothly enhances AI capabilities. Yet, in reality, this path is becoming increasingly unsustainable, which calls for algorithmic innovations to bend the scaling laws and accelerate progress. I will present our recent efforts in this spirit, including gradient-based methods for enhancing synthetic data, symbolic search algorithms for supercharging test-time reasoning, and test-time training that enables continuous model learning and adaptation.

sessions.title: No-Limits AI With Lenovo Neptune Cooling (Presented by Lenovo)
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - AI Policy / Trustworthy AI
sessions.speakers: Vinod Kamath (Distinguished Thermal Engineer, Lenovo) | Rick Moore (Head of CTO Innovation and AI Enablement, Digital Realty) | Mike Sabotta (Solution Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Host a conversation exploring how diversity in AI development fosters more inclusive and impactful outcomes, and share stories of AI innovation and resilient leadership through diversity
2. Create a unique space for women in AI and technology to hear, ask questions, and network with peers at the leading AI company in the world
sessions.description: Forty percent of a typical data center's energy consumption comes from cooling, and AI is a power-hungry workload. How can more organizations benefit from high-performance, powerful AI compute with greater energy efficiency? Hear strategies and solutions that can meet the increasing compute demands of AI while addressing energy efficiency through innovative thermal management. Thermal challenges are an unavoidable outcome to rapid innovation of the GPU to serve AI workloads. Liquid-cooled solutions are being deployed into next-gen AI factories to deliver performance improvements and energy savings. Learn about Lenovo’s expertise and consistent DNA of liquid-cooled designs since 2012, enabling no-limits AI and helping meet your sustainability goals.

sessions.title: Revolutionizing Merchandising With Digital Twin Tools: Enhancing Retail Strategy and Visualization at Lowe's
sessions.speakers: Mason Sheffield (Senior Director, Lowe's)
sessions.points:
1. Leveraging Generative AI for Support Automation: Learn how Uber’s NOVA assistant uses advanced AI techniques like RAG to deliver personalized, context-aware support at scale
2. Cost Efficiency and Scaling Impact: Discover how NOVA drives significant cost savings by automating customer interactions, reducing the need for agent intervention, and improving overall operational efficiency
sessions.description: Dive into the transformative role of digital twin technology in retail merchandising. Discover how advanced Omniverse-driven technology can create dynamic, data-driven visualizations and simulations of store layouts, product placements, and customer behavior. We'll cover key strategies for optimizing merchandising decisions, reducing time-to-market, enhancing customer engagement, and improving labor optimization using digital twins. Gain insights on how to leverage these tools to drive innovation and efficiency in retail spaces

sessions.title: Accelerate AI Innovation and Broaden Access to Resources Through the National AI Research Resource (NAIRR) Pilot
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Tracking / Video Analytics
sessions.speakers: Katerina B. Antypas (Director of the Office of Advanced Cyberinfrastructure, National Science Foundation)
sessions.description: Katie will present an overview of the National AI Research Resource (NAIRR) pilot, a public-private partnership aimed to drive innovation and national competitiveness by supporting novel research and reaching broad communities. The pilot, launched in January 2023, involves 12 agencies and 26 nongovernmental partners, offering resources such as access to cloud computing, advanced computing platforms, models, and datasets. Katie will make clear the broad eligibility for the NAIRR pilot program, which includes researchers and educators from U.S.-based institutions including universities, nonprofits, and small businesses with federal grants.

sessions.title: Best Practices to Implement Your AI Strategies in the Enterprise
sessions.speakers: Anne Hecht (Sr. Director of Product Marketing, Enterprise Products, NVIDIA) | Andrew McMullan (Chief Data and Analytics Officer, Commonwealth Bank of Australia)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how to verticalize a domain, looking at telecommunications as a complex example
2. Get a better understanding of technology limitations and how you can bridge the gaps, creating a future ready, multi-LLM scalable architecture
sessions.description: Enterprises struggle to implement generative AI, but are looking to transition to full-scale production for cost savings and new revenue models. Reliability, security, and scalability are crucial for mission-critical AI applications. We'll explore best practices for implementing AI strategies, highlighting AI's value and potential impact. Learn how customers leverage NVIDIA AI Enterprise, which includes NVIDIA NIM and NVIDIA NIM Agent Blueprints, to gain insights on challenges, lessons, and best practices for all stages of the AI journey.

sessions.title: Transform an Enterprise Data Platform With Generative AI and RAG
sessions.topic: Cybersecurity - Accelerated Computing / AI for Security
sessions.speakers: Nave Algarici (Generative AI Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Sean Sodha (Sr. Software Product Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand how multi-modal AI Agents leverage a combination of technologies like natural language processing, generative AI, and machine learning to deliver comprehensive threat detection and mitigation strategies for enterprise-scale environments
2. Gain insights into real-world use cases that illustrate how AI-driven agents can automate threat intelligence, manage vulnerabilities, and provide proactive defenses, ensuring enterprises stay ahead of evolving cyber threats
sessions.description: Trillions of PDF files are generated every year, each file likely consisting of multiple pages filled with various content types, including text, images, charts, and tables. Learn how generative AI and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) is enabling enterprises to extract massive volumes of data to quickly empower employees with valuable expertise.

sessions.title: 007 Evaluations for Your Customer Assistant LLM Agent: No Time for Hallucinations
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Programming Languages / Compilers
sessions.speakers: Dmitry Mironov (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Sergio Perez (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Ziv Ilan (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Discover the technologies — such as CuPy, Numba, cuda.cooperative, and nvmath.device — that enable you to write efficient CUDA kernels natively in Python
2. Understand the best practices to adopt and common pitfalls to avoid
sessions.description: Evaluate and optimize an LLM customer assistant, ensuring it performs robustly, accurately, and with no hallucinations in real-world scenarios. Leverage the NeMo Evaluator Microservice to create unit tests to track Gen AI model quality continuously during the development:Optimize accuracy in your local languages for multilingual deployments and AI sovereignty.Employ LLM-as-a-judge to ensure truthfulness and toxicity.Evaluate end-to-end RAG applications.Master techniques for visualizing evaluation results, and use these insights to make informed decisions and improvements to your LLM agents. You'll have access to a k8s deployment of NeMo Microservices pipeline and NIM, which will be ready for experimentation.Prerequisite(s):Basic understanding of LLMs.Basic understanding of evaluations.Python.

sessions.title: Accelerating ROS 2 Workloads With NVIDIA GPU-Powered Libraries and AI Models
sessions.speakers: Swapnesh Wani (Senior Systems Software Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Innovation and Product Development: Explore how Generative AI can foster innovation and enhance product development.
2. Operational Efficiency and Customer Experience: Discover how AI can boost operational efficiency, personalize customer experiences, and strengthen decision-making processes.
sessions.description: Learn how to accelerate ROS 2 workloads using NVIDIA’s latest GPU-powered libraries for AI and robotics. This hands-on lab will explore how to leverage generative AI and GPU-accelerated ROS 2 packages to enhance robotic workloads in real time. Gain experience with optimizing ROS 2 packages for GPU acceleration, including techniques for improving performance and reducing latency in AI perception, navigation, and more. We'll also demonstrate NVIDIA Isaac's powerful AI and simulation tools, designed for seamless integration with ROS 2.Prerequisite(s):Experience with OpenUSD, NVIDIA Omniverse and 3D CAD software.Experience in Python.Basic knowledge of NVIDIA Isaac Sim and Isaac ROS.

sessions.title: An Introduction to Building Humanoid Robots
sessions.speakers: Jim Fan (Research Scientist, NVIDIA) | Yuke Zhu (Principal Research Scientist / Senior Research Manager, NVIDIA) | Leela Karumbunathan (Sr. Hardware Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Yan Chang (Sr. Engineering Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. The critical importance of training and skills development, as well as the need for greater collaboration between internal experts and external partners.
2. How we approach improving both operational efficiency and service quality, while ensuring the highest levels of regulatory compliance.
sessions.description:
Developers are building more intelligent, responsive, and efficient humanoid robots capable of transforming industries such as manufacturing, healthcare, and retail. NVIDIA is building Isaac GR00T — a platform for developing humanoid robots. 

Isaac GR00T has four parts: robot foundation models for cognition and control, simulation frameworks built on NVIDIA Omniverse and Cosmos, data pipelines for generating synthetic data and environments, and finally — a supercomputer in the robot Jetson AGX Thor. This engaging session will cover the latest advancements in each of the four pillars of the platform built by NVIDIA Research and Engineering through concrete use cases and examples.

sessions.title: Reinvent Warehouses and Distribution Centers With AI-Powered Digital Twins (Presented by Accenture)
sessions.speakers: Prasad Satyavolu (Lead - Manufacturing Americas, Accenture)
sessions.points:
1. Discover groundbreaking advancements in generative AI for filmmaking
2. Understand the challenges in current AI workflows, including directability and visual quality
sessions.description: Join us to explore how KION, Accenture, and NVIDIA are collaborating to modernize supply chains with physical AI-powered digital twins. Learn how advanced AI and simulation technologies streamline facility design, improve productivity, and bring increased agility, safety, and resilience to facility operations.

sessions.title: Accelerate Data Science and Leverage Foundation Models in Digital Biology
sessions.speakers: Neel Patel (WWFO - Clara Healthcare) (Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA) | Gary Burnett (Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn about how to run distributed Spark applications on Kubernetes with Rapids
2. Deep dive into how to set up a Kubernetes cluster that can run Spark applications with Rapids
sessions.description: In recent years, the intersection of artificial intelligence and biology has opened new frontiers in scientific discovery. With the ability to process vast amounts of biological data, accelerated analysis and foundation model approaches are transforming digital biology, uncovering patterns that were previously inaccessible. This training lab provides hands-on experience for how foundation models can be leveraged to analyze biological data, with a single-cell genomics example. Gain a deep understanding of the end-to-end process, from pre-processing and analyzing single-cell data to fine-tuning an LLM foundation model and evaluating its performance. Learn how foundation models can uncover biological insights, while NVIDIA’s platform accelerates the entire process, enabling fast and scalable results. Get an overview of relevant NVIDIA solutions in digital biology, such as Parabricks, Vista2D, RAPIDS, and BioNeMo, and acquire the practical skills to use them to tackle complex biological challenges with GPUs.Prerequisite(s):Basic Python, ML, and dockers understanding.

sessions.title: The CUDA C++ Developer’s Toolbox
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Programming Languages / Compilers
sessions.speakers: Bryce Lelbach (Principal Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Insight into the CUDA Python development model
2. Discover the wealth of CUDA Python-accelerated libraries such as CuPy, cuDF (and its Pandas/Polars support), nvmath-python, and cuda.parallel
sessions.description: Getting the most out of your GPU with CUDA C++ doesn't require writing custom kernels or manually managing storage for everything! Learn about the libraries and techniques that not only make writing CUDA C++ applications easier, but give you better performance. Through examples, we'll explore all aspects of writing modern CUDA C++ software, including heterogeneous memory management, algorithm design, and project setup.

sessions.title: Accelerating AI: Memory's Impact on GPUs (Presented by Samsung Semiconductor)
sessions.speakers: Eyal Pnini (Sr. Director, SoC & Automotive Memory Marketing, Samsung Semiconductor) | Rohit Bhola (Director, Customer Engineering, Samsung Semiconductor) | Jonathan Prout (Director, Memory Business Development, Samsung Semiconductor)
sessions.points:
1. Improve Decision-Making Speed and Accuracy — Gain insights from your enterprise data with intuitive, AI-powered question-and-answer search experiences — all using your high-quality backup data within Cohesity
2. Accelerate Generative AI Initiatives — Get up and running in minutes with a powerful turnkey AI solution, designed for effortless deployment, setup, and use. Save valuable time while keeping things simple. Unlock efficiency and ease with a solution that delivers instant results
sessions.description: The relentless pursuit of AI, high performance computing, robotics, autonomous vehicles, and immersive gaming has pushed the boundaries of what's possible in graphics and accelerated computing. At the heart of this revolution are Samsung's advanced memory and storage solutions that power NVIDIA's GPU architectures today and into the future, delivering exceptional performance, capacity, and efficiency.

sessions.title: Reinventing Smart Manufacturing: How Foxconn Builds and Deploys an AI Workforce
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - 3D Animation and Modeling
sessions.speakers: Dr. Shi Zhe (Chief Digital Officer, Foxconn)
sessions.points:
1. KION and Accenture are developing digital twins of warehouses and distribution centers to simulate and optimize operations, train intelligent cameras and robotic equipment, and identify and resolve operational inefficiencies
2. Real-time monitoring and decision-making through NVIDIA Metropolis ensure continuous improvement in dynamic environments
sessions.description: Join us to explore how AI is reshaping the workforce and how Foxconn is leading the charge in the era of agentic and physical AI. Learn how our developers used NVIDIA NeMo and NVIDIA Omniverse SDKs and APIs to build an AI workforce platform that is transforming our manufacturing and operations. We'll share the steps taken, tangible results achieved and the future vision of the Foxconn AI Factory — a fully integrated AI ecosystem driving innovation and efficiency in manufacturing.

sessions.title: Enable End-to-End AI Infrastructure With ASUS AI Cluster Solutions (Presented by ASUStek Computer, Inc.)
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Large Language Models (LLMs)
sessions.speakers: Peter Wu (CEO, Taiwan Web Service Company) | Joseph Lu (Director of Storage Application Solutions, ASUSTek Computer, Inc.)
sessions.points:
1. Multi-agent systems can be leveraged for complex tasks, reducing cognitive load
2. Live sensor and simulation feeds are incorporated into a multi-agent system
sessions.description: Simplify your AI infrastructure with ASUS integrated cluster solutions. We eliminate complexity by offering a preconfigured and optimized solution that spans hardware and software. Focus on achieving your AI goals with our easy-to-deploy and manage solution.

sessions.title: How AI is Transforming the Way We Create, Personalize, and Share Content
sessions.speakers: Richard Kerris (VP and General Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Get context on why the team created this tool and how it has improved the agent experience, the customer experience, and enhanced efficiency for multiple lines of business
2. Learn the key challenges the team faced in data, evaluation, tooling, and modeling, and how they overcame them
sessions.description:
AI is transforming media production by changing how we create, handle, and share content. It helps artists and writers generate scripts, music, and visual effects. Natural language processing and transformer models are now used to create dialogue and story outlines, aiding storytellers in crafting narratives. In music, AI helps compose new pieces and improve others. For visual effects, it’s being used for tasks such as rotoscoping, adjusting colors, and creating computer-generated imagery more efficiently.

In the realm of media distribution, AI is optimizing content delivery and personalization. Recommendation systems, powered by AI, analyze user data to suggest content that aligns with individual preferences, thereby enhancing viewer engagement. AI is also instrumental in managing digital rights, detecting copyright infringements, and ensuring compliance with licensing agreements.

As AI continues to evolve, it will further disrupt traditional media production workflows, offering new creative possibilities while also raising important ethical considerations around authenticity and content manipulation. We'll highlight recent advances in technology and software products embracing this new world.

sessions.title: Harness the Power of NVIDIA to Elevate SAP's Document Grounding With Joule and Generative AI Hub Integration
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Avatar / Digital Human
sessions.speakers: Atreya Biswas (Lead Architect, SAP)
sessions.points:
1. How to make the education process for kids up to date, bright, and fun
2. How to make the resource-hungry tech more cost-friendly
sessions.description: Large language models excel at generating human-like text, but they often lack the specificity and contextual understanding needed for business applications. Document Grounding, SAP's retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) solution for unstructured data, addresses this challenge by enabling contextual and semantic retrieval across diverse data types, including text, images, video, and audio. By harnessing state-of-the-art, GPU-accelerated models from NVIDIA for multi-modal embedding, re-ranking, speech-to-text conversion, and video processing, Document Grounding enables advanced data retrieval and interpretation, ensuring more accurate and relevant insights from various formats.

sessions.title: The Performance of CUDA with the Flexibility of PyTorch
sessions.speakers: Mark Saroufim (Software Engineer, Meta Platforms)
sessions.description: This talk explores how PyTorch users are also becoming CUDA developers. We'll start with motivating examples from eager, the launch of torch.compile and the more recent trend of kernel zoos. We will share details on how we went about integrating low bit matmuls in torchao and the torch.compile CUTLASS backend. We'll also discuss details on how you can define, build and package your own custom ops in PyTorch so you get the raw performance of CUDA while maintaining the flexibility of PyTorch.

sessions.title: Data Expressways: Unlocking the Full Potential of AI With Next-Gen Networking
sessions.speakers: Gilad Shainer (Senior Vice President Networking, NVIDIA) | Michael Kagan (Chief Technology Officer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. How can small language models (SLMs) be developed?
2. What are key techniques for modern SLM development to make state-of-the-art base and instruct models.
sessions.description: We'll introduce newly announced networking solutions and advanced features that are specifically designed for AI data centers. By showcasing cutting-edge technologies and recent innovations, we'll explore how these developments are set to revolutionize the landscape of AI model training and deployment. These advancements will unlock new levels of performance, driving the next wave of AI advancements and enabling faster, more efficient processing of AI workloads.

sessions.title: Developing Immersive Experiences on Apple Vision Pro With NVIDIA Omniverse
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - 3D Animation and Modeling
sessions.speakers: Arjun Dube (Principal Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Max Bickley (Product Manager, Spatial Computing, NVIDIA) | Jen Borucki (Omniverse Spatial Workflow Developer, NVIDIA) | Connor Smith (Distinguished Software Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Build an Omniverse Kit-based application for integrating NVIDIA NIM microservices
2. Gain hands-on experience in creating real-time, AI-driven experiences that generate high-fidelity OpenUSD scenes in minutes
sessions.description: Join this interactive session with NVIDIA product managers, engineers, and developer relations to explore how NVIDIA Omniverse can be harnessed to develop cutting-edge immersive experiences on the Apple Vision Pro. Learn about the seamless integration of Omniverse with the Apple Vision Pro, enabling real-time 3D collaboration, simulation, and content creation for extended reality applications. Discover ways to maximize performance and visual fidelity in spatial computing experiences.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: DGX Cloud Deep Dive
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Andrew Liu (Enterprise Products) (Technical Marketing Engineering Manager, NVIDIA) | Robert Clark (Sr. Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA) | Peter Cross (Sr. Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA) | Zoey Zhang (Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA) | Pete MacKinnon (Senior Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how to accelerate digital health solution development with technologies like NVIDIA NIM and Blueprints
2. Understand the role of generative AI and its numerous applications in understanding and summarizing clinical data
sessions.description: Connect with the technical team behind NVIDIA DGX Cloud to gain insight into how you can get the most out of the platform. Learn how DGX Cloud, along with other NVIDIA software and partners, can power your next-generation AI application. Come prepared with questions about the infrastructure, orchestration, and software behind DGX Cloud, and learn how to leverage all of these components to do the work you’re looking to do, and how to design and integrate your applications and workflows. Whether you’re just getting started or have been working with NVIDIA for years, this is a great opportunity to learn more about how the platform really works, and how you can harness that for success in your enterprise projects.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Get NVIDIA Certified
sessions.speakers: Aeshah Hadges (Certification Program Manager, NVIDIA) | Gary Fluitt (Technical Certification Manager, NVIDIA) | Marco Alves (Technical Certification Lead, NVIDIA)
sessions.description: For the first time ever, GTC 2025 attendees will have the exclusive opportunity to earn NVIDIA certifications at no cost. Seize this unique opportunity to validate your expertise, showcase your skills, and join the ranks of NVIDIA-certified professionals. Seats are limited and available on a first-come, first-served basis—be sure to register onsite to secure your spot!Why Certify?Validate your expertise in cutting-edge NVIDIA technologies.Boost your career prospects and earning potential.Join an elite community of NVIDIA-certified professionals.Available Certifications:NVIDIA-Certified Associate: Generative AI and LLMsNVIDIA-Certified Associate: Multimodal Generative AINVIDIA-Certified Associate: AI Infrastructure and OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI InfrastructureNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: Accelerated Data Science (Coming Soon)How to Register for an exam slot:Register for the conference.Review preparation materials thoroughly before attempting the exam.Add this session to your schedule.Sign up for an exam slot onsite.Arrive early to secure your spot – seats are limited and fill quickly.Please note the following:This promotion is available to in-person attendees only, and only available at GTC.The last exams will begin at 3:30 PM or 4:00 PM depending on the schedule.Get certified and secure your invitation to the exclusive NVIDIA Certified Reception on Thursday, March 20th, 7:30 PM – 9:30 PM.

sessions.title: Building Semantic Search and Data Mining Applications With GPU-Accelerated Vector Search
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Ben Frederickson (Principal Engineer, NVIDIA) | Corey Nolet (Principal Engineer, ML, Data Mining, and Vector Search, NVIDIA) | Artem Chirkin (AI Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Akira Naruse (Principal Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Manas Singh (NVIDIA) | Mickael Ide (NVIDIA) | Nathan Stephens (Product Manager, Vector Search, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand how the Intelligence Distribution Network will transform AI
2. Realize the benefits of inferencing as close to the edge as possible
sessions.description: The IDC has predicted that by 2025, 80% of all data will be unstructured. Join our interactive session to learn how you can harness GPUs to perform semantic search and data mining at scale on embeddings created from unstructured data. We will dive into the cuVS library and provide an overview of the various databases and libraries that have integrated it to achieve state-of-the-art performance for building and searching vector indexes.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Turbocharge Numerical Computing on GPU and CPU in C++
sessions.speakers: Tyler Allen (Sr. Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Justin Luitjens (Senior DevTech Manager, NVIDIA) | Cliff Burdick (Principal Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Thomas Benson (Principal Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Revolutionizing Education with AI Integration: Discover how universities are reshaping curricula to align with AI advancements, equipping students with industry-relevant skills to excel in the digital economy
2. Advancing Research and Innovation: Learn how partnerships with NVIDIA are driving cutting-edge research in AI, from addressing societal challenges to pioneering breakthroughs in technology and application
sessions.description: MatX provides an open-source, easy-to-use C++ numerical computing library with an interface similar to Python. The same code can be executed on both GPUs and CPUs (ARM and x86) with a single line change. Using MatX frees developers from language details to write clear code without sacrificing performance. In this session you can speak to the MatX developers any questions you have about usage, optimization, and getting started writing GPU-accelerated codes.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Using Digital Factories to Advance Physical AI
sessions.speakers: Stephen David Travers (Director Digitalization, Production System and Automation Technology, Mercedes-Benz) | Oliver Geißel (Sr. Manager Digital Transformation Production Planning, Mercedes-Benz)
sessions.points:
1. NVIDIA Isaac Sim and other NVIDIA Omniverse extensions can be successfully used for space-related simulations
2. NVIDIA Isaac Sim is useful for digital twinning and physics-based simulations, including realistic modeling of perception systems and of controllers
sessions.description: Learn how Mercedes-Benz is utilizing Omniverse to power their digital factories with connected simulation power. This mighty test ground allows for the training and optimization of physical AI within digital factories.

sessions.title: Harnessing AI Agents for Enterprise Success: Insights From AI Experts
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Medical Imaging
sessions.speakers: Rama Akkiraju (VP, AI/ML for IT, NVIDIA) | Clara Shih (VP of Business AI, Meta) | Dorit Levy-Zilbershot (Group Vice President of AI Experiences & Innovation, ServiceNow) | Raji Rajagopalan (VP, Azure AI Foundry, Microsoft) | Rajendra "RP" Prasad (Chief Information and Asset Engineering Officer, Accenture)
sessions.points:
1. AI factory and NVIDIA's role
2. NVIDIA and cloud service providers working together
sessions.description: AI agents and agentic architectures offer significant potential as enterprises move from initial experiments to widespread generative AI deployments. In this session, moderated by NVIDIA’s vice president of enterprise AI and automation, AI experts will share their insights and experiences in developing and deploying generative AI and agentic solutions. They'll discuss the opportunities AI agents bring, real-world enterprise use cases, strategies for building user trust, and the challenges of scaling these technologies across organizations. Join us as we explore the future of AI in the enterprise.

sessions.title: Accelerate the Future of Healthcare: AI-Powered Innovations for Imaging, Digital Health, and Beyond
sessions.speakers: Roland Rott (President and CEO, GEHC Imaging) | Parminder Bhatia (Chief AI Officer, GE Healthcare)
sessions.description: Join Roland Rott, president and CEO of imaging at GE HealthCare, and Parry Bhatia, chief AI officer, to explore how GE HealthCare is transforming diagnostic imaging with cutting-edge AI technologies. Learn how NVIDIA’s Foundational Model Training, Simulation, and Edge AI Platform enable GE HealthCare to enhance diagnostic accuracy, streamline workflows, and improve patient care. Discover AI's role in supporting the detection and treatment of cancers, Alzheimer’s, and cardiac disease, as well as addressing global healthcare disparities. This session highlights how AI-driven imaging is reshaping modern medicine, offering personalized insights and advancing health outcomes worldwide

sessions.title: Vista: The Bridge to a New Era of HPC
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Industrial Digitalization / Digital Twin
sessions.speakers: Dan Stanzione (Associate VP for Research, Texas Advanced Computing Center)
sessions.points:
1. Accurate Data Visualization: Discover how Caltrans uses Trimble solutions to create comprehensive visual datasets that enhance project understanding and decision-making
2. Risk Management: Learn how timely visualization of project data helps identify and mitigate risks early, improving safety and reducing costs
sessions.description: Dan will give a brief update on new capabilities and plans at the Texas Advanced Computing Center (TACC) for the U.S. National Science Foundation (NSF) Leadership Facility and the National AI Research Resource and present some recent highlights from Vista, which is the new system at TACC based on Grace Hopper, and the planned leadership computing capability named Horizon. Then he'll cover some of the main challenges in HPC research and the HPC industry, from power and sustainability to the shifts in architecture toward lower precision, changes in programming model, etc.

sessions.title: Generative AI Model Serving With Triton Inference Server
sessions.speakers: Tanmay Verma (Senior System Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Ryan McCormick (Senior Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Olga Andreeva (Senior Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Neelay Shah (Principal Software Architect, NVIDIA) | Izzy Putterman (Senior Deep Learning Algorithm Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.description: Do you want to learn how to deploy and optimize model serving for the latest large language and generative AI models? Do you have questions on how to maximize throughput or integrate custom business logic into your AI pipelines? Join this interactive support session with Triton technical product managers, engineers, and solutions architects to get direct help and surface your questions, issues, and ideas specific to your use case.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Empower the Federal Workforce With Generative AI: Boost Productivity, Efficiency, and Job Satisfaction
sessions.speakers: Shane Shaneman (Sr. AI Strategist - U.S. Public Sector, NVIDIA) | Lt Col Jack Long (Navy AI Lead, U.S. Navy)
sessions.points:
1. With DataRobot platform and NVIDIA NIM, customers can accelerate business value with turnkey AI solutions
2. Teams can flexibly build and confidently and securely entire AI ecosystem
sessions.description: As generative AI transforms industries across the globe, the U.S. government is poised to harness this technology to empower its workforce, boosting productivity, efficiency, and overall job satisfaction. This panel of esteemed government and industry leaders will explore how generative AI can enhance government operations, streamline workflows, enhance decision-making, and enable employees to focus on more meaningful, impactful tasks. By reducing routine burdens, generative AI has the potential to create a more dynamic and engaged workforce. We'll also tackle the challenges of implementing this technology in a governmental context, such as ethical considerations, data privacy, and regulatory standards. Join us for an engaging conversation on how generative AI can redefine the workplace, empowering a more agile and efficient public sector workforce.

sessions.title: Dell Pro Max and NVIDIA: Unleashing the Future of AI Development (Presented by Dell Technologies)
sessions.speakers: John Chaney (Segment Sales Director, NVIDIA Enterprise Platforms, NVIDIA) | Charlie Walker (Director & GM, Dell Pro Max & Dell Pro Rugged, Dell Technologies)
sessions.points:
1. Accelerated Drug Discovery: Uses generative AI to rapidly generate 3D biomolecular structures and predict drug-to-protein binding, significantly speeding up the drug discovery process
2. Enhanced Efficiency: Provides data-driven insights from gene to function, improving efficiency throughout the drug discovery pipeline
sessions.description: Introducing Dell Pro Max PCs: the ultimate performance laptops and desktops for professionals, supercharged with NVIDIA RTX GPUs. Discover how this powerful duo, along with services, can help jumpstart your AI initiatives and transform the way AI developers, data scientists, creators, and power users innovate. From driving generative AI breakthroughs to enhancing on-premises AI development and unlocking next-level creative productivity, experience cutting-edge technology with seamless security and collaboration.

sessions.title: How You Should Write a CUDA C++ Kernel
sessions.speakers: Georgii Evtushenko (Sr. Software Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Introduction to GraphRAG
2. How to apply on various modality including text, images, videos, etc.
sessions.description: You may think you know how to write CUDA C++ kernels, but are you making life harder than it needs to be? When a custom kernel is the best tool for the job, you want to be sure you're using the best libraries and practices so that you write excellent kernels that are reliable and performant. In this session, that's exactly what we'll teach you.

sessions.title: Realize the Promise of AI Agents as a Workforce Multiplier in Cybersecurity
sessions.speakers: Joel Spurlock (VP of Data Science, CrowdStrike) | Aditya Kapoor (Senior Director of Data Science, Crowdstrike)
sessions.points:
1. Discover how advanced neural network architectures foster sustainable innovation by generating predictive insights that benefit both citizens and public administrations
2. Explore how integrating complex data and ensuring global privacy compliance elevates the functionality and efficiency of smart cities
sessions.description: AI agents will be workforce multipliers in cybersecurity, boosting analyst productivity and accelerating threat detection and response to drive better outcomes. However, building and scaling agent deployments in a performant, cost-effective, and secure way is critical to realizing the potential of agentic systems. This technical presentation will demonstrate how CrowdStrike works with NVIDIA to deliver always-on, autonomous security agents that tirelessly work to safeguard customers by proactively detecting and automatically triaging suspicious activities in real-time. These agents augment and amplify the abilities of existing security teams, helping them bridge the cybersecurity talent gap to better protect their organizations.

sessions.title: Redefining Urban Evolution with Gen AI in Palermo, Italy
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Industrial Digitalization / Digital Twin
sessions.speakers: Marco De Paoli (Founder and Chief Executive Officer, K2K) | Dario Lucantoni (Software Development Manager, K2K)
sessions.points:
1. How to digitalize manufacturing operations with digital twins.
2. How digital twins equip teams with new insights into production and unlock new possibilities in operations
sessions.description:
Explore the transformative power of video generative AI and video analytics AI agents in smart cities, where advanced neural network architectures analyze hundreds of thousands of video streams in real time to optimize urban management, enhance decision-making, and drive sustainable innovation for both residents and public administrations.

We’ll showcase a customer deployment in the City of Palermo, Italy and into the cutting-edge advancements driving the digital industrial revolution and transforming how to extract, manage, and capitalize complex data in urban settings leveraging NVIDIA GPUs, NVIDIA AI Blueprint for video search and summarization, VLMs, and NVIDIA Metropolis.

sessions.title: NVIDIA Inception: The Catalyst Fueling Your Startup’s Success
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Accelerated Computing Libraries
sessions.speakers: Susan Marshall (Sr. Director, Developer Relations, NVIDIA) | Will Koffel (Director, Inception Startup Program, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Rotating slideshow will showcase new features, results, and future developments
2. Experts for each of the mentioned libraries will be present to address your questions, comments, and challenges
sessions.description: For most AI startups, "build it and they will come" doesn't describe what it takes to acquire customers. In a world of infinite alternatives, it takes ingenuity, grit, and committed partners to generate awareness and conversion for your product.

sessions.title: NVIDIA and Lenovo Present: Women in AI
sessions.speakers: Linda Yao (VP, Solutions & Service Group COO and Strategy, Lenovo Solutions) | Nikki Pope (Sr. Director, AI and Legal Ethics, NVIDIA) | Lan Guan (Chief AI Officer, Accenture) | Prutha Parikh (Head of Security, Cohere) | Urvashi Chowdhary (Vice President  of  Product Management for AI Services, CoreWeave)
sessions.description: This event will feature a panel discussion with leading women executives in AI, exploring how gender diversity in AI development fosters a more inclusive and impactful user experience. This is a unique opportunity to connect with industry peers and expand your professional network.

sessions.title: Designing and Simulating Next Generation Data Centers & AI Factories With Cadence and NVIDIA
sessions.topic: Data Center / Cloud - Software-Defined Data Center
sessions.speakers: Kourosh Nemati (NVIDIA) | Sherman Ikemoto (Sales Development Group Director, Cadence)
sessions.points:
