1. Understand NVIDIA's full stack AI platform available in the cloud
2. NVIDIA AI platform integration into cloud services
sessions.description: With the explosion of generative, agentic, and physical AI, the next industrial revolution has begun. Companies and countries are shifting from trillion-dollar traditional data centers to accelerated computing with a new type of data center — AI factories. Join Cadence and NVIDIA experts to learn about the role of AI factories and the challenges in designing, building, and operating these new facilities. Explore how advanced physics-based simulations, powered by Cadence Reality Digital Twin, NVIDIA Omniverse, and OpenUSD, enable data center teams to design these complex AI factories at scale with greater efficiency and optimized performance. Get briefed on how the broader data center ecosystem can support these efforts and the acceleration of AI-powered innovation for every industry and field.

sessions.title: Maximize AI Potential: Unlock Idle GPU Compute and Collaborate Smarter with Z by HP (Presented by HP)
sessions.speakers: Ruchi Bhatia (Product Marketing Manager Data Science & AI, HP)
sessions.points:
1. Boost first-call resolution to 92% with NVIDIA-powered AI, enhancing member experience and service effectiveness
2. Cut average handle time by 20%, leading to improved operational efficiency and reduced agent workload
sessions.description: Reasoning Models have changed the AI landscape by delivering improved performance in real world tasks. As organizations rush to capitalize on open source models such as DeepSeek, infrastructure costs and GPU accessibility remain critical bottlenecks. This session discusses what reasoning models are and demonstrates how Z by HP Boost complements DeepSeek's innovation through intelligent GPU resource sharing. Join us to see how this powerful combination is making advanced on-prem AI capabilities more accessible and economically viable for companies of all sizes.

sessions.title: LLM Inference Performance and Optimization on NVIDIA GB200 NVL72
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Vishal Mehta (Compute DevTech) (Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Inference servers handle diverse workloads, ranging from bandwidth-intensive to compute-bound tasks, requiring targeted optimizations for each
2. Weight compression is essential for minimizing data movement and enabling efficient performance for low-QPS workloads
sessions.description:
In this session, we will dive into the GB200 NVL72 architecture and programming model, highlighting its inference performance on state-of-the-art LLM models.

We will also explore optimizations techniques that enable the 72 Blackwell GPUs to work together through the NVIDIA NVLINK, functioning as one giant GPU.

sessions.title: AI at Scale: Lessons from Capital One’s Agentic AI Adoption
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Profilers / Debuggers / Code Analysis
sessions.speakers: Jennifer St. John-Foster (Senior Sales Manager, North America Financial Services, NVIDIA) | Prem Natarajan (PhD,  EVP, Chief Scientist and Head of Enterprise AI, Capital One)
sessions.points:
1. The state of the art in AI developer tools within and outside NVIDIA is expanding into previously unavailable domains, like accelerated computing.
2. AI solutions to complex, high-value CUDA and other accelerated computing coding problems are becoming tractable, and will grow more crucial as AI coding becomes commodified
sessions.description: Capital One is taking a well-managed approach to scaling enterprise AI in the regulated financial services industry. This fireside chat will discuss Capital One's development and adoption of generative and agentic AI technologies, highlighting key initiatives that balance innovation in customer experience with well-governed and risk-centered approaches. Discover how the company creates differentiated value through proprietary in-house AI development, including real-world examples of deploying multi-agentic systems that combine generative AI with rigorous validation frameworks.

sessions.title: Self-Driving Microscopes: From Malaria Diagnostics to AI-Driven Discovery Platforms for Spatial Biology
sessions.speakers: Manu Prakash (Associate Professor, Woods Institute for the Environment, Stanford University)
sessions.points:
1. Emerging Technologies: Gain insights into the latest advancements in surgical robotics, from enhanced AI capabilities to real-time, data-driven decision-making
2. AI's Role in Surgery: Understand how artificial intelligence and machine learning are transforming surgical planning, precision, and outcomes
sessions.description: Microscopy is at the heart of life science research and diagnostics, with most discoveries rooted in visualizing the spatial context of the living world. Traditional microscopy platforms are bulky, expensive, lack the capacity to operate in real-world field settings, and are closed. Here, we'll present an open architecture and modular robotic microscopy platform that enables many biological explorations, from the jungles in Senegal to discovery of rare organisms living in the ocean. We share examples of real-time AI analysis driven by GPUs enabled in context of diagnosing malaria and tracking carbon sequestration in the open ocean.

sessions.title: Scale Your Apache Spark Data Processing With State-of-the-art Blackwell GPUs for Cost Savings and Performance
sessions.speakers: Alessandro Bellina (Principal Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Sameer Raheja (Senior Director of Engineering, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Gain insights into leveraging NVIDIA microservices, including NeMo Retriever and NIMs, to enhance performance and accuracy
2. Explore how GenAI significantly improved user support by managing over 60% of tickets with contextual AI responses
sessions.description: The RAPIDS Accelerator for Apache Spark is a plugin that enables batch extract-transform-load workloads on GPUs with no code change. It improves performance while lowering cost and reducing server footprint. Learn how users benefit from RAPIDS Spark. We'll deep dive into scaling Spark applications using the NDS benchmark (based on TPC-DS). Our demonstration will feature the Blackwell GPU architecture, a high-speed interconnect (NVLink), a high-throughput data source and fast disks, together as a powerful compute system. We'll demonstrate GPU acceleration in commodity hardware, and provide tips on tuning RAPIDS Spark for optimal performance.

sessions.title: HybridRAG: Make RAG More Accurate by Combining Graph and Vector-Based Retrieval
sessions.speakers: Benika Hall (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Sunil Patel (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Rohan Rao (Sr. Solutions Architect, Enterprise Generative AI, NVIDIA) | Mitesh Patel (Product Marketing Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understanding AI functional safety in safety-critical systems
2. The role of standardization in mitigating risks
sessions.description:
VectorRAG techniques utilize vector databases for information retrieval. We published new retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) where retrieval is applied on graph, called GraphRAG. Hybrid RAG (VectorRAG+GraphRAG) techniques enhance question-answer (Q&A) systems for information extraction from any data modality are shown to be capable of generating the most accurate and contextually relevant answers.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.HybridRAG can be applied to any kind of data, including text, images, videos, etc., in all the verticals. Existing RAG implementation can accommodate the GraphRAG component as well, with little addition.
HybridRAG is flexible, and NVIDIA components like cuGraph, cuDF, NIM, and Raft, have great play in accelerating end-to-end pipelines.

sessions.title: Unlocking Generative AI's Full Potential: Expert Insights for Rapid Innovation and Scale
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Tony Paikeday (Senior Director of Product Marketing, AI Systems, NVIDIA) | Sarah Laszlo (Senior Director, Machine Learning Platform, Visa) | Greg Forrest (Director, AI Foundations, Lockheed Martin) | Parantap Lahiri (VP of Network and Data Center, eBay) | Bill Mayo (SVP for Research IT, Bristol Myers Squibb)
sessions.points:
1. How the hub-and-spoke model enables large enterprises to balance centralized and decentralized AI development for maximum impact
2. Learn the technical architecture of the AI Factory, operating model, and supporting business components
sessions.description: Generative AI is revolutionizing industries by driving operational efficiencies and fueling innovation. Yet, even the most advanced enterprises face significant challenges like infrastructure disruptions, AI workload inefficiencies, and suboptimal resource utilization. Today’s AI leaders need best practices and insights to overcome infrastructure limitations that inhibit enterprise developers. Join industry leaders who've successfully tackled these issues and built their own AI factories to scale development, reduce risks, and accelerate AI application deployment.

sessions.title: Supercharging Ecommerce Revenue and Operational Efficiency using Generative AI
sessions.speakers: Wenzhong Zhang (Founder, DMALL & Wumart Group) | Azita Martin (VP and GM, AI for Retail and CPG, NVIDIA) | Marcus Spurrell (CEO, DMALL International)
sessions.points:
1. Maestro System’s architecture leverages NVIDIA Holoscan and IGX built by Dedicated Computing to deliver unmatched processing power directly at the surgical bedside
2. Designed to accommodate evolving AI developments, the Maestro system can expand its capabilities as new applications are developed and approved by regulatory bodies worldwide
sessions.description: Learn how advanced AI technologies are reshaping retail operations, from automating customer service to enhancing sales with GenAI shopping advisors and optimizing nighttime operations. Discover practical insights into how these solutions improve efficiency, lower labor costs, and enhance customer satisfaction.

sessions.title: Speech AI Demystified
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Programming Languages / Compilers
sessions.speakers: Sven Chilton (Deep Learning Developer Advocate, NVIDIA) | Elena Rastorgueva (Sr. Applied Research Scientist, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. GPUs consume datasets from storage because they're too big to fit in memory
2. Removing CPU overheads is enabled with direct transfers between storage and GPU, sometimes initiated by the GPU
sessions.description: Speech AI technologies such as automatic speech recognition (ASR), text-to-speech (TTS), and neural machine translation (NMT) automate millions of conversations today. They provide customers with a personalized human-like experience through such applications as Virtual Assistant, Contact Center Agent Assist, and digital avatar. We'll review a few inspiring use cases and solutions to common challenges faced by enterprises that are getting started with speech AI. Learn techniques for achieving world-class accuracy and customizing for your industry. We'll also show the latest models, tools, and features in NVIDIA NeMo and Riva, demonstrate sample applications, and illustrate how to build a speech AI pipeline.

sessions.title: Scaling LLMs to Support 14 Million Users while Optimizing Performance and Accuracy
sessions.speakers: Ali el Hassouni (Head of Data and AI, bunq)
sessions.description: Learn how bunq implemented and scaled large language models (LLMs) to support its 14 million users, with a focus on delivering high-speed performance at such a large scale. We encountered several critical technical challenges, including optimizing vectorization, embeddings, reducing latency, improving retrieval processes, and refining prompt generation. This case study highlights the strategies we used to effectively scale LLMs in large-scale applications, utilizing NVIDIA NeMo Retriever and NIMs for enhanced performance and improved accuracy. We'll finish with a forward-looking view on what's next for Finn, offering insights into the future developments and innovations we plan to integrate to further enhance user experience and operational efficiency.

sessions.title: NVIDIA NIM and GPUs With Kubernetes
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Image / Video Detection & Recognition
sessions.speakers: Meenakshi Kaushik (Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Satish Salagame (Director of Engineering, NVIDIA) | Shiva Krishna Merla (Sr. Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Mahesh Yeole (Engineering Manager, NVIDIA) | Christopher Desiniotis (Sr. Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Alexander Petrovskiy (Senior Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Kevin Klues (Distinguished Engineer, NVIDIA) | Francis Guillier (Product Manager (GPU Operator), NVIDIA) | Tariq Ibrahim (Senior Software Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. See real-world examples of AI-powered marshalling systems in action
2. Explore the technology behind automated marshalling
sessions.description: Join NVIDIA technical product managers, engineers, and solutions architects to learn about NVIDIA's offering to use GPUs and NVIDIA NIMs with K8s. This is the session to learn more about the NIM Operator and the NVIDIA GPU and Network Operator. We'll address a wide variety of topics like use cases, integration, and deployment best practices. We’ve also got you covered if you want information about specific feature/functionality, or even how to contribute, as those products are open-sourced. Join us to understand the amazing things we do with K8s!Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Developing OpenUSD Applications for Controllable Generative AI
sessions.speakers: Ashley Goldstein (Lead Tech Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Develop AI models for physics ML applications
2. Scale the AI models for industrial use cases across multiple GPUs
sessions.description: In this hands-on lab, learn to develop an AI-powered application that combines the capabilities of NVIDIA NIM microservices with the NVIDIA Omniverse platform to create real-time, AI-driven experiences. You’ll start by building an Omniverse Kit-based application and then integrate NIM microservices like Edify3D and USD Search, which enables the generation of high-fidelity OpenUSD scenes and are fully controllable, allowing us to produce dynamic, AI-generated content within minutes.By the end of this lab, you'll have hands-on experience in customizing Omniverse applications and leveraging NVIDIA’s AI technologies to push the boundaries of real-time 3D content creation. This lab is ideal for developers and content creators looking to enhance their skill set with cutting-edge tools in the rapidly evolving field of AI-generated 3D experiences.Prerequisite(s):An understanding of fundamental programming concepts in Python 3 such as functions, loops, dictionaries and arrays and Python 3 related libraries.

sessions.title: The CUDA Python Developer’s Toolbox
sessions.speakers: Katrina Riehl (Principal Technical Product Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the evolving landscape of open-source foundation models and implications for the safety and scalability of Gen AI solutions
2. Explore how source-available models can foster ethical innovation, mitigate risks, and ensure data privacy and copyright
sessions.description: Writing GPU code in Python is easier than ever! Gain valuable insight into the diverse collection of CUDA libraries and frameworks that enable significant performance boosts across various computational tasks. Through practical examples, you'll see popular CUDA Python libraries in action, illustrating their effectiveness in real-world scenarios. We'll share valuable tips and tricks designed to help you maximize the performance of your own Python projects. Whether you’re new to GPU programming or looking to enhance your existing skills, this session will equip you with the knowledge needed to leverage the full potential of the CUDA Python development stack for accelerated computing.

sessions.title: Harnessing NVIDIA’s Advanced Tools for Generative AI in Digital Health and Clinical Trials
sessions.speakers: Jin Li (Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA) | Katie Link (Healthcare Solutions Product Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how we leverage NVIDIA technology to power a retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) solution for the SAP ecosystem
2. Gain insights how we enable multi-modality for RAG
sessions.description: This training lab explores the cutting-edge capabilities of NVIDIA's suite of AI tools—NVIDIA Inference Microservices (NIMs) and NVIDIA AI Blueprints—in transforming digital health solutions. Participants will gain hands-on experience in developing sophisticated AI-driven applications that can converse with healthcare data, assist researchers in clinical trials, and enhance clinician-patient interactions. The session will explore NVIDIA-optimized large language models (LLMs) as well as advanced techniques using reasoning and agentic LLM systems. Emphasis will be placed on the practical aspects of deploying these GPU-accelerated technologies and customizing them to specific digital health scenarios.Prerequisite(s):Basic Python and ML understanding.

sessions.title: Refreshing Manufacturing Operations at Coca-Cola Consolidated With Digital Twins
sessions.speakers: Bharath Ramasubban (Senior Director Strategic GTM, Retail and Consumer Goods, Microsoft) | Jon Sobel (Sight Machine)
sessions.points:
1. Enhanced Customer Experiences: Learn how agentic AI can deliver personalized, proactive, and seamless customer interactions
2. Empowered Agents: Discover how AI can assist human agents by automating repetitive tasks, providing real-time guidance, and improving decision-making
sessions.description: Join leaders from Microsoft and Sight Machine to explore how Coca-Cola Consolidated, the largest independent Coca-Cola bottler in the United States, is digitalizing manufacturing operations with digital twins. Learn how Coca-Cola Consolidated teams take advantage of real-time monitoring, collaboration, and physically based visualization capabilities, powered by Azure internet of things operations, NVIDIA Omniverse cloud APIs, OpenUSD, and Sight Machine’s manufacturing solutions to gain new insights into production and unlock new possibilities in operations.

sessions.speakers: Llion Jones (CTO, Sakana AI)

We'll explore how NVIDIA's transformer models and infrastructure are revolutionizing our interaction with computers, enabling us to transform audio and video inputs into deeply discoverable and contextualized knowledge.

sessions.description: Learn how we set out to build a platform that can gather information about an enterprise software system, and automatically generate an interface that allows AI agents and NIM applications to interact with that enterprise system in an accurate, agentic way. We faced many hurdles and deployed advanced AI techniques to solve them, resulting in the ability to equip AI agents with interfaces to any target system.

sessions.points:
1. How to write portable code between CPU and GPU

sessions.description:
As cyberthreats grow more sophisticated, enterprises need advanced strategies to defend against evolving risks. Learn how multi-modal AI, specifically through NVIDIA Blueprints, is being utilized to tackle modern cybersecurity challenges at scale. These agents, combining generative AI, natural language processing, and machine learning, provide a automated and accelerated solution for threat detection and response, and operational efficiency for security tasks.

Key use cases will demonstrate how AI-driven Agents are transforming enterprise security, automating real-time threat intelligence, managing vulnerabilities, and mitigating risks. We'll also announce new products, showcasing innovations designed to enhance AI's role in securing large-scale infrastructures.

This talk is ideal for cybersecurity developers and enterprise leaders looking to leverage AI to strengthen their security frameworks against emerging threats."

sessions.title: Get the Most Performance From Grace Hopper

sessions.points:

We'll highlight recent advances in the Databricks-NVIDIA partnership, including the availability of DBRX as an NVIDIA NIM microservice, empowering organizations to build efficient, governed AI factories on their proprietary data.

sessions.title: Building Intelligence from the Ground Up: A New Path to Embodied AI
sessions.speakers: Deepak Pathak (CEO and Co-Founder, Skild AI)
sessions.points:
1. How to build an agent application
2. How to fine-tune LLM for tool learning
sessions.description: Building general-purpose embodied intelligence has been a core goal of AI since its inception 70 years ago. The field has evolved through multiple hypotheses, beginning with search as a solution, followed by knowledge-based systems, and, most recently, leveraging large language models for robotics. Yet, the challenge of creating generalist embodied agents capable of performing thousands of tasks across diverse environments remains unsolved. Building such a generalist robotic agent presents a "chicken-and-egg" problem: to train agents for generalization, we need vast amounts of robotic/agent data from varied environments, but gathering such data is impractical without deploying robots/agents that already generalize. I propose a new framework that leverages alternative sources of "indirect" supervision to build robotic agents from the ground up. I'll focus on three key principles: (1) How to generate self-supervised data for training robots? (2) How to bootstrap robot learning by observing human videos? and (3) How can robots learn to adapt via large-scale training in simulation? I'll demonstrate this framework's potential for scaling robotics AI through several case studies.

sessions.title: Accelerate AI: Enhance Performance and Efficiency Using Google Cloud (Presented by Google Cloud)
sessions.speakers: Roy Kim (Google) | Mohan Pichika (Group Product Manager, Google)
sessions.points:

sessions.description: We'll delve into the technical innovations that make AI hypercomputer architecture so powerful and discuss how it translates into tangible benefits for AI practitioners. Discover why choosing Google Cloud is the optimal path for running your AI workloads, offering unparalleled performance, scalability, and a comprehensive suite of tools to accelerate your AI journey.

Join influential leaders in clinical trial domain and LLM technology space as they describe how this transformative technology was used across clinical trial process, from design and development to application and deployment at scale.

sessions.title: Connecting Smart Cities to the tourist experience with Agentic AI

sessions.points:

sessions.title: Build and Run Next-Generation AI on Azure’s Proven AI Infrastructure Platform (Presented by Microsoft)

sessions.points:

sessions.title: Crafting a New Automotive Experience With End-to-End Embodied AI
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Avatar / Digital Human

sessions.points:

From 24/7 customer service and interactive e-learning to enhanced video conferencing and scalable corporate training, these AI-driven avatars offer consistent, engaging, and personalized experiences across languages
2. Seamless Integration of Advanced AI Technologies: We'll show how NVIDIA Maxine's speech-driven Live Portrait, Voice Font customization, and Riva's translation services work together to create a powerful, end-to-end solution. This integration allows for real-time animation of 2D portraits with synchronized lip movements, custom voice generation, and instant language translation, all accelerated by GPU technology for optimal performance
sessions.description: Knight Rider. The Batmobile. Herbie. Society has dreamed of automating vehicles for decades, but what does the road to autonomy look like? Alex Kendall, co-founder and CEO of self-driving AI company Wayve, lifts the lid on the embodied AI that's set to supercharge the automotive industry. He'll focus on the technology driving this new era of assisted and automated driving forward: an end-to-end, multimodal foundation model. Learn how this AI will transform the way we interact with our vehicles, and deliver collaborative, safe, and scalable automated driving solutions.

sessions.title: For What the Bell Tolls
sessions.speakers: David Keyes (Founding Dean and Founding Director of the Extreme Computing Research Center, KAUST)
sessions.description: With today’s exascale computers requiring 20-40 megawatts (MW) and some cloud centers exceeding 100MW, and with no slacking of demand in sight, computing is a non-negligible factor in climate change. Today’s market for computing hardware is driven by machine learning applications that can exploit lower-precision arithmetic. Traditional computational science and engineering are therefore being reinvented to employ lower-precision arithmetic and replacement of blocks of operator and field data by low-rank substitutes, where possible without impacting accuracy. We provide examples from various applications, including Gordon Bell Prize finalist research in 2022 in environmental statistics, in 2023 in seismic processing, and in 2024 in genomics and again in climate emulation. The last broke through to capture the 2024 Gordon Bell Prize in Climate Modeling. We'll elucidate the algorithmic “secret sauce” shared by these diverse applications for which the (Gordon) Bell tolls.

sessions.title: Accelerating Generative AI Adoption with AI Factories
sessions.speakers: Giri Tatavarty (VP Data Science & AI, 84.51°) | Kristin Foster (Senior VP  - AI/Data Science, 84.51°)
sessions.points:
1. Customized Earth Observational data collection is becoming more accessible to everyone
2. Remote sensing data is being used to build volumetric models of the planet
sessions.description: We'll introduce a hub-and-spoke model designed to democratize AI across large enterprises, striking the perfect balance between centralized and decentralized AI development. We'll explore the full spectrum — from operating models and governance to technical foundations with the AI Factory and value tracking. We'll take a deep dive into the AI Factory’s technical foundations and showcase how the NVIDIA stack can supercharge AI development and accelerate enterprise-wide adoption. Finally, we'll highlight the tangible benefits of building an AI Factory, including reduced risks, lower costs, and faster time-to-market for business teams.

sessions.title: Advanced Techniques for Inference Optimization With TensorRT-LLM

2. Discover how software-defined pipelines create opportunities for integrating AI algorithms

We’ll go beyond the basics of engine building and quantization with in-depth explorations of why and how to use new techniques like speculative decoding, tensor parallelism, and LoRA swapping with TensorRT-LLM.

sessions.title: AI for Humanoid Robots
sessions.speakers: Pieter Abbeel (Professor, University of California, Berkeley)
sessions.points:
1. Understand how Industry leaders are actively pushing the boundaries of AI, developing groundbreaking solutions that seamlessly integrate with and enhance our physical experiences
2. Learn how real-world AI applications, like self-driving cars, must overcome hurdles such as ensuring robust performance, operating efficiently on edge devices, and undergoing rigorous safety testing
sessions.description: Humanoid robotics hardware is seeing a major acceleration in progress. It's reasonable to expect commercially viable humanoid hardware to exist within three years. The question is, how do we build the AI that can make these robots helpful? Humanoids have high dimensional action spaces and high dimensional multimodal observation space, posing challenges to existing paradigms. We'll explore these challenges in more depth and highlight some promising paths forward.

sessions.title: Advancing Molecular Design with Deep Learning
sessions.speakers: Michael Bronstein (DeepMind Professor of AI, University of Oxford)
sessions.points:
1. High speed end-to-end AI is the future of medical AI systems
2. Building AI systems requires excellence across three computers — simulation, training, and inference
sessions.description:
Prof. Michael Bronstein and Prof. Bruno Correia present an exploration into how geometric deep learning is enabling protein and molecular design. Protein-based drugs, which rely on strong protein-protein interactions (PPIs), are increasingly important in modern medicine. The vast structural data available on PPIs allows machine learning models to operate effectively on proteins' complex, non-Euclidean surfaces.

In this session, Michael Bronstein and Bruno Correia will explore how geometric deep learning methods are advancing functional protein design. Key applications include predicting interface sites, classifying binding pockets, and identifying surface motifs. The talk will also highlight collaborative efforts with the EPFL Lab of Protein Design and Immunoengineering and AITHYRA, a Research Institute for Biomedical Artificial Intelligence founded by Austrian Academy of Sciences.

sessions.description: In the world of generative AI, creating visually stunning and relevant imagery goes beyond simple fine-tuning — it requires a deep understanding of both the technical and creative aspects of image generation. Explore how Getty Images approaches custom solutioning by blending advanced generative AI techniques with visual content expertise. We'll dive into the complexities of optimizing datasets for personalization, the significance of clean foundational models, the tools needed, and the process behind crafting datasets that deliver high-quality results. The audience will gain insights from Getty Images and TriggerXR’s recent collaboration for Sony Pictures and other case studies, including a collaboration with 3D content developer Tafi to build custom models for background generation – all showcasing the intricacies of dataset preparation, customization, and real-world application. By combining technical AI expertise with an artistic eye, we deliver AI-generated visuals that meet the highest standards of quality, creativity, and ethical standards.

sessions.points:

sessions.description: We'll introduce the new-generation TensorCore programming guide, explaining how to build up Blackwell TensorCore GEMM, how to utilize new introduced low-precision TensorCore, how to map the above concepts to CUTLASS, and better utilize CUTLASS. We'll also share techniques to optimize memory bandwidth and maximize latency hiding. A straightforward rule of thumb can predict the bandwidth utilization of a kernel, simplifying the allocation of staging buffers in shared memory.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. sessions.title: 1,001 Ways to Write CUDA Kernels in Python

sessions.points:

We’re enabling large language models (LLMs), vision language models (VLMs), vision transformers (ViTs), and stable diffusion models to run efficiently on energy-efficient NVIDIA Jetson devices, with multi-modal VLMs like VILA accelerating development.

Bring your questions and join this interactive session with NVIDIA experts to get direct help with your use cases and learn more about the practical aspects of using generative AI for your robotics and edge applications.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. sessions.title: Achieve Scale: Accelerate AI Adoption for Business Impact (Presented by Accenture)
sessions.speakers: Senthil Ramani (Global Lead – Data & AI, Accenture) | Vivian Sun (Senior Director, IT, Jabil) | Soumya Seetharam (SVP and Chief Digital & Information Officer, Corning) | Lawrence Goh (Group Head, Technology & Operations, United Overseas Bank) | Matthew Foster (Executive Director, Technology Strategy & Innovation, Amgen)
sessions.points:
1. Delivering the next generation of AI infrastructure is more than new GPUs: it requires a rethinking of system nodes, racks, networking, and the whole data center
2. Liquid cooling can double computing density with massive efficiency and productivity improvements
sessions.description: Join our panel discussion with NVIDIA and Accenture, where business leaders share their experiences and strategies for expediting AI deployment in the face of time-to-market pressures. Learn how collaboration and integrated solutions can streamline the path from concept to implementation, ensuring your organization stays competitive.

sessions.title: Hardware-Aware Algorithms for Sequence Modeling
sessions.speakers: Tri Dao (Chief Scientist, Together AI)
sessions.description: Hear about recent progress on designing models that take advantage of the hardware they run on, especially for GPUs. These include optimizations for attention (FlashAttention, FlashDecoding), state-space models (Mamba), as well as inference techniques like speculative decoding and large batch inference.

sessions.title: Reshaping the Future of AI Filmmaking
sessions.speakers: Haohong Wang (General Manager, TCL)
sessions.points:
1. Spotlight and deepen engagement with a VC Alliance members
2. Deal flow pipeline opportunities for VC Alliance members
sessions.description: In the rapidly evolving world of filmmaking, the fusion of AI and digitization is unlocking extraordinary creative possibilities. We'll first exploreg how AI-driven tools — such as Sora, Runway, Kling, Luma Dream Machine, and others — are revolutionizing traditional filmmaking workflows. Next, we’ll illustrate how digitization enhances both directability and visual quality in AI-assisted productions. Using MineStudio, an innovative AI-based filmmaking pipeline, we’ll demonstrate how advanced AI technologies like gaussian splatting, stable diffusion, and style transfer integrate seamlessly into producing diverse film genres, including comedy, sci-fi, horror, documentary, romance, and animation. We welcome developers passionate about AI-driven filmmaking to engage with and contribute to the MineStudio initiative, fostering innovations that will help shape the future of the industry.

sessions.title: Speed-of-Light Data Movement Between Storage and the GPU
sessions.speakers: CJ Newburn (Distinguished Engineer, NVIDIA) | Prashant Prabhu (NVIDIA) | Vikram Sharma Mailthody (Senior Research Scientist, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how to integrate NVIDIA’s CloudXR into your VR/AR applications to stream immersive experiences across devices without relying on local high-performance hardware
2. OptimizinGain insights into optimizing performance for low-latency, high-fidelity streaming over 5G and Wi-Fi networks, ensuring seamless user experiences in demanding environments
sessions.description:
GPUs have long been compute monsters. But for a new class of applications with huge datasets and low computational intensity, like generative neural network (GNN) training and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), GPU-initiated communication from O(100K) GPU threads enable them to also be data access monsters. 

We'll frame the problem of storage IO, tie it to specific usage models and classes of applications, present breakthrough successes, and open new horizons to practical applications where storage IO optimization is needed for files and objects and both fine- and coarse-grained transfers. We'll cover two members of the GPUDirect Storage family, cuFile and cuObj, and SCADA, a new programming model for high-throughput, fine-grained, GPU-initiated access. We'll also touch on security issues and how they can be addressed through careful design and, in some cases, the help of DPUs.

sessions.title: Optimizing AI Workloads on Windows Workstations: Strategies and Best Practices
sessions.speakers: George Stefanakis (Systems Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Tejaswin Parthasarathy (Senior Systems Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Maximilian Mueller (Sr. Developer Technology Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Ankan Banerjee (Principal Systems Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Luca Spindler (Senior Developer Technology Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Kevin Chen (Senior Systems Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Rajeev Rao (Engineering Manager, Deep Learning Software, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. When and why to use cuVS over CPU-based approaches
2. Differences between CAGRA and Weaviate’s HNSW Graph
sessions.description: Windows workstations present unique challenges for AI workload optimizations due to the diversity of hardware configurations and software options. Our experts will guide you through the best practices for optimizing AI models and inference pipelines in such environments. We’ll cover strategies for effective model quantization and fusion, explore the strengths of various inference frameworks like ONNX Runtime and TensorRT, and provide practical advice on maximizing performance and resource utilization across diverse GPU, CPU, and NPU hardware. Whether you’re developing applications for creative professionals or enterprise solutions, this session will help you navigate the complexities and make informed decisions to optimize your AI workflows.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Accelerate Distributed Spark Applications on Kubernetes With RAPIDS
sessions.speakers: Brian Nguyen (Lead Software Engineer, Capital One) | Tom Marthaler (Senior Manager Software Engineering, Capital One) | Dhantha Gunarathna (Senior Software Engineer, Capital One)
sessions.points:
1. Discover how NVAIE optimizes AI model training, inference, and real-time analytics on OCI GPU infrastructure
2. Learn how NVAIE removes friction for customers by eliminating the need for a separate NVIDIA license
sessions.description: Get an in-depth look at how to accelerate distributed Spark applications using NVIDIA's RAPIDS framework on AWS EKS Kubernetes clusters. We'll present an overview of an analysis platform based on Kubeflow Notebooks open-source software, followed by an explanation of using Docker to build GPU-enabled Spark worker and scheduler node images. We'll talk through the setup of running Distributed Spark on Kubernetes and accelerating distributed Spark applications using RAPIDS and GPU-enabled workers, as well as the technical challenges of GPU-enabled distributed Spark applications and how to set up the RAPIDS Qualification Tool to profile our Spark jobs, and we'll share benchmarks and initial results for GPU-enabled distributed data engineering workloads. Preliminary results show significant cost savings for large GPU compute workloads.

sessions.title: A Deep Dive Into the Latest HPC Software
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Becca Zandstein (Director, Product Management, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Use speculative sampling methods like Medusa to double tokens-per-second for LLM inference without losing quality
2. Extend your LLM capabilities with function calling (tool use) and structured output (JSON mode) with zero performance loss
sessions.description: Take a deep dive into the latest developments in NVIDIA software for high performance computing applications, including a comprehensive look at what’s new in programming models, compilers, libraries, and tools. We'll cover topics of interest to HPC developers, targeting traditional HPC modeling and simulation, quantum computing, HPC+AI, scientific visualization, and high-performance data analytics.

sessions.title: Advancing AI Reasoning: From Game Mastery to Complex Problem Solving
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Training AI Models
sessions.speakers: Noam Brown (Research Scientist, OpenAI) | Vartika Singh (Strategic AI Lead, NVIDIA) | Bryan Catanzaro (Vice President, Applied Deep Learning Research, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand how Volvo Cars is leveraging NVIDIA to fundamentally shift the way it's designing and improving cars through data and software
2. Discover how generative AI can be a potential approach for improving speed and efficiency in the DevOps of autonomous driving development
sessions.description: The evolution of artificial intelligence has seen remarkable milestones, particularly in developing systems capable of advanced reasoning. This panel will explore the journey from AI mastering strategic games to tackling complex, real-world problems. We will delve into the significance of integrating deliberate, System 2 thinking into AI models, enabling them to process information more thoroughly and solve intricate tasks. The discussion will highlight the challenges and breakthroughs in enhancing AI’s reasoning capabilities, the role of reinforcement learning and self-play in training, and the implications of these advancements for future applications. By examining case studies and their performance in complex reasoning tasks, we aim to shed light on the current state and future directions of AI reasoning research.

sessions.title: Building the World’s First Intelligence Distribution Network, and How it Will Transform AI (Presented by Northern Data Group)
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Vision Language Models (VLMs)
sessions.speakers: Adam Low (Chief Product Technology Officer, Northern Data Group) | Vsevolod Vayner (GCore)
sessions.points:
1. Understand vision-language models (VLMs)
2. How to choose the best VLM for your application
sessions.description: Introducing our groundbreaking Intelligence Distribution Network, a truly distributed infrastructure that places inference as close to the edge as possible. By combining Taiga’s experience in running large-scale GPU systems and workloads with GCore’s pedigree in content delivery network technology, we’ve built a system that ensures optimal data privacy, performance, and scalability for the next phase of AI. We’ll explore the architecture, highlighting how this innovative approach reduces latency and boosts efficiency. Join us for a live demo as we show how this (we believe) world-first system redefines high-performance, user-centric data processing.

sessions.title: The Promise of Humanoid Robots: Research vs. the Real World
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Climate / Weather / Ocean Modeling
sessions.speakers: Aaron Saunders (CTO, Boston Dynamics)
sessions.points:
1. AI-enabled climate modeling and urban simulations for informed decision-making
2. Digital twins and AI planning for innovative tools optimizing cities and climate resilience
sessions.description: The promise of humanoid robots performing complex tasks alongside humans has captivated imaginations for decades. We've seen remarkable progress in areas like bipedal locomotion, manipulation, and even basic task learning. However, the crucial question remains: are we truly seeing progress in terms of practical, deployable humanoid solutions, or are we primarily observing results in isolated research settings? We'll delve into this critical distinction, examining the current state of humanoid robotics and identifying the gap between laboratory demonstrations and real-world applications. We'll analyze key challenges hindering widespread adoption, including robustness in unstructured environments, cost-effectiveness, and the critical need for advanced AI capable of genuine adaptability and problem-solving. We'll also explore promising avenues for bridging this gap. By critically assessing both the achievements and the limitations of current humanoid technology, we'll foster a realistic perspective on the future of humanoids in the workforce and identify the key steps needed to translate exciting progress into tangible results.

sessions.title: AI's Next Frontier: Taking Autonomy from Digital to Physical Reality
sessions.speakers: Raquel Urtasun (Founder and CEO, Waabi)
sessions.points:
1. A deeper understanding of the primary components of Isaac GR00T platform, and how developers can take advantage of each
2. Insight into the progress of NVIDIA Research's unified generalist models and early deployments in industry
sessions.description: We'll explore the exciting potential of generative AI beyond the digital realm, delving into its real-world applications and the challenges innovators face in deploying safe, scalable, and robust AI systems in the physical world. Through examples like autonomous vehicles, warehouse drones, and more, you'll gain insights into the transformative power of AI and the groundbreaking work being done to push its boundaries.

sessions.title: Deep Dive into Small Language Model Development for Various Domains and Applications
sessions.speakers: Negar Habibi (Sr. Manager of Technical Project Management, NVIDIA) | Ameya Sunil Mahabaleshwarkar (NVIDIA) | Yoshi Suhara (NVIDIA) | Zijia Chen (NVIDIA) | Sharath Turuvekere Sreenivas (Sr. Deep Learning Algorithms Engineer, NVIDIA) | Saurav Muralidharan (Sr. Research Scientist, NVIDIA) | Raviraj Joshi (Senior Data Scientist, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Experience the unmatched performance and scalability of Dell Pro Max, powered by NVIDIA RTX GPUs, to accelerate complex AI models, innovative designs, and dynamic creative workflows
2. Explore how Dell Pro Max integrates cutting-edge technology to empower users with the flexibility and control needed for on-prem and local development
sessions.description: In this session you will learn how NVIDIA’s small language models (SLMs) are developed, which established new state-of-the-art accuracy numbers on multiple benchmarks. This session covers the standard pre-training technique and more sophisticated pruning and distillation techniques to develop base models, as well as advanced alignment techniques to turn base models into state-of-the-art instruct models. We will also share best practices in SLM development for various domains and applications.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Data Center GPU Cluster Monitoring and Diagnostics
sessions.speakers: Douglas Wightman (Sr. System Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Brent Stolle (Sr. Manager, NVIDIA) | Nik Konyuchenko (DCGM Technical Lead, NVIDIA) | David Beer (Systems Software Manager, NVIDIA) | Karthik Mandakolathur (DCGM Product Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand how traditional networking infrastructures limit the performance of GPU-based AI data centers and how new networking technologies can address these bottlenecks to enhance workload productivity and reduce training times
2. Gain insights into the latest advancements in networking technologies
sessions.description: Connect with developers from NVIDIA's Data Center GPU Manager software (https://developer.nvidia.com/dcgm) and learn how to effectively monitor NVIDIA GPU clusters and run diagnostics. Explore best practices and how DCGM can be integrated into different user environments.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Developing Physics ML Models for Engineering and Science Applications
sessions.speakers: Kaustubh Tangsali (Sr. Software Engineer, AI-HPC, NVIDIA) | Akshay Subramaniam (Sr. AI Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Ram Cherukuri (Sr. Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Nicholas Geneva (Sr. Software Engineer, Modulus, NVIDIA) | Mohammad Amin Nabian (Sr. Software Engineer, AI-HPC, NVIDIA) | Rishi Ranade (Senior Technical Engineer – Physics ML, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. DGX Cloud for AI Foundry
2. Run:ai on DGX Cloud
sessions.description:
High-fidelity simulations in science and engineering are computationally expensive and time-prohibitive for quick iterative use cases, from design analysis to optimization. NVIDIA Modulus, the physics machine learning platform, turbocharges such use cases by building physics-based deep learning models that are 100,000X faster than traditional methods and offer high-fidelity simulation results.

Come meet our Modulus experts and bring your questions. Learn the basics of physics-informed deep learning and data-driven deep learning applied to problems having roots in physics, and understand the unique techniques that Modulus brings that help you apply deep learning to modeling multi-physics simulations systems. We can discuss how to leverage these principles to apply deep learning, and can explore the building blocks provided by the Modulus platform, including different scalable architectures like neural operators, graph neural networks, physics-informed neural networks, diffusion models, etc.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Confidential and Verifiable AI Computing: Ensure Trust, Privacy, and User Ownership in AI Systems
sessions.speakers: Illia Polosukhin (Co-Founder, NEAR Protocol)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how top telcos are using AI/Gen AI to deliver real business outcomes
2. Gain insights on the challenges and lessons learned along the way
sessions.description: “Attention Is All You Need” coauthor and NEAR Protocol co-founder Illia Polosukhin presents research on confidential and verifiable AI computation. The talk details an approach to training, fine-tuning, and utilizing models and agents that allows for the decentralized, transparent properties of open source while creating a business model for developers and researchers. He presents a novel design for a confidential, decentralized AI cloud that combines NVIDIA Confidential Computing and payment channels with a mechanism called “Proof-of-Response” to deliver service-level agreement in a decentralized environment. This enables model and agent developers to monetize their work without needing to run their own services, provides end-to-end privacy for individuals and businesses, verifiability of what data was used, and proof that outputs came from an AI system.

sessions.title: AI Agents for Real-Time Video Understanding and Summarization
sessions.speakers: Adam Ryason (Product Manager, Visual Insight Agent (VIA) Microservices, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Enhance customer experiences
2. Derive data-driven insights
sessions.description:
The NVIDIA AI Blueprint for video search and summarization enables the creation of interactive analytical agents that reason through massive amounts of video, assess physical processes, and provide decision-making insights to streamline operations. The blueprint combines powerful Vision Language Models (VLMs), Large Language Models (LLMs), and NeMo retriever into a full suite of software for building, fine-tuning, and deploying a diverse set of visual understanding agents. These interactive AI Agents leverage realtime multi-camera streaming and long context understanding in our factories, warehouses, airports and cities - helping enable operations teams to make better decisions faster from richer insights and more natural interactions.
Learn more about NVIDIA AI Blueprint for video search and summarization and how you can customize and deploy on-prem or in the cloud.

sessions.title: The Next Era of Payments: How Generative AI is Shaping the Future
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Medical Imaging
sessions.speakers: Sarah Laszlo (Senior Director, Machine Learning Platform, Visa)
sessions.points:
1. Real-Time AI on Surgical Video Feeds: Providing ultra-low latency segmentation overlays with high-quality video to support surgical workflows
2. Voice Assistance Integration: Streamlining workflows and enabling hands-free interactions to enhance surgical team efficiency
sessions.description: Artificial Intelligence is transforming industries, and the financial services sector is no exception. Visa has long been at the forefront of innovation, leveraging AI to enable secure, seamless, and personalized payment experiences for millions of customers worldwide. In this session, we’ll explore how Visa is harnessing the power of Generative AI to reshape the future of payments, leading the way in security and convenience. We’ll discuss the unique challenges of applying AI in financial services and share how our advanced techniques and tailored approaches unlock new possibilities. Join us to discover how Visa is shaping the future of payments and financial services through the transformative potential of AI.

sessions.title: Everything You Want to Ask About NVIDIA Enterprise Reference Architectures
sessions.speakers: Richard Hastie (Sr. Director, Enterprise Platforms, NVIDIA) | Abhishek Prabhakar (Sr. Software Architect, NVIDIA) | Peter Lillian (Director of Product Management, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the NCP Reference Architecture: Gain insights into the comprehensive blueprint designed for high-performance, scalable AI data centers
2. Deployment Benefits: Learn how the NCP architecture reduces deployment time and costs while ensuring compatibility and interoperability among hardware and software components
sessions.description: Engage directly with NVIDIA specialists to discuss the new NVIDIA Enterprise Reference Architecture program in this informal "Connect With Experts" session. This is a unique opportunity to ask questions, share insights, and gain a deeper understanding of how these reference architectures help our global systems partners to streamline enterprise AI deployments. This session is ideal for IT professionals, AI system architects, and anyone interested in leveraging NVIDIA's cutting-edge technologies to deploy AI in the enterprise. Don’t miss this chance to connect with experts and deepen your understanding of NVIDIA's innovative enterprise AI solutions!

sessions.title: Jane Street: How an Early AI Adopter Thinks About Infrastructure (Presented by CoreWeave)
sessions.speakers: John Mancuso (VP, Solutions Architecture, CoreWeave) | Adam Canady (Jane Street) | Peter Salanki (CTO, CoreWeave)
sessions.points:
1. Understand key trends and patterns in AI agent and model adoption based on data from over 200,000 organizations building with open models on Hugging Face
2. Learn practical strategies for evaluating and selecting the right AI models and architectures for effective AI agents
sessions.description: Adopting AI early isn’t just a competitive advantage — it’s a necessity for staying ahead in today’s fast-paced financial markets. Discover how Jane Street, a global leader in quantitative trading, leverages CoreWeave’s cutting-edge NVIDIA GPU infrastructure to train and fine-tune AI models with speed and precision. Gain insights into the strategic decisions that support their success, from scaling GPU capacity to ensuring flexibility, security, and performance in their AI workflows. Learn how the partnership between Jane Street and CoreWeave is setting a new standard for reliable and scalable AI infrastructure.

sessions.title: Foundation Models in Biology
sessions.speakers: Anthony Costa (Director, Digital Biology, NVIDIA) | Molly Gibson (Origination Partner, Flagship Pioneering) | Patrick Hsu (Co-Founder and Assistant Professor of Bioengineering and Deb Faculty Fellow, Arc Institute & University of California, Berkeley) | Nick Sofroniew (Research Scientist, EvolutionaryScale) | Joshua Meier (Co-founder & CEO, Chai Discovery)
sessions.points:
1. Insights into how accelerated computing can drive energy efficiency in data centers
2. Innovations in cooling systems designed to improve water and energy use
sessions.description: Foundation models have revolutionized how we interact with the digital world, enabling vast efficiencies from the mundane automation of tasks to the handling of complex data. The same is true for biological systems and data, while the field grapples with the challenges of adapting and extending these models to solve fundamental problems in drug discovery and development. We'll dive into capabilities, promises, limitations, and future efforts in biological foundation modeling. We'll be joined by a panel of luminaries from academia, tech-bio, and the pharmaceutical industry to dig into the intricacies of handling biological data and scaling foundation models, to ultimately understand their current and future impact on our understanding of human health, the discovery of novel therapeutics, and the scientific process itself.

sessions.title: Exploring Earth’s Oceans: Using Digital Twins to Drive Digital Ocean Collaboration
sessions.speakers: Conor Lewellyn (Energy and Water Infrastructure Engineer, Emerging Engineering and Physical Sciences, MITRE) | Nick Rotker (MITRE) | Alex Philp (Sr. Principal, Strategic Outreach, MITRE Public Sector)
sessions.points:
1. Learn where and how data are used in an AI workflow
2. Explore the suitability of specific storage technologies to achieving specific AI-related goals and results
sessions.description: The Earth's oceans cover over 70% of the planet's surface and play a crucial role in regulating climate, supporting biodiversity, and facilitating human activities. Despite their importance, the vastness and complexity of oceanic systems pose significant challenges in research, conservation, and management. This presentation explores the innovative use of NVIDIA's Omniverse platform to enhance digital collaboration in ocean exploration, research, and conservation efforts. By integrating real-time simulation, AI-driven modeling, and immersive visualization techniques, Omniverse enables scientists, educators, and policymakers to work together seamlessly across disciplines and locations. This exploration highlights a new paradigm for ocean research that harnesses the power of digital technologies to bridge gaps in understanding, promote sustainable practices, and protect our marine ecosystems. Join us as we chart a course for the future of ocean exploration through digital collaboration, driving initiatives that will enhance our stewardship of the world's oceans.

sessions.title: Unlock Business Success with DataRobot's Enterprise-ready Agentic AI platform
sessions.speakers: Prajakta Damle (Senior Vice President of Product Management, DataRobot, Inc.) | Luke Shulman (Technical Field Director, DataRobot)
sessions.points:
1. Explore real-world examples of how generative AI has been embedded into critical business functions and processes
2. Gain actionable insights on how you can enable efficient model development, deployment, and scaling
sessions.description: Organizations are eager to embrace the era of agentic AI, but moving beyond prototyping into creating enterprise-ready agents that can be deployed into production is still challenging.  DataRobot with its integration with NVIDIA AI Enterprise, provides customers with an end-to-end AI platform to rapidly develop their Agentic AI Apps and deploy them to production with confidence. In this session, we will walk you through key considerations to build enterprise-ready agentic AI apps and show you how you can build and deploy them into production with built-in observability, monitoring, and governance. We will bring it all together with a live demo of a real world use case.

sessions.title: Customer Service 2.0: Transforming Experiences with AI Agents and Digital Humans
sessions.speakers: Yasmina Benkhoui (Strategic Alliances and Partnerships Manager, NVIDIA) | Kwindla Kramer (CEO and Co-Founder, Daily) | Andrej Greguš (Co-Founder, Nettle.ai) | Arjun Desai (Co-Founder, Cartesia) | Roberto Del Ponte (Associate Partner, Reply)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how generative AI is  being leveraged by the federal government to enhance workforce productivity
2. Discover how generative AI tools can assist in data analysis and provide actionable insights, leading to more informed and timely decision-making in the public sector
sessions.description: The integration of digital humans and AI agents is transforming the customer service landscape, offering innovative solutions that enhance engagement and support. Powered by NVIDIA technology, digital humans deliver lifelike interactions that foster genuine connections, while AI agents use sophisticated algorithms to analyze customer needs and provide timely, personalized assistance. We'll explore how these technologies work in tandem to elevate customer experiences, streamline operations, and improve service efficiency. We'll show real-world applications and success stories from our partners, illustrating how organizations can leverage NVIDIA's capabilities to create impactful customer service strategies. Join us to discover the powerful synergy of digital humans and AI agents in reshaping customer engagement.

sessions.title: The Evolving Landscape of Open Source in Generative AI Foundation Models
sessions.speakers: Yair Adato (CEO and Founder, Bria.ai)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how we’re leveraging NVEmbed to help customers find what they want
2. Using LLM NIM to accelerate the relevance and speed of search / product discovery
sessions.description: In order to effectively and safely build generative technologies into their products and businesses, developers need continuous access to the latest AI innovations. However, new challenges are emerging: access to source code for high-performance foundation models is becoming increasingly limited, and concerns over data privacy, copyright, and risk management are slowing down development velocity. We'll explore the role of open-source foundation models in generative AI development, focusing on emerging licensing models that promote safer and more ethical use. We'll also present alternatives to open source that can accelerate development velocity, especially in domains where privacy and copyright are key concerns.

sessions.title: How Robotics and AI are Changing Surgery for the Better
sessions.speakers: Jason Waldman (Associate Director of Embedded Business Development, Advantech)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how EvalForge generates evaluation criteria from your annotated data
2. Understand how alignment metrics validate AI judges against human ground truth
sessions.description: Surgical robotics and AI-assisted surgery were once the realm of science fiction. Now, thousands of procedures a day are performed using robots. Understand how surgical robotics solutions are developed, the role that AI plays in assisting surgeons throughout an operation, and what's coming next in world of AI-assisted surgical procedures. We'll also give some tips on how you can integrate best practices from surgical robotics into other areas of healthcare, such as imaging.

sessions.title: The Next Era of Surgery: AI-Driven Innovation in the Operating Room
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Johan Fornier (EVP Surgical & Modality, Barco)
sessions.points:
1. Innovation as a Growth Driver: Learn how next-gen leaders are harnessing emerging technologies — such as AI, blockchain, and green tech — to create new business models and unlock untapped markets
2. Leadership for the Future: Understand the skills and mindset shifts required for leadership in a rapidly evolving global economy, including agility, inclusivity, and purpose-driven decision-making
sessions.description:
A new era of surgery is unfolding, driven by the potential of AI, advanced video connectivity, and intelligent surgical technologies. Learn how the next-generation surgical displays of Barco and SoftAcuity, equipped with voice assistance and real-time AI, are designed to enhance workflows during image-guided surgeries. 

Leveraging the NVIDIA Holoscan platform and the compute power of IGX, we'll demonstrate how Barco’s Nexxis technology aims to deliver optimized AI-powered compute integration, ultra-low latency, and enhanced performance in the operating room.

sessions.title: Make Retrieval Better: Fine-Tuning an Embedding Model for Domain-Specific RAG
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Transfer Learning / Fine Tuning
sessions.speakers: Ronay Ak (Sr. Data Scientist, NVIDIA) | Gabriel Moreira (Sr. Research Scientist, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand how to fine-tune pre-trained vision AI models using the TAO Toolkit without needing to write code
2. Discover practical tips for optimizing model performance on various platforms, from edge devices to the cloud
sessions.description: LLMs power AI applications like conversational chatbots and content generators, but are constrained by their training data. This might lead to hallucinations in content generation, which requires up-to-date or domain-specific information. Retrieval augmented generation (RAG) addresses this issue by enabling LLMs to access external context without modifying model parameters. Embedding or dense retrieval models are a key component of a RAG pipeline for retrieving relevant context to the LLM. However, an embedding model’s effectiveness to capture the unique characteristics of the custom data hinges on the quality and domain relevance of its training data. Fine-tuning embedding models is gaining interest to provide more accurate and relevant responses tailored to users’ specific domain.In this lab, you'll learn to generate a synthetic dataset with question-context pairs from a domain-specific corpus, and process the data for fine-tuning. Then, fine-tune a text embedding model using synthetic data and evaluate it.Prerequisite(s):Basic knowledge of LLMs, TensorFlow/Pytorch and Python programming is required.Intermediate-level understanding of ML/DL and NLP pipelines.

sessions.title: Structure From Chaos: Accelerate GraphRAG With cuGraph and NVIDIA NIM
sessions.speakers: Benika Hall (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Sunil Patel (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Rohan Rao (Sr. Solutions Architect, Enterprise Generative AI, NVIDIA) | Christopher Brissette (Senior Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Discover how Wumart uses GenAI to automate customer service, increasing labor efficiency by 50%.
2. Learn how Wumart utilizes DMALL OS and LLM to streamline replenishment for 80,000 SKUs across 50 stores, with a 98% adoption rate for AI-driven recommendations.
sessions.description: Learn how to integrate large language models (LLMs) with NVIDIA Inference Microservices (NIM) and cuGraph to create cutting-edge, graph-based AI solutions for handling complex, interconnected data. We'll cover fine-tuning techniques, Langchain agents, and GPU-accelerated graph analytics to enhance AI capabilities and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) evaluation.Prerequisite(s):Generative AI knowledge about LLMs and RAG.Understanding of vector-based RAG and embedding vectors.

sessions.title: Software-in-the-Loop Testing for Robots With OpenUSD, Isaac Sim, and ROS
sessions.speakers: Ayush Ghosh (Robotics Systems Engineer, NVIDIA) | Steven Feng (Robotics Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. How NVIDIA's speech AI technologies (ASR, NMT, TTS, AST) work
2. The latest advances in NVIDIA's speech AI technologies, including in speech language models, which process audio input tokens without first converting them to text
sessions.description: This lab focuses on software-in-the-loop for testing and validating AI-driven robots in a digital twin environment. Participants will learn to assemble a virtual environment using OpenUSD and NVIDIA Isaac Sim. You'll add virtual robots to the scene and simulate and validate their basic movements with ROS (Robot Operating System) commands. sessions.title: Advancing Transaction Fraud Detection in Financial Services With NVIDIA RAPIDS on AWS
sessions.speakers: Sudhir Kalidindi (Principal Solutions Architect, Amazon Web Services) | Paul Chang (Head of Payment Networks, AWS Worldwide Financial Services) | Simon Zamarin (Sr. AI/ML Specialist Solutions Architect, Amazon)
sessions.points:
1. Increase efficiency and enhance productivity by automating tasks and streamlining workflows
2. Explore how agentic AI can drive innovation and create new business opportunities
sessions.description:
Transaction fraud detection is a $43 billion annual problem. AI for fraud detection uses multiple machine learning models to detect anomalies in customer behaviors and connections, as well as patterns of accounts and behaviors that fit fraudulent characteristics.

We'll discuss and share the optimal workflow with data ingestion, data processing and transformation, feature engineering, model training, model inference, and event sequence and notifications running on various open source ML frameworks, NVIDIA AI tools, Triton Inference Server on Amazon EKS or EC2 instances on NVIDIA GPUs. The cost to build features to train AI racks up into hundreds of millions of dollars. NVIDIA RAPIDS and RAPIDS Accelerator for Apache Spark on Amazon EMR enable data processing to be 14X faster at 8X lower cost, compared to CPUs based on fraud detection data benchmarks.

While initial training sets the foundation, the human-generated data used for fine-tuning and reinforcement often determine a model's real-world effectiveness. We'll explore how carefully curated human inputs can significantly improve model performance, reduce biases, and enhance the relevance and safety of AI-generated content.
 
Learn strategies for sourcing, vetting, and incorporating diverse human data, including leveraging internal experts, as well as techniques to balance automation with human oversight. Discover why investing in quality human data post-training is key to developing more capable, responsible, and human-aligned AI systems.

Corteva uses ESMFold and DiffDock for these computations. In a recent benchmarking exercise, Corteva used  NVIDIA NIMs for ESMFold and DiffDock to compare their current open-source based deployment to NVIDIA NIMs and found that the speed up was 11.778X faster than the open-source-based deployment on A100. sessions.title: How Math Libraries Can Help Accelerate Your Applications on Blackwell GPUs
sessions.speakers: Azi Riahi (NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. The GB10 Grace Blackwell Superchip combines MediaTek’s industry-leading CPU performance and power efficiency with NVIDIA’s accelerated computing technologies
2. MediaTek powers more than 2 billion devices a year and has invested heavily in bringing the best AI, connectivity, and multimedia experiences to Arm-based system-on-chip devices
sessions.description: NVIDIA’s GPU-accelerated math libraries, which are part of the CUDA Toolkit and the HPC SDK, are constantly expanding, providing industry-leading performance and coverage of common compute workflows across AI, ML, and scientific computing. One of the main advantages of these libraries is the portability they offer to applications that use them across different generations of GPUs. We'll do a deep dive into some of the latest advancements in the latest Blackwell architecture GPUs, and how math libraries make it easy to access them to accelerate your applications. We'll cover many topics, including how new Tensor Core functionality like micro-scaling formats can be used through libraries like cuBLAS; and how multi-GPU multi-node (MGMN) libraries (e.g., cuSOLVERMp) offer improved performance and scalability on GB200 NVL72 systems leveraging the larger NVLINK domain.

sessions.title: GPU-Accelerated Mixed-Precision Spatial Statistics for Efficient Climate/Weather Modeling and Emulation
sessions.speakers: Hatem Ltaief (Principal Research Scientist, KAUST) | Qinglei Cao (Assistant Professor, Saint Louis University)
sessions.points:
1. Optimizations for attention can speed up training and inference by 2-4X
2. State-space models like Mamba can match Transformer on language modeling and scale to much longer sequences
sessions.description:
We present the design and scalable implementation of an exascale climate emulator to address the escalating computational and storage requirements of high-resolution Earth System Model simulations. We utilize the spherical harmonic transform to stochastically model spatio-temporal variations in climate data. This provides tunable spatio-temporal resolution and significantly improves the fidelity and granularity of climate emulation, achieving an ultra-high spatial resolution of 0.034◦(∼3.5 km) in
space. Our BLAS3-rich code is optimized for systems equipped with different NVIDIA generations of GPUs, scaling well to achieve 0.739 exaFLOPs per second on 1,936 nodes (7,744 Grace Hopper Superchips (GH200)) of Alps, 0.243 EFLOP/s on 1,024 nodes (4,096 A100
GPUs) of Leonardo, and 0.375 EFlop/s on 3,072 nodes (18,432 V100 GPUs) of Summit.

sessions.title: Customize Generative AI Models for Industry-Specific Solutions
sessions.speakers: Shashank Verma (Sr. Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA) | Davide Onofrio (Director, Deep Learning, NVIDIA) | Tanay Varshney (Developer Advocate Engineer for Deep Learning SW, NVIDIA) | Annie Surla (Developer Advocate Engineer, NVIDIA) | Vinh Nguyen (Data Scientist, DL Engineer, NVIDIA) | Aditi Bodhankar (Developer Advocate Engineer, NVIDIA) | Mehran Maghoumi (Sr. Deep Learning Developer Advocate, NVIDIA) | Sergio Perez (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Oleg Sudakov (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Techniques and best practices for custom solutioning with generative AI tools, beyond basic fine-tuning
2. Strategies for optimizing and curating clean datasets, ensuring quality and relevance in AI-generated visuals
sessions.description: In this session, NVIDIA experts will guide you through the technical processes of customizing generative AI models, focusing on how to optimize performance, accuracy, and latency for real-world applications. We’ll dive deep into the customization techniques available using NVIDIA’s Nemotron-4 model suite, covering everything from LoRA (Low-Rank Adaptation) tuning to advanced fine-tuning methods like reinforcement learning with human feedback (RLHF). Learn how to leverage domain-specific data and adapt pre-trained models to meet the unique requirements of your industry. You’ll also discover best practices for balancing model complexity with computational resources, and how to integrate customized AI into existing workflows to drive measurable impact.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Harmonizing Digital Twins and AI Factory: Unlocking Industrial Autonomy

sessions.points:

2. Gain insights into addressing operational challenges, such as integrating AI agents with existing systems and ensuring seamless collaboration between human analysts and autonomous tools
sessions.description: This session delves into the transformative and complementary roles of digital twins and AI factory in achieving higher level of autonomy within our industrial facilities. We are going to demonstrate how PEGATRON leverages NVIDIA Omniverse, Metropolis, AI Blueprints, and visual language models (VLMs) to build and orchestrate AI agents that streamline operational workflows. Gain valuable insights into how digital and AI transformations are shaping the future of industrial autonomous operations.

sessions.title: Build Advanced AI Clouds With the Data Intelligence Platform (Presented by DDN)
sessions.speakers: James Coomer (Sr. Vice President, Products, DDN)
sessions.description: As AI enterprises expand their capabilities with generative AI applications and agent deployment, NVIDIA AI Cloud Partners (NCPs) must evolve. Learn how a data intelligence platform impacts service enhancement by accelerating data discovery, streamlining NIMs and NeMo workflows, reducing data movements, managing distributed data, and enabling massive, elastic, online scaling to support growing customer demands. We'll demonstrate the real business value for both NCPs and their enterprise clients.

sessions.title: Harnessing Generative AI to Scale the Autonomous Vehicle Industry
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices

sessions.points:
