2. Acquire practical skills in utilizing NIMs within real-world digital health workflows such as clinical trials.
sessions.description: Take a deep dive with Zoox to uncover how generative AI is transforming the autonomous vehicle industry by empowering organizations to strategically scale into new markets, enhance safety, and cultivate consumer trust.

sessions.title: Bringing Enterprise Chatbots to Life With AI-Powered Digital Humans
sessions.speakers: Trisha Tripathi (Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Roopa Prabhu (Director Engineering, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. A data intelligence platform is a critical enabling part of an end-to-end AI development and production strategy
2. Rapidly changing and sophisticated real-time workflows are highly enabling, but complex
sessions.description: Learn how to bring digital human experience to your enterprise chatbots. We'll dive deeper into building and customizing a reference virtual assistant workflow connecting digital humans to any reference chatbot or large language model, or a retrieval augmented generation workflow.

sessions.title: Future-Proof Your AI Infrastructure With Private AI (Presented by Equinix)
sessions.speakers: DD Dasgupta (Equinix VP Product Marketing, Equinix)
sessions.points:
1. Supercharge the platform migration and modernization workflow with EXL’s generative AI powered code assistance tool for higher efficiency gains and enhanced governance
2. Data modernization accelerators will support upstream data handling tasks of code migration projects
sessions.description: As AI technology evolves at a rapid pace, organizations must balance security, speed, scalability, and sustainability. A "Private AI" strategy leverages partnerships with leaders like NVIDIA and major hyperscalers to provide the global reach and next-generation infrastructure needed to tackle these challenges. The key to success depends on having high-performance, AI-ready infrastructure with advanced cooling, secure data centers, and multi-cloud connectivity. Learn how optimizing speed, sustainability, and data privacy management can give you a competitive edge in an AI-driven world.

sessions.title: Generative AI for Code Generation (Presented by EXL)
sessions.speakers: Anand Logani (EVP and CDO, EXL)
sessions.points:
1. Explore the first groundbreaking generative AI for core banking that addresses the main challenges banks face in regard to integration with existing data infrastructure, data security, and privacy concerns
2. How the presented AI systems provide transparent and explainable outputs that allow users to easily and accurately verify the results produced. This ensures our systems are “safe, transparent, traceable, non-discriminatory,” therefore abiding by soon-to-be legal requirements such as the EU AI Act
sessions.description: Learn about a Gen AI-powered solution designed to revolutionize the migration of legacy codebases to modern and open-source languages while enhancing data and code governance processes. By automating the labor-intensive tasks of writing and optimizing code, this tool drives accelerated delivery, reduces costs, and improves accuracy. We'll show how NVIDIA’s NeMo framework is leveraged for pre-training and fine-tuning large language models to deeply understand domain-specific code. NVIDIA Inference Microservice (NIM) ensures optimized inference speed and seamless interactions, while NVIDIA’s retrieval microservice is integrated to efficiently retrieve relevant code and contextual data from diverse sources and functional modules.

sessions.title: AI-Driven Safety at the Edge: Minimize Industrial Incidents
sessions.speakers: Shahrouz Yousefi (CTO and Founder, ManoMotion AB)
sessions.points:
1. Discover how the Isaac platform, including Isaac Sim and Isaac Lab, are empowering robotics developers to simulate, test, and deploy solutions faster, with real-world applications in manufacturing, logistics, and humanoids that drive measurable business outcomes
2. Learn how advanced robotics platforms, including Omniverse and Jetson, are enabling innovative end-customer solutions, from autonomous systems optimizing supply chains to human-robot collaboration in industrial environments
sessions.description: We'll explore the essential role of AI in enhancing workplace safety. We'll present a comprehensive overview of developing vision-based AI solutions at the edge to create safer and smarter industrial environments, significantly reducing the risk of incidents.

sessions.title: Robotic Simulations With Reinforcement Learning at Scale: Harness the Power of NVIDIA Isaac Lab on AWS
sessions.speakers: Shaun Kirby (Principal IoT Architect, Amazon) | Abhishek Srivastav (Sr. Solutions Architect, Amazon)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how to integrate, test, and deploy robots powered by a vision and AI perception solution that includes GPU-accelerated compute, sensors (including, but not limited to, cameras) and perception software with 3D localization and obstacle detection
2. Get guidance on how to adjust the perception solution to different environments, use cases, and customer needs dealing with common challenges like sensor calibration, slippery floors, repetitive aisles, and kidnapped robot
sessions.description: Simulation-based reinforcement learning greatly benefits the field of robotics, enabling models to learn complex tasks quickly. NVIDIA Isaac Lab offers a reinforcement learning environment to train and test robots in realistic simulated environments using physics-based rendering. We'll dive deeper into NVIDIA’s Isaac Lab, AWS Batch, and Amazon EC2 instances powered by NVIDIA GPUs, and highlight the advantages of robotic simulation on AWS. Through hands-on labs, you’ll learn distributed training for robots across multiple GPU nodes, leveraging AWS Batch to accelerate performance. Additionally, we’ll explore the crucial sim-to-real transition, sharing insights and strategies for effectively translating simulation learnings to real-world robotic applications.Prerequisite(s):None.

sessions.title: Revolutionizing Rideshare Customer Support using Generative AI
sessions.speakers: Saket Agarwal (Senior Director of Engineering, Uber) | Jai Malkani (Global Head of Product, Customer Obsession, Uber)
sessions.points:
1. Simulation-based reinforcement learning has significantly contributed to the advancements in the field of robotics, enabling models to quickly learn complex tasks
2. The hands-on labs will focus on distributed training for robots across multiple GPU nodes, and leveraging AWS Batch to accelerate performance
sessions.description: Explore NOVA (Neural Omnipresent Virtual Assistant), Uber's generative AI (GenAI)-powered assistant, and learn how it revolutionizes customer support interactions, driving cost efficiency and quality improvement. With 200 million interactions annually costing $500 million, NOVA aims to optimize customer service while offering personalized, scalable, and empathetic responses. NOVA leverages retrieval augmented generation (RAG) to provide fact-based, useful support grounded in Uber’s extensive knowledge base.

sessions.title: Building LLM Agent Applications for the Financial Services Industry
sessions.speakers: Hanyue He (Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Yongming Shi (Solution Architect Manager, NVIDIA) | David Williams (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Ran Zhang (NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. cuVS provides state-of-the-art performance for vector search applications on the GPU
2. cuVS powers several vector search libraries and databases
sessions.description: Join this session to discuss the end-to-end solution for building a large language model (LLM) agent that can handle complex scenarios like banking and quantitative trading. From the application pipeline, training to inference acceleration, learn about best practices for building an intelligent agent for financial services industry (FSI) customers using LLMs.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Visualizing California's Infrastructure with Caltrans' State-Scale Digital Twins
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Profilers / Debuggers / Code Analysis
sessions.speakers: Sean Snyders (Distinguished Engineer, Trimble, Inc.) | Aaron Chamberlin (Sr. Transportation Engineer (Specialist), Caltrans)
sessions.points:
1. Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or 1:1 setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered
2. Learn about CUDA and graphics developer tools, including what's new, along with helpful tips and tricks
sessions.description: Learn how the California Department of Transportation (Caltrans) leverages Trimble's integrated solutions to enhance construction project coordination and risk management through accurate and timely data visualization. By combining design and field data, Caltrans enables survey and construction teams to quickly understand project plans, identify potential risks, and improve coordination with contractors. This approach not only reduces risks and costs, but also streamlines workflows, underscoring the importance of holistic data visualization. Additionally, we delve into Trimble's collaboration with NVIDIA to further enhance data visualization and coordination capabilities, illustrating the impact of innovative technology on infrastructure projects.

sessions.title: Tencent HunYuan: Building a High-Performance Inference Engine for Large Models Based on NVIDIA TensorRT-LLM
sessions.speakers: Meng Wang (Sr. AI Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Yifu Sun (Sr. Applied Researcher, Tencent)
sessions.points:
1. Myth Busting: The Growing Presence of Women-Led Companies — Learn about the expanding number of women-led companies across various industries, and how their innovations are disproving the myth that a lack of investable opportunities exists
2. Spotlighting Innovation: Key Contributions from Female Entrepreneurs — Discover specific examples of women-led companies that are pioneering advancements in technology, sustainability, healthcare, and more, reshaping markets and industries
sessions.description: Tencent HunYuan large language models cover a variety of tasks, including text-to-text, text-to-image, text-to-video, and multimodal understanding. Low latency and low-cost inference for large language models are key challenges for the implementation of HunYuan. Tencent HunYuan has worked closely with NVIDIA to build the high-performance inference engine AngelHCF for HunYuan large language models based on TensorRT-LLM. This supports the online deployment of the HunYuan Turbo trillion-parameter mixture-of-experts (MoE) large language model and has optimized the inference time of the HunYuan text-to-video model to within 2 minutes. Since the implementation of HunYuan large language models, the inference cost has been optimized by over 90%, supporting the efficient deployment of more than 700+ Tencent products. Therefore, we will take the HunYuan trillion-parameter MoE large language model and the HunYuan text-to-video diffusion model as examples to introduce how the HunYuan team and the NVIDIA team have optimized the inference technology based on the TensorRT-LLM framework, and highlight some key methods for optimizing the performance and reducing the latency of large language models and diffusion models.

sessions.title: Autonomous Systems and Remote Sensing for Better Earth Data
sessions.topic: Data Center / Cloud - Software-Defined Data Center
sessions.speakers: Brian Soliday (Chief Revenue Officer, Voxelmaps) | Sertac Karaman (Professor, Director of LIDS, MIT)
sessions.points:
1. Key considerations for developing generative AI applications
2. Best practices for deploying production AI
sessions.description: How MIT’s focus on complex, often distributed and networked, system is advancing  interaction of physical systems with humans or software, and the quantification of appropriate notions of information for the purpose of decision-making with terrestrial and aerial autonomous vehicles. How Voxelmaps utalizes geospatial and remotes sensing data to build 4D volumetric model of the planet, combining visual, spatial and temporal data to create the most detailed map of the world. It does this using Multi-Resolution, Voxel Occupancy Grids.

sessions.title: Build Next-Gen Agents With Large Vision Language Models
sessions.speakers: Debraj Sinha (Product Marketing Manager, NVIDIA) | Sammy Ochoa (Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA) | Abubakr Karali (Senior Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how to integrate NVIDIA Morpheus, RIVA, and VIA microservices to create your own visual AI agent
2. Understand how to apply the workflow integrated to a sample use case for open-world understanding
sessions.description: Vision-language models (VLM) are taking computer vision by storm, offering scalability and robust zero-shot solution for countless industries. However, there are many challenges along the way to deploying VLMs. In this lab, we'll demystify these challenges. You'll learn what VLMs are, and we'll show you how to choose the best model, how to train and fine-tune on a small dataset, and how to deploy and use VLMs scene understanding with NVIDIA NeMo. Then we'll show different workflows for VLM deployment, with NIMs and VIA including grounding the models for more accurate results.Prerequisite(s):Python and Computer Vision.

sessions.title: The 2%: Investing in Women-Led Innovation
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Programming Languages / Compilers
sessions.speakers: Aliya Nur Babul (Program Manager, VC Alliance, NVIDIA) | Mercedes Bent (Partner, Lightspeed)
sessions.points:
1. Learn to evaluate when you should use a CUDA library versus writing your own kernel
2. Explore popular CUDA C++ libraries such as Thrust, CUB, and libcu++
sessions.description: Despite the persistent narrative that a lack of women-led companies explains why only 2% of venture capital funding goes to women, in reality female entrepreneurs are leading some of the most innovative ventures across various industries. This panel will challenge the myth of scarcity by spotlighting the growing number of women-led companies and the groundbreaking innovations they're driving. We'll explore the untapped potential of women-led businesses, highlight examples of cutting-edge technologies, and provide insights on how investors can capitalize on this thriving but overlooked sector. Join us as we reframe the conversation around investing in women and the transformative impact of their work.

sessions.title: Build Visual AI Agents With RAG Using NVIDIA Morpheus, RIVA, and AI Blueprint for Video Search and Summarization
sessions.speakers: Dhruv Nandakumar (Cybersecurity AI Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Adeola Adesoba (Cybersecurity AI Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Strategies for leveraging AI to achieve significant cost savings in clinical trials through efficient and accurate patient recruitment
2. Techniques to minimize the resources required to access clinical trial information, streamlining the search process
sessions.description: Discover how to utilize NVIDIA Visual Insights Agent (VIA) microservices to create your own visual AI agents. You'll construct an agentic retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipeline, employing NVIDIA Morpheus SDK and NVIDIA Riva Speech Services NIMs in conjunction with VIA Microservice. We'll show you a practical example aimed at performing agentic RAG on egocentric (first-person) video feeds for dynamic, open-world QA.Prerequisite(s):Understanding of Generative AI, experience with Open AI, NIM, NVIDIA AI Enterprise.

sessions.title: The Future of Retail E-Commerce: Embedding Generative AI to Enhance Search and Shopping Assistants
sessions.speakers: Vikas Jha (VP of Engineering, Conversational Commerce, Bloomreach) | Chirayu Samarth (Software Engineering Manager, Search, Bloomreach)
sessions.points:
1. Addressing edge cases in autonomy through teledriving significantly reduces costs and development challenges
2. Seamless transitions between AI-driven autonomy and human teledriving enable end-to-end driverless operations
sessions.description: Join this session to learn how definitive production-level data we can improve customer purchase conversions and increase revenue on ecommerce sites. We’ll dive into how are leveraging a NVIDIA built-model and inference technology to power a Hybrid vector search engine.

sessions.title: Enhancing Photovoltaic Power Predictions With High-Resolution Weather Forecasting From NVIDIA Earth-2
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Image / Video Detection & Recognition
sessions.speakers: Wei Sun (Vice Chairman, GCL Power) | Yixin Zhu (Assistant Professor/Assistant Dean, Peking University)
sessions.points:
1. Discover how real-time phase recognition streamlines surgical logistics and communication
2. See how concurrent AI execution improves efficiency and safety in robotic-assisted partial nephrectomy
sessions.description: Renewable energy is crucial for the sustainable development of human society. However, most forms of renewable energy, such as solar energy, are heavily influenced by weather conditions, necessitating accurate forecasting for large-scale utilization. NVIDIA's Earth-2 platform, a full-stack and open solution, enables more efficient weather predictions. The predicted weather data helps to enhance the accuracy of photovoltaic power forecasts. We'll share our experiences, insights, and key takeaways from a collaborative project between GCL, PKU, and NVIDIA, which utilized time series models and weather data from the Earth-2 platform to predict photovoltaic power generation output.

sessions.title: Enhanced Lateral Movement Detection With NVIDIA NIM and NeMo
sessions.speakers: Abdul Rahman (VP in the Artificial Intelligence (AI) Center of Excellence (CoE) in Advisory, Deloitte)
sessions.points:
1. NVIDIA Clara Parabricks significantly accelerates WES analysis, reducing processing times from months to weeks. This GPU-powered solution enables faster insights and drives advancements in genomics research
2. Parabricks improves variant detection sensitivity, identifying more mutation sites in patients than traditional CPU-based pipelines
sessions.description: The increasing complexity and interconnectedness of enterprise networks have made lateral movement intrusions more sophisticated, demanding equally advanced detection strategies. We present a novel and lightweight method for detecting lateral movement by leveraging user and entity behavior analytics (UEBA) and machine learning on NVIDIA Morpheus. This approach enhances threat detection efficiency while minimizing time-to-value. To improve model interpretability and explainability, we build an interaction layer powered by NVIDIA NIM and NeMo on Morpheus. This layer generates incident summaries per entity by aggregating alerts, employing a LLM for (1) incident summarization and contextual search query generation with NIM and (2) threat intelligence retrieval via NeMo. This enables cybersecurity operators and threat hunters to swiftly triage accounts and systems involved in incidents, potentially reducing analysis time from weeks to days.

sessions.title: University Leaders Driving the Future: AI Partnerships Transforming Education and Innovation
sessions.speakers: Dr. Tonya L. Smith-Jackson (NC A&T) | Vincent Del Casino (San Jose State University) | Dr. Seher Awan (Mission College) | Bobbie Knight (President, Miles College)
sessions.points:
1. Arm-based CPUs efficiently handle AI and ML workloads on NVIDIA’s Grace Hopper, Grace Blackwell, and Grace CPU Superchip
2. Find out more about the tools and resources available to optimize AI workflows on Arm-based CPUs
sessions.description: University leaders are redefining higher education through groundbreaking AI collaborations with NVIDIA. These partnerships are advancing research, reimagining curricula, and creating inclusive pathways to develop the next generation of AI talent. Explore how academia is driving innovation, empowering students, and shaping a future where AI transforms industries, communities, and global progress.

sessions.title: Unlock Deep Learning Performance on Blackwell With cuDNN
sessions.speakers: Yang Xu (Enterprise Products) (DL Software Engineering Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how Hitachi is working with NVIDIA to enable the era of Infrastructure-as-a-Robot: from autonomous operations of trains to self-healing assets to optimized power grids and more.
2. Discover how accelerated computing tools streamline contingency analysis and long-term planning.
sessions.description:
Since its launch, cuDNN, a library for GPU-accelerating deep learning (DL) primitives, has been powering many AI applications in domains such as conversational AI, recommender systems, and speech recognition, among others. CuDNN remains a core library for DL primitives in popular frameworks such as PyTorch, JAX, Tensorflow, and many more while covering training, fine-tuning, and inference use cases.  Even in the rapidly evolving space of Gen AI — be it Llama, Gemma, or mixture-of-experts variants requiring complex DL primitives such as flash attention variants — cuDNN is powering them all.

Learn about new/updated APIs of cuDNN pertaining to Blackwell’s microscaling format, and how to program against those APIs. We'll deep dive into leveraging its graph APIs to build some fusion patterns, such as matmul fusion patterns and fused flash attention from state-of-the-art models. Understand how new CUDA graph support in cuDNN, not to be mistaken with the cuDNN graph API, could be exploited to avoid rebuilding CUDA graphs, offering an alternative of CUDA graph capture with real-world framework usage.

sessions.title: Unlocking Next-Level Efficiency with Accelerated Computing and Optimized Solvers (Presented by Hitachi Digital)
sessions.speakers: Raashi Khanduri (VP, NVIDIA Center of Excellence, Hitachi Digital)
sessions.points:
1. Learn about the challenges of training Salamandra with up to 2,048 NVIDIA H100 GPUs on a 7.8 trillion-token multilingual corpus
2. Explore how Salamandra includes unprecedented amounts of data from minority languages, setting a new standard in linguistic diversity
sessions.description:
Using accelerated computing and parallel processing, CUDA Solvers stand out as the game-changing computational power provider necessary to handle massive datasets and iterative problem-solving with unmatched speed and precision. This capability enables industries to perform large-scale simulations and analytics efficiently, driving smarter decision-making and unlocking new opportunities for optimization across industries.

This session explores how CUDA-accelerated solvers are delivering transformative results across various sectors. Using NVIDIA’s accelerated computing capabilities, Hitachi and NVIDIA are leveraging CUDA-driven solutions for innovation solutions to real-world industrial problems. Additionally, you will:

sessions.title: Develop and Deploy Optimized Generative AI Apps in the Cloud
sessions.speakers: Charlie Huang (Product Management and Marketing, NVIDIA) | Zion Brewer (Sr. Technical Partner Development Manager, NVIDIA) | Abhishek Sawarkar (Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Richard Wang (Senior AI/ML Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Juan Pablo (JP) Guerra (Senior AI Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Guy Farber (NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Proven methods for creating and optimizing immersive 3D experiences on Apple Vision Pro using NVIDIA Omniverse
2. Strategies for integrating real-time collaboration, simulation, and content creation workflows between Omniverse and Apple Vision Pro
sessions.description: Connect with experts from our product and cloud teams on the full stack integrations NVIDIA offers with our valued cloud partners. Whether you're a pro coder and prefer to build everything yourself from the ground up or would rather use the breadth of services that the cloud service providers have to offer.  We’ll discuss how the fully managed, full stack DGX Cloud platform that includes NVIDIA AI Enterprise with NeMo and NIM microservices, available on our leading cloud partners, can help you get from pilot to production quickly and cost effectively. Ask our experts on how to harness the power of NVIDIA's end-to-end AI platform to create, manage, and scale generative and agentic AI applications in the cloud. Gain a comprehensive understanding of how to integrate these cutting-edge technologies to maximize performance, efficiency, and innovation in AI-driven solutions. Whether you're a developer, data scientist, or IT professional, this session will equip you with the knowledge and tools necessary to advance your AI endeavors in the cloud.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Building an Optimized AI Platform for the Banking Industry
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Training AI Models
sessions.speakers: Jean-Michel Garcia (Chief Technology Officer, BNP Paribas) | Emmanuel Salzard (Head of ITG Labs, BNP Paribas)
sessions.description:
Within BNP Paribas Group, AI has been integrated into processes and tools since 2016. The progressive use of this technology, and data management, are now at the heart of the Bank's 2025 strategic plan.  However, enhanced computation capabilities and cloud evolutions encompass multiple transformative dimensions. 
 
Join us to learn how BNP Paribas balances technological innovation, regulatory compliance, and resource optimization to build a hybrid AI platform to deliver the group AI strategy.  We will highlight our approach to enabling key capabilities for the bank including AI-augmented applications, seamless human-AI interaction in business processes, and unified data/AI governance.

sessions.title: Using NVIDIA Omniverse To Support Space Mission Design: Simulation First
sessions.speakers: Lutz Richter (Space Projects Consultant, SoftServe, Inc.)
sessions.points:
1. Venture capital (VC) firms offer more than just funding. They provide mentorship, technical guidance, access to valuable partners and customers, and a range of other benefits
2. Making the right connections can help your business reach its potential
sessions.description: NIVIDIA Omniverse has been recognized by diverse industries as an extremely potent environment and toolset that provides a framework for rendering, for high-fidelity physics-based modeling of assets including perception systems and advanced controllers, and for corresponding simulations up to and exceeding real-time capability. We'll demonstrate several use cases of how NVIDIA Isaac Sim and other extensions of the Omniverse can be deployed for important spacecraft and space robotics design problems, such as digital twinning of satellite constellation orbit control, optimal control of dynamical systems as applied to rendezvous and capture for on-orbit servicing, spacecraft thermal analysis, and lunar rover digital twinning with terrain-vehicle interaction.

sessions.title: Next-Gen Customer Experience Using Domain-Expert Digital Employees
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Doron Sterlicht (Head of R&D, Amdocs)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the Importance of Evaluating LLMs: Learn why evaluating your LLMs is crucial for ensuring their accuracy, reliability, and ethical use
2. Unit-Testing LLM Agent Modules: Gain hands-on experience in unit-testing individual modules of your LLM agents to identify and address potential issues early in development
sessions.description: Learn how we are harnessing generative AI technology in the telecommunication industry. Amdocs has been working with NVIDIA to create a series of digital employees, able to work in unison and automate complex tasks, directly facing customers. We'll present our approach to verticalizing this disruptive technology, the technology choices and considerations, and some live demos showcasing the next generation of customer experience. Most of the content will fit technical as well as product and business personas.

sessions.title: Accelerate Enterprise AI Applications with NVIDIA AI Enterprise and DGX Cloud on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (Presented by Oracle)
sessions.speakers: Sid Padgaonkar (Product Management (Gen AI) - Strategic Customers, Oracle Corp.) | Dr. Sanjay Basu (Sr. Director, Oracle Gen AI and GPU Cloud Engineering, Oracle)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how to leverage NVIDIA Blueprints to simplify and expedite AI solution deployment
2. Understand practical techniques to combine NVIDIA Blueprints to create unique AI experiences for your enterprise
sessions.description: Learn how Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) integrates NVIDIA AI Enterprise and NVIDIA DGX Cloud to deliver accelerated AI development, training, and inference at scale. Enterprises can seamlessly leverage GPU-optimized tools, pre-trained models, and powerful AI infrastructure to enhance performance, scalability, and efficiency for AI workloads. OCI simplifies licensing, automates deployment, and provides comprehensive enterprise-grade support, enabling seamless operations. We'll show how OCI customers can unlock new levels of AI productivity with NVIDIA AI Enterprise and DGX Cloud, benefiting from unified support, data residency, and availability across OCI regions.

sessions.title: Accelerate Apache Spark With GPUs
sessions.speakers: Alessandro Bellina (Principal Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Hao Zhu (Senior Manager, NVIDIA) | Kuhu Shukla (Senior System Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Gera Shegalov (Principal System Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Mithun Radhakrishnan (Principal System Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Navin Kumar (Senior System Software Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. eview clustering algorithms such as K-Means, DBSCAN, and HDBSCAN so data scientists and developers can apply them for their own use cases.
2. You can achieve dramatically higher performance for common clustering operations on GPUs versus CPU-only systems.
sessions.description: Did you know GPUs can reduce the cost of your Apache Spark workloads? Find out how! Whether you're new to Apache Spark or a long-time user, we're here to talk about large-scale data processing, your production workloads, optimal configurations, and how to introduce GPUs to your environment. We can answer questions about job qualification and tuning with GPUs, as well as potential performance gains, cost savings, or power usage reduction possible with GPU-accelerated Spark. Learn about the migration journey others have already undertaken.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.points:
1. Geometric deep learning is a powerful resource for machine learning on protein surfaces
2. Protein surfaces has a non-Euclidean structure, so it is a natural fit for geometric deep learning
sessions.description: The healthcare and life sciences industries generate more data than any other industry, representing immense potential for insights-driven optimization. The challenge lies in refining this diverse and vast raw data into actionable insights that can transform drug development and health outcomes. We'll delve into the pivotal role of AI foundries in healthcare, showing how companies are harnessing advanced technologies to discover and develop new personalized medicines faster, as well as ensure access to patients who need them.

In this lightning session, Weights & Biases will showcase how to leverage readily available reference architectures provided by NVIDIA Blueprints with W&B Weave, the platform for creating GenAI applications to evaluate, monitor, and iterate and ultimately build a production grade AI assistant.

2. Inference Frameworks: Understand the capabilities and trade-offs of various inference frameworks like ONNX Runtime, TensorRT, and llama.cpp in constrained environments
sessions.description: We’ll help you understand how to get the most out of the GB200 NVL72 architecture in a hyperscale environment. We'll share details on how GB200 NVL72 is implemented from a topology perspective; review how new APIs for unified memory, ultra-low datatype precision, and hardware-accelerated compression can be leveraged for maximum performance; and cover considerations on workload placement, parallelism strategies, and infrastructure resilience.

sessions.title: Impact of Standardization on Functional Safety-Related AI-Based Applications
sessions.speakers: Riccardo Mariani (VP Safety, NVIDIA) | Mandar Pitale (Senior Manager, Safety Management for Automotive Software, NVIDIA) | Tina Kirschner (Manager Regulatory Affairs, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand GPU server power densification trends and its impact on cooling technologies used in the data center
2. Compare overall design architectures of traditional CPU-based data halls with GPU-based data halls supporting AI applications
sessions.description:
As AI systems become more embedded in autonomous vehicles, robotics, healthcare, manufacturing, and critical infrastructure, ensuring their safety/reliability/dependability has become a top priority. Standardization, specifically related to AI functional safety, plays a vital role in addressing these challenges. We'll focus on the critical role of AI functional safety standards in shaping future of AI systems used in safety-critical applications. We'll explore upcoming AI functional safety standards and their impact, as these standards aim to set global benchmarks and guide organizations in deploying AI safely.
 
Key points are:
•	Understanding AI functional safety in safety-critical systems
•	An overview of the upcoming ISO/PAS 8800 and ISO/IEC TS 22440 standard series, and how they will impact safety-critical AI applications
•	Guidance on how to address the gaps between these standards and classical functional safety standards
•	Insights into global trends and future directionsImportant:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

2. Unified frameworks and codebases can ensure scalability across diverse hardware platforms
sessions.description: Learn how agentic architecture, and digital human capabilities, can help solve complex customer support cases. We'll demonstrate a business use case in the context of a retirement plan provider, and how the firm aims to improve its retirement plan participant experience. We'll demonstrate two capabilities built jointly between Accenture and NVIDIA teams: a virtual advisor to support retirement plan participants, and an AI agent to assist human agents in the contact center supporting plan participants.

Explore how QCT maximizes performance of large-scale GPU clusters with optimized system designs, user-friendly modularity, superior cooling, and unmatched networking and storage expansions. Uncover QCT’s comprehensive solutions spanning from servers to rack solutions with air and liquid cooling options, including QCT’s stand-alone liquid cooling rack compatible with diverse QCT products. With QCT, enterprises can explore the most suitable solutions for their business applications, creating the most powerful infrastructure for their operations.

sessions.title: Anonymized Network Sensing Graph Challenge
sessions.speakers: Vijay Gadepally (Sr. Scientist, MIT Lincoln Laboratory) | Hayden Jananthan (Technical Staff, MIT Lincoln Laboratory) | Siddharth Samsi (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Explore a research-based approach to architectural design that spans traditional wisdom of construction, modern computer graphics, computational design, robotic fabrication, and video games
2. Deep dive into AI augmentation and enhancement of design
sessions.description: The MIT/IEEE/Amazon Network Sensing Graph Challenge seeks to enable large, open, community-based approaches to protecting networks. Many large-scale networking problems can only be solved with community access to very broad datasets with the highest regard for privacy and strong community buy-in. This challenge provides an opportunity to highlight novel approaches for optimizing the construction and analysis of anonymized traffic matrices using over 100 billion network packets derived from the CAIDA internet telescope. A GraphBLAS reference implementation is provided to illustrate a well-defined context for demonstrating innovation. We'll show a simple solution that's entirely based on NVIDIA GPUs and open-source software. Our implementation is based on the RAPIDS ecosystem and achieves a 300X speedup for graph construction and a 178X speedup for calculating graph properties on a single GPU.

sessions.title: AI Agents and Digital Humans Shaping the Future of Interaction in Telecoms
sessions.speakers: Rohit Batra (General Manager, Manufacturing and TMT (Telecom, Media, Technology) Industries, ServiceNow) | Lilach Ilan (Global Head of Business Development -Telco Operations, NVIDIA) | Alan Dennis (Professor, Kelley School of Business, Indiana University) | Anthony Goonetilleke (Group President, Technology and Head of Strategy, Amdocs) | Mark Austin (VP, Data Science, AI and Automation, AT&T)
sessions.points:
1. Critical lessons from implementing AI at scale – from technical execution challenges to fostering cross-functional alignment between practitioners and business leaders.
2. How Capital One's AI organization bridges cutting-edge research with practical applications.
sessions.description:
The integration of AI agents and digital humans is transforming industries by redefining how organizations engage with customers and streamline operations. We'll delve into the cutting-edge developments and challenges in deploying digital human agents and AI-driven solutions across various domains in the telecommunications industry.

Alan Dennis, from Kelley School of Business, will present insights from his groundbreaking research on the effectiveness and user perceptions of digital human agents compared to chatbots and human agents. His studies, which include neurophysiological and behavioral analysis, highlight the promise and pitfalls of current digital human technologies and their potential to overcome algorithm aversion.

Complementing these academic perspectives, two executives from leading telco solution providers will share their experiences and strategies for leveraging AI agents to enhance network operations and customer experience in telecommunications. The panel will discuss real-world applications, showing the practical and transformative impact of AI in this sector.

sessions.title: Quantize Large Transformer Diffusion Models to Improve End-to-End Latencies and Save Inference Cost
sessions.speakers: Allie Yang (Sr. Machine Learning Engineer, Adobe) | Maximilian Mueller (Sr. Developer Technology Software Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. An overview of Accelerated Quantum Computing with CUDA-Q
2. A quick start to programming with CUDA-Q
sessions.description:
The emergence of diffusion models enables new creative workflows for artists, but their resource-intensive nature poses significant deployment challenges. With state-of-the-art image diffusion requiring tens of seconds per image, the computational cost of video diffusion is even more substantial.
We'll showcase the path from research to production-ready TensorRT deployment, leveraging the latest fp8 tensor cores on H100. Not only does this save inference cost, but it also increases the number of users that can be served per GPU. We'll provide in-depth insights into the performance and quality complexities of deploying a quantized diffuser on Adobe’s example. This presentation is ideal for AI researchers and software engineers looking to optimize diffusion model deployment on any NVIDIA GPUs.

Leveraging WEKA’s advanced data platform with NVIDIA NeMo and NIM, WARRP delivers unmatched performance, seamless workload portability, and adaptability for enterprise AI environments.

sessions.points:

We'll explore real-world use cases, such as monitoring regional cloud and fog patterns, supporting medical diagnostics, detecting anomalies in production lines, and utilizing robots for assembly operations. Furthermore, we'll outline our decision-making process for selecting and optimizing algorithms to balance resource constraints with user expectations, ensuring optimal performance, efficiency, and reliability across various scenarios.

Utilizing NVIDIA's full-stack toolset and Leidos' expertise in modeling, simulation, and C2 technologies, this cloud-native solution orchestrates the multi-agent system to enhance decision-making efficiency and effectiveness in high-stress environments.

sessions.title: MedTech: From Medical Imaging to Digital Surgery
sessions.speakers: Marc Edgar (Senior Alliance Manager, NVIDIA) | Stephen Aylward (Global Alliance Manager for Developer Relations, MedTech, NVIDIA) | Mostafa Toloui (Holoscan Product Management Lead, NVIDIA) | Adam Thompson (Principal Technical Product Manager - Sensor Processing, NVIDIA) | Prerna Dogra (Senior Manager for Healthcare AI Products, NVIDIA) | Mahdi Azizian (NVIDIA) | Oliver Kutter (Solution Architect Manager, NVIDIA) | Bob Keating (NVIDIA) | Andres Diaz-Pinto (Technical Marketing Engineer, Healthcare, NVIDIA) | David Niewolny (Sr. Director of Business Development, Healthcare/Medical, NVIDIA) | Maximilian Ofir (Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA) | Nadim Daher (Healthcare Ecosystem Development, NVIDIA) | Julien Jomier (NVIDIA)

NVIDIA's platforms — MONAI, Holoscan, Isaac, Omniverse, and Metropolis — span model training, digital twins/simulations, and runtime deployment. Together, they provide developers with an end-to-end, accelerated, full-stack infrastructure, enabling rapid prototyping and scalable development of real-time AI applications. Learn from NVIDIA experts how our platforms can save you time and money in bringing AI-enabled systems to market, from smart diagnostic devices and innovative imaging systems to surgical robots trained using digital twin technologies.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. sessions.title: Securing the Future: Protecting and Consuming Agentic AI
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Image / Video Detection & Recognition

sessions.points:

sessions.description:
This session is designed to equip business leaders and chief information security officers with the knowledge and strategies needed to protect and effectively consume agentic AI, safeguarding their organizations from emerging threats.

Key Topics: Understanding Agentic AI, Emerging Threats in Agentic AI, Best Practices for Securing Agentic Systems, Compliance and Regulatory Considerations, Incident Response Planning, Collaboration and Training

sessions.title: The Role of AI and Accelerated Computing in Understanding and Mitigating Urban Climate Change
sessions.speakers: Pascal Perez (Sr. Professor, Director of AURIN, University of Melbourne) | Johan Barthelemy (Strategic Researcher Engagement, NVIDIA) | John Taylor (Professor, Australian National University) | Albert Bifet (Professor, University of Waikato) | Flora Salim (Professor, University of New South Wales)
sessions.points:
1. There is no one-size-fits-all LLM for clinical applications. Our evaluation shows that LLMs exhibit a peculiar performance profile, but decomposing it on relevant dimensions can help researchers select the right one for their application
2. In close-ended evaluation, such as the ones on benchmarks (like MedQA, USMLE, MMLU,) model size and medical tuning matter, with larger models outperforming smaller ones, and medically tuned models outperforming their non-medically-tuned base models
sessions.description:
This panel explores the transformative potential of artificial intelligence and accelerated computing in deciphering the complex drivers of urban climate change, and how it can help mitigate it. As cities, home to 4.4 billion people, grapple with increasing environmental challenges, including extreme heat waves driven by a combination of climate change and the urban heat island effect, these cutting-edge technologies offer unprecedented capabilities to analyze vast datasets, model intricate urban systems, and generate actionable insights for policymakers and urban planners.

We'll delve into how AI-powered tools are revolutionizing climate modeling and weather forecasting, enabling high-resolution simulations of urban microclimates and their interactions with the built environment. Experts will discuss the application of generative AI, digital twins, and machine learning algorithms in processing and interpreting diverse data sources, including satellite imagery, internet-of-things sensor networks, and social media feeds, to provide a comprehensive understanding of urban heat islands, air pollution patterns, and energy consumption dynamics.

We'll highlight accelerated computing's role in dramatically reducing computation time and energy consumption for climate simulations and show how it enables more frequent and detailed analyses of urban climate phenomena. We'll also cover innovative projects leveraging these technologies, such as digital twins of cities and AI-driven urban planning tools that optimize for climate resilience. 

Panelists will discuss the challenges and opportunities in implementing AI and accelerated computing solutions, including data privacy concerns, the need for interdisciplinary collaboration, the critical role of compute infrastructure, and strategies for ensuring equitable access to these technologies. We'll finish by exploring the potential of these technologies to inform evidence-based climate adaptation strategies and contribute to sustainable development goals.

sessions.title: Transform AECO with AI: Insights from Industry Innovators
sessions.speakers: Mike Haley (SVP, Research, Autodesk) | Jeff Mottle (NVIDIA) | Karoliina Torttila (Director, Artificial Intelligence, Trimble) | Francois Valois (VP Civil Infrastructure, Bentley Systems) | Charles Sheridan (Chief AI and Data Officer, Nemetschek)
sessions.points:
1. Hear about the latest models, tools, and techniques for creating agentic and RAG pipelines for multimodal data ingestion, extraction, and retrieval
2. Explore blueprints and best practices for building and tuning AI pipelines that deliver scalable, high-accuracy, high-throughput data retrieval
sessions.description:
Artificial intelligence is reshaping the architecture, engineering, construction, & operations (AECO) industry, unlocking new possibilities and revolutionizing workflows. Join our engaging panel discussion with thought leaders from Trimble, Autodesk, Bentley Systems, and Nemetschek as they explore the transformative potential of AI in AECO. Discover how AI is addressing some of the industry’s biggest challenges, driving innovation in design, construction, and infrastructure management, and paving the way for smarter, more sustainable practices. Gain insights into current trends, the exciting momentum surrounding AI adoption, and the opportunities it presents for redefining the future of AECO.

Whether you’re navigating today’s AI-driven landscape or seeking inspiration for tomorrow, this session will provide valuable perspectives, actionable takeaways, and a glimpse into how these global leaders are shaping the industry’s next chapter. Don’t miss the chance to be part of the conversation driving the future of AECO!

sessions.title: Scaling AI Platform at LinkedIn: LLMs, Agents, GPUs, Kernels, and More
sessions.speakers: Animesh Singh (Executive Director, AI Platform, LinkedIn)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the unique security challenges posed by agentic AI systems
2. Gain practical insights into securing agentic systems and mitigating AI-specific threats
sessions.description: With more than a billion members on the platform, LinkedIn is AI-powered at its very core. In addition to recommendation/ranking powered feed, jobs, etc., we've recently launched many generative AI capabilities, and we heavily leverage NVIDIA GPUs for training. We'll cover our journey of scaling AI platform at all layers, including our GPU infrastructure; GPU kernels (including Kernel fusion), investments in compute foundations for distributed hierarchical checkpointing/restore, elastic queues, scaling large language models (LLMs) via techniques like Zero++, LLM agents, graph neural networks (GNNs), and everything in between.

sessions.title: Insights Into Disney’s Robotic Character Platform
sessions.speakers: Moritz Baecher (Associate Lab Director, Disney Research)

1. GPU architectural choices based on model selection (LLMs, GNNs)
2. Scaling AI Infra for social networlng companies, running at internet scale
sessions.description: At Disney, we're redefining entertainment robotics from the ground up and are building artist-centric tools that provide creative control of dynamic character motion. Gain insight into our robotic character platform that enables the rapid design of freely roaming robotic characters like our BDX Droids. See how our characters learn to imitate artist-specified animations with a combination of deep reinforcement learning and GPU-accelerated simulation. Learn how we get our characters to perform highly challenging motions at the limit of hardware, and see the first results of bringing engaging autonomous interactions to our characters.

sessions.points:

sessions.description: Artificial intelligence is unlocking new use cases in industrial, robotics, and medical, in which safety and security are a key concern. Get an overview of ongoing AI safety and security standardization initiatives. We'll also discuss the impact of those new requirements to AI-based methodologies, architectures, and tools.

sessions.title: Accelerate Super Long-Context LLM Inference
sessions.speakers: Boyuan Huang (Product Director of Big Data and AI platform, Alibaba Cloud Intelligence Group)
sessions.points:
1. Samsung's current memory and storage technologies, including GDDR7, HBM3E, LP5X, and SSD 22x42, and their impact on NVIDIA's Grace Blackwell platform
2. How next-generation HBM4 and custom HBM will drive future breakthroughs, and the applications they will enable
sessions.description: As the context length of LLM serving continues to increase, the inference time escalates dramatically. To strike this issue, we devise three key techniques: A fine-grained sparse attention algorithm for the pre-filling phase, equipped by a high-performance token-sparsity attention kernel using Tensor Core with CUTLASS CUTE, which delivers an 8X speedup at a 10X sparse rate without sacrificing accuracy; block-sparsity attention for the decoding phase, which further doubles the sparse rate while preserving accuracy with novel KV cache clustering; dynamic chunked pipeline parallelism, which decomposes a long sequence into chunks with adaptively updated chunk size based on an analytical cost model to balance pipeline stages, resulting in about 2X acceleration over Tensor Parallelism on eight GPUs. The above optimizations have empowered over 20X and 4X speedups for the pre-filling and decoding phases, respectively, while preserving accuracy with context length of 1 million tokens.

sessions.title: Optimizing Vector Search for Scalable AI Native Applications using open source software
sessions.speakers: Etienne Dilocker (Co-Founder & CTO, Weaviate) | Ajit Mistry (Research Engineer, Weaviate)
sessions.points:
1. Achieving zero-tail latency ensures that all requests, even those in the "tail" of the distribution, experience minimal delays, leading to more consistent performance, reducing jitter, and enabling faster decision-making processes.
2. Learn best-practices and lessons we've learned when building large scale networks for AI
sessions.description:
Vector search is crucial for high-performance AI applications and the need for flexible solutions that can efficiently handle both real-time and batch inference scenarios has grown. In this session, we’ll show you how to optimize vector search by integrating Weaviate, an open-source vector database, with NVIDIA cuVS, a GPU-powered vector search and clustering library that accelerates batch query performance and data ingestion.

We'll examine the architectural distinctions between the CPU-optimized HNSW and GPU-optimized CAGRA graph approximate nearest neighbors (ANN) algorithms, and discuss our implementation journey, including cuVS's dynamic batch support. By the end of this session, you'll be equipped with practical knowledge on pairing Weaviate with the GPU. This includes implementing hybrid CPU/GPU architectures, leveraging index conversion capabilities, and scaling AI systems to meet the growing demands of the future.

sessions.title: RBC’s In-Branch Fraud Support Avatar - Purpose, NVIDIA Architecture & Lessons Learned
sessions.speakers: James Sutton (Senior Solutions Architect, GenAI, NVIDIA) | Ronnie Sanders (Senior Director, PB&CB Data & Analytics, Royal Bank of Canada)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how AI agents can be workforce multipliers that greatly increase the productivity of existing teams and help address the talent gap in critical industries like cybersecurity.
2. Understand the importance of optimizing performance, cost, and security when implementing autonomous agents at scale.
sessions.description:
In today’s fast-evolving financial landscape, fraud prevention and customer support are critical yet resource-intensive areas for banks. RBC, in collaboration with NVIDIA and Quantiphi, developed an innovative fraud support agent designed to address these challenges directly in branches.
Using NVIDIA NIM, NeMo Guardrails, NeMo Retriever, PEFT/LoRA, and ACE/Tokkio pipelines, we built a digital avatar that empowers branch employees to handle fraud and account access issues with ease. By providing second-monitor support via a digital agent, this solution improves operational efficiency and reduces the need for specialized fraud call centers.

We'll highlight the unique challenges of in-branch expertise variability and the potential for digital transformation within retail banking, offering practical insights into the intersection of AI, banking, and real-time customer service.

By harnessing advancements in generative AI, this program aims to create solutions tailored to India’s diverse linguistic and cultural contexts. Central to this effort is the “My Nation, My Voice” campaign, ensuring equitable access to services across various dialects.

In agriculture, real-time sensor data provides farmers with localized information, empowering informed decision-making. In ecommerce, automated product listings in multiple languages promote inclusivity for rural sellers and micro, small, and medium enterprises via the Open Network for Digital Commerce.

By transforming India into a global data powerhouse through the “Bharat Data Sagar,” the initiative leverages the country’s cultural diversity for innovative AI applications. NVIDIA AI Enterprise (NVAIE) enhances BharatGPT’s training efficiency, achieving a 92-95% scalability factor and enabling the development of high-quality AI models for India’s multilingual population.

sessions.title: Democratizing AI Model Optimization: A Managed Service Platform for Fine-Tuning Beyond RAG (Presented by SHI International Corp.)

sessions.speakers: Ganesh Tyagali (Lead Data Scientist, SHI International Corp.)
sessions.points:
1. Discover how Base Command Manager simplifies cluster provisioning, workload management, and infrastructure monitoring for AI data centers
2. Learn best practices for deploying and managing multi-GPU and multi-node job scheduling across your AI infrastructure
sessions.description:
As enterprises of all sizes attempt to incorporate generative AI solutions into their workflows, they increasingly face the limitations of using generic foundational models: contextual misalignment, data privacy and compliance challenges, and performance inconsistency. Typical reliefs, such as prompt engineering and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), introduce their own drawbacks — increased inference latencies and shallow enterprise knowledge. Fine-tuning addresses these by generating optimized domain-specific solutions with organizational intelligence, but is technically complex and computationally intensive, limiting its feasibility.

The Fine-Tuning As a Managed Service platform solves this problem by providing a managed platform that pairs human AI expertise, leveraging varied fine-tuning techniques — supervised, reinforcement learning, PEFT etc. — with NVIDIA’s NIMs and GPUs to deliver optimized performant models for all enterprises, removing a key hurdle for organizations in realizing the return on investment in generative AI.

sessions.title: Profile Large Language Model Trainings on the Grace Hopper Superchip

sessions.points: 1. Learn more about the Project DIGITS software development environment
sessions.description: As LLMs continue to grow in size and demand, there's an increasing need to maximize the efficiency of available computational resources during training. sessions.title: Shaping the Future of Digital Health
sessions.speakers: Cedric Steenbeke (HCLS Startups Developer Relations Lead, EMEA, NVIDIA) | Simon Hepworth (Director of Enterprise, Imperial College) | Lars Maaløe (Co-Founder and CTO, Corti) | Dr. Farnaz Behroozi (Head of Pharma, Huma Therapeutics) | Dr. Michal Guindy (Radiologist & co-founder of RISE, Assuta)
sessions.points: 1. Accelerate your AI journey with confidence using Dell and NVIDIA’s joint solutions and services and pave the way for transformative business outcomes
sessions.description: Digital health is transforming healthcare delivery, and startups are at the forefront of this innovation. A well-curated panel of digital health startup founders and experts will provide valuable insights into this dynamic and impactful industry. It will be informative for entrepreneurs, investors, healthcare professionals, and anyone else interested in the intersection of technology and healthcare.

sessions.title: Deploying RAG Pipelines for Production at Scale
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Computational Chemistry / Materials Science
sessions.speakers: Juan Jose Durillo Barrionuevo (DLI Principal Instructor, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn architectural patterns for human-AI collaborative systems in scientific research, focusing on: 1) knowledge integration from computational experiments, and 2) designing systems that expose their reasoning pathways rather than just delivering answers.
2. Understand design considerations for scientific AI systems that balance automation with human insight, including handling uncertainty, maintaining provenance, and integrating domain expertise.
sessions.description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines are revolutionizing enterprise operations. However, most existing tutorials stop at proof-of-concept implementations that falter when scaling. This workshop aims to bridge that gap, focusing on building scalable, production-ready RAG pipelines powered by NVIDIA NIM microservices and Kubernetes. Participants will gain hands-on experience deploying, monitoring, and scaling RAG pipelines with the NIM Operator and learn best practices for infrastructure optimization, performance monitoring, and handling high traffic volumes.The workshop begins by building a simple RAG pipeline using the NVIDIA API catalog. Participants will deploy and test individual components in a local environment using Docker Compose. Once familiar with the basics, the focus will shift to deploying NIMs, such as LLM, NeMo Retriever Text Embedding, and NeMo Retriever Text Reranking, in a Kubernetes cluster using the NIM Operator. This will include managing the deployment, monitoring, and scalability of NVIDIA NIM microservices. Building on these deployments, the workshop will cover constructing a production-grade RAG pipeline using the deployed NIMs and explore NVIDIA's blueprint for PDF ingestion, learning how to integrate it into the RAG pipeline.To ensure operational efficiency, the workshop will introduce Prometheus and Grafana for monitoring pipeline performance, cluster health, and resource utilization. Scalability will be addressed through the use of the Kubernetes Horizontal Pod Autoscaler (HPA) for dynamically scaling NIMs based on custom metrics in conjunction with the NIM Operator. Custom dashboards will be created to visualize key metrics and interpret performance insights.You’ll be able to:Build a simple RAG pipeline using API endpoints, deployed locally with Docker Compose.Deploy a variety of NVIDIA NIM microservices in a Kubernetes cluster using the NIM Operator.Combine NIMs into a cohesive, production-grade RAG pipeline and integrate advanced data ingestion workflows.Monitor RAG pipelines and Kubernetes clusters with Prometheus and Grafana.Scale NIMs to handle high traffic using the NIM Operator.Create, deploy, and scale RAG pipelines for a variety of agentic workflows, including PDF ingestion.Prerequisite(s):Familiarity working with LLM-based applications.Familiarity with RAG pipelines.Familiarity working with Kubernetes.Familiarity working with Helm.Certificate:Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth.

sessions.title: Leverage Tailored LLMs for Improved Insights in Rail Transportation
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Deep Learning Frameworks
sessions.speakers: Janus Wawrzinek (Sr. Key Expert for Data Science, Siemens)
sessions.points:
1. Optimize your PyTorch models with Thunder built-in optimizations
2. Deliver your bespoke optimizations to a variety of models without having to adapt each
sessions.description: We'll share our experience and insights from our ongoing generative AI use cases including chatbots, retrieval-augmented generators, and code generators. We leverage our on-premises NVIDIA cluster to train and deliver fine-tuned LLMS to solve and assist users with problems that require highly domain-specific knowledge.

sessions.title: Building RAG Agents With LLMs
sessions.speakers: Oleg Ovcharenko (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Discover how NVIDIA DOCA accelerates data center development for GenAI workloads, enhancing performance, scalability, and efficiency
2. Learn strategies to optimize data processing and security in AI cloud environments using NVIDIA DOCA
sessions.description: Agents powered by large language models (LLMs) are quickly gaining popularity from both individuals and companies as people are finding new emerging capabilities and opportunities to greatly improve their productivity. An especially powerful recent development has been the popularization of retrieval-based LLM systems that can hold informed conversations by using tools, looking at documents, and planning their approaches. These systems are exciting to experiment with and offer unprecedented opportunities to make life easier, but also require many queries to large deep learning models and need to be implemented efficiently. This course will demonstrate how you can deploy an agent system in practice and scale up your system to meet the demands of your customers.You’ll learn:The components needed to create a simple RAG agent that considers the set of documents provided to it.Organization techniques to structure your system in a modular way, so you can scale up the deployment from a web-hosted service to a dedicated GPU cluster.Tracking schemes to evaluate your system's efficiency and quality of output.Prerequisite(s):Intermediate understanding of Python, LangChain comfort, and comfort with LLMs.RAG 101/Prompt-Eng/LangChain recommended.Certificate:Upon successful completion of the assessment, you’ll receive an NVIDIA certificate to recognize your subject matter competency and support your professional career growth.

sessions.title: Advancing Automotive Factory Planning at BMW With AI-Enabled Digital Twins
sessions.speakers: Felix Theurer (Digital Solutions Architect Virtual Factory, BMW) | Tobias Delago (Researcher, BMW) | Harshit Raikar (Lead Frontend-Stream Omniverse, BMW Group)
sessions.points:
1. NVIDIA Omniverse APIs and NIMs enhance AV simulation workflows with sensor simulation and neural reconstruction
2. Generative AI is empowering AV developers to address critical challenges in development and testing
sessions.description: Join us to explore how BMW delivers factory planning applications, built on NVIDIA Omniverse and OpenUSD, to an industrial scale, transitioning from on-premises GPUs to fully managed, high-performance cloud infrastructure, supporting hundreds of our factory planners. We’ll share how BMW developers built an integrated ecosystem and data pipeline, automating processes such as file conversion, authoring system integration, and file validity management. Additionally, we’ll showcase our suite of adapted and custom extensions developed for tasks like clash detection and scene segmentation. Finally, learn how our teams are pushing innovation with LLM-powered solutions like our intelligent assistant to seamlessly navigate complex factory environments and enhance usability.

sessions.title: An AI Team Lead’s Guide: Drive Developer Teams' Excellence
sessions.speakers: Karine Vardazaryan (NVIDIA) | Dan Ring (Senior ML Team Lead, Chaos) | Tomer Gal (Managing Director, NVIDIA Alliance, AI and Accelerated Computing, Deloitte) | Ulrik Nicolai de Lichtenberg (Director of Scientific Projects, Danish Center for AI Innovation (DCAI)) | Meznah Almutairy (AI consultant and Lead of Generative AI Academy, Saudi Data and Artificial Intelligence Authority (SDAIA))
sessions.points:
1. Visualize unstructured data with embeddings
2. Build and deploy an interactive visualization application for large datasets
sessions.description:
AI is in the active implementation phase across all industries, and the pressure on developer teams is high because business is pushing to deliver advanced solutions fast. Lack of skills is still one of the top barriers for AI implementation, and technical leaders across the world need to recruit bright talents and then upskill and maintain them to achieve results and provide opportunity for staff personal development. 

Our panel will discuss where to find the right skills, how to  implement the learning paths to grow the hottest skills in the market within your team and validate their knowledge, and how to interact with the wider ecosystem by learning about successful examples of national AI projects. If you're a developer considering the next step in your career, or a business leader exploring ways to ensure your teams have the skills needed to tackle new workloads, this session is for you.

sessions.title: Accelerate Robotics Development With Digital Twins: Strategic Insights for Innovators
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Training AI Models
sessions.speakers: Anthony Rizk (Innovation Lab Engineering Manager, idealworks) | Elie Khoury (Engineering Manager Simulation, Idealworks)
sessions.points:
1. AI-defined vehicles are revolutionizing autonomous driving with the need for integrated, end-to-end platforms
2. NVIDIA’s three-computer solution spans from cloud to car, enabling scalable and high-performance in-vehicle computing
sessions.description: Explore how Idealworks builds on NVIDIA Isaac and Omniverse to revolutionize robotics through advanced simulation and synthetic data generation. We'll delve into how idealworks applies digital twins in single-robot use cases and advanced research. Learn about the practical use of vSLAM mapping, depth estimation with extended service set networks, and real-time 3D perception using nvblox in Isaac Perceptor. We’ll also discuss the creation of synthetic datasets using Omniverse extensions, accelerating our development cycles. Discover why companies should invest in simulation for industrial robotics development to save time, reduce costs, and streamline development.

sessions.title: Bridging Performance and Flexibility in Network Architecture
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Sensor Fusion
sessions.speakers: Jean-Baptiste Kempf (Chief Technology Officer, Scaleway)
sessions.points:
1. How neural networks outperform classical algorithms in extracting meaningful features from complex radar data
2. Techniques for optimizing radar-only perception systems through data-driven approaches like multitask learning
sessions.description: A lack of dynamic flexibility, the ability to change fabric on the fly is a significant challenge for building networking architectures. In this talk we will explore some real-world implementations of Spectrum-X and share important lessons learnt. You’ll see how you can change the number of GPUs you use without having to rewire the cluster or do complex configuration changes. You’ll learn how to maximize the benefit provided by the flexibility of the architecture and see how simple implementation is for network engineers used to Ethernet fabrics.

sessions.title: Beyond Genomes: A Global AI Dataset for Biology
sessions.speakers: Philipp Lorenz (CTO, Basecamp Research)
sessions.points:
1. Dynamic flexibility: Spectrum-X’s ability to change the fabric on the fly allows users to adapt resources quickly without complex configurations, enhancing operational efficiency and responsiveness to changing demands
2. High performance: The architecture provides east-west traffic performance comparable to InfiniBand fabrics, ensuring that users experience top-tier performance while leveraging familiar Ethernet-like simplicity for network engineers
sessions.description: The vast majority of life on earth remains undiscovered and has not been digitized for AI applications and foundation models. You will learn how we constructed a global data supply chain across five continents. This unique dataset is two orders of magnitude more diverse in biological sequences (DNA and protein) than any publicly available data. We’ll share the techniques and tools used to gather and process such a diverse dataset, explain how generative models can be trained to model coevolution in specific environments, and demonstrate practical applications of this dataset in genetic medicine and beyond.

sessions.title: Insights and Strategies For Scaling Your Startup
sessions.speakers: Alexander Martynau (Inception Community Manager, Nordics and CEE, NVIDIA) | Philip Hutchinson (Sr. AI Strategist, appliedAI Institute for Europe) | Stéphane Requena (CTO, GENCI) | Jacob Ramlov (Co-Founder and CAIO, Go Autonomous) | Samantha Jérusalmy (Partner, Elaia)
sessions.points:
1. Learn directly from data science champions on optimizing model performance for real-world applications
2. Discover the latest tools and techniques winning data science competitions today
sessions.description: We'll explore critical factors driving startup success in today's dynamic landscape, with a particular focus on the transformative potential of AI. Hear a diverse panel of experts share real-life examples of ways startups can reach their full potential and access valuable support. You’ll gain practical knowledge, discover valuable resources, and connect with key players in the startup ecosystem. You’ll learn how to access funding opportunities and hear more about the tools, resources, and programs that are available to help startups across the life cycle.

sessions.title: Pioneering AI Assistants in Banking
sessions.speakers: Julia Koch (Executive Director, Chief Customer Officer, Chief Development Officer, Finanz Informatik)
sessions.points:
1. We'll present multi-modal foundation models for science that can be used as strong baselines or be further fine-tuned by scientists for specific applications
2. Our models democratize AI in science by providing off-the-shelf models that have stronger priors (i.e., background knowledge) for shared general concepts such as causality, measurement, signal processing, and even more specialized shared concepts like wave-like behavior, which otherwise would need to be learned from scratch
sessions.description: Hear about the large-scale implementation of “S-AIPilot.” Learn how one of the first custom-made personal AI assistants, operated in-house and designed specifically for the employee workplace of the Savings Banks, was deployed 100% on-premises. Discover the benefits of the AI operating within Finanz Informatik (FI)’s own data center and understand the complexities and importance of integrating with the core banking system. This enabled contextually relevant support while ensuring data privacy and compliance. Explore the architecture, security measures, scalability of the AI infrastructure, and data integrity practices from one of the largest generative AI deployments worldwide, powered by NVIDIA GPUs.

sessions.title: AI Innovations Driving Economic Growth
sessions.speakers: Fred Swaniker (Founder and CEO, Sand Technologies) | Fatima Tambajang (NVIDIA) | Maroua Nouira (Program Lead, Novation City) | Andrew Sweet (VP of Innovation, The Rockefeller Foundation) | Philip Thigo (Special Envoy for Technology, Republic of Kenya)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how Holoscan for Media is empowering developers to build flexible, scalable applications that can be deployed across various environments, from on-premises to cloud and edge.
2. Explore how this platform is driving the transition to software-defined broadcast infrastructure, enabling dynamic resource allocation, and facilitating the integration of cutting-edge AI capabilities into live production workflows
sessions.description: In this panel, you’ll hear from companies who are leveraging technologies from conversational AI to multi-modal large language models (MLLMs) to drive innovation in healthcare, agriculture, and education. Hear from specialists from a diverse range of industries working to support farmers, improve healthcare outcomes, and expand access to education. We'll delve into the technologies making these advancements possible and share real-world examples highlighting practical applications. We'll discuss the challenges and opportunities of implementing AI solutions, the impact already being seen, and the ongoing potential of these innovations.

sessions.title: State-of-the-Art Deep Learning Foundation Models for Biology
sessions.topic: Content Creation / Rendering - Media Streaming / Data Streaming
sessions.speakers: Guillaume Richard (Sr. Research Scientist, Instadeep)
sessions.points:
1. AI for fan engagement: Cutting-edge applications that enhance the viewer experience by personalizing content, creating interactive experiences, and providing real-time insights, revolutionizing how viewers connect with sports events.
2. Data-driven decision making: AI analysis that transform operations through smart venue management, automated content creation, and data-driven decision-making, streamlining processes both on and off the field.
sessions.description: We'll explore making biological sequence data accessible through conversational AI. We'll discuss the challenges current conversational AI faces in handling biological sequences, and why existing tools present accessibility barriers. We'll then explore new techniques for integrating sequence understanding into conversational frameworks, including how to combine language and sequence data for more intuitive interaction. Learn about methods for calibrating confidence in AI-generated insights from biological data. Finally, we'll discuss potential applications of this technology in biology, including data analysis and knowledge discovery. We aim to inspire new research and foster collaboration between AI specialists and biologists, paving the way for more accessible bioinformatics tools.

sessions.title: Automatic Large-Scale Synthetic Data Generation for Developing Fully Automated Trains
sessions.speakers: Sebastian Dr. Skibinski (SW Engineering Manager Automated Driving, Digitale Schiene Deutschland) | José Minguez Garrigues (PO Simulation Toolchain, Digitale Schiene Deutschland)
sessions.points:
1. Best practices for building AI RAG applications at scale
2. Using data gravity to accelerate your AI initiatives
sessions.description: For the development, specification, and testing of fully-automated trains, access to vast amounts of sensor data covering the entire operational design domain (ODD) is critical — particularly for non-regular scenarios where real-world data is scarce or unavailable. By harnessing the power of NVIDIA Omniverse, we’ve developed a cutting-edge toolchain that traverses the ODD and orchestrates the simulation of both regular and non-regular railway scenarios at massive scale. This comprehensive synthetic data, combined with real-world data, creates a robust foundation for training advanced machine learning models specifically tailored for railway automation, overcoming the limitations of conventional data sources.

sessions.title: Near-Real-Time Fire Detection Leveraging Edge AI in Space: Transforming Thermal Earth Observation with NVIDIA
sessions.speakers: Julia Gottfriedsen (Head of Data Science and AI, OroraTech GmbH) | Fabian Schöttl (Senior Software Engineer, OroraTech)
sessions.points:
1. Archive is currently a required cost center, not a profit center
2. Archival content should be analyzed with AI on ingest
sessions.description: We'll showcase space-based fire detection leveraging NVIDIA technology on an operational thermal cubesat constellation. By using NVIDIA Jetson on board the satellite, image processing and fire detection can be achieved in under 60 seconds, dramatically reducing ground-based processing requirements and delivering near-real-time data to fire management teams. AI-powered cloud masking and onboard compression on the edge further refine data quality and push the boundaries of low-latency fire detection from space to assist fire management and suppression around the globe.

sessions.title: Accelerate Reservoir Modeling for the Energy Transition With Physics-Informed AI Techniques
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Accelerated Computing Libraries
sessions.speakers: Elias CHERIF (Data Scientist, TotalEnergies)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how to scale to multiple GPUs, and how CUDA-aware MPI, NVSHMEM and NCCL can be used if the needed functionality is not provided by a higher-level library or framework
2. Understand how communication libraries leverage the GPUDirect technologies
