sessions.description: Discover how sequential Physics-Informed Neural Operators (PINO), developed with NVIDIA Modulus and integrated with generative adversarial networks (GANs) and optimizers, can revolutionize subsurface modeling for both traditional and emerging energy applications. Learn new techniques to enhance reservoir simulations and address evolving challenges in sustainable resource management, with a focus on optimizing existing oil & gas production to minimize environmental impact, and modeling carbon capture and storage (CCS) in depleted oil reservoirs to support decarbonization efforts.

sessions.title: Watch Party: 使用 NVIDIA 机器人解决方案加速端到端无序抓取的开发
sessions.speakers: Rebecca Zhang (Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Lance Li (Solution Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Deep Learningを使用した過去の取り組み
2. AMRの取り組み事例
sessions.description: GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 本地专家主持，以中文讲解，带领参与者同步观看某一精选演讲并解读和实时答疑的会议形式。这是一个互动式的会议，我们鼓励您在聊天区参与讨论，提出见解或问题。但请注意，原始演讲者可能不会出席本会议。会议主持人：Richard Guo, China HER IBD, NVIDIA借助 NVIDIA 机器人解决方案，我们帮助人形机器人合作伙伴“银河通用”快速构建了一个端到端解决方案，用于复杂的工业随机无序抓取任务。深入了解技术流程，探索我们如何创建数字孪生并在仿真和真实环境中验证我们的软件栈，以加速工程开发。在 ISAAC Sim 仿真环境和真实机器人上验证端到端的无序拣选解决方案探索零样本 6D 位姿估计算法在工业领域的应用设计智能决策和排序算法构建快速动态响应的无碰撞轨迹生成工作流在会议开始时间前 15 分钟，登录状态下，下方会出现一个【Join Watch Party Now】的链接。点击该链接，可以在您的电脑上或从您的网络浏览器中启动 Microsoft Teams 参加会议。

sessions.title: Revolutionizing the Customer Experience in Banking With LLMs
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Image / Video Detection & Recognition
sessions.speakers: Oktay Şahinoğlu (Chief Data Scientist, Turkiye Is Bankasi) | Çağlar Gülşeni (Chief Artificial Intelligence Architect, Turkiye Is Bankasi)
sessions.description: Join an in-depth exploration of how we at İşbank are transforming financial services through a Turkish large language model (LLM) tailored for the banking sector. We'll cover selecting the appropriate LLM and fine-tuning it to understand and process the nuances of the Turkish language within a financial context. We’ll delve into how we scaled the fine-tuning and inference processes using cutting-edge technologies, unveiling our generative AI (Gen AI) architecture and the platform we’ve developed to support it. Additionally, we’ll showcase practical use cases we’ve implemented, demonstrating the tangible benefits and innovations in enhancing customer experience and operational efficiency.

sessions.title: In a World of One-Year Tech Cycles, Can Traditional Financial Planning Keep Up?
sessions.speakers: Richard Zoontjens (Lead of the TU/e Supercomputing Center, Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e)) | Carlo Ruiz (VP, EMEA AI & Data Center Operations, NVIDIA) | Bill Mayo (SVP for Research IT, Bristol Myers Squibb) | Timothy Shockley (Global Sales, NVIDIA Financial Solutions, NVIDIA) | Ingemar Lanevi (Head of NVIDIA Capital at NVIDIA, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Gain insights from organizations helping startups at various stages of their growth journey. You’ll hear about the support available to your startup to enable you to overcome challenges and seize opportunities
2. Hear directly from GoAutonomous how they leveraged AI to revolutionize business-to-business commerce. They’ll also share real-life examples of how they used the support of the ecosystem to enable their growth
sessions.description: In a rapidly evolving tech landscape, traditional financial planning struggles to keep pace with one-year tech cycles. This panel will explore how outdated financial models hinder innovation and growth, particularly in AI. We’ll discuss adaptive strategies that empower organizations and nations to lead in AI advancements. Learn from innovators such as Bristol Myers Squibb, Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e), and NVIDIA Financial Services how modern financial frameworks can drive global competitiveness and technological progress.

sessions.title: Creating a Digital Twin of the French Railway: From Point Cloud to Operational Efficiency
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Image Processing & Enhancement
sessions.speakers: Yoann Yvon (Head of Digital Interaction, Sopra Steria) | David Maurange (Consulting Director, Sopra Steria Next) | François Pontvianne (Signalisation Tools Manager, SNCF Réseau)
sessions.points:
1. Image processing and computer vision application
2. Image decoding and encoding performance technique
sessions.description: Learn how the SNCF, which operates over 27,000 kilometers of tracks, is leveraging a digital twin to enhance operational efficiency. We'll explore the real-world implementation of this innovative tool, which uses 3D and business data (point clouds, repositories, BIM models, etc.) to optimize worksite planning, secure critical spots like railway crossings, provide predictive maintenance simulations, and reconcile data repositories with the actual infrastructure (as-planned vs. as-built). Gain insights into how NVIDIA's ecosystem, including Omniverse, Isaac, Replicator, and NIMs, enables the creation of a scalable enterprise architecture. This architecture makes advanced AI, simulation, and visualization capabilities accessible to end users, integrating seamlessly into their business processes. Understand how these technologies can be applied to improve your own infrastructure management projects for better planning, safety, and maintenance.

sessions.title: Accelerating Genome-Wide Association Studies Using Mixed-Precision Computations on Alps Supercomputer
sessions.speakers: Rabab Alomairy (Postdoctoral Researcher, MIT/KAUST) | Hatem Ltaief (Principal Research Scientist, KAUST)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the capabilities of NVIDIA BioNeMo and Parabricks
2. Understand successful use cases leveraging our life sciences products
sessions.description:
We exploit the widening margin in tensor-core performance between [FP64/FP32/FP16/INT8,FP64/FP32/FP16/FP8/INT8] on NVIDIA Ampere and Hopper GPUs to boost the performance of output accuracy-preserving mixed-precision (MxP) computation of
genome-wide association studies (GWAS) of 305,000 patients from the U.K. BioBank, the largest-ever GWAS cohort studied for genetic epistasis using a multivariate approach. We highlight the numerical robustness of our MxP approach, illustrate the performance impact on our HPC GWAS application using Summit/Leonardo/Alps supercomputers, and compare them against Frontier.

sessions.title: Bringing AI to Radar: A Deep Dive Into Neural Networks for Perception
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Image / Video Detection & Recognition
sessions.speakers: Dane Mitrev (Senior ML Engineer, Provizio)
sessions.points:
1. Using VLMs to monitor processes in industrial and manufacturing setting
2. Customizing and fine-tuning VLMs for bespoke use cases
sessions.description: Radar data is inherently rich, offering detailed information about the environment, but traditional algorithms struggle to unlock its full potential. Learn how AI provides the ideal solution for radar perception, leveraging radar's unique velocity data to enhance perception accuracy. We'll also discuss radar-only freespace estimation made possible through on-the-fly ground truth data generation, driven by SLAM and Bayesian algorithms, exploiting the temporal nature of driving data.

sessions.title: Get Ready for NVIDIA Certification
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Accelerated Computing Libraries
sessions.speakers: Aeshah Hadges (Certification Program Manager, NVIDIA) | Gary Fluitt (Technical Certification Manager, NVIDIA) | Marco Alves (Technical Certification Lead, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. We introduce the highest-level solutions that require the least amount of work
2. An introduction to popular implicit data parallel libraries, such as RAPIDS Dask and cuNumeric
sessions.description: Ready to showcase your AI expertise and stand out in the crowd? Join us for an exclusive certification overview session and take the first step toward becoming NVIDIA certified.In this session, we’ll help you figure out which NVIDIA certification best fits your career goals and walk you through the preparation process. You’ll get general exam hints and tips as well as details on exam topics and weightings, recommended training, and practice questions for the following exams:NVIDIA-Certified Associate: Generative AI and LLMsNVIDIA-Certified Associate: Multimodal Generative AINVIDIA-Certified Associate: AI Infrastructure and OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI InfrastructureNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: Accelerated Data Science (Coming Soon)Once you are ready, you can take any of the certification exams at GTC during the following times:Monday, Mar 17 | 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM and 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM PDTTuesday, Mar 18 | 1:00 PM - 5:00 PM PDTWednesday, Mar 19 | 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM and 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM PDTThursday, Mar 20 | 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM and 1:00 PM - 5:00 PM PDTFriday, Mar 21 | 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM and 1:00 PM - 4:00 PM PDTDon't miss this exclusive opportunity to validate your expertise at no cost. Be among the first to earn your NVIDIA certification and stand out in the competitive fields of AI and accelerated computing.Get certified and secure your invitation to the exclusive NVIDIA Certified Reception on Thursday, March 20th, 7:30 PM – 9:30 PM.

sessions.title: Intro to Large Language Models:  LLM Tutorial and Disease Diagnosis LLM Lab
sessions.speakers: Michaela Buchanan (Principal Data Scientist, Mark III Systems)
sessions.points:
1. Isaac Perceptorの効用とインテグレーション方法
2. Jetson AGX Orinを用いたAMRアプリケーションの開発手順
sessions.description: First we'll discuss what an LLM is and some of the strengths and weaknesses of these models, looking at a handful of models and approaches. We'll cover the difference between pre-training and fine-tuning and discuss input processing by showing how to take an input string and tokenize it into input ids. We'll present QLoRa as a means of greatly reducing computational requirements for LLM inference and fine-tuning. We'll wrap up the concepts portion of the session by discussing Hugging Face and their transformers library.The lab portion starts with performing inference using the Hugging Face transformers library and the Falcon-7B-Instruct model. We'll then move to fine-tuning Falcon-7B-Instruct using the MedText dataset, where the goal is to take a prompt that describes symptoms of a medical issue and generate a diagnosis of the problem, as well as steps to take to treat it.Prerequisite(s):Python and/or ML experience is helpful but not required.

sessions.title: Learn OpenUSD: Robotics Best Practices
sessions.speakers: Renato Gasoto (Robotics and AI Engineer, NVIDIA) | Steven Feng (Robotics Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. How the bank is bringing more use cases to production faster, with confidence
2. Design considerations for inference-only architectures at scale (making it enterprise-ready)
sessions.description: In this course, we will be expanding on the concepts of assets from our previous Learn OpenUSD courses and applying them within the domain of robotics. We’ll learn about the benefits of a robot asset structure in OpenUSD and learn best practices by studying the asset structure utilized by the URDF Importer in Isaac Sim. We will gain insights on various optimizations that can be performed on a robot asset and experiment with the different techniques like mesh merging and instancing. Lastly, we will assemble the robot asset and an environment to construct a robot training scene.Prerequisite(s):An understanding of fundamental programming concepts in Python 3 such as functions, loops, dictionaries and arrays and Python 3 related libraries.

sessions.title: Turbocharge Cloud-Native AI Workloads With DPU-Accelerated Service Proxy for Kubernetes
sessions.speakers: Ash Bhalgat (Sr. Director, AI Networking and Security Solutions, Ecosystem and Marketing, NVIDIA) | Ahmed Guetari (VP and GM, Service Providers, F5) | Ashiq Khan (Vice President, Head of Unified Cloud & Platform Division, SoftBank)
sessions.points:
1. The pillars of humanoids safety
2. Standardization on humanoids safety
sessions.description:
AI clouds deploy AI applications at a massive scale, typically as containerized workloads accelerated for cloud-native environments. To meet the needs of LLMs, RAGs, and other AI applications, AI cloud infrastructure relies on high-bandwidth, low-latency interconnections between CPU, GPU, memory, and storage.

AI cloud architecture is built using Kubernetes clusters. Kubernetes networking lets containerized applications communicate within the GPU cluster directly. Deployment of AI applications at scale needs high performance, efficient load balancing, application security, auto scaling, and multi-tenancy. An efficient proxy infrastructure service provides ingress/egress access to cluster resources without burdening the CPU and GPU.

Learn how to meet AI cloud demands with a cloud-native, hardware-accelerated proxy. Offloading and isolating application delivery services to a DPU dramatically reduces CPU overhead and boosts infrastructure efficiency while minimizing attack surface.

sessions.title: From FP8 LLM Training to Inference: Language AI at Scale
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Large Language Models (LLMs)
sessions.speakers: Markus Schnoes (Staff Research HPC Engineer, DeepL)
sessions.description: We'll take a deep dive into training DeepL's LLM-based, next-gen translation models and discuss how we put these models into production. In particular, we'll share our experience with FP8 training on a DGX H100 superpod based on NVIDIA Transformer Engine. You'll also learn how to prepare LLMs for FP8 inference using TensorRT-LLM, and gain insights into deploying models at scale. With this technology stack we achieve industry-leading translation quality at low latency.

sessions.title: Create and Manage On-Prem AI Clusters With Base Command Manager
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Industrial Digitalization / Digital Twin
sessions.speakers: Terrell Bennett (Technical Training Content Developer, NVIDIA) | Max Steele (Sr. Technical Instructor in AI and Data Center, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the operational benefits of AI, simulation, and visualization applied to railroad infrastructure management
2. Deep dive into a real-world implementation of a national railway digital twin on NVIDIA ecosystem
sessions.description: This lab will introduce the NVIDIA Base Command Manager software and describe the best practices for managing AI infrastructure. You’ll gain hands-on experience with provisioning cluster nodes, managing software images, creating users and groups, deploying Kubernetes, running a containerized workload, building a custom monitoring script, and configuring nodes with GPUs. We'll cover both Base Command Manager, which is included in the NVIDIA DGX SW stack, and Base Command Manager Essentials, which is included in NVIDIA AI Enterprise.Prerequisite(s):Basic Linux administration knowledge.

sessions.title: Unlocking the Future of LLMs: High-Efficiency xLSTM Architectures for Scalable Performance
sessions.speakers: Sepp Hochreiter (Chief Scientist, NXAI)
sessions.points:
1. Uncover heuristic multi-stream allocation methodologies that empower multi-stream execution, markedly enhancing the efficiency of horizontal architectures like multi-prediction towers and mixture of experts
2. Discover how to enhance compiler strategies by continuously integrating CUDA programming techniques from experts, such as workload balance, efficient reduction and handling unaligned memory access, focusing on reduce and concatenation operations for incremental improvements
sessions.description: As AI applications push the boundaries of large-scale deployments, traditional architectures face limitations in efficiency and scalability. Enter xLSTM — a groundbreaking evolution in long short-term memory (LSTM) networks. We'll unveil how xLSTM's innovative memory structures and exponential gating mechanisms allow for unprecedented efficiency, enabling models to manage larger context windows without sacrificing performance. Discover how this architecture is setting new standards in LLM adoption across industries by dramatically reducing energy consumption and boosting throughput in enterprise applications.

sessions.title: Advanced Medical AI Development with MONAI: From Interactive Annotation to Foundation Models
sessions.speakers: Ahmed Harouni (Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Explore an advanced, automotive-focused LLM built on decades of data from in-car conversations
2. Understand the technical framework that supports dual-agent operations between embedded and cloud systems
sessions.description: This hands-on training lab demonstrates how to build end-to-end medical AI workflows using the latest tools: MONAI Label, VISTA-3D, MAISI, and VILA-M3. Learn to combine AI-assisted annotation, interactive segmentation, synthetic data generation, and advanced visual-language understanding to create powerful medical imaging applications. Gain practical experience with these tools while understanding how they complement each other in real-world scenarios.Prerequisite(s):Basic Python understanding and basic ML understanding.

sessions.title: Revolutionize Supply Chain Analytics With AI and Accelerated Computing (Presented by EY)
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Medical Imaging
sessions.speakers: Preethi Maulik (Product Engineering - cuOpt, Optimization for Operations Research, NVIDIA) | Takshay Aggarwal (Americas Supply Chain Growth Platforms Leader, Ernst & Young (EY)) | Ashutosh Dekhne (Americas Strategic Enterprise Transformations Leader, Ernst & Young)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how Quantiphi and Northwestern University developed MONAI-based AI model helping in segmenting cardiac structures, offering practical solutions to current challenges such as manual segmentation delays, variability in interpretation, and the need for improved accuracy
2. Explore the advanced, scalable, and flexible self-supervised learning architecture designed to easily accommodate additional imaging modalities, ensuring it remains a future-proof investment for healthcare institutions
sessions.description: Join us for an immersive experience where we show how the EY Supply Chain & Ops Platform, powered by NVIDIA’s accelerated computing and AI capabilities, is transforming our clients’ supply chains. This modern platform increases supply chain resiliency against disruptions and offers timely insights through integration with existing systems.

sessions.title: Getting Started with Multi-GPU Scaling: Distributed Libraries
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Accelerated Computing Libraries
sessions.speakers: Mads Kristensen (Sr. Software Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Discover how task-based programming models can greatly simplify multi-GPU programming
2. Learn how to write task-based multi-GPU programs by leveraging the existing single-GPU libraries
sessions.description: Scaling beyond a single GPU can be challenging, but it's not as hard as you might think! Join us on a journey exploring multi-GPU libraries that simplify the process. We'll cover different strategies taken by such libraries, and how they impact the user experience.

sessions.title: The Telco AI Renaissance Is Here
sessions.speakers: Ronnie Vasishta (Sr. Vice President, Telecommunications, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Modeling the structure of proteins and their interactions, enabling a huge range of applications in protein modeling and design
2. AlphaFold 3 model has a substantially updated diffusion-based architecture that can predict the joint structure of complexes including proteins, nucleic acids, small molecules, ions, and modified residues
sessions.description: It’s been a bumper year for AI-focused initiatives in the telecoms industry. On the infrastructure side, at least 10 telcos have deployed sovereign AI infrastructure, enabling them to turbocharge AI initiatives in their domestic market. On operational activities, the spate of Gen AI initiatives across different segments of the telecom business is accelerating. On preparing for the future, we saw the launch of the first AI-radio access network (RAN) in Japan and accompanying acceleration of activities at the AI-RAN Alliance to develop technologies and capabilities for the 5G+ and 6G era. These industry developments highlight that going AI-first is now every telco's default aspiration. NVIDIA is enabling the industry on this journey, providing the hardware and software platforms, tools, and blueprints for the AI-first telco. NVIDIA SVP Telecoms, Ronnie Vasishta, will talk about how NVIDIA is working with its partners to deliver on this ambition and announce new platforms, tools, and blueprints that NVIDIA is bringing to the market.

sessions.title: Accelerate the Future of AI-Defined Vehicles and Autonomous Driving
sessions.speakers: Xinzhou Wu (VP of Automotive, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Performance gains running transient aerodynamics computational fluid dynamics (CFD) simulations on accelerated platforms
2. Impact on design process of accelerating external aerodynamics simulations
sessions.description: AI-defined vehicles are shaping the future of autonomous driving. To safely develop and deploy these vehicles, an end-to-end platform that combines high-performance in-vehicle computing and a scalable infrastructure is required. See how NVIDIA is leading this AI-centric approach with our three-computer solution, spanning from the cloud to the car, and gain insights into how generative AI is accelerating the industry toward a foundation model-empowered, end-to-end approach to bring the autonomous driving experience to the next level.

sessions.title: Unleash Sovereign AI's Potential: The UK's Vision for Innovation and Growth
sessions.speakers: Peter Kyle (MP and Secretary of State for Science, Innovation and Technology, United Kingdom)
sessions.points:
1. Discover how we enhanced history-matching accuracy in petroleum reservoir simulations using a Sequential Physics-Informed Neural Operator with NVIDIA Modulus, achieving better accuracy compared to other AI models
2. Learn how integrating our approach with CUDA optimizes computational workflows, enabling faster and more efficient reservoir simulations
sessions.description: The Rt. Hon. Peter Kyle, member of Parliament and secretary of state for science, innovation, and technology, will present the U.K.'s ambitious AI Opportunities Action Plan. Peter will discuss how these initiatives aim to foster economic growth, enhance public services, and create new opportunities for businesses and citizens. This session will provide valuable insights for developers, business leaders, and policymakers interested in understanding what approach nations can take to harness AI's transformative power, and its potential impact on the global technology landscape.Part of theSovereign AI Summit. Join us starting at 7:30 AM for a half-day exploring Sovereign AI. Featured speakers include government and industry leaders from the UK, France, Italy, Denmark, Japan, India, Korea, Thailand and Brazil. Learn from experts as they come together to discuss the development of domestic AI capabilities to drive economic growth and tackle industry-wide challenges.Schedule7:30 AM Networking Breakfast8:00 AM Unleashing Sovereign AI’s Potential: The UK’s Vision for Innovation and Growth, The Rt Hon Peter Kyle MP8:30 AM Sovereign AI Panel of prominent government leaders9:15 AM Empower the Ecosystem with Sovereign Foundation Models10:30 AM Lessons Learned from Deploying Gen AI Applications11:50 AM Closing remarks

sessions.title: Unlock the Speed of Light for Data Science Workflows With Gemini Coding Assistant
sessions.speakers: Paige Bailey (ENG MGR, Developer relations, Google)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how to use NVIDIA Base Command Manager to deploy Run:ai
2. Discover how to use Run:ai as an administrator,and what the data scientist view is
sessions.description: Boosting your data science workflows has never been easier — just access pre-installed CUDA-X libraries for data processing to accelerate your workflows in Google Colab. Discover and unlock the benefits of accelerated data science with zero code changes; speed up your code by simply switching on the GPU runtime — no need for code refactoring or library installations. For better discoverability, Gemini provides multiple touch points to help Colab users discover and generate code to accelerate their data science workloads

sessions.title: Maximize Your AI Performance and Scale With Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (Presented by Oracle)
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Deep Learning Frameworks
sessions.speakers: Amar Gowda (Senior Principal Product Manager, Oracle) | Taylor Newill (Senior Director of Product Management, Oracle)
sessions.points:
1. Dive deep into the latest status of different frameworks
2. Learn how to write more efficient script to maximize performance on NVIDIA GPU systems
sessions.description: Some of the most advanced AI workloads are running on Oracle Cloud's AI Infrastructure, designed to provide the highest performance, sovereignty controls, and best value in the cloud. Whether you need small-scale AI inferencing or massive scale AI training, OCI has options, including clusters with up to 131,072 NVIDIA Blackwell GPUs. Learn about OCI's breadth of capabilities, including data center enhancements around power, cooling, networking, and more, that help Oracle bring you more efficient AI solutions and infrastructure than ever before. And then see examples of what you can do with all this power.

sessions.title: Domain-Adapted LLM for Offshore Integrity and Reliability
sessions.speakers: Otávio Ciribelli (General Manager for Upstream Applications, Petrobras) | Tim Wiesel (Partner - Artificial Intelligence & Data Leader (Deloitte Brazil), Deloitte)
sessions.points:
1. Discover how EA is reimagining AI infrastructure to achieve scalability across three key areas — people, application, and impact — setting new standards in gaming technology
2. Learn about fast compute provisioning across multi-cloud and on-premises environments
sessions.description: Join us in an innovative application of domain-adaptive pre-training and supervised fine-tuning for asset integrity and reliability. Petrobras has transformed a 30-year-old knowledge dataset into a "game-changing" AI assistant for offshore and onshore operations, leveraging NVIDIA's NeMo framework.

sessions.title: How Real-Time Observability Revolutionizes LLM System Evaluation in Financial Services
sessions.speakers: Orest Xherija (Data Science Manager, Director, UBS) | Lavinia Ghita (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the core purpose and vision driving SAP Business AI
2. Learn how to harness agility and sustainability across your business value chain
sessions.description: The collaboration between UBS and NVIDIA focuses on real-time risk assessment and monitoring of production retrieval augmented generation (RAG). Unlike holistic evaluations of RAG applications, real-time solutions must introduce minimal latency and offer a high degree of live adaptation and reasoning. To ensure the live observability of large language models (LLMs), we use "LLMs as a judge," where the reliability of the answers provided by one LLM is re-evaluated by another LLM before being returned as the system’s output. A common pitfall in "LLM as a judge" applications is that models tend to prefer their own answers, and thus undermine a system’s trustworthiness. To provide a first-of-its-class solution to this problem in the heavily-regulated banking industry, we adopt NVIDIA’s NIMs to deploy an open-source model as the LLM judge and extend it with observability tools from NeMo Guardrails and Evaluator.

sessions.title: How to Build Multimodal Agentic AI Retrieval Systems
sessions.speakers: Tanay Varshney (Developer Advocate Engineer for Deep Learning SW, NVIDIA) | Annie Surla (Developer Advocate Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. AI projects are failing or are behind due to tool complexity. Having a unified platform greatly simplifies getting an AI app to production and controlling costs
2. Understand the unique challenges large enterprises face when developing AI applications
sessions.description: Join NVIDIA technical product architects for an in-depth tutorial demonstrating how to build agentic AI pipelines that integrate diverse data types—including text, images, audio, and video—into enterprise AI applications. This session will cover the full journey, from designing production-ready retrieval systems to effectively using them in Enterprise use cases.

sessions.title: Sovereign AI Summit
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Training AI Models
sessions.speakers: Calista Redmond (VP, Global AI Initiatives, NVIDIA) | Peter Kyle (MP and Secretary of State for Science, Innovation and Technology, United Kingdom) | Abhishek Singh (Additional Secretary, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology, India) | Nadia Carlsten (CEO, Danish Centre for AI Innovation) | Shibuya Toshihiko (Deputy Director-General for IT Strategy, Commerce and Information Policy Bureau, Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry, Japan) | Shilpa Kolhatkar (Global Head of AI Nations Business Development, NVIDIA) | Yuwon Kim (CEO, NAVER Cloud) | Uljan Sharka (Founder and CEO, IGenius) | Ratanaphon Wongnapachant (CEO, Siam.AI Cloud) | Landon Davidson (Manager, Global Business Development for AI Nations, NVIDIA) | Sharmistha Dasgupta (Deputy Director General, National Informatics Centre (NIC)) | Vincent Van Steenbergen (CEO, ThinkDeep AI) | Nelson Leoni (Co-Founder and CEO, WideLabs) | Kavita Bhatia (COO, AI Mission) | Nagendra Bandaru (President and Managing Partner Enterprise Futuring, Wipro)
sessions.description: Sovereign AI refers to a nation’s capacity to develop and deploy AI using its own infrastructure, local datasets, skilled workforce, and business ecosystems. Join us for a dynamic summit exploring how nations are embracing AI factories as critical infrastructure for digital transformation and resilience. Featured speakers include government and industry leaders from the UK, France, Italy, Denmark, Japan, India, Korea, Thailand and Brazil. In a three-part discussion, learn from experts as they come together to discuss the development of domestic AI capabilities to drive economic growth and tackle industry-wide challenges.Schedule7:30am Networking Breakfast8:00amS74764– Unleashing Sovereign AI’s Potential: The UK’s Vision for Innovation and Growth, The Rt Hon Peter Kyle MP8:30am Sovereign AI Panel of prominent government leaders9:15am Empower the Ecosystem with Sovereign Foundation Models10:30am Lessons Learned from Deploying Gen AI Applications11:50am Closing remarksSovereign AI Panel of prominent government leaders, sharing their insights on how they are driving forward their national AI agenda.Denmark - Nadia Carlsten, CEO of DCAIIndia - Abhishek Singh, Additional Secretary, Ministry of Electronics and Information TechnologyJapan - Shibuya Toshihiko, Director-General for IT Strategy, Commerce and Information Policy Bureau, METIEmpower the Ecosystem with Sovereign Foundation Models features LLM builders presenting their implementations of models that reflect the language, culture, and nuances unique to their nation.Korea - Yuwon Kim, CEO NAVER CloudItaly - Uljan Sharka, CEO / Founder, iGeniusThailand - Nagendra Bandaru, President, Wipro & Siam.AI, CEO, K SunLessons Learned from Deploying Gen AI Applications features our partners (GSI, ISV) and customers, sharing real-world applications using sovereign models.India - Kavita Bhatia, COO, AI Mission & Sharmishta Dasgupta, Deputy Director General NICFrance - ThinkDeep, Vincent Van Steenbergen, CEO & Thomas Binder, Head of AI Transformation, Ministry of FinanceBrazil - WideLabs, Nelson Leoni, CEO & João Sidou, Director, Federal Public Ministry

sessions.title: Securing Agentic AI Developer Day
sessions.speakers: Erick Galinkin (AI Security Researcher, NVIDIA) | Becca Lynch (ThreatOps) (Offensive Security Researcher, NVIDIA) | Prasoon Varshney (AI Safety Researcher, NVIDIA) | Ilhan Gurel (Senior Security Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how CrowdStrike and NVIDIA combine AI-powered cybersecurity and accelerated computing to protect generative AI deployments from advanced threats and shadow AI
2. Discover strategies to outpace adversaries by leveraging cutting-edge technologies that enable real-time threat detection, prevention, and response
sessions.description: In today’s rapidly evolving AI landscape, agentic AI is an emerging tool being leveraged by organizations across industries. However, as AI agents move from concept to production, they introduce new security challenges. Join the NVIDIA Security for an exclusive, in-depth session designed to transform your AI agentic workflows securely from blueprint to production. Discover how to navigate and mitigate key deployment risks in common agentic flows with expert guidance and practical advice. This collaborative and hands-on experience will empower you to bring your AI vision to life with confidence. Don't miss this opportunity to elevate your AI security knowledge and skills. Take the first step toward mastering AI security and achieving seamless integration into your workflows.

sessions.title: Keep Your GPUs Going Brrr : Crushing Whitespace in Model Training
sessions.speakers: Alban Desmaison (Research Engineer, Meta) | Syed Ahmed (Senior Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Aidyn Aitzhan (Senior Software Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Adapting KAN (Kolmogorov Arnold Networks) for financial time-series data
2. Application of ensembles for predictive analytics in finance
sessions.description: Substantial progress has recently been made on the compute-intensive portions of model training, such as high-performing attention variants. While invaluable, this progress exposes previously hidden bottlenecks in model training, such as redundant copies during collectives and data loading time. We'll present recent improvements in PyTorch achieved through Meta/NVIDIA collaboration to tackle these newly exposed bottlenecks and how practitioners can leverage them.

sessions.title: Build Next-Generation AI Factories With DOCA-Accelerated Networking
sessions.speakers: Valas Valancius (Sr. Staff Software Engineer, Google Cloud) | Ariel Kit (Director, Product Management, NVIDIA) | David Wetherall (Distinguished Engineer, Google Cloud, Google)
sessions.points:
1. Techniques for interfacing SQL databases with NVIDIA-hosted language models
2. Methods for performing vector searches using database-stored embeddings
sessions.description:
Generative AI is revolutionizing cloud data centers, pushing the limits of what is possible in computing. As businesses strive to harness the power of AI, the need for a new class of data centers has emerged — one that can meet the demands of these advanced technologies. NVIDIA DOCA is at the forefront of this transformation, offering AI and cloud innovators an extensive suite of tools designed to create cutting-edge cloud data centers tailored for GenAI workloads.

Learn how NVIDIA DOCA empowers organizations to build AI factories that deliver exceptional performance, scalability, and efficiency. Gain insights into the strategic benefits of using NVIDIA DOCA, including enhanced security, optimized data processing, and seamless integration with existing systems. Join us to learn how NVIDIA DOCA plays a crucial role in advancing AI for transformative business outcomes.

sessions.title: Building LLMs: Accelerating Pretraining of Foundational Models With FP8 Precision
sessions.speakers: Harishankar G (Lead - Machine Learning Engineer, Zoho Corp.)
sessions.description: Delve into the transformative journey of Zoho's large language model (LLM) foundational model evolution. We’ll explore how our shift from the Fairseq framework to NVIDIA's cutting-edge NeMo framework significantly boosted our training performance and model quality. See how adopting FP8 precision significantly transforms pre-training performance and costs while retaining model quality. We'll also compare FP8 with BF16 precision and delve into the advanced techniques essential for achieving effective FP8 convergence. Discover how the integration of NVIDIA H100 GPUs, coupled with DGX OS, has streamlined our training processes, reducing time and enhancing throughput. We’ll share insights into the technical advancements and operational efficiencies achieved, and how these innovations have set a new benchmark in LLM pre-training.

sessions.title: Build your next Vision AI application for Physical AI on a Digital Twin
sessions.speakers: Louise Huang (Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Daniel Yu (Co-founder and CEO, MetAI Technology) | Carlos Garcia-Sierra (Product Manager - Metropolis AI Workflows, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Explore how QCT's data center solutions support AI workloads across containers, bare metal, and private cloud environments
2. Learn about the features of the QCT GenAI Dev. Kit and generative AI scenarios it can support
sessions.description:
Physical AI improves the efficiency and safety of large space environments such as factories and warehouses by using cameras and advanced computer vision models to facilitate tracking and dynamic responses based on the spatial insights. However, developing vision AI applications for such settings often presents challenges, including limited data availability, unusable sources, and infrastructure constraints, making it difficult to accurately perceive and interpret complex, large-scale environments.

This session explores how NVIDIA Metropolis, Omniverse and synthetic data generation addresses these challenges. Using a warehouse use case, you’ll learn to create high-fidelity digital replicas of physical environments, simulate what-if scenarios, and generate synthetic data to fine-tune visual language models (VLMs) for customized, accurate, and reliable applications. Finally, deploying the solution utilizing Metropolis NIMs and AI Blueprints to implement scalable, real-world-ready vision AI applications for physical AI.

Whether you are new to vision AI applications or an experienced practitioner, this talk provides a comprehensive guide to streamline your app deployment from simulation, training, to runtime.

sessions.title: Diffusion Models: The Swiss Army Knife for Generative AI in Science
sessions.speakers: Arash Vahdat (Principal Scientist and Research Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Experience a “how it’s made”-style behind-the-scenes look at the project, showcasing the collaboration between HP, Adobe, NVIDIA, and Industrial Light & Magic
2. Gain an overview of Landis Fields’ latest project, including his inspiration, workflow, and the technical rig powering his creative process
sessions.description: Diffusion models have transformed generative AI by enabling breakthroughs in diverse applications, such as images, videos, and speech. We'll show that these versatile frameworks extend beyond traditional domains and hold substantial potential for scientific data modeling. Through case studies spanning molecular generation, protein design, and weather modeling, we'll explore the unique opportunities and challenges involved in leveraging diffusion models to answer complex scientific questions.

sessions.title: Leading Locally: State and Municipal Policymakers Driving AI Workforce Transformation
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - 3D Animation and Modeling
sessions.speakers: Tiffani Alvidrez (NVIDIA) | Ajay Pittman (State Representative, Oklahoma House District 99) | Courtney Taylor (Director, Mississippi State Office of Workforce) | Jason Elliott (President, Versus Solutions) | Matt Mahan (Mayor, City of San Jose)
sessions.points:
1. Strengthen your understanding of OpenUSD by revisiting core terminology
2. Develop data exchange pipelines that can be applied to your own workflows
sessions.description: As AI transforms industries and redefines the future of work, state and local leaders are forging innovative partnerships to unlock its potential. This panel features policymakers who've collaborated with NVIDIA to drive workforce development, empower communities, and create pathways to economic growth. From integrating AI into education and public services to fostering inclusive, tech-enabled ecosystems, these trailblazing agreements are shaping a future of opportunity. Join us to explore how strategic alliances are advancing ethical AI, lifelong learning, and sustainable progress, building a stronger, more equitable workforce for tomorrow.

sessions.title: Insights From NVIDIA's Kaggle Grandmasters: Winning Techniques for World-Class Model Building
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Large Language Models (LLMs)
sessions.speakers: Theo Viel (Senior Data Scientist, NVIDIA) | Chris Deotte (Sr. Data Scientist, NVIDIA) | Jiwei Liu (Senior Data Scientist, NVIDIA) | David Austin (Senior Data Scientist, NVIDIA) | Gilberto Titericz Junior (Senior Data Scientist, NVIDIA) | Kazuki Onodera (Senior Deep Learning Data Scientist, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Key Techniques for Industrial LLMs Training and Inference: Financial corpus construction, data engineering, distributed and parallel training, internal information alignment and quantization
2. How LLMs can be integrated into asset management to drive innovation and efficiency
sessions.description: Gain unique insights from NVIDIA's Kaggle Grandmasters, who've competed and earned top honors in hundreds of international data science competitions. The team brings deep expertise in generative AI, computer vision, natural language processing, forecasting, recommender systems, tabular data, signals, and graphs. Discover the latest tools and techniques winning competitions today, hear best practices for GPU acceleration across diverse use cases, and explore how these experts approach complex challenges. Bring your questions and learn directly from data science champions on optimizing model performance for real-world applications.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: How Volkswagen Shapes the Next Generation of Interactive 3D Experiences
sessions.speakers: Pierre Grage (CPO, UNEVIS GmbH) | Ove Tetens (Volkswagen Group Services) | Christian Weber (Managing Director, Credera)
sessions.points:
1. Past simulation data is used to predict high-accuracy solutions of the next time step, and used as an initial solution to the iterative solver, leading to a reduction in the number of PDE solver iterations
2. Applicable to a variety of systems such as CPU-based, GPU-based, and strongly connected CPU-GPU heterogeneous systems
sessions.description: In today’s digital age, purchasing decisions for new cars are heavily shaped by online research and immersive digital experiences. With the vast range of customizable features available in modern vehicles, automakers like Volkswagen face the challenge of delivering highly detailed, realistic 3D visualizations that meet customer expectations. Traditional methods for creating these streaming experiences are often time-consuming and expensive. Discover how Volkswagen harnesses Universal Scene Description (USD) in NVIDIA’s Omniverse and SolidMeta’s CAD2Realtime AI to drive efficiencies. Learn how these complementary technologies streamline workflows, reduce production times, and enable fast, cost-effective, high-quality interactive visualizations that transform the customer experience.

sessions.title: How To Build a Digital Human, With Experts From All Pipelines: Perception, Cognition, Action, Customization
sessions.speakers: Rohit Vaswani (Engineering Leader, NVIDIA) | Vinay Bagade (Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA) | Pascal Berard (Director - Avatar AI, NVIDIA) | Zheng Liu (Engineering Manager, NVIDIA) | Cyrus Hogg (NVIDIA) | Darshana Garach (NVIDIA) | Sanjay Singh Chauhan (NVIDIA) | Shengyao Guo (NVIDIA) | Sarath Maddala (NVIDIA) | Narimane Hennouni (Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Sukrit Rao (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Dharmendra Choudhary (NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand best practices and techniques for enterprise-scale multimodal data ingestion and extraction
2. Learn how to build production-grade RAG pipelines tuned for the highest accuracy and throughput
sessions.description: Building a digital human requires several pipelines. We'll have a group of experts covering everything from avatar creation to customization with RIVA present to answer questions and help lead developers through a successful journey.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Leverage Small Language Models for Your Digital Human Applications
sessions.speakers: Oluwatobi Olabiyi (Sr. Engineering Manager, NVIDIA) | Negar Habibi (Sr. Manager of Technical Project Management, NVIDIA) | Meriem Bendris (Sr. Deep Learning Data Scientist, NVIDIA) | Yoshi Suhara (NVIDIA) | Vinay Raman (NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Explore in-depth insights into our key use cases, highlighting their unique features, challenges, and success stories
2. Utilize our expertise in leveraging cutting-edge technology, combining innovative solutions with practical application
sessions.description: Learn the best practices for leveraging small language models for your digital human application. We'll dive deep into the art of small language model selection for your use case, how to configure model parameters, and how to deploy the models and applications leveraging NVIDIA tools.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: How Intercontinental Exchange is Taking AI from Production to Scale to Improve Efficiency
sessions.speakers: Anand Pradhan (Head of AI Center of Excellence, NYSE - ICE)
sessions.points:
1. The importance of optimizing GPU clusters to accelerate AI development and research
2. Effective strategies for monitoring and optimizing GPU cluster performance
sessions.description:
This session will be broken down into 2 parts: Role of AI Center of Excellence, and Use Cases.

Role of AI Center of Excellence in an established organization:
•	ICE is a $90 billion global financial organization operating exchanges, clearing houses, data services, and mortgage technology
•	ICE AICoE oversees all AI initiatives at ICE to streamline various AI workloads by providing a platform for cost-effective experimentation with necessary governance and seamless ways to deploy at scale, along with a company-wide collaboration channel in the company.
•	AICoE streamlined various existing, as well as new, AI use cases with a platform-first approach with a hybrid (on-premises plus multi-cloud) AI platform.

Use Cases :
•	Improving the accuracy of text2SQL using schema, document, with LLM prompting for natural language search support for structured data without data migration.
•	Unstructured-to-structured data with multiple AI and Gen AI models in a pipeline to reduce human labor cost and improve accuracy.

sessions.title: Developing Next-Gen AVs with Physical AI-Powered World Foundation Models
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Pre-Trained / Foundation Models
sessions.speakers: Norm Marks (Worldwide Field Ops) (VP, Automotive Enterprise, NVIDIA) | Nima Nejatti (Global Head of Solutions Architecture and Engineering, Automotive, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. What are world foundation models, and how do they advance physical AI?
2. Learn about NVIDIA Cosmos — world foundation model development platform
sessions.description: This session demonstrates how NVIDIA is leveraging our Cosmos World Model Development platform and end-to-end world models to safely develop and deploy autonomous vehicles.  Learn how customers are accelerating current workloads, and adopting new technologies to curate video data, find the most valuable data assets to train complex and rare corner cases, fine-tune AV world models, and enable video generation for the most complete coverage of simulation and validation scenarios.  Additionally, we showcase the scalable infrastructure needed to deliver the performance and efficiency necessary for developing safe AVs at scale.

sessions.title: How Indonesia Delivered a Telco-led Sovereign AI Platform for 270M Users
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Transfer Learning / Fine Tuning
sessions.speakers: Anissh Pandey (Senior Director NCP Asia Pacific, NVIDIA) | Lilach Ilan (Global Head of Business Development -Telco Operations, NVIDIA) | Munjal Shah (Co-Founder and CEO, Hippocratic AI) | Vikram Sinha (CEO, Indosat Ooredoo Hutchison) | Senthil Ramani (Global Lead – Data & AI, Accenture)
sessions.points:
1. Platform-first approach
2. Role of benchmarking and eval platform for improving accuracy
sessions.description: Sovereign AI enables nations to create their own AI and participate in the new global economy. Nations are partnering up with telcos to enable the foundational AI platform and ecosystem required for their universities, startups, enterprises, and government agencies to create AI. Indosat, a major telecoms provider with over 100 million customers, working with Lintasarta, GoTo, Accenture, and Hippocratic, has deployed a Sovereign AI Factory and a collection of LLMs for Indonesia leveraging the NVIDIA Cloud Partner program. We'll explore how Indosat set up the sovereign cloud and launched its own foundational large language model, Sahabat.ai, for the 277 million native Bahasa speakers with NVIDIA NEMO and NIMs. We'll also discuss how partners like Accenture and Hippocratic AI are accelerating AI use-case deployment in Indonesia for critical sectors including banking and healthcare using NVIDIA AI Platform.

sessions.title: Navigating Critical Challenges in AI Governance
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Image Processing & Enhancement
sessions.speakers: Daniel Rohrer (Vice President of Software Product Security, NVIDIA) | Nikki Pope (Sr. Director, AI and Legal Ethics, NVIDIA) | Leon Derczynski (Principal Research Scientist, NVIDIA) | Eileen Long (Director of AI Services, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Global, Low-Latency Fire Detection: See how NVIDIA technology facilitates near-real-time global fire detection, providing critical support in disaster response and fire mitigation
2. Edge AI for Cloud Masking: Learn how we leverage a GPU in space for pre-trained deep learning models to perform real-time cloud masking onboard
sessions.description: As AI systems grow more powerful and pervasive, interaction with users raises critical challenges beyond just technical implementation. Join NVIDIA experts as they discuss the complex and diverse set of regulatory compliance, safety protocols, and security imperatives shaping AI development. We'll explore practical approaches to building responsible AI systems while navigating evolving regulations, addressing safety concerns, and maintaining robust security measures. Gain insights into balancing innovation with protection, managing competing priorities, and implementing effective governance frameworks for the next generation of AI technology.

sessions.title: Going Deeper with Multi-GPU Scaling: Task-based Runtimes
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Industrial Digitalization / Digital Twin
sessions.speakers: Manolis Papadakis (Sr. Software Engineer, Legate Framework, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. GPU and CUDA Ecosystem have become critical drivers of advancements in scientific computing, particularly in fields requiring multi-physics and multi-scale simulations. Numerical schemes in these areas are being reimagined to leverage SIMD architectures, maximizing computational efficiency.
2. Particle Monte Carlo (PMC) Simulations powered by Nvidia Optix: Ray tracing techniques significantly accelerate particle-tracked Monte Carlo simulations, achieving speedups of 10 to 10 squared for plasma process modeling, such as sputtered etching and deposition. These advancements enhance predictability, bridging the modeling gap from localized transistor components to integrated circuit cell levels.
sessions.description: Do you want to write multi-GPU libraries, but don't know where to start or how to write message-passing interface code? We'll introduce the world of general-purpose, task-based runtime systems. These runtime systems will help you write programs transparently, scaling to any number of GPUs without any explicit communication and coordination that are difficult to do by hand. We'll also show you how to make your newly written code interoperate seamlessly with the existing domain libraries within the same program.

sessions.title: Get NVIDIA Certified
sessions.speakers: Aeshah Hadges (Certification Program Manager, NVIDIA) | Gary Fluitt (Technical Certification Manager, NVIDIA) | Marco Alves (Technical Certification Lead, NVIDIA)
sessions.description: For the first time ever, GTC 2025 attendees will have the exclusive opportunity to earn NVIDIA certifications at no cost. Seize this unique opportunity to validate your expertise, showcase your skills, and join the ranks of NVIDIA-certified professionals. Seats are limited and available on a first-come, first-served basis—be sure to register onsite to secure your spot!Why Certify?Validate your expertise in cutting-edge NVIDIA technologies.Boost your career prospects and earning potential.Join an elite community of NVIDIA-certified professionals.Available Certifications:NVIDIA-Certified Associate: Generative AI and LLMsNVIDIA-Certified Associate: Multimodal Generative AINVIDIA-Certified Associate: AI Infrastructure and OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI InfrastructureNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: Accelerated Data Science (Coming Soon)How to Register for an exam slot:Register for the conference.Review preparation materials thoroughly before attempting the exam.Add this session to your schedule.Sign up for an exam slot onsite.Arrive early to secure your spot – seats are limited and fill quickly.Please note the following:This promotion is available to in-person attendees only, and only available at GTC.The last exams will begin at 3:30 PM or 4:00 PM depending on the schedule.Get certified and secure your invitation to the exclusive NVIDIA Certified Reception on Thursday, March 20th, 7:30 PM – 9:30 PM.

sessions.title: NVIDIA AI Platform and Accelerated Solutions Overview (Presented by PNY Technologies)
sessions.speakers: WILLY ORTIZ (Sr. Field Sales Engineer Manager, PNY Technologies)
sessions.points:
1. 国産 AI Factory によるエンドツーエンド AI 開発: 生成 AI から AI エージェントまで、国内データセンターの安全な環境で開発を完結。
2. NVIDIA H100/H200 GPU による高速化: 最新 GPU でトレーニングと推論を高速化し、開発期間を大幅短縮。
sessions.description: See a high-level overview of PNY and the NVIDIA AI Platform and accelerated solutions, and how they help accelerate AI training and inference in different markets.

sessions.title: From LLMs to Planning-Based AI Systems
sessions.speakers: Ori Goshen (Co-Founder and Co-CEO, AI21 Labs)
sessions.points:
1. Learn the latest techniques for using neural radiance fields and 3D Gaussian splatting in 3D asset/scene synthesis
2. Learn to accelerate 3DGS on multi-GPU to drastically reduce time-to-solution
sessions.description: Are LLMs the be-all and end-all of AI innovation? We'll explore the growing trend toward moving from standalone LLMs to LLMs as part of a comprehensive AI system. But not just any AI system — a planner-based system that combines complex reasoning and decision-making, adapts to unique environments, and offers transparency and resource management to address critical enterprise needs.

sessions.title: Physical AI for Humanoids: How Google Robotics Uses Simulation to Accelerate Humanoid Robotics Training
sessions.speakers: Erik Frey (Lead, Google)
sessions.points:
1. Millions of Micro-Transformations in Daily Operations: See how AI workplace assistants transform daily routines for 200,000 employees, delivering tangible efficiency gains and enhancing customer service
2. Secure, On-Premises AI Operations: Understand the benefits of deploying AI within a dedicated data center infrastructure, augmented with NVIDIA GPU technology, and the benefits of keeping AI operations in-house to ensure data privacy and regulatory compliance
sessions.description: Google deploys AI models onto humanoid robots that perform tasks in the real world. Training robots to operate in diverse, complex environments (e.g., any possible kitchen) requires a “simulation-first” approach, starting with generating large sets of synthetic data for training and simulation for validating robot behavior at scale. Learn how Google improved its simulation performance by integrating core NVIDIA technologies and libraries, including Warp, into critical parts of its humanoid simulation pipeline.

sessions.title: Multi-Domain Large Language Model Adaptation Using Synthetic Data Generation
sessions.speakers: Injy Sarhan (NLP Researcher, Shell) | Oleg Ovcharenko (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Avanindra Singh (Shell)
sessions.points:
1. Complex challenges and technical debit in LLM deployment
2. Beyond standard broad-use AI/ML tools
sessions.description: Discover how we at Shell are collaborating with NVIDIA to adapt LLMs to learn about our domain-specific knowledge that open models lack. Dive deep into our methodologies such as DAPT, SFT, and reward modeling to systematically fine-tune LLMs across multiple domains, leveraging innovative approaches with synthetic data generation.

sessions.title: Build Immersive Teleoperation Systems for Robotics
sessions.speakers: Connor Smith (Distinguished Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Jiakai Zhang (Senior Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Oyindamola Omotuyi (Technical Marketing Engineer - Isaac, NVIDIA) | Edith Llontop (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. What motivated us to add GPUs to our fleet, as general purpose accelerators. Why we opted to continue building in-house, when time came to introduce GPUs
2. Our experience building via NVIDIA’s stack, primarily using NVIDIA’s GPU operator for k8s
sessions.description: Meet the experts who'll show how NVIDIA’s immersive technologies are transforming humanoid robotics development. NVIDIA Omniverse, Isaac Lab, Isaac Sim, and AI-driven robotics SDKs allow for fully interactive, 3D environments that replicate complex real-world scenarios, enabling precise training and performance tuning before deployment. The integration of AI further enhances immersion by enabling robots to learn from their surroundings, adapting to dynamic environments with minimal human intervention. This seamless blend of virtual and physical worlds accelerates the creation and scaling of sophisticated autonomous systems across industries.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Korean AI Expert Day
sessions.speakers: Ku Hyung Chung (Solutions Architect, Korea SA Team Lead, NVIDIA) | Gwangsoo Hong (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Jonghwan Lee (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Transforming Education and Public Services with AI: Learn how these leaders are integrating AI into education systems and local government services to enhance accessibility, efficiency, and opportunities for lifelong learning
2. AI-Driven Workforce Strategies: Discover how policymakers are collaborating with NVIDIA to implement innovative workforce development programs that prepare communities for the evolving demands of an AI-powered economy
sessions.description: The Korean AI Expert Day is an opportunity to meet Korean NVIDIA experts and connect with conference attendees from Korea. Exchange knowledge and industry trends and share GTC experiences. You can also network with Korean AI experts, creating international business or academic collaboration opportunities. Korean will be the predominant language spoken here.Korean AI Expert Day는 한국 NVIDIA 전문가들을 만나고 한국에서 온 컨퍼런스 참석자들과 교류할 수 있는 기회입니다. 이 자리에서 지식과 업계 동향을 공유하고, GTC에서의 경험을 나눌 수 있습니다. 또한, 국제 비즈니스 및 학술 협력 기회를 창출하는 한국 AI 전문가들과의 네트워킹도 가능합니다. 본 행사에서는 한국어가 주요 언어로 사용됩니다.

sessions.title: Scalable AI Infrastructure in the Gaming Industry
sessions.speakers: Wah Loon Keng (Sr. AI Engineer, Electronic Arts) | Xin Gao (Lead Product Manager, Electronic Arts)
sessions.points:
1. Rapid AI Application Development: Learn how to quickly create and deploy domain-specific generative AI applications, delivering measurable business outcomes
2. Low-Code Tools for Customization: Tailor solutions to your unique data and needs
sessions.description: Discover how Electronic Arts is advancing its AI/ML infrastructure to scale teams who can run AI, scale applications of AI, and scale the impact of AI across player experiences. We'll highlight EA’s streamlined GPU provisioning across multi-cloud and on-premises environments, centralized model management for compliance and accessibility, and rapid deployment capabilities, enabling seamless workflows that accelerate development and bring AI innovations into production with robust service level agreements.

sessions.title: Enterprise MLOps 101
sessions.speakers: Michael Balint (Director, Product Architecture, NVIDIA) | William Benton (Principal Product Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Key challenges to consider when moving GenAI into production
2. Best practices to leverage to ensure maximum performance and return on investment from GenAI
sessions.description:
Virtually every organization has heard that they need to establish a machine learning operations (MLOps) practice, or at least define an MLOps strategy. Because machine learning systems are complex software systems, the ecosystem of tools supporting MLOps is rich and diverse. Unfortunately, enterprises often attempt to understand MLOps by first understanding this ecosystem, or by studying another organization’s processes — and the emergence of generative AI applications appears to add still more layers of complexity.
 
Learn a framework for making sense of MLOps that will also enable you to understand what the ecosystem offers. You’ll learn how to support the entire machine learning workflow and tomorrow’s generative AI apps, to evaluate which offerings are best for your needs, and to tailor a solution for your team. You’ll leave this session with a clear map to MLOps and large language model operations (LLMOps) processes, practices, and solutions that will support your organization’s machine learning initiatives.

sessions.title: AI-Driven Data Centers: Optimizing Total AI Solutions in the AI Age With Ubitus (Presented by ASUSTek Computer Inc.)
sessions.speakers: Wesley Kuo (CEO, Ubitus K.K.) | Alber Wu (Division Director of Solutions, ASUS)
sessions.points:
1. Dive into our strategies adapting CFD algorithms and physics modeling for GPU computing.
2. Discover how AI can rapidly explore design options and identify optimal configurations, boosting engineering productivity.
sessions.description: The rapid growth of artificial intelligence is transforming the data center landscape. ASUS explores the success of AI-driven data centers with Ubitus, where AI is leveraged to optimize operations, enhance efficiency, and reduce costs. We delve into key areas of optimization, including data center infrastructure planning, platform management, and building platform as a service to enable AI solutions. Through the lens of the Ubitus case study, we examine how a leading cloud technology provider is implementing these solutions to deliver superior performance and value in the AI age. This analysis highlights the transformative potential of AI in shaping the future of data center infrastructure.

sessions.title: AI Inferencing using NIM with Serverless GPUs (Presented by Microsoft)
sessions.speakers: Devanshi Joshi (Sr. Product Marketing Manager, Microsoft) | Harry Li (Software Engineer, Microsoft) | Cary Chai (Product Manager, Microsoft)
sessions.points:
1. Discover how conversational AI and multi-modal large language models are being applied to solve real-world problems in healthcare, agriculture, and education
2. Explore how AI is already impacting various sectors and understand the future opportunities presented by these innovations
sessions.description: In the rapidly evolving world of AI, companies face challenges in incorporating AI into their applications due to the need for rapid upskilling and adapting to new models. Learn how NVIDIA NIM, provided as containerized microservices, offer cutting-edge AI models optimized for specific scenarios. By inferencing these models with serverless GPUs, developers can streamline the deployment and management of AI solutions. Learn about the benefits of using NVIDIA Blueprints for key AI use cases, and how to leverage Azure's autoscaling platform to enhance your applications with AI capabilities.

sessions.title: The Future of AI: Scaling Intelligence, Open-Source Innovation, and Human-AI Collaboration
sessions.speakers: Ali Farhadi (CEO, Allen Institute for AI) | Vartika Singh (Strategic AI Lead, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Gain insights on the big picture view of how AI is transforming the telecommunications industry.
2. Understand how telcos are deploying AI Factories to power sovereign AI initiatives in their domestic markets, including by delivering inferencing at the edge and the AI Grid.
sessions.description:
Join us for an exclusive fireside chat with Ali Farhadi, CEO of AI2, as we explore the next frontier of artificial intelligence — from scaling models efficiently to the transformative power of open-source AI. Ali, a strong advocate for open research and democratizing AI, will share his vision on how open-source AI ecosystems can drive innovation, accelerate breakthroughs, and ensure equitable access to cutting-edge technology.

In this engaging conversation, we’ll discuss efficiency-driven architectures like mixture of experts (MoE) and multi-head latent attention (MLA), test-time compute strategies, speculative decoding, and the balance between scalability and responsible AI development. We’ll also dive into the role of multi-modal AI, the challenges of proprietary versus open models, and how the AI community can foster transparency and collaboration.

sessions.title: AI on Location: Deploying Mobile Private Networks and Edge Compute for Next Gen Content Pipelines
sessions.speakers: Scott Connolly (Head of Media Technology, Verizon Innovation Labs) | Tony Walasik (Product Manager, Monks)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the technical and commercial opportunities from an AI-native RAN to drive increased spectral efficiency, network capacity, and network utilization
2. Discover how the industry is delivering on AI-RAN through the AI-for-RAN and AI-with-RAN pathways
sessions.description: This session will explore the integration of containerized cloud applications running locally with NVIDIA Holoscan for Media to drive innovative new broadcast workflows. Using Verizon’s 5G Private Network with Enterprise AI solution, users will be able to take advantage of cloud and software-driven workflows on locally deployable hardware, enabling cutting edge workflows on an IP-secure environment while minimizing the need for specialized hardware. Explore how you can build a workflow that leverages NIMs alongside cutting edge technologies like SMPTE 2110, 5G wireless video & AI analysis to create new and exciting broadcast pipelines.

sessions.title: Stable and Scalable FP8 Deep Learning Training on Blackwell
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Kirthi Shankar Sivamani (Sr. Deep Learning Performance Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn about infrastructural challenges in integrating novel technologies into complex ML stacks
2. Discover the role of NVIDIA Triton and TensorRT-LLM in enhancing ML serving performance
sessions.description: Learn about the new advancements in low-precision training recipes coming with Transformer Engine 2.0 for Hopper and Blackwell GPUs. We'll dive deep into the training performance and convergence of large language models when using FP8.

sessions.title: Accelerating Model Development and Deployment for Drug Discovery and Life Sciences
sessions.speakers: Anthony Costa (Director, Digital Biology, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Unlock unprecedented performance for humanoid robotics applications using NVIDIA Jetson Thor
2. Learn about NVIDIA's extensive robotics platform, including advanced software tools, AI models, and libraries specifically designed for humanoid robotics
sessions.description: Learn about the latest developments and the next generation of NVIDIA software to accelerate drug discovery and life sciences. BioNeMo is NVIDIA's platform to accelerate state-of-the-art chemistry, biology, and genomics foundation modeling. NVIDIA Parabricks is our state-of-the-art genomics platform that accelerates our understanding of biology. Together with the entire NVIDIA full-stack computing platform, the technology to discover the nature of biology and disease, and to develop new drugs and therapeutics, has never been faster and more accessible. We'll discuss the latest advancements in the capabilities of both platforms, aspects of our future roadmap, and real-world demonstrations of successful programs leveraging our technology.

sessions.title: Using cuDNN for DL Optimizations
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Programming Languages / Compilers
sessions.speakers: Yang Xu (Enterprise Products) (DL Software Engineering Manager, NVIDIA) | Gautam Jain (Senior Systems Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Anerudhan Gopal (Senior Systems Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Vedaanta Agarwalla (Senior Systems Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Jingfan Sun (Senior Systems Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Brian Ryu (Senior Systems Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Kevin Lin (Senior Systems Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Rajas Mhaskar (Senior Systems Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Yanqin Zhai (Senior Systems Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Alex Yang (NVIDIA) | Joe Halabi (Senior Systems Software Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. The panel experts are available to cover different aspects of NVIDIA’s CUDA compiler tool chain tool
2. We'll also discuss recent new compiler improvements — e.g., generated code size, and compilation time improvements
sessions.description: Do you want to learn how to get started accelerating Large Language Models and other state of the art DL models? Join this interactive support session with the cuDNN engineering staff to get direct help and surface your questions, issues, and ideas specific to your use case.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: AI Agents on the Road: Revolutionizing In-Vehicle Intelligence with NVIDIA NIM and RAG
sessions.speakers: Avi Yashar (Co-founder and Chiel Executive Officer, Dataloop) | Laksh Parthasarathy (Global Head, Smart Mobility Group, Tata Consultancy Services)
sessions.points:
1. What the future data center and GPU cluster will look like
2. ASUS’s key solutions for delivering comprehensive AI capabilities​
sessions.description: The automotive industry is evolving beyond static dashboards, AI agents are taking the wheel in delivering real-time intelligence. Join Dataloop and TCS  as we introduce a next-generation in-vehicle AI agent that continuously monitors vehicle health parameters and dashboard indicators, providing context-aware, real-time insights and actionable recommendations in a conversational interface. This intelligent co-pilot is built on Dataloop’s AI orchestration pipeline, integrating NVIDIA NIM microservices and a RAG framework to enhance response generation, decision-making, and user interaction. We’ll explore how TCS uses AI agents that transform mobility, offering personalized, proactive support for drivers and fleet operators.

sessions.title: Enhance Real-World Educational Materials With AI: Multimodal Solutions to Empower Educators
sessions.speakers: Yau Ping Lam (Chief Technology Officer, Evoke AI, Ltd.)
sessions.points:
1. Oil and gas companies are increasingly adopting numerical simulations for equipment development and testing in harsh downhole conditions
2. A novel approach combining CFD and DEM predicts downhole scale deposition, addressing flow blockages and valve operation issues
sessions.description: Education often feels like a half-built bridge, struggling to connect what’s taught with how it’s used. Enter Evoke AI — a game-changer that transforms lessons from theory into vibrant, real-world experiences. Imagine a classroom where concepts aren’t just explained — they’re lived; where every student’s unique needs are met, and learning sparks true curiosity. Powered by NVIDIA’s technology, Evoke AI turns abstract ideas into interactive scenarios, making learning engaging and relevant. It’s not just about flashy tech; it’s about bridging gaps between theory and practice, teachers and students. Evoke AI empowers educators without replacing them, freeing up time by handling routine tasks so teachers can focus on building real connections. It caters to diverse learning needs, enhancing the joy of teaching and learning alike. Join us in making education not just smarter, but truly transformative.

sessions.title: FlexAttention: The Flexibility of PyTorch With the Performance of FlashAttention
sessions.speakers: Driss Guessous (Machine Learning Engineer, Meta Platforms)
sessions.points:
1. Maximize the ROI on AI factory investments
2. How to architect end-to-end networking for AI
sessions.description: Introducing FlexAttention: a novel PyTorch API that enables custom, user-defined attention mechanisms with performance comparable to state-of-the-art solutions. By leveraging the PyTorch compiler stack, FlexAttention supports dynamic modifications to attention scores within SDPA, achieving both runtime and memory efficiency through kernel fusion with the FlashAttention algorithm. Our benchmarks on A100 GPUs show FlexAttention achieves 90% of FlashAttention2's performance in forward passes and 85% in backward passes. On H100 GPUs, FlexAttention's forward performance averages 85% of FlashAttention3 and is ~25% faster than FlashAttention2, while backward performance averages 76% of FlashAttention3 and is ~3% faster than FlashAttention2. Explore how FlexAttention balances near-state-of-the-art performance with unparalleled flexibility, empowering researchers to rapidly iterate on attention mechanisms without sacrificing efficiency.

sessions.title: Advancing AV Development With Sensor Simulation and Cosmos
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Tracking / Video Analytics
sessions.speakers: Gautham Sholingar (Sr. Manager, Product, NVIDIA)
sessions.description: Learn how the NVIDIA Omniverse Blueprint for AV Simulation and Cosmos are enabling AV developers to enhance their simulation workflows and solve the most important problems in AV development and testing. This session will feature workflows developed by NVIDIA's AV simulation ecosystem partners for scenario creation, synthetic data generation, 3D reconstruction and closed loop simulation.

sessions.title: Unfolding Humanoids Safety
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Training AI Models
sessions.speakers: Mathias Blake (Platform Architect, NVIDIA) | Leela Karumbunathan (Sr. Hardware Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Suhas Hariharapura Sheshadri (Sr. Software Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Riccardo Mariani (VP Safety, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Revolutionize LLMs with xLSTM: Gain insights into how xLSTM outperforms transformers with significantly improved energy efficiency and scalability, making it ideal for large-scale deployments
2. Master Long Context Processing: Learn how xLSTM handles larger context windows — up to 1 million tokens — while maintaining superior accuracy, positioning it as the go-to architecture for future AI applications
sessions.description: Robotics safety is at a tipping point with humanoids: safety requirements for autonomy, mobility, and AI fuse all together. Let's explore together the challenges and opportunities to achieve humanoids safety, including a deep dive into most recent developments on safety architectures, methodologies, and tools.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Advanced LLM App Evaluation: Building Real-Time Guardrails for Real-World LLM Risk Mitigation
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Medical Imaging
sessions.speakers: Aparna Dhinakaran (CPO, Arize AI)
sessions.points:
1. Understand annotation workflows using MONAI Label
2. Utilize interactive 3D segmentation using VISTA-3D's zero-shot capabilities
sessions.description: As LLM apps become more widespread, so do their associated risks — protecting your LLM application from malicious inputs and undesired outputs is critical in both development and production. We'll share lessons learned from dozens of productionized use cases into applying LLM evaluations and guardrails to enhance the safety and relevance of Gen AI systems in real-world environments.

sessions.title: Accelerating Sovereign AI Factories: Insights from Telco Case Studies
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Large Language Models (LLMs)
sessions.speakers: Joao Kluck Gomes (Director, Business Development – AI Factories & Applications, NVIDIA) | Kaaren Hilsen (Chief Innovation Officer & Head of Telenor AI Factory, Telenor) | Saeed Otufat-Shamsi (Director of Engineering, Telus Communications) | Ryuji Wakikawa (Vice President, Research Institute of Advanced Technology, Softbank)
sessions.points:
1. Explore common vulnerabilities in LLM applications, including jailbreak attempts, PII leaks, and harmful outputs, and their potential impact on companies
2. Understand how LLM observability and evaluation provide real-time risk management to protect apps from misuse or unintended behavior
