sessions.description: The pace of AI Factory deployments by Telecom companies have ramped up significantly in the past 18 months.Telcos are establishing themselves as AI factory providers by leveraging their intrinsic strengths in managing and investing in complex infrastructure, being the trusted national providers of essential infrastructure, plus having access to data centers' power and space. In a growing number of countries, Telecom companies are providing the national ecosystem including government, universities, startups, and enterprises with the required AI infrastructure and platform, supporting industry and government efforts to drive AI impact across society.We'll explore how Telcos from different regions are approaching the opportunity and driving impact in their countries.

sessions.title: Build High-Performance and AI-Enabled Sensor Processing Applications
sessions.speakers: Maximilian Ofir (Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA) | Bogdan Mitrea (Senior Solution Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Virtual Robotics Training with Omniverse & Isaac Sim: Discover how NVIDIA Omniverse and Isaac Sim create interactive 3D environments that accurately replicate real-world scenarios, enabling precise and cost-effective training for humanoid robots before deployment
2. AI-Driven Robotics & Adaptability: Learn how NVIDIA’s AI-driven robotics SDKs allow robots to adapt to dynamic, unpredictable environments, reducing human intervention and accelerating the development of autonomous systems
sessions.description: Along with the demand for real-time insights and autonomous decision-making comes the need for scalable edge solutions that can process AI-enabled sensor data at the source and scale out to on-premises or cloud. However, several formidable challenges lie ahead:Real-time latency requirements.Complexity of building and maintaining custom pipeline for AI-enabled sensor processing.Hardware heterogeneity needs (for a solution not tied to a specific type of hardware).Multimodality sensor processing.Compute-efficient visualization.Integration from edge to on-premises to cloud distributed network.Long-term whole-stack stability.Holoscan SDK is NVIDIA’s real-time, low-latency, and domain-agnostic SDK to build, deploy, and scale domain-agnostic AI-enabled sensor processing applications. We'll demonstrate how to scale with Holoscan, while stressing core components including simplification of I/O from sensor to GPU, AI inferencing and accelerated computing, and real time visualization.Prerequisite(s):Basic python, ML, and dockers understanding.

sessions.title: Reimagining Business Processes for Manufacturers with AI-Powered Digital Twins
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Industrial Digitalization / Digital Twin
sessions.speakers: Mitchell Clark (Product Manager - Discrete Manufacturing Industries, SAP Labs) | Amit Sharma (SAP)
sessions.points:
1. Innovative Integrations: Learn how to leverage NVIDIA Omniverse and related advanced analytic tools for asset health modeling, robotics, and AMRs to drive cutting-edge manufacturing solutions that connect to existing plant floor standard systems
2. Collaborative Labs using Omniverse: Explore how Omniverse enables improved collaboration so digital twins, augmented training, and AI-driven decision-making can be more quickly adopted
sessions.description: Industrial AI and enterprise data are transforming the way manufacturers buy, sell, manufacture, and service their products and equipment. sessions.title: Using NVIDIA CUDA Compiler Tool Chain for Productive GPGPU Programming
sessions.speakers: Jerry Zheng (Senior Engineering Manager, NVIDIA) | Jaydeep Marathe (Principal Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Gautam Chakrabarti (Senior Engineering Manager, NVIDIA) | Chu-Cheow Lim (Director of Engineering, NVIDIA) | Mike Murphy (Senior Compiler Engineer, NVIDIA) | Howard Chen (Compiler Engineering Manager, NVIDIA) | Xiaohua Zhang (Senior Compiler Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Breakdown of AI code assistants between copilot-like systems, fully autonomous agentic systems, and collaborative agentic systems
2. Current state-of-the-art and expectations that a company should have when adopting each category of AI code assistance
sessions.description: Learn how to use CUDA compiler tool chain effectively for your needs. We'll cover all aspects of the tool chain — including nvcc, libnvvm, ptxas, nvrtc, and nvJitLink. Maybe you're a beginner trying to understand the CUDA C++ language and compiler usage, or maybe you're planning to use CUDA C++ for your applications and want to find out if your requirements can be met by parts or the whole tool chain, or you may already be programming in CUDA C++ and want to learn about new features in NVIDIA’s compiler tool chain to use it even more productively. Whatever your level of experience, we’re ready to share our knowledge of best practices  and CUDA C++ programming, so that you get the most out of NVIDIA’s GPU capabilities and performance and succeed in your GPGPU development and deployment. We're equally interested in your feedback on how to further improve the overall compiler support.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Scalable, Configurable Multi-Modal Data Processing Pipelines to Enhance Gen AI Accuracy
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Training AI Models
sessions.speakers: Niket Agarwal (AI Infra) (Distinguished Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Arham Mehta (Product Manager, Deep Learning Software, NVIDIA) | Ryan Wolf (Deep Learning Algorithm Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Develop a comprehensive understanding of long-context modeling
2. Get expert guidance on choosing appropriate training methods for long-context models
sessions.description:
Enterprises are increasingly leveraging large-scale datasets that encompass not just text, but also image and video data, to drive advancements in generative AI. For video foundation models (for example), the aggregate input for these pipelines is on the order of hundreds of petabytes of raw data, and the output is tens of petabytes of high-quality data. Processing these massive datasets presents significant challenges, including scalability issues, bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and fragmented workflows.

We'll dive into the challenges and explore techniques you can leverage to effectively address them. We'll discuss data processing pipelines for various modalities and how to employ strategies that enable seamless scaling across multi-GPU and multi-node configurations. Learn how to accelerate data processing, improve GPU utilization, reduce processing time, and lower the total cost of ownership for enterprises.

We'll show how to leverage the robust resiliency features of NVIDIA's NeMo Framework to enhance your LLM training workflows on leading cloud platforms. You'll learn practical strategies to overcome common hurdles and optimize your large-scale AI training operations for improved reliability and efficiency.

sessions.description: Do you need to compute larger or faster than a single GPU allows, but a multi-GPU library providing the functionality you need isn't available? sessions.title: Toward Rational Drug Design With AlphaFold 3
sessions.speakers: Max Jaderberg (Chief AI Officer, Isomorphic Labs) | Sergei Yakneen (Chief Technology Officer, Isomorphic Labs)
sessions.description: The introduction of AlphaFold 2 has spurred a revolution in modeling the structure of proteins and their interactions, enabling a huge range of applications in protein modeling and design. Here, we describe our AlphaFold 3 model, with a substantially updated diffusion-based architecture that's capable of predicting the joint structure of complexes including proteins, nucleic acids, small molecules, ions, and modified residues. The new AlphaFold model demonstrates substantially improved accuracy over many previous specialized tools: far greater accuracy for protein–ligand interactions compared with state-of-the-art docking tools, much higher accuracy for protein–nucleic acid interactions compared with nucleic-acid-specific predictors, and substantially higher antibody–antigen prediction accuracy compared with AlphaFold-Multimer v.2.37,8. Together, these results show that high-accuracy modeling across biomolecular space is possible within a single unified deep-learning framework.

As data evolves and volumes grow exponentially, traditional storage solutions can no longer meet the rigorous demands of enterprise AI systems. Discover how NVIDIA is collaborating with storage trailblazers to create a new class of accelerated data platforms — optimized for GenAI workloads and real-time RAG pipelines. Powering these next-generation systems are NVIDIA GPUs, high-performance NVIDIA networking, NVIDIA NIMs, and an AI-native data ingestion stack, delivering efficient pre-processing, storage, and retrieval at unprecedented speeds. Explore the innovations that are redefining enterprise data platforms and shaping the future of GenAI.

sessions.title: Make My PyTorch Model Fast, and Show Me How You Did It
sessions.speakers: Thomas Viehmann (Principal Research Engineer, Lightning AI) | Luca Antiga (CTO, Lightning AI)
sessions.points:
1. Understand practical strategies for optimizing GPU utilization to reduce training and inference times
2. Learn how real-world organizations scaled their AI models efficiently while managing costs
sessions.description:
PyTorch is popular in deep learning and LLMs for richness and ease of expressions. To make the most of compute resources, PyTorch models benefit from nontrivial optimizations, but this means losing some of their ease and understandability.

Learn how with Thunder, a PyTorch-to-Python compiler focused on usability, understandability, and extensibility, you can optimize and transform (i.e., distribute across many machines) models while
•	leaving the PyTorch code unchanged
•	targeting a variety of models without needing to adapt to each of them
•	understanding each transformation step because the results are presented as simple Python code
•	accessing powerful extension code for your own optimizations with just one or a few lines of code

We'll show how the combination of Thunder transforms and the NVIDIA stack (NVFuser, cuDNN, Apex) delivers optimized performance in training and inference on a variety of models.

sessions.speakers: Jeremy Wilke (Legate-JAX Technical Lead, NVIDIA) | Bo Dong (Principal Technical Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Manolis Papadakis (Sr. Software Engineer, Legate Framework, NVIDIA) | Wonchan Lee (Sr. Software Engineering Lead, NVIDIA) | Shriram Janardhan (NVIDIA)

sessions.description: Python is a powerful and user-friendly programming language, but as data sizes and computational complexity grow, single-CPU Python implementations struggle to deliver the speed and scale demanded by cutting-edge research. cuPyNumeric enables you to seamlessly scale your Python programs from a single-CPU machine to multi-node clustered computers, utilizing multiple Intel/AMD/ARM CPUs and multiple NVIDIA GPUs, without any modifications to your code. This Chat With Experts lets you meet with our Python experts to address a variety of numerical computing challenges. We can cover advanced topics related to using cuPyNumeric effectively, including debugging, profiling, performance optimization, and extending the library.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. sessions.title: Navigating Challenges and Technical Debt in LLMs Deployment
sessions.speakers: Ahmed Menshawy (Vice President of AI Engineering, Mastercard)
sessions.points:
1. Essential approaches to balance competing priorities: how to maintain rapid innovation while implementing robust security measures
2. Real-world methods for embedding safety considerations throughout the AI development life cycle
sessions.description:
Deploying large language models (LLMs) in production introduces numerous challenges and technical debt including memory management, parallelization, and model compression, highlighting a trade-off between utility and complexity.

Learn how Mastercard developed a generative AI assistant to augment LLMs with Mastercard-specific data, ensuring business-required latency and throughput and operating on-premises using NVIDIA DGX, NeMo, and Triton inference servers. This technical initiative is detailed in their recently accepted ACM paper titled "Navigating Challenges and Technical Debt in Large Language Models Deployment" (https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3642970.3655840) co-authored in collaboration with the University of Edinburgh.

This talk will discuss the paper and the technical debts associated with deploying LLMs for businesses, highlighting the need for solutions and sophisticated engineering strategies that go beyond the capabilities of standard machine learning libraries and inference engines.

We'll also introduce new libraries like CV-CUDA and nvTiff, alongside updates to DALI, NPP, and nvJPEGImportant:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. sessions.title: FlashAttention-3: Fast and Accurate Attention With Asynchrony and Low Precision
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Deep Learning Frameworks
sessions.speakers: Tri Dao (Chief Scientist, Together AI) | Jay Shah (Research Scientist, Colfax International)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how FlexAttention enables rapid development of custom attention mechanisms while maintaining performance close to state-of-the-art solutions like FlashAttention2 and FlashAttention3
2. Discover how to implement complex attention variants (e.g., sliding window, ALiBi, relative positional encoding) in just a few lines of PyTorch code using FlexAttention's flexible API
sessions.description: Attention, as a core layer of the ubiquitous Transformer architecture, is the bottleneck for large language models and long-context applications. FlashAttention pioneered an approach to speed up attention on GPUs by minimizing memory reads/writes. However, it has yet to take advantage of recent hardware. We develop three main techniques to speed up attention on NVIDIA Hopper GPUs: exploiting asynchrony of the Tensor Cores and TMA to (1) overlap overall computation and data movement via warp-specialization and interleave block-wise matmul and softmax operations, and (2) block quantization and incoherent processing that leverages hardware support for FP8 low-precision. Our method, FlashAttention-3, achieves speedup on H100 GPUs by 1.5-2.0X, with BF16 reaching up to 800 TFLOPs/s, and with FP8 reaching1.3 PFLOPs/s. We validate that FP8 FlashAttention-3 achieves 2.6X lower numerical error than a baseline FP8 attention.

sessions.title: Enhancing Oil & Gas Innovation: High-Fidelity Simulations & AI Surrogates with Accelerated Computing
sessions.speakers: Gocha Chochua (Technical Advisor, SLB) | Joris Poort (Founder and CEO, Rescale)
sessions.points:
1. How to design an optimized AI infrastructure from the start
2. How to automate infrastructure management to new levels
sessions.description:
The presentation with Schlumberger NV (SLB) emphasizes how cloud-based NVIDIA GPUs enable highly detailed and reliable simulations, helping developers optimize equipment design and production strategies. It's vital for the community, as it shows how advanced GPU technology is revolutionizing the oil & gas industry by addressing one of its most challenging aspects — equipment performance under harsh downhole conditions. By leveraging the immense parallel processing power of cloud-based NVIDIA GPUs, developers can conduct highly detailed and reliable simulations that were previously unattainable due to computational limitations.

These simulations enable precise modeling of complex physical phenomena, such as multiphase flows and particle interactions, which are critical for optimizing equipment design and production strategies. The insights gained not only improve operational efficiency and reduce maintenance costs, but also help ensure safer and more sustainable energy extraction. We'll underscore how cutting-edge technology can drive innovation, solve industry-critical problems, and unlock significant economic and operational benefits for stakeholders.

We'll also show how AI surrogate models can be built using NVIDIA Modulus based on the high-fidelity simulations to accelerate results by 100X, with real time inference in seconds. We'll include benchmark studies of combined computational fluid dynamics/discrete element method (CFD-DEM) simulations on various GPUs, and the end-to-end process of building an AI surrogate model using NVIDIA Modulus. 

Gain insights with significant potential for improving the safety and efficiency of hydrocarbon recovery by minimizing maintenance costs and improving effectiveness in high-salinity environments, demonstrating the transformative role of cutting-edge technologies in addressing critical industry challenges. By utilizing NVIDIA GPUs for high-fidelity simulations and NVIDIA Modulus to build AI surrogate models, the potential revenue impact for all types of energy companies could range from $150 million to over $1 billion annually, to pave the way for new, more efficient, and more sustainable technologies.

sessions.title: Best Practices in Feature Engineering for Tabular Data With GPU Acceleration

sessions.points:

sessions.description: Feature engineering is an important component in (tabular) machine learning solutions, which can be easily integrated into existing models and boost model accuracy. We'll teach best practices for feature engineering techniques specific to tabular data building off our teams' collective experience competing in data science competitions such as Kaggle and RecSys. Learn how to create features from categorical, numerical, and time-series data, and accelerate your data frame operations on GPU. We'll use RAPIDS, an open-source software that accelerates the whole data science pipeline from data preprocess/engineering to machine learning on GPU.Prerequisite(s):Python programming using libraries, such as pandas and NumPy.Basic understanding of machine learning, decision trees and feed forward neural networks.
