sessions.description:
Join us for the first NVIDIA Quantum Developer Day, celebrating the transformative work being enabled across the quantum computing ecosystem in collaboration with NVIDIA's expertise and world-leading software and hardware tools.  

Featuring the following technical talks from NVIDIA partners: Quantum Contextual Machine Learning: A Glidepath From GPU to QPU - Pranav Gokhale (Infleqtion), How to Build a Distributed Quantum Computer: Adaptive Circuit Knitting - Masoud Mohseni (Hewlett Packard Enterprise), Harnessing CUDA-Q’s Dynamics Capabilities for the Design of Quantum Sensors - Nima Leclerc (MITRE), A Quantum Computing Pipeline for Proteins - Kanav Setia and Kenny Heitritter (QBraid), Integrated QPU/GPU Calibration of Multiqubit Circuits - Ramon Szmuk (Quantum Machines), Acceleration of quantum simulations with fault-tolerant quantum algorithms for chemistry applications - Kenji Sugisaki (Keio University), Accelerate Quantum Apps Development with Realistic (Virtual) Quantum Processing Units - Andrea Tabacchini (Quantum Brilliance)

sessions.title: Connecting Industrial Data to Digital Twins With Microsoft Power BI, NVIDIA Omniverse, and OpenUSD
sessions.speakers: Martin Karlsson (Principle Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Andrew Dudek (Senior Software Engineer, Microsoft)
sessions.points:
1. Repurposable software-defined hardware with NVIDIA GPU and NIC are redefining live media industries
2. AI can be connected to live, uncompressed media on-premises
sessions.description: This hands-on lab guides developers through the process of creating a cloud-based IoT application using NVIDIA Omniverse Kit and Microsoft Azure. Participants will learn to develop, deploy, and integrate a containerized Omniverse Kit application with a web-based front-end, focusing on data streaming and state management in industrial scenarios.By the end of this lab, you'll be able to develop a cloud-hosted application that leverages NVIDIA Omniverse for backend processing and a web interface for real-time data visualization and interaction. This lab is ideal for software developers interested in cloud-based IoT solutions, real-time data streaming, and industrial digital twin applications.Prerequisite(s):Knowledge of cloud computing concepts and Microsoft Azure services.Familiarity with IoT, data streaming, and 3D graphics.Experience with Python programming, NVIDIA Omniverse and OpenUSD.

sessions.title: AI to ROI with CDW and NVIDIA (Presented by CDW)
sessions.speakers: Kevin Kaiser (Director, AI in Product and Partner Management, CDW)
sessions.points:
1. How to spot the right skills
2. How to implement the learning paths to grow the hottest skills in the market within your team and validate their knowledge
sessions.description: Let CDW guide you through your journey to unlock the value of your data with cloud, hybrid, and managed services expertise. Our partnership means you have access to experts who understand how to keep your data secure and accessible while reaping the benefits of AI innovation.

sessions.title: Flexible and Optimized Architecture to Train, Secure, and Deliver AI to the Edge (Presented by F5)
sessions.speakers: Buu Lam (Sr. Solutions Architect and Community Evangelist, DevCentral, F5)
sessions.points:
1. Overview of FP8 training techniques
2. Enable FP8 at the software level with NeMo and Transformer Engine
sessions.description: Building and delivering AI applications is moving from experimentation by select groups with minimal cost controls to mainstream use, managed within organizations’ overall technology groups with real return-on-investment (ROI) calculations. Over the past couple of years, we've come to understand that it's not unlike architectures we are already familiar with, whether high performance computing data centers, previously only found in research, or microservice-based applications that have been adopted over the last decade. While we aren’t starting from scratch, we still must be aware of how AI differs, and what architectural decisions will influence performance, cost, and security. We’ll touch on architecture and security across training of models, inferencing, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), hybrid and multicloud networking, and edge AI deployments, in addition to protecting LLM model outputs and inputs.

sessions.title: Accelerate AI Innovation with Cloudera’s AI Studios (Presented by Cloudera)
sessions.speakers: Robert Hryniewicz (Director, GTM, Enterprise AI, Cloudera)
sessions.points:
1. SLB building energy NIMs
2. First energy-specific Gen AI commercial solutions
sessions.description: Organizations are seeking practical solutions to rapidly build and deploy AI applications that deliver measurable business outcomes. Discover how Cloudera AI Studios empowers teams to rapidly create domain-specific Gen AI applications. Learn how Cloudera’s low-code tools for retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), fine-tuning of foundation models, and deploying AI agents to streamline workflows and adapt models to your unique data and business needs. You'll gain actionable strategies to reduce development time, increase operational flexibility, and integrate Gen AI effectively into your workflows.

sessions.title: Master AI Workload Optimization: Insights From Real-World Implementations (Presented by GMI Cloud)
sessions.speakers: Yujing Qian (VP of Engineering, GMI Cloud)
sessions.points:
1. Some of the most advanced AI workloads are running on Oracle Cloud's AI Infrastructure, designed to provide the highest performance, sovereignty controls, and best value in the cloud
2. From customers needing small-scale AI inferencing to those with the most advanced requirements, OCI has options, including clusters with up to 131,072 GPUs
sessions.description: Yujing Qian, vice president of engineering at GMI Cloud, will present a real-world case study showing how NVIDIA Kubernetes technologies helped a client reduce training times, scale models, and achieve measurable return on investment. By addressing infrastructure inefficiencies and employing innovative strategies, the client achieved significant performance and cost improvements.

sessions.title: Startup Pitches: Robotics, Automotive, Smart Spaces, and Engineering
sessions.speakers: Jack Resnick (Inception Partner Manager for Healthcare and Life Sciences, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Achieve cost optimization and performance improvements with NVIDIA-optimized AI software modules and LLMs, as demonstrated in token generation benchmarks
2. Learn how a CI/CD approach to Gen AI solutions enable deployments in hours and updates in minutes
sessions.description: Join us for an engaging hour of startup pitches showcasing groundbreaking solutions across diverse fields, including robotics, automotive, smart spaces, engineering, and more. These dynamic presentations are part of NVIDIA Inception, a free program designed to help startups evolve faster through cutting-edge technology, opportunities to connect with venture capitalists, and access to the latest technical resources from NVIDIA.

sessions.title: Power Sustainable AI Clouds With Advanced Networking
sessions.speakers: Gavin McKee (Principal Engineer for Network Architecture, Crusoe.ai) | Alexander Petrovskiy (Senior Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Nupur Pravin Uttarwar (Senior Software Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Experience next-generation security purpose-built for AI factories and cloud data centers, providing robust protection without impacting performance
2. Learn how real-time threat detection and response operate independently of the host to ensure tamper-proof protection for every AI node
sessions.description:
AI is transforming industries and driving solutions to some of the world’s most pressing challenges. To support this growing demand, the infrastructure powering AI must also evolve — with a focus on sustainability and energy efficiency. In this joint session, NVIDIA and Crusoe will discuss how advanced networking solutions are enabling a new era of AI-driven innovation.

Discover how Crusoe leverages NVIDIA’s accelerated networking platforms to build a sustainable AI cloud that delivers high performance while minimizing energy consumption. Learn how Crusoe’s vertically integrated infrastructure, powered by innovative energy sources and NVIDIA’s networking technology, combines enterprise-class controls, scalability, and sustainability to meet the demands of next-generation AI workloads.

sessions.title: Power the Next Wave of AI with Real-Time Runtime Security
sessions.speakers: Ofir Arkin (Sr. Distinguished Engineer, NVIDIA) | Nataly Kremer (Chief Product Officer and Head of R&D, Check Point) | Ahmad Atamli (Director, Research, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Build AI agents and workflows with Lenovo AI libraries, platforms, and NVIDIA NIMS and blueprints
2. Accelerate AI deployments with validated AI designs and solutions built on NVIDIA-accelerated compute and software
sessions.description:
As generative AI revolutionizes industries, it also brings unique security challenges that traditional defenses fail to address. Containerization, a cornerstone of AI workloads, enables repeatable and consistent deployment across platforms but also introduces security risks that demand innovative solutions.

Discover a cutting-edge DPU-powered solution to securing NVIDIA NIMs and other containerized AI workloads. Leveraging live memory forensics, this solution detects and stops threats in real time. Operating independently of the host, it creates a tamper-proof trust domain to safeguard every AI node. Purpose-built for modern AI factories and cloud data centers, it isolates malicious activity, identifies attack vectors targeting network-facing services, and delivers actionable forensic insights — all without compromising performance. Learn how this next-generation security framework redefines cybersecurity for cloud-native AI environments, delivering unmatched speed, agility, and trust for the next frontier of innovation.

sessions.title: Peering Into the Future: What AI and Graph Networks Can Mean for the Future of Financial Analysis
sessions.speakers: Sudeep Kesh (Chief Innovation Officer, S&P Global) | Siddharth Samsi (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how we develop and optimize CUDA kernels for inference with transformer models
2. Dive deep into Tensor Cores, asynchronous memory ops, and more
sessions.description: Artificial Intelligence, agentic systems, and graph neural networks (GNNs) are providing the new frontier to assess, monitor, and estimate opportunities and risks across work portfolios within financial services. Although many of these technologies are still developing, organizations are eager to understand their potential. See how S&P Global and NVIDIA are working together to find practical ways to learn and integrate such capabilities, ranging from forecasting corporate debt issuance to understanding capital markets at a deeper level. We'll show a graph representation of market data using the PyTorch-Geometric library and a dataset of issuances spanning three decades and across financial and non-financial industries. Technical developments include generation of a bipartite graph and link-prediction GNN forecasting. We'll address data preprocessing, pipelines, model training, and how these technologies can broaden capabilities in an increasingly complex world.

sessions.title: Lessons Learned Turning AI Models Into Production-Grade Microservices at Scale
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Training AI Models
sessions.speakers: Nik Spirin (Director, Generative AI and LLMOps Platform, NVIDIA) | Michael Balint (Director, Product Architecture, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Discover the common pitfalls and strategies for training LLMs at scale
2. Explore NeMo's powerful resiliency features, including in-job restarts, straggler detection, and asynchronous distributed checkpointing, and learn about upcoming features on the NeMo roadmap.
sessions.description: Learn how NVIDIA works with popular AI model providers like Google, Microsoft, Meta, and Mistral, among others, to create NIMs — performance-optimized enterprise-grade microservices ready for production deployments across on-premises and cloud environments. We'll introduce the platform that NVIDIA built for optimizing models for inference using TRT/TRT-LLM, building and validating containers for NVIDIA NIM standard compliance, performance benchmarking, accuracy benchmarking, and production-grade testing and “shimming” the container APIs to make them seamlessly integrate with various deployment targets. By leveraging advanced hardware and software co-optimizations, one can achieve significant performance gains, enabling scalable and cost-effective AI solutions. This platform enables NVIDIA and AI ecosystem at large to shorten time-to-market for the latest AI models and make it easy to consume by world’s enterprises.

sessions.title: Toward Multidisciplinary Scientific Foundation Models
sessions.speakers: Francois Lanusse (Research Scientist, National Center for Scientific Research (CNRS))
sessions.points:
1. Learn how NVIDIA’s full-stack networking platforms enable high-performance AI infrastructure to meet the demands of next-gen workloads
2. Discover how CoreWeave leverages NVIDIA’s networking solutions to deliver AI computing at massive scale with a focus on reliability and flexibility
sessions.description: We present the PolymathicAI approach to building foundation models for scientific applications, with a focus on bridging the traditional boundaries between data modalities and scientific domains. See our results on building foundational surrogate models for fluids, trained on a wide diversity of different physical systems, as well as our research on multimodal foundation models to bridge different scientific data types, with a concrete example from the field of astrophysics.

sessions.title: Unlocking the Potential of the AI Compiler in Recommendation Systems
sessions.speakers: Han Shen (Senior Software Engineer, Kuaishou Technology) | Xinbo Zhao (Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Ruitao Wang (R&D Engineer, Kuaishou Technlogy)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how GPU-accelerated computing and AI techniques transform data processing pipelines to enable real-time analysis of massive data streams.
2. Understand how to leverage NVIDIA cuDF and Morpheus Runtime Core (MRC) to build scalable, GPU-powered pipelines with integrated AI processing.
sessions.description: Despite the widespread adoption of AI compiler accelerators on GPU-based recommendation systems, these tools often fall short in harnessing the full computational and memory potential of modern GPUs. We'll explore innovative strategies to transcend these limitations that achieve a better-than 30% model training performance gain compared to OpenXLA.

sessions.title: Re-Imagine Logistics Through AI-Driven Mapping
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Industrial Digitalization / Digital Twin
sessions.speakers: Aleksandr Petiushko (Head of AI Research, Gatik)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how AI can be combined with OpenUSD and digital twins in a typical sales process to drive significant business value
2. Understand how Omniverse Kit-based applications and Omniverse streaming can be integrated and supported in an enterprise software landscape
sessions.description: Logistics networks for point-to-point movement of consumer goods for companies like Walmart, Kroger, and Loblaw are historically dictated by efficiency calculations on static route mapping, but autonomous vehicle (AV) deployment is helping to rewrite the rules. We'll examine how AVs are not only helping train AI mapping through real-time data, but also safely expanding their operational design domain by integrating AI-driven mapping, ultimately leading to more efficient delivery networks for companies and better service for consumers.

sessions.title: Transforming Complex Value Chains with Generative AI & Digital Twins
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Energy Exploration & Generation
sessions.speakers: Anup Sharma (President Digital, Worley) | Laura Leonard (Group President, Technology Solutions, Worley)
sessions.points:
1. Unlocking New Inferences from Data: Discover how cutting-edge spatial AI technologies are harnessing new inferences from extensive data stores across the energy sector without needing any human supervision
2. Advancing Sustainability: Explore how generative AI drives reductions in greenhouse gas emissions and supports environmental sustainability efforts by generating optimized designs for energy transition in critical industrial processes
sessions.description: As industries tackle some of the world’s most intricate challenges—from conceptual design to engineering, construction, and operations—leaders are harnessing Generative AI and Digital Twins to drive transformation. This session will explore how Worley, in collaboration with Nvidia’s cutting-edge technology, enables change management with a global workforce, accelerating productivity and reducing time to value. Drawing from the success and lessons learned in Worley’s Advanced Development Lab, we’ll discuss how innovation, talent activation, and a sharp focus on business and customer success are shaping the future of complex, integrated value chains.

sessions.title: Robotics Simulation and Synthetic Data Generation for Accelerating Robotics Development Workflows
sessions.speakers: Spencer Huang (Product Manager, Isaac Sim, NVIDIA) | Akhil Docca (Senior Product Marketing Manager, NVIDIA) | Austin Klein (Product Manager, Isaac Sim, NVIDIA) | Liila Torabi (Director of Engineering, NVIDIA) | Dennis Lynch (Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Rishabh Chadha (Technical Marketing Engineer - Isaac, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Key challenges around building drug discovery pipelines with optimal resource utilization and life-cycle management.
2. The NIM Operator with various BioNeMo NIMs streamline pipeline deployment and autoscaling with a production-focused, opinionated approach.
sessions.description: Next-generation robots will need to sense, plan, and act autonomously. A "sim-first" approach is required to ensure that entire robot stack performs. Come and connect with NVIDIA experts to learn how you use Isaac Sim for your robotics workflows, including generating synthetic data for perception model training and software-in-loop testing to validate your robot stack.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: The Impact of Generative AI on the Automotive Industry
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Image / Video Detection & Recognition
sessions.speakers: Sri Subramanian (Global Head of Generative AI, Automotive, NVIDIA) | Felix Friedmann (Product Manager, Automotive, NVIDIA) | Nima Nejatti (Global Head of Solutions Architecture and Engineering, Automotive, NVIDIA) | Ananth Sankarasubramanian (Senior Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Get started with latest in VLMs and Foundation Models
2. Talk through barriers you might be facing with visual AI projects
sessions.description: Connect with NVIDIA experts to discuss how generative AI is revolutionizing the automotive industry, from vehicle design and manufacturing to customer service and in-vehicle intelligence. Discuss how GenAI is being used to enhance customer service, personalizing the user experience and providing intelligent, real-time support.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Utilizing NVIDIA NIM™ for Enterprise-Grade AI Code Assistance (Presented by Codeium)
sessions.speakers: Anshul Ramachandran (Head of Enterprise and Partnerships, Codeium)
sessions.points:
1. How AI is transforming visual storytelling
2. How Runway’s text-to-video and image-to-video tools are empowering filmmakers to create compelling visuals
sessions.description: We'll clearly explain the exploding AI code assistant market and how to think about the various categories of tools, their value propositions, and options of configurability, including incorporating NVIDIA NIM microservices.

sessions.title: Horizontal Scaling of LLM Training with JAX
sessions.speakers: Andi Gavrilescu (Sr. ENG Manager, Google) | Matthew Johnson (Research Scientist, Google) | Abhinav Goel (Senior Deep Learning Architect", NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Explore how Amgen uses DGX C on AWS to train state-of-the-art protein language models and other related Gen Bio workloads
2. Amgen was a launch customer for DGX C and has open sourced AMPLIFY — a protein language model that achieves state-of-the-art performance with significantly fewer parameters than previous models
sessions.description: Explore techniques to scale training of LLMs on GPUs with JAX to 10,000k chips and beyond. Learn about JAX reference workload MaxText.

sessions.title: Connect With IGX and Jetson Software Leads on Metropolis, Holoscan, and Isaac Software Applications
sessions.speakers: Chen Su (Sr. Technical Product Marketing Manager, NVIDIA) | Leela Karumbunathan (Sr. Hardware Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Suhas Hariharapura Sheshadri (Sr. Software Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Winnie Hsu (Director, Embedded Platform Software, NVIDIA) | Thejas Shivashankar (Partner Ecosystem Manager, NVIDIA) | Yogesh Kini (NVIDIA) | Eric Work (NVIDIA) | Bhanu Pisupati (NVIDIA) | Rahul Choudhury (NVIDIA) | Hemal Shah (NVIDIA) | Anubhav Rai (NVIDIA) | Dustin Franklin (Principal Engineer and Developer Evangelist, NVIDIA) | Chitoku Yato (Sr. Technical Product Marketing Manager, NVIDIA) | Martin Doe (NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Gain hands-on experience with Base Command Manager from installation to Kubernetes deployment
2. Get an introduction to provisioning and managing nodes
sessions.description: NVIDIA IGX and Jetson are the world's leading computing platform for AI at the edge. It offers high-performance compute and advanced NVIDIA AI software stack as well as an extensive ecosystem to help you create and take products to market. Join with NVIDIA engineers and experts to ask your questions and join discussion on topics ranging from the latest AI software and SDKs like Metropolis, Holoscan and Isaac. For questions about hardware design, platform software and sensors, please join this session: Connect With IGX and Jetson Hardware Experts on IPC and Embedded Applications.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: AI-Driven Paradigms in Therapeutic Design for Drug Discovery
sessions.speakers: Stacie Calad-Thomson (Business Development Lead, Healthcare and Life Sciences, NALA, NVIDIA) | Sam Sinai (Co-Founder, Head of Machine Learning, Dyno Therapeutics) | Koki Shimada (CEO, SyntheticGestalt KK) | Mahdi Zamanighomi (Head of ML, Cellarity)
sessions.points:
1. Witness the power of AI firsthand through captivating customer journeys
2. How industry leaders across diverse sectors share their experiences using Google Cloud
sessions.description: This session showcases advancements in therapeutic drug design facilitated by artificial intelligence, from targeted gene therapies to small molecules and protein design. We'll highlight how AI is streamlining the design and delivery of genetic therapies with specific examples from Dyno Therapeutics, where accelerated foundation models help researchers develop capsid proteins targeting specific tissues. We'll also explore Cellarity's approach to integrating continuous reinforcement learning with single-cell omics data to tailor novel compounds that precisely influence disease cell states. Furthermore, we'll cover SyntheticGestalt's innovative use of a foundation model based on 3D structural data of billions of compounds, illustrating its significant impact on the accuracy and extrapolation of drug properties. We'll delve into the patterns of how these technologies not only accelerate the drug development process, but also enhance the specificity and efficacy of treatments, pushing the boundaries of what's possible in the quest to cure human diseases.

sessions.title: Harness the Potential and Navigate the Challenges of Generative AI in Higher Education and Research
sessions.speakers: Amanda Butler (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Kristopher Keipert (SA Manager, Higher Education Research, NVIDIA) | Mike O'Keeffe (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Mahsa Lotfollahi (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Zoe Ryan (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Mark Hill (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Brad Palmer (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Huiwen Ju (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Melisa Alkan (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Kaleb Smith (Sr. Data Scientist, NVIDIA) | Zahra Ronaghi (Sr. Manager, HER and Gen AI Solutions, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. How to build and manage a unified virtual platform for real-time, cutting-edge workloads
2. LLM development for generative 3D modeling to improve design Iteration with retrieval-augmented generation and NVIDIA NIM
sessions.description: Learn how to harness the power of NVIDIA's Gen AI platform to drive innovation in all areas of your university — administration, teaching, and research. Explore new strategies for mitigating its risks, improving human output, and leveraging its ability to solve the toughest problems.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Heritage Meets Technology: Leveraging Virtualized Platforms for Architectural Conservation and Business Innovation
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Deep Learning Frameworks
sessions.speakers: Mark Cichy (Principal, Director of Design Technology, HOK)
sessions.points:
1. Explore implementations of various forms of parallelism in JAX
2. Learn about the reference workload MaxText and how can you take advantage of it
sessions.description: In today’s fast-evolving technology landscape, enterprises need a flexible, future-proof infrastructure to tackle today’s and tomorrow’s business challenges. Presented jointly by NVIDIA and HOK, a global design, architecture, engineering, and planning firm, we'll explore how HOK revolutionized its operations by adopting NVIDIA vGPU technology to power AI innovations and intense design collaboration at scale across all of its teams on an exceptionally complex multi-billion-dollar project. Whether you're an IT professional, AI developer, or business executive, you'll gain insight into making your virtual desktop infrastructure a cornerstone for the next generation of AI-driven, accelerated graphics solutions of your own digital transformation.

sessions.title: Building a Resilient Cloud Strategy for the Next Era of AI
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Industrial Digitalization / Digital Twin
sessions.speakers: Alexis Bjorlin (VP and GM, DGX Cloud, NVIDIA) | Viv Keswani (Sr. Director, Engineering - AI Platform, Uber)
sessions.points:
1. How generative AI models and NIM microservices for OpenUSD help developers to quickly build digital twins
2. How developers use USD Code NIM to quickly answer OpenUSD knowledge queries and generate USD Python code
sessions.description: The landscape of AI is evolving rapidly, as we’ve observed with the emergence of physical AI and DeepSeek. While these advances offer immense potential to shape every industry, it also presents unique adoption challenges for enterprises and developers. Join Alexis Bjorlin, VP and GM of NVIDIA DGX Cloud, and Viv Keswani, Senior Engineering Director at Uber, to explore real-world AI applications, emerging trends, and the cutting-edge of AI development to deployment. Discover how to accelerate impactful outcomes, and future proof your business.

sessions.title: Agentic AI for Physical Operations
sessions.topic: Cybersecurity - Accelerated Computing / AI for Security
sessions.speakers: Roopa Prabhu (Director Engineering, NVIDIA)
sessions.description:
Envision an AI agent designed to interact with your warehouse—a complex logistical environment of autonomous robots, potential hazards, and workers. This session will demonstrate how we've harnessed the power of Spatial AI agents. These agents, leveraging natural language, provide operations teams with a deep understanding of their operating environments and reason-based processes optimization.

We’ll deep dive on building spatial AI agents to complement human operators managing complex operations, powered by NVIDIA NIMs, NVIDIA Llama Nemotron LLM, and NVIDIA Cosmos Nemotron VLM. These agents can quickly analyze and understand objects, spaces, geometry and spatial relationships in 3D, then can produce actionable, real-time intelligence to manage the flow of goods, optimize space utilization, improve process efficiency, and ensure worker safety.

sessions.title: Choosing Fractional GPU Instances in the Cloud for Graphics or AI Development
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Jimmy Rotella (Senior Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Kelly Siggers (Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Shailesh Deshmukh (Manager, Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how NVIDIA Metropolis simplifies the deployment of diverse anomaly detection models across smart city applications
2. Discover how digital twin simulations help predict and manage complex urban scenarios for enhanced city management
sessions.description: As the demand for high performance computing grows, fractional NVIDIA GPU instances in the cloud offer a flexible and cost-effective solution, enabling companies to harness powerful GPU capabilities without committing to full-instance costs. We’ll discuss how fractional GPUs can be leveraged for graphics-intensive applications or accelerate developmental AI training processes, and we'll talk you through the technical considerations for choosing available instance types for either type of workload.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: How Amgen Leverages NVIDIA DGX Cloud on AWS and Amazon EC2 Instances for Drug Discovery and Research (Presented by Amazon Web Services)
sessions.speakers: Stephanie Louis (Life Sciences Industry GTM Lead, AWS) | Scott Skellenger (SVP and CIO, Amgen)
sessions.points:
1. Learn from Indonesia how countries can deliver sovereign AI platforms to turbocharge AI initiatives in their domestic markets
2. Discover how telcos are emerging as the providers of AI infrastructure to power sovereign AI platforms
sessions.description: Learn how Amgen uses NVIDIA DGX Cloud on AWS to train state-of-the-art protein language models (pLMs) and other, related generative AI workloads for biology. Amgen was a launch customer for DGX Cloud and continues to use DGX Cloud on AWS to train new models. As a result, Amgen has open-sourced AMPLIFY — a pLM that achieves state-of-the-art performance with significantly fewer parameters than previous models. AMPLIFY outperforms larger models while requiring fewer computational resources for training and inference. By open sourcing their code, data, and model checkpoints, the authors aim to democratize protein language model development.

sessions.title: How Leading AI Labs Maximize Performance in GPU Clusters (Presented by CoreWeave)
sessions.speakers: Chetan Kapoor (Chief Product Officer, CoreWeave) | Chen Goldberg (Sr. Vice President, Engineering, CoreWeave)
sessions.points:
1. Learn the design considerations and tools of real-time RAG observability
2. Understand the main observability assessments of LLM systems deployed in financial services
sessions.description: In the rapidly evolving field of artificial intelligence, leading AI labs are constantly seeking ways to maximize the performance of their GPU clusters. We'll explore advanced strategies and techniques for optimizing GPU clusters to achieve superior speed, efficiency, and reliability — without cutting into performance. We'll dive into critical aspects such as improved model loading, better checkpointing, and robust fleet management for improved fault management. Additionally, we'll discuss the NVIDIA GB200 NVL72 cluster CoreWeave rolled out last fall, highlighting its role in enhancing AI workloads. Gain valuable insights into best practices and emerging technologies that are shaping the future of GPU cluster management. You'll also get a quick inside view into how CoreWeave quickly identifies, remediates, and tracks job and job failures to achieve an industry-best effective training time for large-scale GPU clusters.

sessions.title: Accelerate NVIDIA AI Enterprise With Data Intelligence to Achieve Faster Industry Outcomes (Presented by DDN)
sessions.speakers: Sven Oehme (CTO, DDN) | Nave Algarici (Generative AI Product Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the application of digital twins in robotics, from single-robot scenarios to advanced research
2. Learn about the latest NVIDIA technologies driving innovation in robotics
sessions.description: Discover how data intelligence platforms accelerate NVIDIA AI Enterprise, including NeMo, NIM, and CUDA, by delivering unmatched scalability, efficiency, and performance. Learn the importance of how a fully software-defined, containerized architecture seamlessly integrates with NVIDIA's advanced AI platforms, enabling real-time data access and low-latency processing at scale. Explore how metadata-optimized design accelerates AI training, inference, and model deployment, while native multi-tenancy ensures secure resource sharing and streamlined operations. Join us to explore how data intelligence platforms propel AI innovation by optimizing NVIDIA AI workflows across cloud, edge, and data center environments to drive key industry outcomes.

sessions.title: How to Automate AI Transparency: Enhancing Model Card Transparency With Minimal Effort
sessions.speakers: Michael Boone (Product Manager, Trustworthy AI, NVIDIA) | Arun George Zachariah (Software Systems Engineering Manager, NVIDIA) | Paul Taylor (Chief Architect, IBM)
sessions.points:
1. Speech recognition with state-of-the-art Riva ASR, Parakeet// Vision AI (User attention, expression estimation) built on NVIDIA ACE  and Composable HELM Chart to streamline deployment
2. Dialog management and language generation with Llama 3.1 LLM or Nemotron-4 4B Instruct, SLM for specificity LangChain RAG Pipeline for accurate, fresh information retrieval
sessions.description: Producing model card documentation is a state-of-the-art best practice for advancing AI transparently, and educating enterprise developers and nontechnical influencers like customers, investors, users, and policymakers about AI in a clear and uniform manner. Learn how to streamline the creation and management of model cards through the model card generator. Understand how the model card automation engine captures essential metadata during training and from model source code, ensuring comprehensive, consistent, and up-to-date documentation for AI models.

sessions.title: Accelerate Fortran and C/C++ Code With NVIDIA HPC Compilers
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Anastasia Stulova (HPC Compiler Programming Models Architect, NVIDIA) | Bryce Lelbach (Principal Architect, NVIDIA) | David Appelhans (NVIDIA) | Jiri Kraus (Principal Developer Technology, NVIDIA) | Mathias Wagner (Sr. Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Data intelligence platforms accelerate NVIDIA AI Enterprise by providing real-time data access and low-latency operations, while advanced metadata handling ensures efficient data movement and processing
2. Native multi-tenancy within data intelligence platforms supports thousands of tenants without performance degradation, ensuring secure resource sharing and isolation. This capability optimizes the use of NVIDIA AI Enterprise across hybrid cloud environments, enhancing efficiency and reducing operational overhead
sessions.description: If you're curious about accelerating Fortran, C, and C++ applications on NVIDIA hardware, join us to explore the tools and approaches offered by the NVIDIA HPC SDK. NVIDIA experts will guide you through the available programming models and libraries that best suit your needs. They'll also share their experiences in porting applications to the NVIDIA ecosystem, with a special focus on the latest platforms like Grace-Hopper.

sessions.title: Cloud-Native Approach to Achieving Training Resilience and Efficiency at Extreme Scale
sessions.speakers: Shelby Thomas (Enterprise AI Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Dong Ahn (Infrastructure Architect, Distinguished Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Innovative application of fine-tuning techniques
2. Generative AI applied to industrial scenarios
sessions.description: As we scale AI training from 1,000 to 100,000 GPUs, infrastructure downtime becomes increasingly costly and challenging to manage. Leveraging a hybrid HPC and cloud architecture, we propose a solution that integrates AI/HPC cloud stacks to address key problems of fault tolerance, resource management, and real-time monitoring. Our approach supports a wide range of workload managers and integrates application and system anomaly data to enable transparent failure handling. We'll explore the unique errors seen at scale as we built this system, and the lessons learned from some of the largest training deployments in the world.

sessions.title: Connecting NIM to Uncompressed Audio/Video Pipelines With Holoscan for Media
sessions.speakers: Gareth Sylvester-Bradley (Principal Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Pravin Sethia (Software Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Explore the possibilities of acceleration and what it can do
2. Learn what linear programming and mixed integer programming are
sessions.description: Holoscan for Media is a software-defined platform running on AI infrastructure to develop, deploy, and run live media applications. It supports uncompressed media over IP with PTP synchronization for live broadcasters and allows customers to run applications from multiple software vendor on centralized certified commercial off-the-shelf hardware. Servers can be repurposed from day to day depending on user needs. We showed the latest progress and vendor adoption at IBC in September 2024, including live graphics, vision mixing, and live AI captioning. We'll present the recent improvements to the platform, highlighting benefits for live broadcasters, and detail how it can leverage NIMs with live media streaming.

sessions.title: Defining AI-Native RAN for 6G
sessions.speakers: Ardavan Tehrani (Director Engineering, Samsung Research) | Chris Dick (Senior Distinguished Engineer, 5G/6G, NVIDIA) | Moe Win (Professor, MIT) | Jim Shea (CEO, DeepSig, Inc.) | Kai Mao (Head of AI-RAN Strategy for Fujitsu Network Business, Fujitsu)
sessions.points:
1. Introduction to Delta Robot and D-Bot solution
2. Integration of Delta’s physical robots/D-bots in the Omniverse platform
sessions.description: The telecoms industry is working to integrate AI into the design, operation, and optimization of 6G networks to enable unprecedented levels of automation, efficiency, and adaptability. The AI-native 6G radio access network (RAN) embodies this expectation and makes AI a foundational element of the 6G stack. In this session, leading telecoms industry stakeholders will outline how they're advancing 6G research, with AI integration, to revolutionize connectivity, performance, and societal transformation. They'll explore how the AI-native 6G RAN can deliver extreme levels of radio access performance, integrating technologies like deep learning and edge computing, promoting sustainability, enhancing public safety, and driving economic growth through advanced applications like smart cities, digital twins, and immersive communication.

sessions.title: Empowering Global Change:  United Nations Adopts AI to Further Sustainable Development Across Nations
sessions.speakers: Lambert Hogenhout (Chief Data and AI Officer, The United Nations) | Anne Hecht (Sr. Director of Product Marketing, Enterprise Products, NVIDIA) | Lan Guan (Chief AI Officer, Accenture)
sessions.points:
1. The Intersection of AI and Economic Empowerment: Understand how AI can be a tool for financial literacy, wealth creation, and economic growth within underserved communities
2. Amplifying Underrepresented Voices in AI: Learn how community-driven initiatives are breaking barriers to ensure underrepresented groups have access to AI education, career opportunities, and leadership roles
sessions.description: Join Lan Guan, Accenture’s chief AI officer, and Lambert Hogenhout, the United Nations’ chief data officer, and NVIDIA for an exciting discussion on the groundbreaking collaboration between Accenture and the United Nations to create a generative AI chatbot powered by Accenture’s AI Refinery, built on NVIDIA’s cutting-edge technology.

sessions.title: GPU-Accelerated Semiconductor Process Simulations: From Atom to Transistor
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Image / Video Detection & Recognition
sessions.speakers: Nuo Xu (Sr. Engineering Manager, TSMC)
sessions.points:
1. Fellowship-funded Ph.D.-level student research
2. Student fast-forward presentations in different topic areas
sessions.description: The NVIDIA CUDA software ecosystem has become a transformative force in the field of semiconductor Technology Computer-Aided Design (TCAD), enabling the resolution of tera-scale (10¹²) to exa-scale (10¹⁸) problems with turnaround times (TAT) in hours. Fundamental components of TCAD simulators—such as solvers, meshers, optimizers, and design of experiments—can be restructured using the "Single-Instruction-Multiple-Data" (SIMD) paradigm, allowing them to fully harness the power of GPU architecture for unparalleled computational efficiency.

sessions.title: Audio-Driven Facial Animation Technology for NVIDIA Audio2Face
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Industrial Digitalization / Digital Twin
sessions.speakers: Yeongho Seol (Sr. Manager, Research, NVIDIA) | Michael Huang (Solution Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. How to build a toolchain that traverses the operation design domain of a fully automated driving system and orchestrates the simulation of synthetic data at massive scale, based on NVIDIA Omniverse
2. How to overcome the constraints and scarcity of real-world data acquisition, particularly for non-regular scenarios, through large-scale synthetic data generation
sessions.description: We'll describe the audio-driven facial technology that's used for NVIDIA Audio2Face. From its beginning to current models, we'll explain how it evolved and which techniques contributed to get to the current high-quality model. We also explain how the technique is deployed as product. Finally, we introduce the future direction of Audio2Face technology.

sessions.title: Best Practices for Building an Enterprise RAG App Atop Unstructured Data at Scale (Presented by Cohesity)
sessions.speakers: Greg Statton (Office of the CTO - Data and AI, Cohesity)
sessions.points:
1. Learn best practices for feature engineering techniques specific to tabular data
2. Learn to optimize feature engineering pipelines for more and faster exploration and iteration
sessions.description: Bringing data to AI models can have its challenges. Instead, Cohesity product leaders will share best practices for how to do the opposite: bring AI to where your enterprise data already lives. Learn how Cohesity built retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) services on petabytes of unstructured data across multiple data sources. Topics include a review of data search, information retrieval and answer generation, as well as scalability and security considerations.

sessions.title: Structured Cabling Considerations for AI Cluster Flexibility (Presented by CommScope)
sessions.speakers: Ken Hall (Data Center Solutions Architect, CommScope)
sessions.points:
1. Optimize AI Infrastructure for Performance and Cost Efficiency: AI workloads are increasingly resource-intensive, requiring scalable infrastructure that maximizes GPU utilization and reduces processing times. Enterprises need solutions that can enhance performance while controlling costs, ensuring that scaling AI initiatives doesn’t lead to spiraling expenses
2. Empower Data Science Teams with Self-Service Access to Data: Innovation in AI often slows when data scientists must rely on IT or DevOps for provisioning and managing data. Providing self-service capabilities for data access and storage allows teams to iterate faster, accelerating model development and experimentation
sessions.description: Enabling flexibility within AI clusters for capacity growth, application migration, and innovative next-generation solutions through physical layer choice can extend the values and life cycle of the network. We'll focus on cable media options and the longer-term impact on network evolution and scale. Join us as we review practical choices that can positively impact cabling installation, migration efficiency, and sustainability for Day 2 operations.

sessions.title: A New Horizon of AI-Driven Autonomous Operations for the Energy Industry
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - AI Policy / Trustworthy AI
sessions.speakers: Jim Chappell (Head of AI and Advanced Analytics, AVEVA) | David Smith (Head of AI Product Innovation, AVEVA)
sessions.points:
1. Deep dive into the design of tests for the evaluation of important ethical and safety related aspects
2. Discover best practices for reducing costs in the testing of AI models
sessions.description:
The use of AI in process control brings a new horizon for the autonomous plant. An AI controller can minimize human intervention in processes with superior capability than conventional closed loop and advanced control technologies.

AVEVA and NVIDIA have partnered to create an AI-driven solution for the energy industry that provides autonomous plant control through not only steady-state, but also complex transient conditions, such as changing feed levels, startups, and unplanned disruptions. This cutting-edge solution leverages AVEVA’s Dynamic Simulation as an accurate digital replica of the process plant to safely and quickly train NVIDIA’s Raptor Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) agent. Results show that DRL agents are an extremely promising addition to process control technology to bring reliable and repeatable operation during complicated events, reducing the operator workload and the vulnerability to lost production.

sessions.title: Revolutionize Pedestrian Safety: AI-Powered Crash Simulation
sessions.speakers: Simon Xu (Tech Fellow & Engineering Manager for Vehicle Optimization and AI/ML, GM) | Thomas von Tschammer (U.S. General Manager and Co-Founder, Neural Concept)
sessions.points:
1. Real-world applications of AI, powered by accelerating computing, to enhance supply chain efficiency
2. Detailed use cases showcasing curation of big data from siloed data sources into comprehensive actionable insights
sessions.description:
We'll explore groundbreaking approaches to pedestrian crash simulation, leveraging deep learning models trained on NVIDIA A100 GPUs to predict impact physics in seconds, rather than days. Learn how this innovation accelerates the design process, allowing rapid exploration of safety-optimized vehicle geometries and setting new standards in automotive safety engineering. 

General Motors recognizes that, while AI offers immense potential, many challenges must be overcome to fully unlock its impact on automotive product design. One key hurdle is integrating AI models into existing engineering workflows in a way that complements years of engineering expertise while maintaining confidence in real-world applications and customer perceptions. AI must also demonstrate consistent, real-time performance across diverse scenarios, such as achieving high accuracy rates in physics-driven simulations.

sessions.title: From Prototype to Production: GenAI Workflows at Enterprise Scale
sessions.speakers: Lukas Biewald (Chief Executive Officer and Co-Founder, Weights & Biases)
sessions.points:
1. Understand how GenAI and RAG workloads are pushing the limits of traditional enterprise storage solutions
2. Discover the cutting-edge innovations enabling real-time RAG pipelines at enterprise scale
sessions.description: Weights & Biases co-founder and CEO Lukas Biewald will discuss the trends and challenges leading enterprises are encountering when moving a generative AI (GenAI)-powered workflow from proof of concept to production. He'll also cover best practices enterprises are leveraging, including how to best evaluate the performance of the application and optimize the cost to maximize return on investment.

sessions.title: Designing Transparent AI Systems for Scientific Discovery: Patterns and Practices for Human-AI Collaboration
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Training AI Models
sessions.speakers: Sutanay Choudhury (Chief Scientist | Co-Director, Computational and Theoretical Chemistry Institute, Pacific Northwest National Laboratory)
sessions.points:
1. NVIDIA DGX provides the performance and efficiency needed for developing autonomous vehicles at scale
2. NVIDIA AI Enterprise (NVAIE) provides developers with the tools and frameworks necessary to streamline deployment of AI algorithms
sessions.description: While Generative AI has shown remarkable capabilities in scientific domains, its true potential emerges when integrated thoughtfully with human expertise and scientific workflows. This talk explores architectural patterns and methodological frameworks for creating effective human-AI collaborative systems, with a focus on scientific discovery processes. We'll examine how to design AI systems that not only propose solutions but transparently reveal their reasoning pathways, enabling scientists to evaluate and build upon the AI's analytical process.

sessions.title: Empowering Global Ecommerce With Generative AI
sessions.speakers: Huping Ding (Chief Engineer of AI Infra, AIDC-AI, Alibaba International Digital Commerce)
sessions.points:
1. MLOps is complex, but it's not as complicated as industry thought leaders would have you believe
2. We can understand the MLOps landscape by understanding how teams build machine learning systems and understanding what tools and platforms support these teams and systems
sessions.description: From both a business and a technical perspective, we'll provide an overview of how generative AI was used to empower global ecommerce at Alibaba International. AI was leveraged to enhance the efficiency and efficacy of different aspects of Alibaba International's business, from marketing, product listing, customer service, and design to compliance and risk management. Our experience is a case study for others who want to develop a comprehensive AI solution for a complex, multifaceted business. From a technical point of view, this involves serving multiple models of different sizes and purposes under different service load requirements. The diversity of applications requires different types of NVIDIA inference GPUs and customized TensorRT-LLM. We'll explain the planning and optimization of this family of models on the abovementioned NVIDIA infrastructure.

sessions.title: Delta’s AI-Integrated Robot and D-Bot With Omniverse (Presented by Delta Electronics)
sessions.speakers: Michael Mayer-Rosa (Sr. Director, IABG at Delta Electronics EMEA, Delta Electronics)
sessions.points:
1. Understand how the NVIDIA GH200 Grace Hopper Superchip combines an Arm-based Grace CPU with a Hopper GPU over a high-bandwidth and memory coherent NVLink Chip-2-Chip interconnect
2. Explore programming models, performance libraries, compilers, debuggers and profiling tools to accelerate scientific computing workflow performance while realizing power and energy efficiency
sessions.description: Discover how Delta leverages Omniverse Isaac Sim to design, optimize, train, and deploy autonomous control systems for its robots and D-bots, enhancing efficiency and performance in smart factory automation.

sessions.title: How To Write A CUDA Program: The Parallel Programming Edition
sessions.speakers: Stephen Jones (SW) (CUDA Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. We'll highlight significant challenges in processing large datasets (video), including scalability issues, bottlenecks, and fragmented workflows
2. We'll present our solutions for seamless scaling across multi-GPU and multi-node setups that can greatly accelerate data processing and improve GPU utilization
sessions.description:
Join one of CUDA's architects on a journey through the concepts of parallel programming: how it works, why it works, why it's not working when you think it should be working, and in particular why it's different on a GPU from a CPU. We'll look at different approaches to parallel programming in CUDA and how to take advantage of the hardware it runs on.

This is the next episode in what has become a series looking at the way that CUDA and the GPU work, and why they work this way. This session will focus on how to think about parallel programming on a massively-parallel GPU and why that might be different to what you're used to. If you've never even written a parallel algorithm then you'll learn all sorts of new things, but even if you're a ninja you'll walk away with some new tricks up your sleeve.

sessions.title: Kolmogorov AI Networks for Interpretable Financial Forecasting
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Yigal Jhirad (Portfolio Manager/Head of Quantitative and Derivatives Strategies, Cohen & Steers) | Emanuel Scoullos (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Summary of announcements at GTC keynote in Korean language
2. What's more important among keynote announcements to Korea market
sessions.description:
We apply KANs (Kolmogorov Arnold Networks) to forecast the financial markets, such as volatility. 
KANs allow the practitioner to learn interpretable features from the data and leverage 
domain-specific knowledge into the neural network in order to improve forecasting power. This sets up
a strong foundation for either using model outputs directly or selectively leveraging outcomes to integrate into the investment process.

sessions.title: Scalable Drug Discovery Pipelines With Kubernetes Operators and BioNemo NIMs
sessions.speakers: Meenakshi Kaushik (Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Eda Johnson (Product Architect, NVIDIA) | Kelci Miclaus (Head of AI Solutions for Health & Life Sciences, Dataiku)
sessions.points:
1. Understand Virtual Try-On Technology: Learn the end-to-end process of generating photorealistic try-ons using generative AI and computer vision
2. Distributed Systems for Scalability: Discover how a distributed architecture enables real-time performance for high user demand
sessions.description: Explore the use of Kubernetes Operators, specifically NIMOperator, to enhance drug discovery pipelines with BioNemo NIMs by providing efficient life-cycle management, model caching, and autoscaling capabilities while simplifying deployment. A sample implementation integrated in the Dataiku AI platform demonstrates how best practices can be leveraged for using these technologies to optimize resource utilization and streamline complex workflows.

sessions.title: Scale Virtual Try-On: Deliver Thousands of Realistic Fittings in Seconds (Presented by Marvik)
sessions.speakers: Paula Martinez (CEO, Marvik)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how we expose large language models and multi-modal large models for internal and external use cases
2. Learn how we provision our ML infrastructure
sessions.description: Explore the technical backbone of Doris, a state-of-the-art virtual try-on solution for fashion ecommerce. We'll explore the challenges of hosting large generative models for high-quality image synthesis and the strategies used to seamlessly deliver thousands of try-ons in seconds. We'll cover distributed system design, GPU-accelerated inference, and the integration of NVIDIA tools such as Triton and Nsight Systems to optimize performance. Learn how AI, computer vision, and generative networks are converging to transform the online shopping experience with accurate and scalable solutions.

sessions.title: Scaling Transformers: Navigating Challenges and Innovations in Long-Context Modeling
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Deep Learning Frameworks
sessions.speakers: Bowen Yang (Member of Technical Staff, Cohere) | Bharat Venkitesh (Member of Technical Staff, Cohere)
sessions.points:
1. Learn the new FP8 training recipes for Hopper and Blackwell GPUs and how to use them with Transformer Engine 2.0
2. Explore new low precisions available in Blackwell, like FP4
sessions.description: Explore the frontier of scaling transformer models to handle increasingly long contexts, a critical advancement in large language models. We'll examine the multifaceted challenges encountered in this pursuit, spanning modeling techniques, framework limitations, and computational constraints. We'll cover a range of approaches, from data preparation, modeling methods, and model architecture innovations to framework-level optimizations on GPUs. We'll also highlight some of the limitations of these methods and discuss future research and development.

sessions.title: Scaling Inference Using NIM Through a ServerLess NCP SaaS Platform
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Programming Languages / Compilers
sessions.speakers: Jalaj Thanaki (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Anish Mukherjee (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Seamlessly scale Python applications from single-CPU to multi-GPU, multi-node (MGMN) clustered computers
2. Obtain MGMN scalability with zero code changes in Python
sessions.description: We'll train you to scale your Gen AI workload and create a software-as-a-service (SaaS) serverless platform. We'll use NIMs of an open-source LLM, scaling it using open-source technologies like Kubernetes, Ray, and KServe, and we'll demonstrate the usage of NVCF. We'll show you how to obtain GPU utilization metrics using Grafana and Prometheus, autoscaling compute resources based on inflight demand and defining best practices around efficiently using the underlying abstracted GPU infrastructure based on NCP RA.Prerequisite(s):Basics of Model Inference, Kubernetes, KServe.

sessions.title: Unlock the Future of Data Security with GPU-Powered Pipelines
sessions.speakers: Patrick Lu (Lead Architect for Data and AI/ML, Trend Micro) | Matt Penn (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Ted Z Zhang (Architect, VisionOne data security posture management, Trend Micro)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how to boost your workflows using popular Python libraries; pandas, scikit-learn, Polars, and NetworkX
2. Leverage Gemini to generate RAPIDS accelerated code snippets and zero code change options in Colab and speed up your pandas code
sessions.description: Join Trend Micro as we explore how to modernize data loss prevention (DLP) architecture using accelerated computing and AI. We’ll dive into the architectural strategies considered and why NVIDIA cuDF and Morpheus Runtime Core (MRC) were chosen to create GPU-powered data pipelines with built-in AI processing. Discover how this cutting-edge approach tackles the challenges of real-time analysis and processing of massive data streams, delivering unmatched speed, intelligence, and scalability for enhanced data security. Don't miss this opportunity to envision the future of AI-driven data protection and its transformative impact on cybersecurity.

sessions.title: Build Trustworthy AI: Guardrailing Gen AI Applications
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Image / Video Detection & Recognition
sessions.speakers: Bethann Noble (Product Marketing Manager, NVIDIA AI Enterprise, NVIDIA) | Mehrnaz Amjadi (Staff Data Scientist, Generative AI Technical Lead, NVIDIA) | Aditi Bodhankar (Developer Advocate Engineer, NVIDIA) | Burcin Bozkaya (Senior Developer Relations Manager, NVIDIA) | Sandro Cavallari (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Leon Derczynski (Principal Research Scientist, NVIDIA) | Erick Galinkin (AI Security Researcher, NVIDIA) | Shaona Ghosh (Sr. Research Scientist, NVIDIA) | Monika Katariya (Gen AI Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Christopher Parisien (Sr. Manager, Applied Research, NVIDIA) | Traian Rebedea (Principal Applied Scientist, NVIDIA) | Farshad Saberi Movahed (Strategic Alliances Manager, Generative AI, NVIDIA) | Makesh Narsimhan Sreedhar (Research Scientist, NVIDIA) | Alex Stephens (Sr. Solutions Architect, Financial Services, NVIDIA)
sessions.description: Learn how to safeguard enterprise generative AI applications with NVIDIA NeMo Guardrails scalable LLM rail orchestration platform. We can answer your questions about applying the latest LLM rails for security, safety, and topical relevance, using auditing and analytics to continuously improve rail and application effectiveness, and customizing and extending rails through a robust LLM safety software ecosystem.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Startup Pitches: Healthcare, Sciences, and Digital Productions
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Training AI Models
sessions.speakers: Jack Resnick (Inception Partner Manager for Healthcare and Life Sciences, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Innovative Insights: Discover cutting-edge solutions addressing real-world challenges across industries
2. Emerging Trends: Gain a front-row seat to the latest developments in AI and accelerated computing technologies
sessions.description: Join us for an engaging hour of startup pitches showcasing groundbreaking solutions across diverse fields, including healthcare, sciences, digital productions, and more. These dynamic presentations are part of NVIDIA Inception, a free program designed to help startups evolve faster through cutting-edge technology, opportunities to connect with venture capitalists, and access to the latest technical resources from NVIDIA.

sessions.title: Building Industrial Digital Twins for the Era of Physical AI
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Pre-Trained / Foundation Models
sessions.speakers: Teresa Conceicao (Solutions Architect Manager - Omniverse, NVIDIA) | Alex Qi (Sr. Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Mike Geyer (Omniverse Manufacturing Product Management Lead, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Framework Evolution: Understand the comparative benefits of transitioning from Fairseq to NVIDIA NeMo Framework for LLM training, including improvements in performance and quality
2. Hardware Integration: Learn how leveraging NVIDIA H100 GPUs, DGX OS has optimized our training infrastructure, resulting in faster training times and increased tokens processed per second
sessions.description: Want to learn how to get started building virtual facility digital twins with NVIDIA Omniverse, generative AI models, and NIM microservices for OpenUSD? Join this interactive support session with Omniverse technical product managers and solutions architects to get direct help and surface your questions, issues, and ideas specific to your use case.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: AI-Driven Digital Twins: Real-Time Physics and Accelerated Simulation Using NVIDIA Technologies
sessions.speakers: Rongguang Jia (Distinguished Engineer, Ansys) | Jeremy McCaslin (Director, Fluids Product Management, Ansys)
sessions.points:
1. How targeted delivery of genes to specific tissues in the body can spawn a revolution in genetic medicines, helping cure millions of people
2. How using AI can achieve state-of-the-art design of delivery vectors, skipping year-long, million-dollar experiments by replacing them entirely with in silico computation
sessions.description: This talk explores how Ansys leveraged NVIDIA Omniverse Blueprint for CAE using CUDA, Modulus, and Omniverse for the creation and deployment of digital twins. We'll dive into developing a high-fidelity CFD solver optimized for NVIDIA hardware (Grace, Hopper, Blackwell), enabling fast and accurate physics simulations. We'll then talk about the Integration of NVIDIA Modulus AI framework to easily build customized AI solutions that can improve designer productivity and quickly identify optimal design configurations. Finally, we'll show how we are leveraging Omniverse for real-time, photo-realistic visualization with examples. This combination of hardware and software solutions empowers engineers to build and deploy highly accurate digital twins with unprecedented speed, dramatically shortening product development cycles.

sessions.title: The Big Data Challenge of Radio Astronomy
sessions.topic: Conversational AI - Audio / Speech Foundation Models
sessions.speakers: Emma Tolley (Assistant Professor, EPFL) | Etienne Orliac (HPC Application Expert, EPFL)
sessions.points:
1. How AI is revolutionizing music composition, sound design, audio production, and immersive experiences
2. Panelists will discuss cutting-edge AI tools, ethical considerations, and the balance between human artistry and machine learning
sessions.description: Radio astronomers are engaged in an ambitious new project to detect faster, fainter, and more distant astrophysical phenomena using thousands of individual radio receivers linked through interferometry. The expected deluge of data (up to 300 petabytes per year) poses a significant computational challenge that requires rethinking and redesigning the state-of-the-art data analysis pipelines.

sessions.title: Build a Co-Pilot for Industrial Process Monitoring and Quality Control
sessions.speakers: Chintan Shah (Product Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. How can Maxine 3D  change  the way we perceive video?
2. Where will Studio Voice drive most impact in your workflow?
sessions.description: Powered by AI, co-pilots are revolutionizing the way industrial workers perform manual tasks, significantly improving operational efficiency and quality. This course will demonstrate how intelligent assistants use computer vision and natural language processing to monitor and optimize repetitive processes. These processes are often defined by Standard Operating Procedures, step-by-step instructions that are essential in maintaining consistency and quality in industrial settings. Integrating co-pilots into these industrial processes can help guide workers through tasks and identify errors in real-time, enhancing productivity and yields.In this hands-on session, you’ll learn how to build industrial co-pilots with Vision Language Models (VLMs) and Large Language Models (LLMs). Plus, you’ll explore how to customize and optimize AI models for any use case, process, and industry.Prerequisite(s):Basic understanding of AI, NVIDIA Pre-trained models, and Python.

sessions.title: DevOps for Gen AI App Development: Build Scalable and Reproducible LLMOps Pipelines
sessions.speakers: Dmitry Mironov (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Anshul Jindal (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Martin Piercy (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Review diffusion models applied to continuous data (images, weather, atom coordinates) and discrete data (text, atom type, etc.)
2. Learn how diffusion models are applied in different domains, including molecule or protein generation and weather modeling
sessions.description: As Gen AI applications become increasingly prevalent, development practices must evolve to meet modern standards. Learn how to address the gap between data science and modern development practices. In this lab you’ll build a scalable and reproducible LLMOps development pipeline. Using off-the-shelf software, you'll integrate key tools like NeMo Customizer, NeMo Evaluator, NVIDIA NIM, and MLFlow into one GitOps-driven pipeline. By the end of this lab, you'll be equipped to support data scientists with flexible, cloud-agnostic pipelines.Prerequisite(s):Basic experience with Kubernetes.Basic experience with Helm.

sessions.title: A Scalable Approach Toward Trustworthy AI
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Avatar / Digital Human
sessions.speakers: Antoine Gautier (Chief Scientist, QuantPi)
sessions.points:
1. Get to know NVIDIA Audio2Face technology and its functionalities
2. Learn how Audio2Face model is working and how to use the technique
sessions.description: Learn how to scale the computation of trustworthiness assessment for diverse AI models and data types in a unified way. Based on concrete examples from computer vision and text generation, we'll show how the evaluation of biases and robustness can be leveraged to improve the safety and adoption of AI models in practice.

sessions.title: Driving 6G Development With Advanced Simulation Tools
sessions.speakers: Balaji Raghothaman (Chief Technologist, 6G, Keysight Technologies) | CC Chong (Senior Director, Aerial Product Management, NVIDIA) | Arien Sligar (Senior Principal Product Specialist, Ansys, Inc.) | Tommaso Melodia (William Lincoln Smith Professor, Northeastern University)
sessions.points:
1. Effective utilization of DGX BasePod resources with RunAI
2. Installation best practices of Run:AI
sessions.description: The NVIDIA Aerial Omniverse Digital Twin (AODT) is a platform that leverages the power of NVIDIA accelerated computing, NVIDIA Omniverse, and NVIDIA Aerial to provide a comprehensive, scalable, and flexible solution for 6G research and development. The platform enables researchers and developers to customize, program, and test 6G networks in near-real time, with AI/ML in the loop, and to simulate and optimize the network performance and quality of service based on site-specific data and system-level simulation. The platform has been adopted by Keysight and Ansys with advanced simulation tools. One is leveraging our state-of-the-art 3D electromagnetic ray tracing model and radio access network (RAN) modules for advanced 5G/6G end-to-end simulations. The other has integrated their PerceiveEM Solver into the AODT to leverage NVIDIA AI/ML with full-stack RAN in the loop to accelerate and simplify 6G research and development. The NVIDIA Aerial Omniverse Digital Twin has also empowered academia to unleash the potential of cloud and AI-native networks for 6G system research, design, and development.

sessions.title: Revolutionizing Construction Visualizations and Analyses with GeoAI, Radiance Fields, and Gaussian Splatting
sessions.speakers: Ben Stocker (Senior Construction Technologist, Skender) | Michael Rubloff (Founder and Managing Editor, Radiancefields.com) | Patrick Wallis (Innovation Lab Director, ESRI)
sessions.points:
1. Strategic Selection and Fine-Tuning of LLMs: Learn how to choose the right language model and customize it for specific industry needs
2. Scaling Fine-Tuning and Inference: Discover methods for effectively scaling the fine-tuning process and optimizing inference performance to handle large-scale applications
sessions.description:
We'll explore the cutting-edge applications of GeoAI, radiance fields, and Gaussian splatting in the architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC) industry. Gain insights into the fundamental differences between traditional photogrammetry and Gaussian splats, and learn how these advanced techniques are transforming the way we visualize and manage construction projects. We'll delve into the process of creating Gaussian splats and discuss their practical uses in construction, from enhancing site surveys to improving safety and collaboration. 
Additionally, discover how GeoAI provides the crucial spatial intelligence that integrates these visualization techniques with real-world geospatial data, creating smarter, location-aware construction workflows.

sessions.title: Effective GPU Utilization with Run:AI
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Training AI Models
sessions.speakers: Vallard Benincosa (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Scott Ellis (Manager - Solutions Architecture and Engineering, NVIDIA) | Chad Chapman (NVIDIA) | Steve Blow (NVIDIA) | Wes Carroll (NVIDIA) | Robert Magno (Manager Solution Architects, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how this innovative solution is making complex SDG content more accessible and actionable for policymakers, educators, businesses, and citizens around the world
2. Discover how AI is fostering collaboration, driving engagement, and addressing global challenges through scalable, impactful solutions
sessions.description:
Everything you wanted to know about Run:AI but were afraid to ask, including:
 
•	Deployments in air-gapped environments
•	Effective utilization of GPU resources
•	Case studies on what worked for other organizationsImportant:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered.
