sessions.title: Inter-GPU Communication Techniques and Libraries for HPC and AI
sessions.speakers: Jim Dinan (Distinguished Engineer, NVIDIA) | Sylvain Jeaugey (Distinguished Engineer, NVIDIA) | Akshay Venkatesh (Senior Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Pak Markthub (Senior Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Jiri Kraus (Principal Developer Technology, NVIDIA) | Seth Howell (Senior Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Misbah Mubarak (Principal Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Arnav Goel (Senior Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Oded Green (Senior Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand what an LLM is and its strengths and weaknesses are
2. Work through pre-training and fine-tuning scenarios in practical exercises to build a real disease diagnosis LLM advisor
sessions.description: Discuss with experts everything related to inter-GPU communication through NVLink, Infiniband, or other networks. We'll cover all communication libraries: NCCL, MPI, UCX/UCC and NVSHMEM. This is the perfect place to discuss performance benefits of GPU Direct, NVLink, Infiniband, and SHARP to accelerate your deep learning training workload or your HPC application.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Optimize Distributed AI Workloads With Ray Compiled Graphs
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Image / Video Detection & Recognition
sessions.speakers: Stephanie Wang (Founding Engineer, Anyscale) | Amjad Almahairi (Research Scientist, Anyscale)
sessions.points:
1. Modern video applications leverage petabyte-scale volumes of data, incurring processing costs quickly rising into millions of dollars
2. Processing short web videos, with heterogeneous resolutions and codecs, is particularly challenging. Decoding and encoding often surpass other compute burden in such applications
sessions.description:
The Ray system (ray.io) makes it simple to scale distributed Python applications in machine learning. With the new Ray Compiled Graphs system, we're making it simple to develop programs for distributed accelerators. Ray Compiled Graphs lowers system overhead to make it suitable for millisecond tasks, and adds native APIs for GPU-to-GPU communication via NCCL.

We'll explore key use cases enabled by Ray Compiled Graphs, including online and offline multi-GPU LLM inference with Tensor and pipeline parallelism, as used in vLLM; and heterogeneous training workloads, including multimodal training and LLM post-training with reinforcement learning from human feedback (RLHF), leveraging fast and flexible communication across devices. We'll discuss these use cases and the performance improvements made possible by compiled graphs in distributed AI workloads.

sessions.title: Reduce Fraud and Financial Crime With Featurespace ARIC Risk Hub on AWS (Presented by Amazon Web Services)
sessions.speakers: Mark Smith (Head of Payments Market Development, AWS) | David Excell (Founder, Featurespace)
sessions.points:
1. Get an introduction to logistics routing through the eyes of the companies driving demand, and from the perspective of a company at the forefront of pioneering technology to move the supply chain industry forward
2. Learn about the benefits and challenges logistics routing presents to AV deployment at scale
sessions.description: We'll go over payment fraud prevention and financial crime trends and how financial institutions are leveraging graph databases, LLMs, large transaction models (LTMs), and graph neural networks to increase fraud detection rates. We'll also cover how Featurespace ARIC Risk Hub running on AWS leverages advanced machine learning techniques using NVIDIA accelerated computing to adapt to changing behaviors and new scams, while profiling good and bad data. ARIC Risk Hub uses advanced, explainable anomaly detection to enable financial institutions to automatically identify risk, catch new fraud attacks, and identify suspicious activity in real time. ARIC Risk Hub has processed over 100 billion events per year, resulting in up to 75% of fraud attacks blocked as they occur with a 5:1 false positive ratio.

sessions.title: From Clicks to Conversations - Intelligence Data Fusion Fueled by AI Agents
sessions.speakers: Jonas Lindgren (Software Product Lead and driver AI initiatives, SAAB) | Christian Ehrenström Roos (Software Developer, Saab Group) | Alexander Young (Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. End-to-End AI Solutions
2. Edge-to-Cloud Integration
sessions.description: In this session, we will explain how we introduced AI-agents into an Intelligence system holding massive amounts of data. How the interaction with the system changes from clicks to conversation, all shown in a coast guard scenario.

sessions.title: Optimize Short-Form Video Processing Toward the Speed of Light
sessions.speakers: Hareshkumar Borse (Manager, System Software, NVIDIA) | Louis Sugy (Senior Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | David Lesage (Engineering Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Gain a next-level understanding of the power of retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)-LLM pipelines and how they can improve enterprise productivity
2. Learn how to leverage NIM Agent Blueprints (NVingest) to transform static PDFs containing text, charts, and tables into dynamic, query-able knowledge bases with an out-of-the-box reference architecture
sessions.description:
Video Gen AI, world models, social media, and video search applications are tapping into hundreds of petabytes of video content, from the web or proprietary datasets. It's particularly challenging to process (decode, process, encode) such data efficiently: short clips, low resolutions, and many codecs and formats, in the Python ecosystem.

Learn how to leverage the latest and greatest from NVIDIA’s ecosystem (PyNvVideoCodec, CV-CUDA, CUDA-MPS, CUDA-ICP) to get the best out of NVIDIA’s hardware (NVDec, NVEnc, CUDA cores), with substantial throughput improvements over a CPU baseline.

sessions.title: PDFSpeak: Unlocking Multimodal PDF Intelligence Through Speech
sessions.speakers: Aparnaa Ramani (Solutions Architect, Generative AI, NVIDIA) | Shyam Renjith (AI Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Rachel Oberman (AI Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Arun Raman (Sr. Solution Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. See how timeseries forecasting can be used with a heterogenous GNN
2. Gain valuable insights into building an AI-ready data pipeline
sessions.description: Gain next-level insights from PDF documents just by speaking to your data. This hands-on session shows participants how to build and run PDFSpeak, an innovative approach to interacting with complex PDF documents using NVIDIA's cutting-edge AI technologies through speech, vision, and text.Prerequisite(s):GitHub, Docker, Bash, familiarity with Python.

sessions.title: NVIDIA MedTech Developer Day
sessions.speakers: Stephen Aylward (Global Alliance Manager for Developer Relations, MedTech, NVIDIA) | Axel Krieger (Associate Professor, Johns Hopkins University) | Wolfgang Wein (Founder and CEO, ImFusion)
sessions.points:
1. ビジネスシナリオ：適用すべきお客様の業務課題
2. 生成AIの活用シーン：Agentic AIを活用したユースケースと業務効果
sessions.description: Physical AI will transform every industry by bringing AI-driven, robotic solutions directly into the real world. Take our deep dive into the game-changing innovations that will transform medical technology! NVIDIA experts and a select group of developers will showcase real-world use cases in medical imaging and robotics. We'll demonstrate how to build such physical AI applications across the three-computer framework of training, simulation, and runtime — from simulating data/environment/task (Isaac Sim and Omniverse) to training novel AI models for transformative tasks (MONAI powered by TAO and NeMo) to the physical AI runtime powered by NVIDIA Holoscan platform.

sessions.title: End-to-End Optimization of Onboard Autonomy Workloads
sessions.speakers: Sebastian Jodlowski (Tech Lead Manager, Performance, Nuro)
sessions.points:
1. How industry can use generative AI and agents to build autonomous grid
2. Use of AI to predict weather changes faster for demand forecasting
sessions.description: Nuro Driver is an L4-capable, AI-first autonomy stack. Autonomy workloads have different performance characteristics than classical data center workloads, and thus can require different optimization approaches. They tend to be more heterogeneous and non-uniform, while being required to adhere to rigid execution constraints. We'll first explain how to define and measure relevant performance metrics, and then deep dive into how we achieved the targets for Nuro Driver. We'll cover mechanisms like compute resource isolation, workload scheduling, quantization challenges across different model types, and multi-GPU-aware ML compiler framework.

sessions.title: Novel Uses for AI to Drive Monetization in Large M&E Archives
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Lewis Smithingham (EVP Media, Entertainment, Gaming and Sports, Monks)
sessions.points:
1. Overview of Ada Generation products
2. We'll cover NVIDIA AI Platform and accelerated solutions, and how they help accelerate AI training/inferencing in different markets
sessions.description:
In 1928, a Norwegian doctor put an original print of Carl Dreyer’s silent movie “The Passion of Joan of Arc” in a janitor’s closet in an insane asylum. This new cut was discovered during renovations 53 years later, changing our understanding of the film. Hopefully, most media companies don’t store in janitor’s closets, but most have hundreds of thousands of hours of footage sitting dormant, stored with little more information than the file name.

Learn how using a NIMS-based contextual analysis for metadata ingest within a software-defined broadcast pipeline can make your active media and archive searchable by a frame’s visual contents, and even the greater context around it. These data allow for dynamic and novel opportunities for monetization and personalization. We'll discuss how contextual metadata can be produced and refined recursively within a TAMS (time-addressable media) framework to add and amend metadata each time footage is retrieved. These data can be used to generate retrieval-augmented generation models for everything from anomaly detection to predictive/suggestive editing and FAST-content generation. 
Discover how a news organization will use metadata to “Control F” through their archive, and how a racing company will use their contextual data to create models to predict camera switching, improve safety, and generate user-specific narratives. We’ll close with an exploration of how media & entertainment (M&E) contextual data pipelines can be used outside our industry, from avoiding collisions with self-driving cars to sonar analysis.

sessions.title: Exploring NVIDIA’s Strategy for AV Safety
sessions.speakers: Jonas Nilsson (Director of Safety Engineering, Head of AV Safety, NVIDIA) | Riccardo Mariani (VP Safety, NVIDIA) | Apoorva Sharma (Research Scientist, NVIDIA) | Karl Greb (Sr. Director Safety Engineering, NVIDIA) | Ed Schmerling (Sr. Research Scientist, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Existing attention algorithms such as FlashAttention(-2) have yet to take advantage of new hardware features such as asynchrony and low precision in Hopper
2. Asynchrony allows us to overlap computation and data movement, speeding up attention computation
sessions.description: Dive into the key pillars of NVIDIA’s strategy for physical AI safety, including design time, deployment time, and validation time guardrails. Discover how these pillars integrate with NVIDIA’s hardware and software safety platform, and align with regulation and standardization frameworks in the AI era.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Build Secure Enterprise-Class Agentic Applications by Co-Locating Data and AI (Presented by Couchbase)
sessions.speakers: Rahul Pradhan (VP, Product Management, Couchbase)
sessions.points:
1. Speed time-to-deployment for agentic and physical AI
2. How to implement agentic and physical AI safely and reliably
sessions.description: Learn how to co-locate data with LLMs, from the cloud to the edge, to power critical agent applications that can't tolerate data traversing the internet. We'll also cover how to analyze and manipulate JSON data using the NL2SQL tool.

sessions.title: The Expanding Sound: Unlock Creativity With AI in Audio Innovation
sessions.speakers: Shari Reich (Manager of Developer Relations for Audio and Music, NVIDIA) | Jessica Powell (CEO and Co-Founder, AudioShake) | Daniel Rowland (Head of Strategy and Partnerships, LANDR) | Dave Tozer (Music Producer, Songwriter, Musician, Recording Hardware and Software Expert, Recording Artist) | Rafael Valle (NVIDIA) | Kord Taylor (Fractional CEO, CMO and Consultant, Syntropique)
sessions.points:
1. How Gen AI is accelerating the shift toward a new data-driven business model in the infrastructure sector
2. The role of data across the infrastructure life cycle, and the opportunities latest AI advances bring to reason over this data
sessions.description: Advancements in artificial intelligence are reshaping the audio landscape, offering unprecedented opportunities for creativity and innovation. This panel explores how AI is revolutionizing music composition, sound design, audio production, and immersive experiences. Industry leaders and experts will discuss cutting-edge AI tools, ethical considerations, and the balance between human artistry and machine learning. Gain insights into how AI empowers creators to push the boundaries of sound, fostering collaboration and unlocking new dimensions of auditory expression. Join us to explore the future of audio innovation and the expanding possibilities of creative soundscapes.

sessions.title: The Future of Infrastructure in an AI-Powered World: From Data as a Byproduct to a Data-Driven Industry
sessions.speakers: Tim Wark (Global AI Lead, AECOM)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how generative AI is transforming the automotive industry by streamlining vehicle design processes and optimizing manufacturing. AI-driven tools enable faster prototyping, smarter design decisions, and more efficient production workflows, ultimately reducing time-to-market
2. Discover how GenAI improves customer interactions through personalized user experiences. Gain insights into how AI-powered tools can offer intelligent, real-time support and tailor services to individual needs, enhancing customer satisfaction and loyalty
sessions.description:
Learn how the current generative AI wave will rapidly accelerate the digital transformation of the infrastructure industry and shift the design and construction model's focus from time and materials to value and outcomes. Global infrastructure spend is expected to exceed $9 trillion in 2025, with increasingly large and complex projects now dominating the landscape, making managing these mega projects more and more challenging.

We'll show how data will become increasingly central to the core business models and creation of value across the entire architecture, engineering & construction (AEC) industry and infrastructure life cycle. We'll explore how latest advances in generative AI are providing the abilities to reason and extract insights over the vast datasets that underpin the infrastructure life cycle, and the shift to the future of data-platform asset models.

sessions.title: From Open Source to Frontier AI: Build, Customize, and Extend Foundation Models (FoxBrain Case Study)(Presented by Foxconn)
sessions.speakers: Tran Van Nhiem (Technical Lead, Foxconn (Hon Hai Research Institute))
sessions.description: We'll dive into the details of how to build an advanced foundation AI model that achieves top performance by leveraging open-source AI. In detail, we'll explore key components for customizing and extending model capabilities and knowledge through the development pipelines (data, training, inference, and benchmark evaluation).

sessions.title: A Grand Slam for Network Operations: Agentic AI in Action
sessions.speakers: Jeremy Schulman (Senior Director, Integrated Solutions Engineering, Major League Baseball) | Cesar Murillas (Sr. Director, Network & Security Engineering, Major League Baseball)
sessions.points:
1. Reference designs and an ecosystem of high-quality models for using digital twins to design and operate AI factories
2. Production examples of improvements in productivity and quality of results using agentic AI design solutions for semiconductor and system design
sessions.description: Major League Baseball (MLB) is at the forefront of operational innovation, leveraging AI agents to revolutionize how it manages critical workflows and decision-making processes across infrastructure and cybersecurity management. Join us to see how MLB is pioneering AI-driven network automation in particular, and the potential for broader industry applications.

sessions.title: Meet the Experts From Deep Learning Framework Teams
sessions.speakers: Phuong Nguyen (DL Performance Engineer, NVIDIA) | Tim Moon (Sr. DL Performance Engineer, NVIDIA) | Chang Liu (Sr. Deep Learning Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Triston Cao (Sr. Deep Learning Software Engineering Manager, NVIDIA) | Frederic Bastien (Principle Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Rishi Puri (Sr. Deep Learning Engineer and Lead for PyTorch Geometric, NVIDIA) | Naoya Maruyama (Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Jaroslav Sevcik (Principle Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Eddie Yan (Technical Lead of PyTorch, NVIDIA) | Kshiteej Kalambarkar (Software Engineer in Thunder, NVIDIA) | Masaki Kozuki (Senior Software Engineer in PyTorch, NVIDIA) | Patrick Wang (Enterprise Products) (Software Engineer in PyTorch, NVIDIA) | Ivan Yashchuk (Senior Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Mike Ruberry (Distinguished Engineer in Deep Learning Frameworks, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Astris AI, a Lockheed Martin company, offers defense-grade AI solutions that prioritize security, safeguarding organizational data and enhancing workforce productivity with secure AI assistants and agents
2. Astris AI's solutions provide an open and modular AI architecture, allowing enterprises to deploy AI without vendor lock-in, and enabling rapid AI/ML development and deployment through the Astris AI Factory
sessions.description: Dive deep into how to use and contribute deep learning frameworks, such as PyTorch, Jax, TensorFlow,  DGL and PyTorch Geometrics. We have all engineer leads in different deep learning frameworks to enable you best use of these frameworks for your projects.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. Attendees can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Advances on Decision Optimization
sessions.speakers: Alex Fender (Sr. Engineering Manager, NVIDIA) | Chris Maes (Principal Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Performance gains running transient aerodynamics computational fluid dynamics simulations on accelerated platforms
2. Impact on the design process of accelerating external aerodynamics simulations
sessions.description:
Decision-making in complex systems is driven by insatiable demand for performance and efficiency, pushing traditional approaches to their limits. How to achieve more efficient prescriptive analytics?
Join us to explore NVIDIA groundbreaking innovations in GPU-accelerated decision optimization, including primal-dual linear programming (PDLP) and mixed-integer linear programming (MILP) heuristics. These advancements  deliver order-of-magnitude speedups and record-breaking solutions for real-world challenges.
In this session, you'll:

sessions.title: Advance In-Car User Experience with Hybrid LLM Architecture
sessions.speakers: Sri Subramanian (Global Head of Generative AI, Automotive, NVIDIA) | Nils Schanz (EVP Product & Technology, Cerence AI) | Luc Julia (Chief Scientific Officer, Renault) | Jim Morgan (Chief Engineer, In-Vehicle Infotainment, Jaguar Land Rover)
sessions.points:
1. Engage with Industry Leaders: Participate in an inspiring conversation with visionary technical leaders
2. Explore Developer Opportunities: Gain insights into integrating OpenUSD and uncover new opportunities within the 3D technology landscape
sessions.description: Cerence AI is pioneering in-car innovation with Cerence xUI, its new LLM-powered AI assistant platform. xUI, built on Cerence’s CaLLM family of language models, taps into years of training on extensive automotive datasets and NVIDIA’s advanced AI technologies to offer efficient, accurate, and personalized real-time responses, regardless of connectivity. Featuring AI leaders from global automakers JLR, and Renault, this panel will explore the importance of integrating embedded in-car models and cloud-hosted AI in OEMs’ mission of creating enhanced user experiences that make every journey safer, smarter, and more enjoyable. Partnering with NVIDIA, Cerence AI and its automaker partners at JLR, and Renault, are leveraging AI to set a new standard for automotive user experiences.

sessions.title: Accelerating Automotive Transient Aerodynamics CFD Simulation
sessions.speakers: Simone Landi (Application Specialist for Vehicle Aerodynamics, Siemens)
sessions.points:
1. Genome-wide association studies analyze DNA sequence variations spanning an entire genome (human or other) in order to identify genetic risk factors for diseases or other traits within a population
2. We deploy high-performance tile-centric matrix computations to democratize kernel ridge regression (KRR) for capturing genetic epistasis
sessions.description: BMW, Siemens, and NVIDIA will present the results of their collaboration on accelerating automotive transient aerodynamics simulations. Traditionally, transient aerodynamics simulations are very computationally intensive. This is due to large model sizes needed to capture all the details of the vehicle, including external and internal (under-hood) flows. Additional complexity and computational cost is added by including rotating rims in the analysis. We'll present the results of accelerating these Simcenter STAR-CCM+ simulations on the latest GPU hardware. We'll discuss the impact on the design process and the potential to add more fidelity to the simulations, as well as the energy savings of leveraging accelerated approaches.

sessions.title: Implement Accelerated PDE-Based Time-History Simulation by Data-Driven Methods on Strongly Coupled CPU-GPU systems
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - AI Policy / Trustworthy AI
sessions.speakers: Kohei Fujita (Associate Professor, Earthquake Research Institute, The University of Tokyo)
sessions.points:
1. A brief overview of the AI regulations of which businesses should be aware in different regions
2. Insights into which regions and industries are likely to be most impacted by AI regulation
sessions.description: Partial differential equation (PDE)-based time-history simulations, such as seismic wave simulations, are computationally costly, so we've been working on reducing their computational costs on HPC systems. Hear about recent research and implementation examples on using data-driven methods to accelerate PDE-based implicit time-history simulations without reducing simulation accuracy.

sessions.title: Accelerate Energy Transformation With Industry Domain AI Models
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Programming Languages / Compilers
sessions.speakers: Shashi Menon (VP Digital, Schlumberger) | Marc Spieler (Sr. Managing Director Energy, NVIDIA) | Arshad Mansoor (President and CEO, Electric Power Research Institute) | Maureen Zawalick (Vice President, Business and Technical Services, Pacific Gas and Electric Company)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how to get started accelerating Fortran or C/C++ code on GPUs or multicore CPU
2. Learn about available HPC programming models or tools, and how to choose the best one for your use case
sessions.description:
Energy companies handle some of the world’s largest and most complex datasets, from seismic surveys and well logs in the oil & gas sector to grid sensor data and smart meter readings in the power sector. This panel brings together industry leaders to explore how domain-specific AI models are transforming these vast data sources into actionable intelligence.

Panelists will share real-world examples of how generative AI is not only driving significant cost savings, but also unlocking new revenue streams by enhancing productivity and operational efficiency. The discussion will delve into strategies for accelerating AI adoption, reducing operating costs, and enabling faster, safer, and more informed decision-making.

Key topics will include overcoming challenges in AI model development and deployment, as well as insights into how AI can help the energy sector achieve greater efficiency, sustainability, and reliability across the entire value chain.

sessions.title: Integrate LLMs Into Asset Management to Drive Innovation and Efficiency
sessions.topic: Networking & Communications - Networking for Scientific Computing Workloads
sessions.speakers: Zhengfei Li (Director of AI Research, E Fund Management)
sessions.points:
1. How to optimally apply the existing multi-GPU Programming Libraries CUDA-aware MPI, NCCL and NVSHMEM
2. Understand the performance behavior of multi-GPU Programming Libraries
sessions.description:
Large language models are designed to predict the next word in a sentence, enabling them to generate coherent and contextually relevant text. In the context of asset management, LLMs can process unstructured financial data such as news, reports, and market analyses, offering fund researchers and managers the ability to analyze sentiment, predict trends, and automate decision-making processes.
 
In an era when technology is transforming every aspect of finance, integrating LLMs into asset management is not just a trend, but a revolution. We explore how LLMs are shaping the future of asset management. We'll examine the advanced techniques used to train and fine-tune LLMs for asset management applications, and delve into scenarios where LLMs can increase research efficiency and enhance decision-making processes. We'll also discuss the importance of foresight in leveraging these technologies to gain a broader industry impact.

sessions.title: GraphBolt: Overcoming Dynamic Shapes and Irregular Accesses in GNN Data Loading
sessions.speakers: Hongzhi Chen (Software Development Manager, AWS) | Muhammed Fatih Balin (Ph.D. Candidate, Georgia Institute of Technology)
sessions.points:
1. Discover how to leverage NVIDIA's full-stack Gen AI platform, including NVIDIA NeMo, NVIDIA AI Enterprise, and NVIDIA DGX Cloud, to build, customize, and deploy generative AI models for various university functions, such as administration, teaching, and research
2. Understand how to harness the power of NVIDIA's accelerated computing platform, including NVIDIA TensorRT and NVIDIA TensorRT-LLM, to optimize and accelerate generative AI workloads, and learn how to use NVIDIA's NIM microservices to incorporate generative AI into various applications
sessions.description: GraphBolt is a state-of-the-art graph neural network (GNN) data loader. It owes its speed to its ability to keep GPUs utilized at all times. Whether it's copy operations from host to device or host device synchronizations, we'll show how to hide the latencies of such operations through heavy use of pipelining. We'll dive deep into the internals of GraphBolt and show how we achieved its unmatched performance by utilizing various CUDA programming techniques.

sessions.title: Build Secure and Scalable Gen AI Applications With Databases and NVIDIA AI
sessions.speakers: Muazma Zahid (Principal Group PM Manager, Microsoft) | Bob Ward (Principal Architect, Microsoft)
sessions.points:
1. Provides data privacy that enterprises require for compliance, and reduces the risk of threats like prompt injection and LLM jailbreak
2. Allows for easily analyzing and manipulating JSON data using the NL2SQL tool
sessions.description: In today’s enterprise landscape, the demand for secure and scalable Gen AI applications is at an all-time high. We'll show you how to leverage SQL databases to interface seamlessly with popular language models, including those hosted on the NVIDIA AI Enterprise platform. Learn to build applications that perform vector searches using embeddings from database-stored data and explore hybrid searches combining various data types. We'll also cover developing end-to-end applications with frameworks like LangChain and Gradio, and highlight using SQL databases for managing chat history and feedback data for analytical purposes.

sessions.speakers: Georg Kolling (Principal Algorithms Scientist, Oxford Nanopore Technologies)
sessions.points:
1. Perception AI is critical for unlocking autonomy for humanoids and other robots
2. Synthetic data can help bootstrap perception AI model training
sessions.description: At Oxford Nanopore Technologies, we use transformer models to process signal data generated by our DNA sequencers. These models are similar to popular LLMs, although they are much smaller. Reduced size comes with different challenges to get optimum performance out of the GPU. We develop our own CUDA kernels and tune them for performance on our target architectures. We'll explain the Why and How of our approach.

Discover how Northwestern University and Quantiphi are revolutionizing cardiac MRI analysis through the integration of MONAI and the Triton Inference Server. We'll showcase a MONAI-based cardiac segmentation model designed to provide faster and more accurate results, ultimately enhancing patient outcomes.

Learn about the unique architecture of these superchips and their versatile form factors that simplify data center deployment. We'll address such questions as how the 900 GB/s NVLINK Chip-to-Chip interconnect enables the CPU and GPU to access all system-allocated memory, how you can seamlessly migrate your x86-based workloads to the Arm-based Grace CPU, and the performance gains you can expect to unlock for your applications.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. sessions.title: Enable AI-Native Networking for Telcos with Kubernetes
sessions.speakers: Erwan Gallen (Senior Principal Product Manager, Red  Hat) | Elad Blatt (Global Head Business Development Telco Networking, NVIDIA) | Ahmed Guetari (VP and GM, Service Providers, F5)
sessions.points:
1. How to build trust around AI within organizations through technology adoption processes
2. Securing AI assets through development to production
sessions.description: As telcos transform their networks for the age of AI, utilizing the Bluefield 3 (BF3) DPU engines has been challenging for developers and clients alike. Yet, BF3 is a critical part in deploying and securing an accelerated compute cluster to enable this networking-for-AI infrastructure. The DOCA Platform Framework (DPF) simplifies this task, providing a framework for LCM (life cycle management) and provisioning of both the BF3, as a platform, and the services running on it as K8 containers. DPF is deployed via two network operators in the K8 environment that allow you to deploy and service chain NVIDIA and third-party services. With this, for the first time, independent software vendors (ISVs), operating systems (OS) vendors, and developers can deploy and orchestrate services with ease, as well as onboarding these tools to their environment. In this session, OS and ISV partner companies who've adopted the DPF will share their experience, what they are able to achieve, and what comes next.

sessions.title: Enable Enterprise AI Adoption by Building Trust in AI Assets and Processes
sessions.speakers: Yuval Fernbach (VP, CTO MLOPs, JFrog)
sessions.points:
1. Classical data center and autonomous workloads are different in terms of the optimization targets: average latency/throughput versus long-tail events
2. Catching a long-tail event requires complex monitoring and tracing to be in place, all the time, in real time. These are hardly reproducible in simulation or offboard environments
sessions.description:
Technology organizations have mastered the process of building, maturing, and releasing traditional software assets in a way that instills trust throughout the process. AI/ML assets represent a new paradigm lacking the same mature control level. To accelerate production-ready AI, AI workflows must be integrated within an organization’s standard DevOps and security frameworks — operating from a single source of truth.

We'll explore how existing frameworks can be expanded to encompass AI pipelines, emphasizing sustainable and secure processes that build trust in AI assets and facilitate a smooth transition from concept to production. We'll share insights from large organizations that have successfully integrated their DevSecOps practices into their AI workflows, illustrating the benefits for the organization and the data scientists and MLOps teams focused on delivering maximum value from AI/ML services.

sessions.title: Polymathic AI: Building Foundation Models for Science
sessions.speakers: Shirley Ho (Professor/Group Leader, Simons Foundation/NYU/Princeton)
sessions.points:
1. Understand how NVIDIA’s accelerated networking technology enables energy-efficient, high-performance AI infrastructure
2. Explore how Crusoe integrates sustainable energy practices with NVIDIA networking solutions to build their AI cloud
sessions.description:
Foundation models like GPT-4 have dramatically altered the modern work landscape for many industries reliant on language tasks, but no equivalent model exists yet for scientific applications. Incorporating foundation models into research workflows could enable unprecedented discoveries that connect traditionally distinct scientific sub-disciplines. However, mainstream foundation models trained on human-scale datasets will be insufficient for analyzing most scientific phenomena — a foundation model for science will require special consideration for the requirements of scientific datasets, especially those with wide dynamic ranges. 

We'll introduce the Polymathic AI initiative: our goal is to accelerate the development of versatile foundation models tailored for numerical datasets and scientific machine learning tasks. Our challenge is to build AI models that leverage information from heterogeneous datasets and across different scientific fields.

sessions.title: Pushing Spectral Efficiency Limits on CUDA-accelerated 5G/6G RAN
sessions.speakers: Yuan Gao (Senior Software Engineer, 5G – Algorithms, NVIDIA) | Tommaso Balercia (Principal Engineer, Aerial, NVIDIA) | Vikrama Ditya (Senior Director of Software, Aerial, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Planning data center infrastructure carefully is critical to delivering ROI for the business
2. Data center resources must be balanced: CPU and GPU compute, memory, power, thermals, and footprint
sessions.description:
The demand for mobile broadband continues to grow, and correspondingly the radio access networks (RAN) delivering it are asked to support an extraordinary rate of innovation. 

RAN-based on software-defined platforms are of key importance in enabling such a rate of innovation sustainably. Among all software-defined platforms, the one based on the GPU allows for the introduction of complex algorithms to pursue new levels of spectral efficiency. This is both to the ease with which the GPU can be programmed and their computational efficiency. 

Moreover, GPU-based 5G and 6G RAN stacks can run coherently with the code of a new class of simulation tools: digital twins. The efficiency with which the GPU can run both physics simulation chains as well as the 5G/6G RAN stack enable simulations to reach new scales and levels of accuracy. Such simulation environments, in turn, enable the creation and the detailed characterization of new algorithms.

In this talk, we will demonstrate how a series of key algorithms that make use of the GPU computational power allow us to push the boundary of system spectral efficiency. The characterization is performed in a digital twin environment, where the radio environment is closely resembling the field.
