1. テレコム業界における大規模言語モデルの使用例とその傾向
2. マルチデータセンターにおけるLLMの分散学習のためのネットワーク最適化
sessions.description: 私たちは数年前より”データ駆動型創薬”をキーワードとして様々な取り組みを進めてきました。そしてAI技術を利用した化合物のプロファイルの予測や、大規模なバーチャルスクリーニングを研究ワークフローに組み込むなどして難標的への挑戦を続けております。合わせてこれらの研究を支えるクラウド、オンプレミス環境もともに整備を進めており、さらなる創薬研究の加速化を目指しております。本発表では、過去からこれまでの取り組みと、今後の展望について発表させていただきます。

sessions.title: 大規模言語モデル学習スケールのためのテレコムユースケース
sessions.speakers: 露崎 浩太 (ノベーションセンター テクノロジー部門 担当課長 エンジニアリングマネージャー, NTTコミュニケーションズ株式会社) | 鈴ヶ嶺 聡哲 (イノベーションセンター テクノロジー部門 Software Engineer, NTTコミュニケーションズ株式会社)
sessions.points:
1. GPU を用いて Pandas プログラムを高速化する方法
2. Pandasプログラムを高速化するランタイムコンパイル技術
sessions.description: 高速低遅延なフォトニックネットワークを用いた大規模で効果的な大規模言語モデルの分散学習における技術的概要を説明します。これには、NCCLやNeMoフレームワークのようなNVIDIA AIソフトウェアスタックをチューニングすることによる学習のスケーリングも含まれます。通信技術が、容量、エネルギー使用、データレジデンシー要件に関するデータセンターの制限をどのように克服するかについて学びます。

sessions.title: OmniverseとOpenUSDで実現する次世代バーチャルファクトリーの創り方
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Pre-Trained / Foundation Models
sessions.speakers: 石川 大樹 (執行役員 次世代事業開発部長 兼 経営企画室長, 株式会社理経) | 文 思行 (次世代事業開発部　インダストリアルAIグループ　3Dアートディレクター, 株式会社理経)
sessions.points:
1. Developing Multi-GPU Applications: Ray Compiled Graphs gives you the flexibility of the Ray API when programming multi-GPU applications. Express arbitrary execution graphs across different devices and execute with 10s of us of task overhead
2. Native GPU-GPU Communication: Ray Compiled Graphs uses NVIDIA NCCL for GPU-GPU communication for fast Tensor transfer. The system guarantees no deadlock and implements optimizations such as overlapping communication with computation
sessions.description: バーチャルファクトリーをテーマに、製造業におけるデジタルツイン導入の工程や課題を紹介します。またそれに対してOmniverseとOpenUSDを活用した最新の3Dワークフローがどのように有効なのか、3Dモデル・マテリアル・データ構造などの観点を含めてこれまでのユースケースをもとに解説します。

sessions.title: 実行時コンパイル技術によりプログラム書き換え無しにpandas処理を100倍以上高速化
sessions.speakers: 荒木 拓也 (主幹研究員, NEC)
sessions.points:
1. 次世代ロボット基盤モデルの進展と応用
2. 発達ロボティクスに基づく学習事例
sessions.description: pandasはデータ分析において非常に頻繁に用いられるライブラリである。一方、pandasはその処理速度が遅く、データ分析処理のボトルネックとなっていた。この問題を解決するため、我々はpandasによるデータ処理を高速化するライブラリであるFireDucksを開発している。FireDucksはライブラリ内にJITコンパイラが組み込まれており、実行時に高度な最適化を行うことで高速化を実現する。また、個々の処理の実行にはcuDFを用い、その高速な実装を活用する。これにより、pandasとの高い互換性を保ちながら、高速な実行を実現した。TPC-Hベンチマークを用いた評価では、pandasと比較して100倍以上の性能向上を達成した。ユーザはpandasプログラムを書き換えることなく、GPUを用いた高い性能を利用することができる。

sessions.title: Isaac PerceptorとAutowareを組み合わせたNova Carterの自動運転
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Deep Learning Frameworks
sessions.speakers: Yutaka Kondo (Engineering Manager, 株式会社ティアフォー)
sessions.points:
1. PyTorch has recently introduced a MemPool API allowing custom memory allocator registration for highly customizable/efficient memory allocation
2. Custom allocation allows for further optimizations such as NCCL zero copy, eliding previously wasteful copies during communication
sessions.description: Jetson AGX Orinが搭載された自律移動ロボット開発プラットフォームであるNova Carterとオールインワン自動運転オープンソースソフトウェアであるAutowareを組み合わせ、自動運転のデモンストレーションを行います。Nova Carterに搭載された多種多様なセンサーをIsaac PerceptorやCUDA、TensorRTなどを用いて処理し、Autowareで軌道計画、ロボットの制御を行うことで自動運転を実現します。聴衆の皆様は、Isaac Perceptorのインテグレーション方法やJetson AGX Orinを用いたAMRアプリケーションの開発手順について学ぶことができます。

sessions.title: Tokyo-1とBioNeMoで実現するAIベースの創薬ワークフローの構築
sessions.speakers: 江頭 啓 (研究本部創薬ケミストリー研究部長, 小野薬品工業株式会社)
sessions.points:
1. By training on a variety of different physical systems, our surrogate models for fluid dynamics can more easily adapt to new physics during fine-tuning
2. We develop strategies for unifying scientific modalities within single foundation models
sessions.description: 小野薬品はNVIDIA DGX H100を計算基盤としたTokyo-1プロジェクトに参画しました。それ以降GPUを活用した大規模ドッキング、高精度タンパク質ーリガンド結合予測の高速化、タンパク質言語モデルの活用などを推進しています。GPU活用するを希望する人材も3倍になり、AI創薬を加速させています。

sessions.title: Spectrum-X & H200で構築したGPUクラウドサービス開発の最前線
sessions.speakers: genki tomo (リーダー, GMOインターネット株式会社) | 梅崎 皓太 (エンジニア, GMOインターネット株式会社)
sessions.points:
1. Innovative Insights: Discover cutting-edge solutions addressing real-world challenges across industries
2. Emerging Trends: Gain a front-row seat to the latest developments in AI and accelerated computing technologies
sessions.description:
スパコンランキング Top500で37位を獲得したGPUクラウドをゼロから立ち上げる過程で、GPUリソースを最大限お客様に提供するためにクラウドサービスとして最適化した手法を説明します。
リファレンスアーキテクチャを基盤とし、NVIDIA H200 GPU 768基 と Spectrum-Xを用いて構築したGPUクラウド環境開発のユースケースを紹介いたします。
また、高密度なインターコネクトネットワークにおける課題に対する解決策について、弊社の実例をもとに実践的な知見を共有します。

sessions.title: 次世代のロボット基盤モデルの展望とその応用可能性
sessions.topic: AI Platforms / Deployment - AI Inference / Inference Microservices
sessions.speakers: Tetsuya Ogata (理工学術院 基幹理工学部 表現工学科 教授, 早稲田大学)
sessions.points:
1. 2025年大阪万博のNTTパビリオンで展示されるAIの活用事例。来場者の表情から壁の動きを制御したり、来場者の転倒を検知して即座に救助したり、プライバシーを保つためにぼかし処理を実施
2. IOWN APN（All Photonics Network）上のRDMA（Remote Direct Memory Access）を活用し、地理的に3階層に分散した処理モデル（カスタマーエッジ、エッジクラウド、パブリッククラウド）によるAI解析プラットフォームの概要
sessions.description: 大規模なロボット基盤モデルの構築や、それを人型ロボットに応用する取り組みが、近年、世界中で急速に進展している。これらのロボットは、従来の製造現場での利用に加え、家庭内や医療、災害対応など、これまで応用が難しいとされてきた多様な環境での利用が期待されている。本講演では、講演者が取り組んできた『発達ロボティクス』の視点に基づくEnd-to-Endのロボット動作学習事例を紹介する。さらに、次世代のロボット基盤モデルに求められる要素として、継続的かつ能動的な発達の重要性や、変動し続ける実世界に対応するための能動的推論の役割について考察する。

sessions.title: 高速・高精度・絶対シミュレーションによるシンセティックデータが作るAI創薬の未来Integrating HPC & AI: The Future of AI Drug Discovery Using Scaled and High Quality Synthetic Data
sessions.speakers: 寺田 央 (取締役・Chief Scientific Officer, アリヴェクシス株式会社)
sessions.description:
医薬品開発には15年もの歳月と2000億ともいわれる莫大な費用が掛かる上、30,000化合物に1つが医薬品として世に出るという成功確率の低さから、あらゆる角度からの効率化が望まれて久しい。近年では、効率化のアプローチの一つとして、電子カルテや研究論文情報、化合物の構造や評価データなどの膨大な情報を利用したAI創薬に大きな期待が集まっている。ただ、入手可能な学習ソ－スである膨大なデータは、多様かつ再現性が低いなどの様々な課題があり、結果不正確なデータで学習せざるを得ない創薬AIは、期待されたパフォーマンスを出せていない。
一方で、シミュレーションが作るシンセティックデータによるAI学習は、自動運転など多くの分野ですでに実用化されており、AIの性能を飛躍的に上げることが知られているが、創薬分野では質と量を兼ね備えたシミュレーション手法がなかったため、実用化に至っていなかった。
今回、我々は既存の最新の手法に比べ数百から数千倍高速で高精度、かつリファレンスデータの不要な革新的な化合物活性予測シミュレーターを開発した。本セッションでは、この技術の概要・特徴と、AI創薬への応用について議論したい。From discovery to the clinic, drug development takes about 15 years and costs a huge amount of money, said to be around 200 billion yen, while the success rate is low, with only one in 30,000 compounds reaching the market. Therefore, there has long been a need for efficiency at all stages of the process. In recent years, as one approach to efficiency, high expectation have been placed on AI drug discovery models that use huge amounts of data, such as electronic medical records, research paper information, and compound structure and evaluation data. However, the huge amount of data that is available as a training resource for the AI models has various issues, including diversity and low reproducibility. As a result, drug discovery AI that has no choice but to learn from inaccurate data does not perform as expected. On the other hand, AI learning using synthetic data created by simulation has already been put to practical use in many fields such as autonomous driving, and is known to dramatically improve the performance of AI, but in the drug discovery field, there has been no simulation method that combined quality and quantity, so it has not been put to practical use. We have developed an innovative compound activity prediction simulator that is hundreds to thousands of times faster than existing state-of-the-art methods while still maintaining high accuracy and with the additional benefit that it does not require reference data. In this session, we would like to discuss the overview and features of this technology and its application to AI drug discovery.

sessions.title: NVIDIA GPU クラウドを使った API アクセスによる高速アプリ開発
sessions.speakers: 鈴木 章太郎 (FPTデータ & AI インテグレーション　エグゼクティブエバンジェリスト, FPTジャパンホールディングス株式会社)
sessions.points:
1. Building Edge AI Applications: Learn how to create edge AI applications using the three-computer framework that encompasses training, simulation, and runtime, leveraging tools like NVIDIA Isaac Sim, Omniverse, MONAI, and TAO
2. Understand how to integrate these innovations into the physical world through the NVIDIA Holoscan platform enabling low-latency, high-bandwidth, multi-modal, and multi-AI sensor processing
sessions.description: 国産 AI Factory を活用した NVIDIA H100/H200 GPU クラウドプラットフォームで、生成 AI モデル構築からエンタプライズ向け AI エージェントデプロイまで、エンドツーエンドの AI 開発を実現しましょう。直感的な API とFPT が開発した SDK を用いることにより、複雑なコーディングは不要です。僅か数行のコードで、モデルのファインチューニングも可能です。本セッションでは、具体的なユースケースを交え、迅速な開発と最適化された推論環境による国産 AI Factory の利点をご紹介します。

sessions.title: 生成 AI 時代の最先端エンタメコンテンツ・プロダクションワーク
sessions.speakers: 新井 モノ (CEO, AiHUB株式会社)
sessions.points:
1. シミュレーションを多用した創薬の最新状況
2. 創薬におけるシンセティックデータのAI学習への応用事例
sessions.description:
生成 AI の登場によってエンタメコンテンツ・プロダクションワークの変革が起きています。
生成 AI がクリエイターの意図を忠実に反映するアシスタントとして、生成 AI の特性を活かし、バズコンテンツを生み出します。そのためのワークフローの変革、要素技術、インフラについて NVIDIA の技術とオープンソースがどのように貢献するか、実際のコンテンツ例を紹介しながら説明します。NVIDIA NIM・ACE を活用した事例なども、本セッションにてご紹介いたします。

sessions.title: 生成AIを活用したより良い金融サービスの提供に向けて
sessions.speakers: 板屋 篤 (常務取締役, 大和証券株式会社)
sessions.points:
1. NVIDIA NIM/ ACE の活用事例をご紹介いたします。
2. 生成 AI の登場は、エンターテインメントコンテントと制作業務に変革をもたらしています。生成 AI は、クリエイターの意図を忠実に反映し、生成 AI の特性を活かして話題を呼ぶコンテンツを生み出すアシスタントとして機能します。本セッションでは、NVIDIAの技術とオープンソースがワークフロー、主要技術、インフラストラクチャの変革にどのように貢献しているか、実際のコンテンツ例を交えて説明します。
sessions.description: 大和証券では国内企業の中でもいち早く生成AIの活用に取り組んできました。社内ドキュメントの要約から自社内でのAIアバター作成、2024年10月には顧客向けのAIオペレータの運用を開始しました。そして今、NVIDIA NeMo、NIMを活用したローカルLLMでの展開に取り組んでいます。

sessions.title: 効率的なソブリンAIの最前線：データセンターからAIアプリケーションまで
sessions.speakers: 劉 功義 (Director, Principal Architect, キンドリルジャパン株式会社)
sessions.description: キンドリルは、ソブリンAIの日本導入を支援するプライベートクラウドサービスを発表した。本講演では、そのサービス導入時に検討したデータセンター基盤構築からAIアプリケーション展開までの運用設計について解説する。NVIDIAの技術を活用することで、スケーラブルで効率的なサービス設計を実現する方法を具体例を交えて紹介する。Svereigntyの要件とその実装を明らかにする。

sessions.title: Watch Party: Physical AI for the Next Frontier of Industrial Digitalization
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Training AI Models
sessions.speakers: Christoph Berlin (VP, Engineering, Microsoft) | Deirdre Bosa (“TechCheck” Anchor, CNBC) | Jean-Claude Ercolanelli (Sr. Vice President, Simulation and Test Solutions, Siemens) | Wendy Tan White (CEO, Intrinsic) | Pras Velagapudi (CTO, Agility Robotics) | Rev Lebaredian (VP of Omniverse and Simulation Technology, NVIDIA) | Brand Cheng (Chairman and CEO, Fii (Foxconn Industrial Internet))
sessions.points:
1. 最先端のスピーチAIモデルを探る：アジア言語に特化したスピーチ基盤モデルの最新技術と進化について解説します。
2. ビジネスの可能性を発見する：日本やアジア全体でのスピーチAI技術の市場ポテンシャルと商業的応用についてご紹介します。
sessions.description: GTC Watch Party 是由 NVIDIA 本地专家主持，以中文讲解，带领参与者同步观看某一精选演讲并解读和实时答疑的会议形式。这是一个互动式的会议，我们鼓励您在聊天区参与讨论，提出见解或问题。但请注意，原始演讲者可能不会出席本会议。会议主持人：Tricia Mao, Omniverse Project & XR Business Development Manager, NVIDIAThe world’s largest industries are racing to become software-defined, using the latest advancements in AI and simulation technologies to transform their enterprises. Hear from this panel of distinguished luminaries about their journeys to industrial digitalization. Learn how they're leveraging generative AI, open data frameworks, and advanced digital twins to unlock new possibilities across their organizations, from accelerated planning to a new era of agentic-AI powered autonomous operations.How leaders across industries are leveraging AI and simulation to transform their operationsThe role of open standards and data interoperability across the ecosystemHow to prepare for the next era of AI — physical AI在会议开始时间前 15 分钟，登录状态下，下方会出现一个【Join Watch Party Now】的链接。点击该链接，可以在您的电脑上或从您的网络浏览器中启动 Microsoft Teams 参加会议。

sessions.title: アジアをリードするスピーチAI基盤モデルの革新
sessions.speakers: 小島 熙之 (Co-Founder and CEO, Kotoba Technologies, Inc.)
sessions.points:
1. ソブリンAI実現のための課題
2. 業務効率化のためのベストプラクティス
sessions.description: アジア言語に特化したエンドツーエンドのスピーチ基盤モデル開発の軌跡をご紹介します。日本やアジア全体での活用可能性を示すデモを通じて、スピーチAI技術の進化をお届けします。また、モデルのトレーニングや展開において直面したユニークな課題と、それらを乗り越えるためにNVIDIAの最先端技術をどのように活用したかを詳しく解説します。トレーニングのスケールアップや展開スピードの向上を実現した技術力をご体感いただき、アジア市場におけるビジネスやその可能性についてご紹介いたします。

sessions.title: NVIDIA NIM/NeMoで実現する生成AIによる資産運用レポーティングの変革
sessions.speakers: 山田 裕文 (ジェネラルマネジャー, SMBCグローバル・インベストメント＆コンサルティング株式会社) | 白方 健司 (リサーチャー, SMBCグローバル・インベストメント＆コンサルティング株式会社)
sessions.points:
1. Challenges of data centers for an AI service provider
2. Advantages of NVIDIA MGX and OCP DC-MHS
sessions.description: SGICはLlama 3.1をベースに日本語対応したSwallowモデルを、自社の運用レポートデータでファインチューニングし、金融レポーティング専用の生成AIモデルを開発しました。NeMoフレームワークを活用して学習・推論を最適化し、投資家向けレポート作成の効率化と品質向上を実現しています。

sessions.title: Digital and Physical AI Helps Write a New Chapter in Medicine: Q&A From the EMEA Region
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Computation Imaging
sessions.speakers: Kimberly Powell (VP, Healthcare and Life Sciences, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Key research challenges in highly photorealistic 3D digital human synthesis
2. Leveraging large internet-scale data collections, generative AI, and neural 3D scene representations to create AI foundation models for 3D human synthesis
sessions.description: AI is revolutionizing healthcare by seamlessly integrating digital and physical technologies to address critical industry challenges. Digital AI agents now provide round-the-clock, individualized healthcare services, significantly reducing the administrative burden on medical teams. Concurrently, the convergence of AI and biology offers unprecedented insights into biological processes, enabling the exploration of vast therapeutic possibilities. In the physical realm, AI-powered medical devices and robotics enhance precision in diagnostics and treatments while optimizing operational efficiency. Domain-specific computing platforms are fostering a more responsive and patient-centric healthcare ecosystem. These advancements collectively promise to improve health outcomes on a global scale, marking a transformative chapter in medical history. Join Kimberly Powell, NVIDIA’s vice president of healthcare and life sciences, to explore how these advancements are reshaping the future of the industry.

sessions.title: Diffusion Models: The Swiss Army Knife for Generative AI in Science: Q&A From the EMEA Region
sessions.speakers: Arash Vahdat (Principal Scientist and Research Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Building digital health agents deployable anywhere, for almost anything
2. Setting up drug discovery AI factories and the latest in biomolecular foundation models
sessions.description: Diffusion models have transformed generative AI by enabling breakthroughs in diverse applications, such as images, videos, and speech. We'll show that these versatile frameworks extend beyond traditional domains and hold substantial potential for scientific data modeling. Through case studies spanning molecular generation, protein design, and weather modeling, we'll explore the unique opportunities and challenges involved in leveraging diffusion models to answer complex scientific questions.

sessions.title: Agentic AI at the Edge: Real-Time Sentiment Analysis for Engaging Customer Interaction: Q&A From the EMEA Region
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Tracking / Video Analytics
sessions.speakers: Jacque Istok (CEO, Enfuse) | Cahlen Humphreys (Chief AI Architect, Enfuse) | Niels Kasch (Chief Data Scientist, Eviden)
sessions.description: Discover an AI agent that reimagines customer interactions, turning physical spaces into engaging and personalized experiences. Using on-device vision transformers (ViTs) on NVIDIA Jetson, this solution performs real-time sentiment analysis to gauge audience reactions while providing relevant product contents and ensuring rapid responsiveness. It processes sensitive data locally, sending only anonymized metadata to the cloud via Kafka streams, and employs hybrid cloud reinforcement learning and generative AI to tailor advertisement content dynamically. Leveraging NVIDIA DeepStream for real-time video analytics and a closed-loop feedback mechanism, the system continuously improves interactions with customers to maximize their experiences and improve business return on investment.

sessions.title: Application Optimization for NVIDIA Grace CPU: Q&A From the EMEA Region
sessions.topic: AR / VR - AR / VR Development Tools
sessions.speakers: Lukas Krenz (Sr. Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Mathias Wagner (Sr. Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn about the RTXGI SDK’s features and gain insights into its structure
2. We’ll deliver guidance of how to integrate RTXGI into an existing renderer
sessions.description:
The NVIDIA Grace CPU, NVIDIA’s inaugural CPU for the data center, delivers exceptional performance whether paired with NVIDIA’s best-in-class data center GPU or combined with a second Grace CPU in the Grace Superchip. While offering impressive out-of-the-box performance and power efficiency, understanding and optimizing applications is essential to fully harness the capabilities of the Grace CPU.
We'll show how to optimize existing applications — ranging from HPC to data center workloads — to maximize their performance on Grace. We'll cover best practices, including recommendations on compiler options, performance libraries, and coding considerations for targeting the NVIDIA Grace CPU. Discover how to leverage developer tools to detect and bring to life optimization possibilities using a data-driven approach for real-world applications.

sessions.title: The Big Data Challenge of Radio Astronomy: Q&A From the EMEA Region
sessions.speakers: Emma Tolley (Assistant Professor, EPFL) | Etienne Orliac (HPC Application Expert, EPFL)
sessions.points:
1. By training on a variety of different physical systems, our surrogate models for fluid dynamics can more easily adapt to new physics during fine-tuning
2. We develop strategies for unifying scientific modalities within single foundation models
sessions.description: Radio astronomers are engaged in an ambitious new project to detect faster, fainter, and more distant astrophysical phenomena using thousands of individual radio receivers linked through interferometry. The expected deluge of data (up to 300 petabytes per year) poses a significant computational challenge that requires rethinking and redesigning the state-of-the-art data analysis pipelines.

sessions.title: Agentic AI for Physical Operations: Q&A From the EMEA Region
sessions.speakers: Roopa Prabhu (Director Engineering, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Denmark has made a huge investment in AI and partnered with NVIDIA to bring a supercomputer to Denmark
2. The new AI supercomputer powered by NVIDIA is a critical tool that is accelerating research in Denmark, including in healthcare, life sciences, energy, and quantum computing
sessions.description:
Envision an AI agent designed to interact with your warehouse — a complex logistical environment of autonomous robots, potential hazards, and workers. See how we've harnessed the power of spatial AI agents. These agents, leveraging natural language, provide operations teams with a deep understanding of their operating environments and reason-based processes optimization.

We’ll dive deep into building spatial AI agents to complement human operators managing complex operations, powered by NVIDIA NIMs, NVIDIA Llama Nemotron LLM, and NVIDIA Cosmos Nemotron VLM. These agents can quickly analyze and understand objects, spaces, geometry, and spatial relationships in 3D, then can produce actionable, real-time intelligence to manage the flow of goods, optimize space utilization, improve process efficiency, and ensure worker safety.

sessions.title: Build a Strategic Foundation for Enterprise Gen AI: Q&A From the EMEA Region
sessions.speakers: Charlie Boyle (VP, DGX Systems, NVIDIA) | Panagiotis Korfiatis (Ph.D., AI Scientist, Mayo Clinic) | Marie J. Kostecki (Senior Service Owner for Data/HPC, Mayo Clinic)
sessions.points:
1. RTX AI PCs offer the next-gen Windows platform for running AI enabled co-pilots, and agentic apps
2. RTX AI PCs offer a robust developer platform consisting of an ecosystem of tool and frameworks to make it easy for developer to build apps such as Ollama, Llama.cpp, ORT-DML
sessions.description: Generative AI is now central to global business strategies, with a recent survey showing that nine in 10 companies are already deploying or piloting the technology. However, with this integration comes the challenge of scaling AI development and deployment across the enterprise. We’ll delve into the critical elements required to operationalize Gen AI at scale — including proven infrastructure with a comprehensive software stack that enables high reliability and uptime, high visibility into cluster and job status, and simplified workload management to maximize developer productivity.

sessions.title: Toward Multidisciplinary Scientific Foundation Models: Q&A From the EMEA Region
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Large Language Models (LLMs)
sessions.speakers: Francois Lanusse (Research Scientist, National Center for Scientific Research (CNRS))
sessions.points:
1. Learn about the Lightning AI open-source stack, a high-performance set of libraries for training, fine-tuning, and deploying AI systems that builds upon and extends the PyTorch ecosystem
2. See how the Lightning stack can cover the full life cycle, from data preparation to deployment, with practical examples and particular focus on distributed training and high-performance inference
sessions.description: We present the PolymathicAI approach to building foundation models for scientific applications, with a focus on bridging the traditional boundaries between data modalities and scientific domains. See our results on building foundational surrogate models for fluids, trained on a wide diversity of different physical systems, as well as our research on multi-modal foundation models to bridge different scientific data types, with a concrete example from the field of astrophysics.

sessions.title: Accelerate Model Development and Deployment for Drug Discovery and Life Sciences: Q&A From the EMEA Region
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Programming Languages / Compilers
sessions.speakers: Anthony Costa (Director, Digital Biology, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Discover programming languages and libraries supported by the NVHPC compilers to accelerate Fortran, C, and C++ code across HPC platforms
2. Understand performance portability, programming productivity, and performance tuning trade-offs, and learn how to utilize NVIDIA HPC SDK to meet your goals
sessions.description: Learn about the latest developments and the next generation of NVIDIA software to accelerate drug discovery and life sciences. BioNeMo is NVIDIA's platform to accelerate state-of-the-art chemistry, biology, and genomics foundation modeling. NVIDIA Parabricks is our state-of-the-art genomics platform that accelerates our understanding of biology. Together with the entire NVIDIA full-stack computing platform, the technology to discover the nature of biology and disease, and to develop new drugs and therapeutics, has never been faster and more accessible. We'll discuss the latest advancements in the capabilities of both platforms, aspects of our future roadmap, and real-world demonstrations of successful programs leveraging our technology.

sessions.title: Building World Models in the Era of Generative AI: Q&A From the EMEA Region
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Tracking / Video Analytics
sessions.speakers: Ed Balduf (Cloud Integration Architect - DGX Cloud, NVIDIA) | Ming-Yu Liu (VP Generative AI Research, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how vision-language models (VLMs) are revolutionizing visual understanding, with insights into their advantages and limitations
2. Master strategies to overcome VLM integration challenges in production pipelines, optimizing the balance between computational costs and performance gains
sessions.description: Today’s developers are struggling to get accelerated infrastructure optimized for the demands of modern LLM customization. As model sizes increase, so will the demand for high-performance compute. Therefore, developers must use resources more efficiently. In addition, there’s an overwhelming array of tools, services, open-source models, and platforms to customize generative AI, but many developers don’t know where to begin. Before productive training begins, many offerings require developers to validate and test environments before fine-tuning occurs, amounting to loss of resources and slower time-to-train. Learn how to build a world-class model using NVIDIA DGX Cloud, with all the tools and capabilities you need, starting from data curation through model training to fine-tuning and inferencing. See how NVIDIA DGX Cloud, a fully-managed platform with high performance compute clusters, optimized at every layer, provides Day One productivity, allowing you to focus on delivering AI-driven outcomes.

sessions.title: A New Era of Generalist Robotics: The Rise of Humanoids — Q&A From the EMEA Region
sessions.speakers: Lukas Krenz (Sr. Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Mathias Wagner (Sr. Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how to compile your application optimally for the NVIDIA Grace CPU
2. Discover which performance libraries can help to improve your application performance on NVIDIA Grace CPUs
sessions.description: The ChatGPT of robotics has arrived. Humanoid robots will be one of the largest form-factor deployments of generalist robotics the world has ever seen. Hear from luminaries across some of the world's leading humanoid robotics companies about their outlook on the future of humanoid robotics, and what it'll take from foundation models, simulation technology, and computing to get there.

sessions.title: AI Agents: Shaping the Future of Cybersecurity: Q&A From the EMEA Region
sessions.speakers: Alon Schindel (VP of AI and Threat Research, Wiz)
sessions.points:
1. The challenge of adapting internet-scale foundation models to physical robotic tasks
2. The importance of data strategies, and how each are approaching real-world and simulated data
sessions.description: Generative AI is poised to revolutionize cybersecurity by deploying fleets of intelligent agents capable of continuously analyzing enterprise-wide data to detect and respond to threats in real time. Join leading AI and security experts as they discuss how these AI agents are set to fundamentally transform the landscape of cybersecurity.

sessions.title: RAPIDS in 2025: Accelerated Data Science Everywhere: Q&A From the EMEA Region
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Image / Video Detection & Recognition
sessions.speakers: Nick Becker (Sr. Technical Product Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Intelligent learning of surface defects using deep neural network architecture
2. Possible to perform regular inspections at a speed up to 100 kph (60 mph)
sessions.description: The RAPIDS open source library suite is the foundation for accelerated AI and data science workloads. It supports dataframes, machine learning, graph analytics, vector databases, and LLM-based workflows. In this session, NVIDIA technical leaders will walk data scientists and engineers through new features, zero code change interfaces, and powerful optimizations, and give a peek at what’s around the corner.

sessions.title: Transforming the Energy Sector With Generative Spatial AI: Q&A From the EMEA Region
sessions.speakers: Greg Fallon (Chief Executive Officer, Geminus AI) | Kari Anne Kjolaas-Holland (Senior Vice President Digital Services & Operations, Schlumberger (SLB))
sessions.points:
1. Discover how to optimize root MILP p solutions for faster, more efficient decision-making with cuOpt
2. Explore the impact of GPU-accelerated optimization on large-scale LP and MILP problems
sessions.description: Generative AI is revolutionizing the energy sector by breaking the limits of language models with physics-based reasoning capabilities, allowing models to interpret and respond to events in the physical world without any prior training. This new frontier of generative spatial AI is enhancing operational efficiencies and expediting the scaling of the new energy sources that our world so urgently needs. Join two leading pioneers in energy and generative spatial AI to discover how this groundbreaking technology is being leveraged across the value chain to boost performance and reduce emissions.

sessions.title: AI Agents for Real-Time Video Understanding and Summarization: Q&A From the EMEA Region
sessions.topic: Cybersecurity - Accelerated Computing / AI for Security
sessions.speakers: Adam Ryason (Product Manager, Visual Insight Agent (VIA) Microservices, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn how generative AI is transforming cybersecurity by enabling intelligent agents across the enterprise
2. Learn about opportunities to significantly improve the efficiency and effectiveness of security measures
sessions.description: The NVIDIA AI Blueprint for video search and summarization enables the creation of interactive analytical agents that reason through massive amounts of video, assess physical processes, and provide decision-making insights to streamline operations. The blueprint combines powerful vision language models, large language models, and NeMo retriever into a full suite of software for building, fine-tuning, and deploying a diverse set of visual understanding agents. These interactive AI Agents leverage real-time, multi-camera streaming and long-context understanding in our factories, warehouses, airports and cities — helping operations teams to make better decisions, faster, from richer insights and more natural interactions. Learn more about NVIDIA AI Blueprint for video search and summarization and how you can customize and deploy on-premises or in the cloud.

sessions.title: AI Accelerating a Country: Advances from Gefion, an AI Supercomputer in Denmark: Q&A From the EMEA Region
sessions.topic: Computer Vision / Video Analytics - Tracking / Video Analytics
sessions.speakers: Nadia Carlsten (CEO, Danish Centre for AI Innovation)
sessions.description:
Learn about an exciting strategic collaboration that is bringing large-scale AI computing power to Denmark, and how the new AI supercomputer is accelerating the work of many innovators. The goal of the Danish Centre for AI Innovation (DCAI) is to accelerate research and innovation in fields from healthcare and life sciences to the green transition, supporting the development of innovative solutions to the world’s biggest problems. 

Hear from DCAI’s CEO Nadia Carlsten about what it takes to stand up one of world’s largest supercomputers, and how customers from academia, startups, and large companies are using this new facility to make headway in healthcare, life sciences, and quantum computing.

sessions.title: From Design to Operations: Optimize Data Center Energy and Water Efficiency: Q&A From the EMEA Region
sessions.speakers: Ranjitha Gurunath Kulkarni (Senior Machine Learning Engineer, Dropbox)
sessions.description: How do you enhance and measure your data center’s energy efficiency? Industry experts from NVIDIA, Vertiv, Cadence, and Isambard AI will share real-world examples of cutting-edge solutions designed to enhance the sustainability of data center operations. They'll cover strategies for optimizing energy consumption, water efficiency, and reducing carbon footprints, highlighting the latest innovations in accelerated computing, cooling, digital twins, and sustainable supercomputing.

sessions.title: Next-Gen Data Centers: Intelligent Automation and Integrated Observability for Peak Developer Productivity
sessions.speakers: Stefan Mesken (VP of Research, DeepL) | Pradyumna Desale (Group Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Whitney Zhao (NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Use the Nsight Systems DataService to easily import profiling data into Python environment
2. Better understand the performance of your application by executing or modifying existing recipes
sessions.description: In the era of trillion-parameter models, even the most tech-savvy enterprises are seeing only 30% effective utilization of their infrastructure, with AI workloads frequently failing, creating time-to-market delays impacting return on investment. As AI workloads grow in scale and demand larger resource pools, a robust, software-powered, full-stack data center platform is essential to ensure developers can efficiently build and scale on infrastructure offering best-in-class uptime and effortless IT manageability.

sessions.title: Mastering NVIDIA Nsight: GPU Performance Analysis for Ray Tracing Applications
sessions.speakers: Jeffrey Kiel (Sr. Engineering Manager, Graphics Developer Tools, NVIDIA) | Aurelio Reis (Director, Graphics Developer Tools, NVIDIA) | Axel Mamode (Graphics Performance Tools Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. What would be a more flexible and domain-specialized framework for hardware design: a traditional general agent flow or an innovative agentic framework?
2. Leveraging task graphs and flexible single-AI/multi-AI agent configurations, combined with domain-specific tools and knowledge, has shown promising results in cell layout optimization, Verilog syntax error correction, Verilog and DRC code generation, and timing debugging for problematic blocks, nets, and wires, based on experimental findings
sessions.description: Learn how to use NVIDIA Nsight Graphics to profile and optimize both graphics and compute workloads, focusing on ray tracing applications. You’ll analyze GPU performance through trace data from CUDA, DirectX, and Vulkan, identifying bottlenecks at the source-code and GPU assembly levels. By mastering tools like Flame Graphs and the “top-level triage” workflow, you’ll gain the skills needed to optimize and debug shaders and compute code for maximum efficiency.Prerequisite(s):Basic understanding of GPU programming (CUDA, Direct3D, or Vulkan).Experience with 3D graphics.Familiarity with GPU architecture and profiling/debugging tools.

sessions.title: Leveraging NIM and GPU Acceleration to Transform Chip Design with AI
sessions.topic: Content Creation / Rendering - Rendering Engines / Pipelines / Tools
sessions.speakers: Anand Thiruvengadam (Sr. Director of Product Management, head of the Memory Segment, Synopsys) | Geetha Rangarajan (Director of Product Management, Artificial Intelligence, Synopsys)
sessions.points:
1. Gain a deep understanding of how GPU hardware interacts with both graphics and compute workloads through profiling
2. Learn to identify critical performance bottlenecks in graphics workloads using real-world data
sessions.description: AI-driven techniques are tackling the escalating complexity of design and PPA demands, optimizing specific workloads, and uncovering new insights in the design process. At Hot Chips 2024, Synopsys and NVIDIA showcased the transformative impact of AI-assisted design, utilizing generative AI to accelerate semiconductor development. This GTC talk will explore innovations in AI-assisted design techniques, generative AI, domain-adapted LLMs, and NIM for on-prem chip design. It will also delve into how accelerated computing is advancing chip design verification and semiconductor manufacturing. Synopsys' optical proximity correction software, powered by NVIDIA's cuLitho library, leverages GPU’s parallel processing for enhanced precision and efficiency. NVIDIA's Grace-Hopper architecture further boosts SPICE simulation performance by 2X, reducing turnaround times while maintaining accuracy.

sessions.title: Learn how Gen AI Image Pipelines are Shaping up in Various industries With Hands-on Workflows
sessions.speakers: Shreyans Dhankhar (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Avinash Chakravarthi (Sr. Solutions Architect, NVIDIA) | Sakshi Tyagi (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. AI-Driven Design Optimization: Learn how AI-assisted design techniques and generative AI technologies through the integration of NIMs enhance the efficiency of chip design workloads, addressing complexity and automating repetitive tasks.
2. Accelerated Lithography and Manufacturing: Discover how NVIDIA GPUs and the cuLitho software library significantly accelerate optical proximity correction, enhancing precision, efficiency, and speed in semiconductor manufacturing.
sessions.description: Generating and understanding images are the two core areas of image-based workflows. We'll cover how the media & entertainment, retail/fashion, and healthcare industries are leveraging diffusion and transformer models together for Gen AI workflows. We'll emphasize emerging use cases while addressing how conventional computer vision pipelines are impacted by Gen AI, and its consequences. NIMs, ComfyUI, and TensorRT are the core components to demonstrate these workflows.Prerequisite(s):Awareness of general computer vision pipelines.Basic understanding of deep learning and Python programming.

sessions.title: Training Perception AI Models With Synthetic Data Generated From Isaac Sim
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Industrial Digitalization / Digital Twin
sessions.speakers: Zoe Ryan (Solutions Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Discover how Reality Cloud Studio and NVIDIA Omniverse help businesses achieve high-quality rendered views in hours, not weeks
2. Go from scanned point clouds to fully to a fully textured, cloud-processed mesh
sessions.description: In this hands-on lab, we'll using NVIDIA Omniverse and Isaac Sim to generate synthetic data for training AI models that control robotic manipulators.By the end of the lab, we'll provide hands-on experience in developing pipelines to create synthetic datasets, training perception models, and deploying these models in simulated environments before bringing them to the real world.Prerequisite(s):Experience with OpenUSD, NVIDIA Omniverse and 3D CAD software.Experience in Python.Basic knowledge of NVIDIA Isaac Sim and Isaac ROS.

sessions.title: From RAG to Agents: Building Enterprise Products with Generative AI
sessions.speakers: Ranjitha Gurunath Kulkarni (Senior Machine Learning Engineer, Dropbox)
sessions.description:
How can an LLM effectively navigate the diverse complexities of enterprise systems and data - emails, documents, calendars, messages, tasks, tickets, line of business
systems? How do you enable precise orchestration and execution of multi-step workflows while ensuring accuracy, predictability, and reliability in production? This
session will explore how Dropbox Dash leverages cutting edge advances in RAG and Agents to tackle these challenges. From integrating heterogenous data sources and optimizing task orchestration by leveraging advances in powerful LLM models, we share our journey in building scalable and secure AI solutions. We will discuss how robust evaluation frameworks and architectural innovations help us ensure reliable, enterprise-ready systems.

sessions.title: Get Ready for NVIDIA Certification
sessions.speakers: Aeshah Hadges (Certification Program Manager, NVIDIA) | Gary Fluitt (Technical Certification Manager, NVIDIA) | Marco Alves (Technical Certification Lead, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Gain insights into leveraging NVIDIA NeMo Framework in Langflow for tasks like data ingestion and model fine-tuning
2. See how to adapt and scale multi-agent systems for various domains, beyond ecommerce
sessions.description: Ready to showcase your AI expertise and stand out in the crowd? Join us for an exclusive certification overview session and take the first step toward becoming NVIDIA certified.In this session, we’ll help you figure out which NVIDIA certification best fits your career goals and walk you through the preparation process. You’ll get general exam hints and tips as well as details on exam topics and weightings, recommended training, and practice questions for the following exams:NVIDIA-Certified Associate: Generative AI and LLMsNVIDIA-Certified Associate: Multimodal Generative AINVIDIA-Certified Associate: AI Infrastructure and OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI InfrastructureNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: Accelerated Data Science (Coming Soon)Once you are ready, you can take any of the certification exams at GTC during the following times:Monday, Mar 17 | 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM and 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM PDTTuesday, Mar 18 | 1:00 PM - 5:00 PM PDTWednesday, Mar 19 | 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM and 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM PDTThursday, Mar 20 | 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM and 1:00 PM - 5:00 PM PDTFriday, Mar 21 | 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM and 1:00 PM - 4:00 PM PDTDon't miss this exclusive opportunity to validate your expertise at no cost. Be among the first to earn your NVIDIA certification and stand out in the competitive fields of AI and accelerated computing.Get certified and secure your invitation to the exclusive NVIDIA Certified Reception on Thursday, March 20th, 7:30 PM – 9:30 PM.

sessions.title: Accelerating Linguistic Diversity: GPU-Powered Corpus Curation With NVIDIA NeMo Curator for Spanish, French, and Other Non-English Languages
sessions.topic: Models / Libraries / Frameworks - Accelerated Computing Libraries
sessions.speakers: Adam Henryk Grzywaczewski (Sr. Deep Learning Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Miguel Martinez (Sr. Deep Learning Data Scientist, NVIDIA) | Meriem Bendris (Sr. Deep Learning Data Scientist, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Learn to formulate portfolio optimization as a numerical optimization with constraints using risk-reward paradigms with different risk metrics
2. Delve into accelerated optimization using cuOpt on NVIDIA hardware
sessions.description: Developing LLMs for non-English languages often faces the challenge of limited or imbalanced datasets. We present a cutting-edge approach to curating high-quality text corpora for languages like Spanish, French, and beyond, leveraging the power of GPU acceleration. We'll delve into the methodologies for constructing a comprehensive corpus, starting with basic heuristics for text selection and cleaning through more sophisticated techniques, such as semantic deduplication. Finally, we'll explore the innovative strategies for synthetic data generation, a crucial step in augmenting the dataset where real-world examples are scarce.We'll show how NVIDIA's NeMo Curator can perform these tasks with remarkable speed and efficiency. You'll leave with practical insights into corpus curation workflows that can be applied to a variety of non-English languages, paving the way for more inclusive and representative language technologies.Prerequisite(s):A solid programming background.

sessions.title: Scaling Meta's Infrastructure for Heterogenous AI Use-Cases and Operational Efficiency
sessions.speakers: Abhinav Jauhri (Research Scientist, Meta Platforms) | Tyler Graf (Production Systems Engineer in Hardware Design and Release to Production, Meta Platforms)
sessions.description: Learn about techniques that have reliably scaled Meta's infrastructure with GPUs. We'll review several dependencies needed to determine whether GPUs can operate efficiently, automate triaging of issues,  accelerate stability in terms of interruptions to jobs, and how we orchestrate the flow to minimize idle GPU time. Hear about our process for stabilizing new hardware SKUs such that they are effective in production more quickly.

sessions.title: Get NVIDIA Certified
sessions.speakers: Aeshah Hadges (Certification Program Manager, NVIDIA) | Gary Fluitt (Technical Certification Manager, NVIDIA) | Marco Alves (Technical Certification Lead, NVIDIA)
sessions.description: For the first time ever, GTC 2025 attendees will have the exclusive opportunity to earn NVIDIA certifications at no cost. Seize this unique opportunity to validate your expertise, showcase your skills, and join the ranks of NVIDIA-certified professionals. Seats are limited and available on a first-come, first-served basis—be sure to register onsite to secure your spot!Why Certify?Validate your expertise in cutting-edge NVIDIA technologies.Boost your career prospects and earning potential.Join an elite community of NVIDIA-certified professionals.Available Certifications:NVIDIA-Certified Associate: Generative AI and LLMsNVIDIA-Certified Associate: Multimodal Generative AINVIDIA-Certified Associate: AI Infrastructure and OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI InfrastructureNVIDIA-Certified Professional: AI OperationsNVIDIA-Certified Professional: Accelerated Data Science (Coming Soon)How to Register for an exam slot:Register for the conference.Review preparation materials thoroughly before attempting the exam.Add this session to your schedule.Sign up for an exam slot onsite.Arrive early to secure your spot – seats are limited and fill quickly.Please note the following:This promotion is available to in-person attendees only, and only available at GTC.The last exams will begin at 3:30 PM or 4:00 PM depending on the schedule.Get certified and secure your invitation to the exclusive NVIDIA Certified Reception on Thursday, March 20th, 7:30 PM – 9:30 PM.

sessions.title: Turbocharge Prescriptive Analytics and Optimization With GPU Acceleration
sessions.speakers: Mitch McKay (Engineering Manager, SimpleRose) | Mark Ostroot (Director of Engineering, SimpleRose)
sessions.points:
1. Deploy generative AI microservices on NVIDIA Jetson
2. AWS IoT Greengrass to enable cloud-to-edge connectivity and device management
sessions.description:
As industries face increasing demands in logistics, scheduling, and portfolio management, traditional optimization approaches struggle to scale efficiently. SimpleRose integrates NVIDIA cuOpt to accelerate linear programming (LP) and mixed-integer linear programming (MILP), delivering significant speedups without compromising accuracy.
Join us to:
•	Discover how to optimize root MILP p solutions for faster, more efficient decision-making with cuOpt
•	Explore the impact of GPU-accelerated optimization on large-scale LP and MILP problems
•	Gain insights into real-world use cases and performance breakthroughs enabled by cutting-edge optimization technology

sessions.title: How to Accelerate a Multimodal LLM-Based Real-Time Video Generation and Life-Like Interactive System on a Digital Human Platform by TensorRT-LLM
sessions.speakers: Yisong Li (Solution Architect, NVIDIA) | Zhen Huang (Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Weihua Jian (Manager of the Kuaishou Digital Human Platform, Kuaishou)
sessions.points:
1. Conventional retrieval techniques that work well for open-source data often underperform when applied to domain-specific databases
2. Hybrid retrieval approaches that combine vector-based retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) with structured RAG (e.g., knowledge graph-based RAG) are better at answering complex multi-hop reasoning questions/tasks
sessions.description: Kuaishou VGI (Visual Generation and Interaction) team has implemented a next-generation digital human platform, powered by the state-of-the-art, end-to-end Multimodal Interaction language model (LM), and industry-leading Life-Like Interactive System architecture. We'll share our innovative technical implementation and best practices using NVIDIA GPU and TensorRT-LLM, which can achieve industry-leading real-time, high-quality, low-latency, full duplex, and multimodal user experience. We'll also share the insights to the future development of lifelike digital humans.

sessions.title: Improve Chip Design Using Intelligent Retrieval and Agent-Driven Workflow Innovations
sessions.speakers: Bonita Bhaskaran (Sr. Manager, DFX Data Analytics, NVIDIA) | Sanmitra Banerjee (Sr. DFX Methodology Engineer, DFX Data Analytics, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand why DRAM use significantly drives up AI system costs
2. Learn how KIOXIA-developed software can improve performance while lowering DRAM usage
sessions.description: Several steps in the chip design flow can be streamlined using generative AI to shorten production cycles. This can encompass bug and issue tracking, generating verification tests, and running simulations to debug complex issues using intelligent agents. See how we can use next-gen retrieval techniques to extract relevant information from domain-specific databases. We'll also demonstrate how we can create an agentic ecosystem that leverages these retrieval methods to iteratively solve complex issues in the chip design cycle.Important:Connect with the Experts sessions are interactive sessions that give you a unique opportunity to meet, in either a group or one-on-one setting, with the minds behind NVIDIA’s products and research to get your questions answered. You can meet with experts on a first-come, first-served basis.

sessions.title: Designing VLM-Based AI Agents for Large-Scale Video Analysis
sessions.speakers: Oran Shayer (AI Research Lead, AppsFlyer)
sessions.points:
1. Review diffusion models applied to continuous data (images, weather, atom coordinates) and discrete data (text, atom type, etc.)
2. Learn how diffusion models are applied in different domains, including molecule or protein generation and weather modeling
sessions.description: Dive deep into innovative architectures for building vision language models (VLMs)-based AI agents for large-scale video processing pipelines. Explore strategies to maximize the benefits of VLMs and their comprehensive visual understanding capabilities, balanced with computational efficiency.

sessions.title: Accelerate Science With NVIDIA HPC Compilers
sessions.speakers: Nikolaos Tselepidis (Sr. Compute Developer Technology Engineer, NVIDIA) | Anastasia Stulova (HPC Compiler Programming Models Architect, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Large-scale LLM training corpora creation is no longer prohibitively difficult
2. NeMo Curator can dramatically reduce the cost and time associated with the process, making it within reach of almost any research group.
sessions.description: Learn how to accelerate Fortran, C, and C++ applications on multicore CPUs or GPUs. Explore popular HPC programming models supported by NVIDIA HPC SDK — OpenACC, OpenMP, CUDA, or even standard parallelism in Fortran and C++. We'll cover diverse solutions offered by the SDK to meet the unique requirements of performance portability, productivity, and performance tuning with the emphasis on the latest GPU platforms, such as Grace Hopper.

sessions.title: Explore AI-Assisted Developer Tools for Accelerated Computing Application Development
sessions.speakers: Matt Frazier (Director Software Engineering, AI Technologies for Developer Tools, NVIDIA) | Abhinav Bhatele (Associate Professor, University of Maryland) | Sana Damani (Research Scientist, NVIDIA) | Eran Yahav (CTO, Tabnine) | Neha Batra (Microsoft Github) | Eiso Kant (Founder, Poolside.ai)
sessions.points:
1. Insights into how accelerated computing can drive energy efficiency in data centers
2. Innovations in cooling systems designed to improve water and energy use
sessions.description: AI-assisted developer tools are evolving rapidly and provide developers with unprecedented productivity boosts. Our panel will discuss the latest developments on how AI is changing our approach to software development by looking at the latest features, capabilities, and trends from the commercial solutions, and areas of research that will shape the next generation of developer tools — from code generation to code refactoring and porting for performance or maintenance, and more. We'll also discuss how supporting accelerated computing can be accelerated by AI and what makes it different from traditional software development approaches. Our panelists will represent the commercial solutions available in the marketplace, as well as NVIDIA research, academics, and NVIDIA's AI-assisted developer tools team.

sessions.title: Open-Sora: Democratizing Efficient Video Production for All
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Programming Languages / Compilers
sessions.speakers: James Demmel (Chief Strategy Officer, University of California, Berkeley; HPC-AI Technology, Inc.) | Yang You (Founder and Chair, National University of Singapore; HPC-AI Technology, Inc.)
sessions.description: Video generation is still in its early stages, similar to the development of language models like GPT-1 in the LLM domain. We'll share our experiences in building large AI video generation models and explore the latest technologies, including data processing pipelines, training strategies, model architecture, training codes, and model weights — all of which are open source on our GitHub. We aim to help you use or build your own video generation models, advancing AI video generation in filmmaking, advertising, marketing, gaming, and more.

sessions.title: Unleash Generative AI Microservices at the Edge With NVIDIA Jetson and AWS IoT Greengrass
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Industrial Digitalization / Digital Twin
sessions.speakers: Chitoku Yato (Sr. Technical Product Marketing Manager, NVIDIA) | Channa Samynathan (Solutions Architect, Amazon Web Services) | Yong Ji (Senior Solutions Architect, Amazon Web Services)
sessions.description: Push the boundaries of edge computing by leveraging the power of NVIDIA Jetson alongside the seamless connectivity of AWS IoT Greengrass. In this hands-on lab, you’ll learn how to deploy generative AI microservices on Jetson devices, both directly and through the cloud using AWS IoT Greengrass. Engage in practical exercises to enable edge-to-cloud connectivity, optimize deployment pipelines, and orchestrate device management, all while exploring the transformative potential of generative AI at the edge and ready-to-deploy AI microservices. Don’t forget to bring your laptop for an interactive, step-by-step learning experience.Prerequisite(s):Basic Linux command familiarity.

sessions.title: Advanced RAG Pipelines: Engineer Scalable Retrieval Systems for Enterprise AI
sessions.speakers: Meriem Bendris (Sr. Deep Learning Data Scientist, NVIDIA) | Bilge Yücel (Developer Relations Engineer for Haystack by deepset, Deepset AI)
sessions.points:
1. Using NVIDIA Enterprise AI offerings to optimize on-premises retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipeline implementation
2. Optimizing RAG to run in a more constrained environment
sessions.description: Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems integrate the reasoning capabilities of large language models and information retrieval by searching for the relevant content from a large corpus to generate informed, accurate responses. Learn how to build advanced, custom RAG applications. You'll explore the design of an end-to-end RAG system, including data preparation, indexing, retrieval, and response generation. Then, we'll show how you can leverage Haystack pipelines with multiple NVIDIA NIMs such as the LLM, text embedding, and reranking microservices to self-host on a Kubernetes production environment at scale. Finally, we'll discuss AI models evaluation and customization for specific RAG tasks.

sessions.title: Challenges and Breakthroughs in RAG Implementation for On-Prem Industrial Copilot Assistants
sessions.speakers: Mostafa Gharieb (Sr. Research Engineer, Siemens) | Michael Schrapp (Global Head of Industrial AI Innovations, Siemens)
sessions.points:
1. CuLitho Integration: Recent adoption of NVIDIA's cuLitho library for further performance improvements in computational lithography
2. GPU-Accelerated OPC: How Samsung is leveraging NVIDIA GPUs to accelerate optical proximity correction workloads
sessions.description: Deep dive into Siemens' Industrial Copilot for operations with a special focus on integrating operational time-series data as industrial context, time-series generative search breakthroughs, and optimized agentic design to meet performance and quality-of-response metrics by shop floor target personas.

sessions.title: Accelerate Computational Lithography for Optical Proximity Correction
sessions.speakers: Seongtae Jeong (Fellow, VP with Executive Privilege, Samsung Electronics)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the capabilities of NVIDIA BioNeMo and Parabricks
2. Understand successful use cases leveraging our life sciences products
sessions.description: We'll show how Samsung has accelerated its optical proximity correction (OPC) workloads using NVIDIA GPUs and the newly adopted NVIDIA cuLitho. With increasing lithography complexity in semiconductor manufacturing, GPU acceleration through cuLitho has enabled Samsung to achieve significant performance improvements, enhancing both speed and efficiency in critical OPC processes.

sessions.title: Secure Your Data and Model IP While Improving Productivity
sessions.speakers: Emily Sakata (Product Manager, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Get a high-level overview of the international next-generation radio interferometry project, the Square Kilometer Array, and the associated computational challenges
2. Learn how GPU computing can accelerate high-throughput workflows for large scientific infrastructures
sessions.description:
Every day, people discover more ways to use AI to improve productivity and create more value out of the data. Data is the new gold. Varied datasets and models trained with it require more resources to ensure that the output is meaningful to the users. It's paramount to protect both data privacy and model intellectual property (IP) in the world of AI. 

While traditional solutions exist for protecting data at rest and in transit, we use confidential compute/Secure AI to protect data while it's in use. We'll walk through the different Blackwell platform-level solutions to solve this problem.

sessions.title: Programming Blackwell Tensor Cores with CUTLASS
sessions.speakers: Cris Cecka (NVIDIA) | Mihir Awatramani (NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Overview of the accelerated data processing ecosystem and capabilities
2. Key announcements and updates
sessions.description: The release of CUTLASS 3.8 enables programmers to write optimized Tensor Core kernels for the NVIDIA Blackwell architecture. This session provides an overview of both the new features in the Blackwell architecture and the complementary CuTe + CUTLASS capability. We'll conclude with an in-depth example of how to construct a performant GEMM kernel using CUTLASS.

sessions.title: An Introduction to NVIDIA Cosmos for Physical AI
sessions.speakers: Asawaree Bhide (Robotics Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. It's important to keep the end customer in mind
2. Different workloads exhibit different issues on hardware
sessions.description: In this introductory, hands-on course, learners will explore NVIDIA Cosmos™, a platform of generative world foundation models (WFM), advanced tokenizers, guardrails, and an accelerated data processing and curation pipeline built to accelerate the development of physical AI.Prerequisite(s):An understanding of AI model training, fine tuning, and deep learning frameworks.Experience with Python programming.Basic experience with 3D software and workflows.

sessions.title: Accelerating Portfolio Optimization
sessions.speakers: Ioana Boier (Global Head of Capital Markets Strategy, NVIDIA) | Peihan Huo (Ph.D. Student at Cornell University) | Yigal Jhirad (Portfolio Manager/Head of Quantitative and Derivatives Strategies, Cohen & Steers)
sessions.points:
1. Policy and Ethical Framework: Establish clear objectives, constraints, and ethical boundaries to guide the AI’s behavior
2. Privacy and Real-Time Perception: Use on-device ViTs on NVIDIA Jetson with DeepStream and generative AI for intelligent, context-aware analysis, transmitting only anonymized data for privacy
sessions.description: Join our in-depth exploration of cutting-edge techniques to accelerate portfolio optimization on GPUs. We'll unpack how to formulate optimization problems in terms of risk-reward trade-offs under various constraints. We'll discuss how to transform traditionally sequential optimization algorithms into parallel ones that can leverage GPU acceleration to manage complex, high-dimensional investment portfolios efficiently. Concrete examples using FX options and equity portfolios will be provided.Prerequisite(s):Familiarity with Python and Jupyter Lab environments.

sessions.title: Enable Human Telepresence with Generative AI
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Programming Languages / Compilers
sessions.speakers: Shalini De Mello (Director of Research, New Experiences and Distinguished Research Scientist, NVIDIA)
sessions.description: We present the key research challenges in enabling highly photorealistic digital human synthesis. Departing from the industry-wide de-facto approach of using expensive multi-view human data captures, we present our innovative techniques that successfully harness the power of generative AI, large internet-scale data, and state-of-the-art neural 3D scene representations to create AI-based foundation models for highly photorealistic 3D digital human synthesis. We present the numerous downstream applications enabled by these foundational pieces of technology for digital humans, including, AI-mediated telepresence, content creation for film and gaming, and digital agents. We deep dive into AI-mediated telepresence and highlight many practical considerations encountered while building real-time cloud-enabled streaming systems for such telepresence solutions. Finally, we highlight open frontiers, which are avenues for further research in digital human understanding and creation.

sessions.title: How can OpenShift AI and NVIDIA NIM Help You Accelerate and Optimize GenAI Application Development
sessions.speakers: Tomer Figenblat (Senior Software Engineer, Red Hat) | Babak Mozaffari (Distinguished Engineer & Director, Red Hat)
sessions.points:
1. Introduction to Kuaishou's state-of-the-art design of end-to-end Multimodal Interactive LM, a "GPT-4o like + video generation" model that achieves an industry-leading lifelike user experience
2. How we balance high-quality multimodal interactive effects with extremely low latency, especially addressing the significant challenges of real-time video generation
sessions.description: In this session, we'll explore how Red Hat OpenShift AI empowers developers to create and deliver AI-enabled applications at scale across hybrid cloud environments. By offering native support for NVIDIA NIM, OpenShift AI unlocks seamless integration with state-of-the-art NVIDIA technologies, ensuring optimized performance. Learn how you can leverage NVIDIA NIM to deploy Generative AI (GenAI) applications on OpenShift AI for maximum efficiency and flexibility. This session will demonstrate the advantages of combining these platforms, including enhanced portability, enterprise-level security, and scalable deployment across both private and public clouds.

sessions.title: Build Digital Humans, Visual Agents, and AI-Generated Podcasts for RTX PCs And Workstations
sessions.speakers: Annamalai Chockalingam (Sr. Product Manager - GeForce, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Day-One Productivity: Use a fully managed service to maximize GPU utilization and increase return on investment. Learn how DGX Cloud can provide resource quotas and efficient GPU allocation across multiple teams
2. Achieve a multi-cloud strategy through an open, flexible platform that provides portability and allows us to port your AI and machine learning pipelines anywhere
sessions.description: NVIDIA RTX AI provides an end-to-end, GPU-accelerated platform for building and deploying state-of-the-art AI models across PC and cloud. Developers can use RTX to build private, on-device AI that keeps your data and applications secure, while tapping into the power of AI on your PC. We'll showcase and guide developers on the end-to-end suite of tools to streamline development and deploy outstandingly fast, AI-enabled applications for the 100 million Windows RTX PCs.

sessions.title: Nsight Analysis System: Build Custom Python Analysis Scripts to Summarize Performance and Reveal Bottlenecks With Single- and Multi-Node Applications
sessions.speakers: Joan Yi (Senior Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Jay Kreibich (Senior Software Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. LLMファインチューニングの方法
2. NVIDIA NeMoフレームワークを使ったトレーニング
sessions.description: In this hands-on lab, we'll show you how to write custom analysis scripts, called recipes, to gain deeper insights into the performance of your application using the Analysis System of the Nsight Systems profiler. We'll walk through multiple examples to show the Nsight Analysis System functions that can process, filter, correlate, and visualize the various hardware and software events captured by Nsight Systems. We'll also show how to upgrade a single-report recipe to a multi-report recipe in order to identify performance issues in large-scale HPC and cloud applications.Prerequisite(s):Familiarity with Nsight Systems, Python, Pandas, and Jupyter Notebooks.

sessions.title: Real-Time Multi-GPU Rendering for Codec Avatars
sessions.speakers: Vasu Agrawal (Research Engineering Manager, Meta)
sessions.points:
1. Hands-on experience with deploying lightweight LLMs (Gemma 2 3B and Llama 3 3B) on a cost-effective Jetson Nano cluster for edge AI processing
2. Essential patterns for implementing edge-cloud failover mechanisms, ensuring continuous AI operations during network disruptions
sessions.description: Learn practical strategies to accelerate and scale real-time, low-latency rendering workloads with multiple GPUs. We'll share examples from building "time machine"-style Codec Avatar virtual reality (VR) experiences, which provide a glimpse into the future of telepresence, and offer ideas on fully leveraging cutting-edge hardware.

sessions.title: Multi-Modality and Multi-AI Agents for Hardware Design
sessions.speakers: Mark HO (Sr. Research Scientist, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Discover how to scale workload capacity with intelligent, automated orchestration that sidesteps infrastructure anomalies before they escalate
2. Learn how to maximize uptime using cluster-wide telemetry and full-stack, end-to-end intelligence for rapid anomaly detection and failure recovery
sessions.description: Hardware design presents numerous challenges due to its complexity and rapidly advancing technologies. These challenges result in longer turnaround times (TAT) for optimizing performance, power, area, and cost (PPAC) during synthesis, verification, physical design, and reliability loops. Large language models have demonstrated a remarkable ability to comprehend and generate natural language at scale, leading to numerous potential applications and benefits across various domains. Successful LLM-based agents for hardware design can significantly reduce TAT, enabling faster product cycles, lower costs, improved design reliability, and a reduced risk of costly errors. Cutting-edge multi-AI agents have shown promising results in Hardware Description Language (HDL) generation, layout optimization, design rule code generation, and Multi-Corner Multi-Mode (MCMM) timing report analysis and debugging at both the block and path levels. Notably, the developed multi-AI agents not only achieve a 94.2% functionally correct pass rate on the VerilogEval-Human v2 benchmark, but also deliver a 60X speedup in MCMM timing report analysis compared to experienced human engineers.

sessions.title: Better Virtual Prototyping: Using Global Illumination to Enhance VR Simulations
sessions.speakers: Eric Kam (Sr. Product Marketing Manager, ESI Group) | Andreas Dietrich (Specialist, Software Development, ESI Group)
sessions.points:
1. How to deploy and configure an interactive digital human avatar
2. How to deploy and configure a multi-modal RAG pipeline
sessions.description:
Virtual engineering and prototyping is a hallmark use case of VR. Immersive virtual environments have proven to be a valuable evaluation tool for assembly and maintenance, repair, and operational processes. However, the growing demands from higher resolutions and increasing frame rates in head-mounted displays pose significant challenges for rendering physically based global illumination and ray tracing effects in real time.
We'll explore NVIDIA’s RTX Global Illumination (RTXGI) SDK and its application in the context of virtual prototyping. We'll give a comprehensive overview of the structure and capabilities of the RTXGI SDK, and demonstrate how it can be seamlessly integrated into an industrial high-performance VR rendering engine. We'll also show the system’s application across various practical use cases.

sessions.title: Enable Tensor Core Programming in Python With CuTe
sessions.speakers: Brandon Sun (Software Engineer, NVIDIA) | Kihiro Bando (Deep Learning Library Performance Software Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Discover a novel approach for improving LLM performance with segment-wise inference, enabling better processing of long input sequences and extensive contexts
2. Explore how Writing in the Margins (WiM) facilitates intermediate information classification, optimizing the model’s ability to focus on specific tasks during inference
sessions.description: CUTLASS 4.0 introduces a new Python interface around the core abstractions within CUTLASS, allowing developers to unlock the same customizability and performance achieved today with C++ CUTLASS exclusively with Python. We'll preview how the CuTe programming model and a rich set of language-like features can be used to write performant custom kernels in a Pythonic way.

sessions.title: Enhance LLMs With Writing in the Margins (WiM): A Better Inference Pattern for Long-Context Retrieval
sessions.topic: Development and Optimization - Profilers / Debuggers / Code Analysis
sessions.speakers: Waseem Alshikh (Co-Founder and CTO, Writer)
sessions.points:
1. What AI-assisted developer tools can foster adoption of accelerated computing in application development?
2. What new features and improvement have we seen around AI code gen for accelerated computing?
sessions.description: In the evolving landscape of artificial intelligence, managing long input sequences efficiently remains a significant challenge for large language models in retrieval-oriented tasks. We introduce a novel inference pattern, Writing in the Margins (WiM), specifically designed to address this issue. WiM innovatively utilizes a chunked prefill of the key-value cache, enabling segment-wise inference that significantly enhances the handling of extensive contexts. This method facilitates the generation and classification of intermediate information, termed "margins," which strategically guide the model toward accomplishing specific tasks. To further optimize this process, we integrate WiM with TensorRT, a high-performance deep learning inference platform. This combination allows for the efficient execution of LLMs by leveraging TensorRT’s capabilities to accelerate computational processes and reduce latency.

sessions.title: Train and Serve AI Systems Fast With the Lightning AI Open-Source Stack (Presented by Lightning AI)
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Synthetic Data Generation
sessions.speakers: Luca Antiga (CTO, Lightning AI)
sessions.points:
1. Generate synthetic data using NVIDIA Omniverse and Isaac Sim for training AI models controlling robotic manipulators
2. Create and train perception models using the synthetic datasets
sessions.description: See how the Lightning stack can cover the full life cycle, from data preparation to deployment, with practical examples and particular focus on distributed training and high-performance inference. We'll show examples that focus on new features like support for multi-dimensional parallelism through DTensors, as well as quantization through torchao.

sessions.title: Transforming Reality: From Scan to Stunning With Hexagon and NVIDIA Omniverse (Presented by Hexagon)
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Energy Exploration & Generation
sessions.speakers: Eric McSherry (VP, Strategy, Hexagon)
sessions.points:
1. Unlocking New Inferences from Data: Discover how cutting-edge spatial AI technologies are harnessing new inferences from extensive data stores across the energy sector without needing any human supervision
2. Advancing Sustainability: Explore how generative AI drives reductions in greenhouse gas emissions and supports environmental sustainability efforts by generating optimized designs for energy transition in critical industrial processes
sessions.description: Discover how Reality Cloud Studio and NVIDIA Omniverse are transforming 3D project workflows by drastically reducing rendering times and simplifying complex processes. Learn how users can create immersive visualizations efficiently — even without specialized technical expertise.

sessions.title: Real-Time Fault Detection for Railway Surfaces Using Computer Vision (Presented by LTTS)
sessions.topic: Simulation / Modeling / Design - Avatar / Digital Human
sessions.speakers: Noopoor Rabi (Area Director, L&T Technology Services)
sessions.points:
1. See practical examples of scaling rendering to workstations (2-4 GPUs) and servers (8-20+ GPUs), targeting both desktop and VR visualization
2. Discover a general scaling framework applicable to multiple rendering techniques, including mesh rasterization, NeRF, and Gaussian Splatting
sessions.description: Most rail accidents are caused by derailments. One of the top reasons for derailment is a defect in the track or rolling stock. We'll explain how we can use machine vision, lasers, and inertial measurement units to detect surface faults on railway tracks in real time.

sessions.title: Open and Module Design for GPU Server (Presented by MiTAC)
sessions.speakers: Alex Chou (Director, MiTAC Computing Technology)
sessions.points:
1. Discover how to effectively utilize video generation models to create a variety of engaging video clips that enhance your content
2. Learn about our battle-tested reference architectures of video generation models
sessions.description: With frequent changes on both supply (technical trend) and demand (data center requirements), we need a platform with flexibility and options for multiple use cases such as different CPU, GPU power, different IO, and different storage devices. In this case, module design with Open SPEC is one of the better choices. Learn about the leverage and synergy of NVIDIA MGX and OCP DC-MHS for next-generation GPU server design.

sessions.title: Improve Vector Database Performance While Reducing DRAM Use in AI Systems (Presented by KIOXIA)
sessions.speakers: Rory Bolt (Sr. Fellow, KIOXIA)
sessions.points:
1. Retail Workflow - Virtual TryOn: How users could visualize themselves in various fashion accessories
2. Healthcare Workflow -  Medical Image Segmentation and Annotation:  Pipeline demonstrates the advantages of Gen AI-based models, compared to conventional computer vision workflows
sessions.description: As AI systems become more effective with more and better data, DRAM costs increase as memory requirements grow.  KIOXIA has developed a way to scale vector databases, while reducing DRAM use and cost with the use of flash memory and open-source software.

sessions.title: Resilient Edge-Cloud Hybrid AI Infrastructure: Orchestrating Multi-Modal Agents in Resource-Constrained Environments (Presented by Lablup)
sessions.speakers: Jeongkyu Shin (CEO, Lablup, Inc.)
sessions.points:
1. Learn Blackwell confidential computing (CC) and Secure AI feature capabilities
2. Describe the different confidential computing capabilities available for different Blackwell platforms – starting with Hopper-style confidential computing to more secure and performant TDISP/IDE-capable system with full CC feature
sessions.description: Explore new solutions for building resilient AI infrastructure that seamlessly integrates edge and cloud computing through intelligent orchestration. We'll demonstrate how an eight-node NVIDIA Jetson Nano cluster serves multiple LLMs (including Gemma 2 2B and Llama 3.2 3B) and supports multi-modal AI agents while maintaining cloud GPU integration. Learn how to orchestrate distributed AI systems that process text, images, and sensor data, enabling robust edge computing with cloud failover capabilities. Our implementation shows how to maintain continuous AI operations in air-gapped environments and during network disruptions. Through real-world scenarios, you'll discover how this hybrid architecture provides both local processing reliability and cloud scalability, offering practical solutions for modern AI deployment challenges. We'll share specific deployment strategies and performance optimizations for running sophisticated multi-agent workloads across edge and cloud environments.

sessions.title: Build an AI Research Assistant With NVIDIA AI Blueprints
sessions.speakers: Jacob Liberman (Sr. Manager, Generative AI Solutions, NVIDIA) | Trisha Tripathi (Product Manager, NVIDIA) | Vinay Bagade (Technical Marketing Engineer, NVIDIA)
sessions.points:
1. Understand the latest AI infrastructure trends and how they can be leveraged to maintain a competitive edge
2. Learn how you can stand up a next-gen data center with workload-aware orchestration, end-to-end observability, and unmatched uptime
sessions.description: NVIDIA AI Blueprints show developers how to build complex solutions using NVIDIA software. In this hands-on training lab, you'll build an interactive AI-powered research assistant that includes:A stylized digital human avatar for interactivity.A retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) system for multimodal document understanding.An AI agent that will research topics and discuss its findings.Prerequisite(s):Experience building GenAI applications in Python frameworks like LangChain.Experience building and running software containers.

sessions.title: Get Started With Langflow: Build a Multi-Agent Shopping Assistant
sessions.speakers: Kiyu Gabriel (GM, Search and AI, DataStax)
sessions.points:
1. NVIDIA NIM is fully supported on OpenShift AI as a first-class citizen.
2. NIM on OpenShift AI enables seamless portability across private and public clouds.
sessions.description: Harness Langflow and NVIDIA NeMo Framework to design and deploy powerful, multi-agent solutions. Join DataStax for an interactive training lab where you'll learn to design and deploy a custom shopping assistant using Langflow's intuitive drag-and-drop interface and NVIDIA NeMo Framework. From data ingestion to NVIDIA NIM model fine-tuning, uncover innovative strategies to streamline agent creation while designing intelligent agentic workflows. Gain hands-on experience in configuring agents, customizing retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines, and deploying a multi-agent workflow.Prerequisite(s):Basic familiarity with AI concepts like LLMs and AI Models.
